div0.head: *i
div0.entryFree: *ii, i)w=ta, to/, indecl., tenth (later ninth) letter of the Gr. alphabet: as numeral i/ = 10, but i(NUM) = 10,000. The i 'subscript' of modern texts was said prosgra/fesqai, cf. D.T.639.14, A.D.Pron.87.10, Ael.Dion.Fr.192 (also to\ lhisth/s (disyll.) . . e)/xei proskei/menon to\ i_ Hdn.Gr.2.946), and this mode of writing is found in Papyri, Inscrr., and some medieval Mss. (e.g. cod. A of Plato, saec. ix, which has tw=i = tw=|, etc.); the present mode is found as early as the tenth century, and came into use in the thirteenth. This i was prob. always pronounced up to ca. 150 B.C., but thereafter dropped in pronunciation, cf. D.T. l.c.; hence called i a)nekfw/nhton Choerob.in Theod.1.143 and freq. omitted in Pap. and Inscrr. (cf. Epigr. ap. Str.14.1.41,= SIG766), later freq. restored in writing, sts. in the wrong place (v. r(a/qumos). From ca. 150 B.C. (at Argos from ca. 450 B.C., v. SIG56.13) ei was pronounced i and the sound is written indifferently ei or i.

qwra_ko-i/,
iota demonstrativum, in familiar Att. (not in Trag.), is attached to demonstr. Prons., to strengthen their force, and as it were point out the individual, as ou(tosi/, au(thi/+, touti/, e)keinosi/, o(di/, tadi/, tosoutoni/, tosondi/, tunnoutosi/, etc.; also with the Particles ge de/ me/n inserted, as toutogi/, toutodi/, tauthndi/, th|dedi/, toutoumeni/, for touti/ ge, tauthni\ de/, etc.: also to demonstr. Advs., as ou(twsi/, w(di/, e)nqadi/, deuri/, nuni/, and nundi/ for nuni\ de/.—Of these forms, such as end in si/ are sts. written in codd. with n e)felkustiko/n before a vowel, as ou(tosi/n, e)keinosi/n, ou(twsi/n, etc.: such forms are recognized by A.D.Pron.59.24, 82.11, but are not found in best codd., e.g. of Pl. and D. [i_ with the acute accent; along vowel or diphthong before it is shortd., as au(th^i/, ou(toi^i/.]

i(/, nom. of the reflex. Pron. ou(=,
sui (q.v.), S.Fr.471, cj. Wackernagel in Il.24.608, Bekk. in Pl.Smp.175c,223d: dat. i(/n au)tw=|,
sibi ipsi, Hes.Fr.11; i(n (enclit.) prob. in Pi.P.4.36; vi\n au)tw=| Leg.Gort. 2.40. [i_ S. l.c., i^n Pi. l.c.]
i(=, Argive,= ei(=, SIG56.29 (V B.C.), Schwyzer90.12,al., 91.31 (iii B.C.).

i)/, Cypr. for h)/,
or, before a vowel, Inscr.Cypr.135.24H.

i)a/ [i^], Ion. i)h/, h(,= i)wh/,
voice, cry, Orac. ap. Hdt.1.85, A.Pers.937 (lyr.); su/riggos i)a/ E.Rh.553 (lyr.).

i)/a^, i)h=s, i)h=|, i)/a^n, Ep. fem.,=
one, v. ei(=s.

i)a/ [i_], ta/, heterocl. pl. of i)o/s,
arrow, Il.20.68.

i)/a [i^], ta/, pl. of i)/on,
violet, h.Cer.6.
i)a/zw (A), (*)ia/s) = i)wni/zw, Dicaearch.3.2, A.D.Adv.134.31, Hermog<*> Id.2.4.

i)a/zw (B), (i)a/)
cry aloud, Theognost.Can.18.

i)a/zw (C), (i)/on)
to be of a violet colour, Hld.2.30. (i)o/s c)
to be green, of bile, Gal.18(2).141.
i)aqenei=: diaporei= e)pi\ kakw=| (Coan), Hsch.:—also i)hqene/ousa: e)kpeplhgme/nh kai\ a)porou=sa, Id. i)aqmo/s, v. i)auqmo/s. i)/aqos: pro/qumos, Id.
i)ai/, barbarous exclam. of sorrow, S.Fr.631. of triumph, Ar.Lys.1292; i)ai\ i)ai/ Id.Ec.1180.
i)aiboi= [i^], Comic exclam. for ai)boi=, Ar.V.1338.

i)ai/nw, Ion. impf. -eskon Q.S.7.340: aor. i)/hna Od.8.426, Dor. i)/a_na Pi.O.7.43:—Pass., aor. i)a/nqhn Il.23.598, etc. [i^, exc. in augm. tenses, in Hom.; but at the beginning of a verse i_ without augm., Od.22.59: i_ freq. in later Poets, AP12.95 (Mel.), Q.S. l.c., 4.402, 10.327, Orph.L.268, etc.]:—
heat, a)mfi\ de/ oi( puri\ xalko\n i)h/nate Od. 8.426:—Pass., i)ai/neto d' u(/dwr 10.359.
melt, i)ai/neto khro/s 12.175: metaph., qumo\n i)ai/nein
melt the heart, Il.24.119.
relax by warmth, Hp.Mul.1.69 (Pass.). more freq. (cf. Plu.2.947d)
warm, cheer, kradi/hn kai\ qumo\n i)ai/nein h.Cer.435; qumo\n i)ai/nein tini/ Od.15.379, Pi.O. l.c., cf. Theoc.7.29; kardi/an Alcm.36, Pi.P.1.11; no/on ib.2.90:—more freq. in Pass., i(/na . . su\ fresi\ sh=|sin i)anqh=|s Il.19.174; qumo\s e)ni\ sth/qessin i)a/nqh Od.4.549; ei)s o(/ ke so\n kh=r i)anqh=| 22.59; h)=tor i)anqe/n Anacreont.48.2: c. dat., soi\ . . meta\ fresi\ qumo\s i)a/nqh Il.23.600, cf. 24.321, etc.; qumo\n i)a/nqhs Od.23.47; xoroi=si fre/na i)anqei/s B.16.131; me/twpon i)a/nqh her brow
unfolded, Il.15.103: c. dat. rei,
take delight in, sfin i)ai/nomai ei)soro/wsa Od.19.537; sfisi qumo\s ai)e\n e)u+frosu/nh|sin i)ai/netai 6.156; kardi/hn i)ai/netai Archil. 36; i)anqei\s a)oidai=s Pi.O.2.13; cf. eu)frosu/nh: later i)ai/nein tina/ tini Man.3.184. later,= i)a/omai,
heal, save, tina\ o)duna/wn Q.S.10.327; u(pe\k kakou= i)ai/nontai Id.4.402.—Ep. and Lyr. word; Trag. only Phryn.Trag.1, i)ai/netai: xolou=tai, pikrai/netai, para\ to\n i)o/n (cf. Hsch.).

*)ia^ko/s, h/, o/n, (*)ia/s) Ionic, a)swti/a Plb.32.11.10; to\ *)iako/n
the Ionic form, Ath.9.400c; h( *)i. e)/gklisis A.D.Pron.98.8. Adv. -kw=s ib.4.21.
*(iakunqotro/fos, h(, epith. of Artemis, Schwyzer 265 (Cnidus); cf. *(uakinqotro/fia.

i)a/kxa, hs, h(, Sicyonic name of
a perfumed garland, Philet. ap. Ath. 15.678a, Timach.ibid., Hsch.

*)iakx-a^gwgo/s [i^], o/n,
bearing the image of Bacchus on his festivals, IG22.1092B31 (written *)iaxx-), IG3.162,262, Poll.1.35.

*)iakx-a/zw,
shout *)/iakxos, Longus 3.11 (cj. for i)akxeu/santes): c. acc. cogn., i)akxa/zein fwnh/n Hdt.8.65. generally,= i)axe/w, of birds, i)akx. a)oidh/n Orph.L.46.
*)iakx-ai=os, a, on, Bacchanalian, ste/fanos Philet. 27.

*)iakx-ei=on, to/,
temple of Bacchus, Plu.Arist.27, Alciphr.3.59.
i)akxe/w, i)akxh/, v. i)ax-.

*)iakxiasth/s, ou=, o(,
worshipperof*)/iakxos, Benndorf-Niemann
Reisen in Lykien No.134b.

*)/iakxos, o(, Iacchos, mystic name of Dionysus, S.Fr.959, Trag.Adesp.140 (lyr.), Ar.Ra.398, Paus.1.2.4, etc.; h( *)eleusi=ni tou= *)iaa/kxou (sic) u(podoxh/ IG22.847.21; to
 *)/iakxon e)celau/nein lead forth a Bacchic procession, Plu.Alc.34; to
 *)/i. prope/myai IG22.1028.10.
song in his honour, o( mustiko\s i)/. Hdt.8.65, cf. Athenio ap.Posidon.36 J., Anon. ap. Suid.; a)/|dein to
 *)/i. Hsch. s.v. *diago/ras: as Adj., i)/akxos w)|da/ E.Cyc.69 (lyr.). in pl., Epigr.Gr.985 (Philae): generally,
chorus, nekrw=n i)/. E.Tr.1230; tumpa/nwn i)/. dub. in Id.Fr.586.4L (lyr.). used by the tyrant Dionysius for xoi=ros, Athanis 1 ( = Dionys.Trag.12).
i)a_lem-e/w [i^],= sq., Hdn.Gr.2.236.

i)a_lem-i/zw, Ion. i)hl-, (i)a/lemos)
bewail, Call.Fr.176.

i)a_lem-i/stria, Ion. i)hl-, h(,
wailing woman, A.Ch.424 (lyr., Herm., from Hsch.).

i)a_/lem-os, Ion. i)h/l-, o(,
lament, dirge, used by Trag. in lyr., A.Supp.115, E.Rh.895, Tr.1304, Ph.1033, etc.; to\n i). a)ri/steuse Theoc.15.98: rare in Prose, Metrod.Herc.831.17 (s.v.l.)<*>
prov., i)ale/mou yuxro/teros, of something tedious and dull, Zen.4.39. as Adj.,
melancholy, go/oi E.HF109(lyr., s.v.l.); but usu.,
tedious, dull, stupid, poihtai/ Luc.Pseudol.24; i)atroi/ Gal. 14.617: as Subst.,
dullard, oaf, Men.236, Hermog.Id.2.6; title of play by Amphis, Ath.2.69b. (Perh. from the cry i)h/.)

i)a_lem-w/dhs, es,
like an i)a/lemos,
wretched, Phot., Suid.
i)ali/a, h(, Cret. for fwnh/, Hsch. i)a/lion: e)re/binqon h)\ th\n qa/lassan (Cret.), Id.

i)a/llw, Att. i(a/llw acc. to Hdn.Gr.1.539, cf. e)fia/llw: fut. i)a^lw= （e)p-) Ar.Nu.1299: aor. i)/hla Il.15.19, Dor. i)/a_la Sophr.14. [i^, unless augmented; Hom. never uses the augm.]:—
send forth, o)i+sto\n a)po\ neurh=fin i)/allen Il.8.300,309, cf. AP5.187（Leon.): used by Hom. mostly in phrase, e)p' o)nei/ata xei=ras i)/allon
they put forth their hands to the dishes, Od.1.149,al.; e)pi\ si/tw| x. i). 10.376; e(ta/rois e)pi\ xei=ras i)/.
laid hands upon his comrades, 9.288; peri\ xersi\ de\ desmo\n i)/hla
threw chains around thy arms, Il.15.19; e)pi\ desmo\n i)/hle Od.8.447; so later u(lakh/n
give tongue, AP7.69（Jul. Aegypt.); i)/xnos
set down, plant the foot, Nic.Al.242. c. acc. obj., a)/riston a)timi/h|sin i)a/llein
assail him with insults, Od.13.142. later,
send, dispatch, a)/ggelon Thgn.573, cf.A.Ch.45 (lyr.); e)pi\ *dwdw/nhs . . qeopro/pous i)/allen Id.Pr.659; *di/khn i)/alle su/mmaxon Id.Ch.497; a)/o(NUM)ton toi=s paidi/ois Sophr.l.c.; tina\ para/ tina Id.61; *fqi/a| e)leu/qeron h)=mar i). AP7.529 (Theodorid.). = eu(ri/skw, Hsch. s. vv. i)a=lai, i)a/llei. intr. (sc. e(auto/n)
send oneself on, i.e.
flee, run, Hes.Th.269. (Cf. Skt.
iyarti 'set in motion'.)

i)alto/s [i^], h/, o/n,
sent forth, e)k do/mwn A.Ch.22(lyr.).

*)ia_luso/s, Ion. *)ihluso/s, h(, one of the three Dorian cities of Rhodes, Il.2.656, Hdt.1.144, Pi.O.7.74, Timocr.1.7, Str.14.2.12: *)ialusi/a, h(, its territory, D.S.5.57:—Adj. *)ihlu/sios, a, on, D.P. 505. [u_ in Hom., u^ in D.P., doubtful in Pi.; i^ exc. in Timocr.l.c. and *)ialusoi=o (_ ^ ^ _ ^) AP7.716（Dionys.).]

i)/a_ma, Ion. i)/hma, atos, to/, (i)a/omai)
remedy, medicine, Hdt.3.130, Hp.Acut.6, Th.2.51, Pl.Lg.771c, etc.; stenagmoi/, tw=n po/nwn i)a/mata v.l. in A.Fr.385. = i)/asis, i)a/mata tou= *)apo/llwnos kai\ tou= *)asklapiou= IG4.951.2(Epid.), cf. 1 Ep.Cor.12.9(pl.).
soothing, pacification, LXXEc.10.4.
i)ambaulei=n: to\ di' au)lou= pariambi/zein th=| kiqa/ra| kai\ w)|dh=|, Hsch. (emended).
i)ambeiogra/fos, v. i)ambeiofa/gos.

i)ambei=os [i^], on, （i)/ambos)
iambic, me/tron Arist.Po.1448b31. as Subst. i)ambei=on, to/,
iambic verse, Ar.Ra.1133, 1204, Pl.R.602b, Arist.Po.1458b19, Sammelb.6308(iii B.C.), etc.: in pl.,
iambic poem, Luc.Salt.27: generally,
verse, line, Ath.8.355a (of anapaests).
iambic metre, Arist.Rh.1404a31.

i)ambeiofa/gos [i^, fa^], o(,
glutton at iambics, or perh.
mouther, murderer of them, applied to Aeschines by D.18.139（v.l. -gra/fos):— also i)ambo-fa/gos, o(, AB190.
i)amb-e/legos [i^], o(, an asynartete verse, formed by substituting an iambic penthemimer for the former half of a pentameter, Heph. 15.11.
i)amb-ia/zw,= sq., AP7.405（Phil.).

i)amb-i/zw,
assail in iambics, lampoon, tina Gorg. ap. Ath.11.505d, Arist.Po.1448b32, D.H.7.72. abs.,
talk in iambic verse, Luc.JTr.33(s.v.l.). etym. of qri/ambos, Corn.ND30.

i)amb-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of invective, i)de/a Arist.Po. 1449b8; in metric,
iambic, D.H.Comp.18, Heph.5, etc.: h( -kh/ (sc. o)/rxhsis) Ath.15.629d. Adv. -kw=s Phld.Po.2.29.
i)amb-i/s, i/dos, h(, cited without interpr. from A.（Fr.81) by Hsch.

i)amb-isth/s, ou=, o(,
one who writes iambics, libeller, Ath.5.181c.

i)ambo-gra/fos [i^, gra^], o(,
writer of iambics, Suid. s.v. *swta/dhs, v.l. in EM424.23.

i)ambo-eidh/s, e/s,
like an iambus, Aristid.Quint.1.17.

i)ambo-poie/w,
parody, Arist.Po.1458b9.

i)/ambos [i^], o(,
iambus, the metrical foot ^ _, Pl.R.400b, etc.; o( i)/. au)th\ . . h( le/cis h( tw=n pollw=n Arist.Rh.1408b33; da/ktulos o( kata\ i)/ambon, = ^ _ ^ _, Anon.Rhythm.Oxy.2.3, Aristid.Quint.1.17.
iambic verse, Archil.22 (pl.) Pl.Ion534c, etc.; i)/ambos tri/metros Hdt. 1.12; i)/. *(ippw/naktos Ar.Ra.661, cf. Arist.Rh.1418b29, Po.1448b33.
iambic poem, such as those of Callimachus, Str.8.3.30; esp.
lampoon, mostly in pl., Pl.Lg.935e, Arist.Pol.1336b20; e)f' u(bristh=ras i)a/mbous AP7.352 (Mel.(?)): also in Prose, oi( kataloga/dhn i)/. Ath.10.445b. of the persons lampooned, Luc.Pseudol. 2.
a kind of extempore play got up by au)toka/bdaloi, who themselves had the same name, Semus 20. (For the termination perh. cf. diqu/rambos, qri/ambos.)

i)ambu/kh [u_], h(,
musical instrument, distinct from the sambu/kh, acc. to Hsch., Eup.139, Phillisap.Ath.14.636b.

i)ambu/los [i^, u^], o(,
libeller, Hdn.Gr.1.164, Hsch. (-bhlos cod.).

i)ambw/dhs [i^], es,
iambic, scurrilous, e)pi/deicis Philostr.VA6.11.
i)a^menai/, late form of ei)amenai/, Hsch.
i)/amnoi, wn, oi(,= foreg., Nic.Th.30,al.; glossed by qa/mnoi, koi=tai, nomoi/, Hsch. (i)/amboi cod.).
*)ia/n, o(, in pl. *)ia=nes, contr. for *)ia/wn, *)ia/ones, Ionian, A.Pers.950,al.
i(/ana (i)/anna cod.): ta\ ballo/mena, a)po\ tou= i(e/nai, Hsch.

i)a/nqi^nos, h, on, (i)/on, a)/nqos)
violet-coloured, i(ma/tion Str.15.3.19, cf. Plin.HN21.27, Aq., Sm.Ex.25.5:—Subst. i)/anqos, o(, or i)/anqon, to/,= i)/on, Hsch., Theognost.Can.18.
i(a^no-gle/fa^ros [i^], on,= malako-ble/faros, prob. l. in Alcm.23.69:

i(a^no/-kroka: lepta/, Hsch.: but i)ano-krh/demnos (sic), on, is expld. by i)oi=s o(/moion to\ e)pikra/nisma, Id.; o( ste/mma e)c i)/wn forw=n, Suid. (Prob. compds. of a dialectic form of e(ano/s, wh. (viz. e(ano/s) is glossed malako/s, lepto/s, lampro/s in Sch.Il.18.613.) i)ano/frus, prob. f.l. for kuan-, PMich.11.13.

i)a/omai, imper.i)w= (v. infr.), Ion. inf. i)a=sqai Hp.Loc.Hom.24 (i)h=sqai v.l. in Id.Morb.Sacr.13), Cypr. i)
ja=sqai Inscr.Cypr.135.3H.: fut. i)a/somai E.HF1107, Aeschin.3.69; Ion. and Ep. i)h/somai Od.9.525, Archil. 13, (e)c-) Hp.Morb.1.6: aor. i)asa/mhn E.Fr.1072, Pl.Phd.89a; Ion. i)hsa/mhn Il.5.899, Hp.Int.2:—Pass.(v. infr.). [i_- in Hom., etc.; also i^, E.Hipp.597]:—
heal, cure, in pres. and impf.,
attempt to cure, treat, of persons or bodies, etc., tina Il.12.2, Hdt.3.134, etc.; tou\s ka/mnontas Pl.Plt.299a, cf. 293b; o)fqalmo/n Od.9.525; to\ sw=ma S.Tr.1210: abs., Od.9.520, Il.5.899: prov., o( trw/sas i)a/setai Mantiss.Prov.2.28.
cure. treat, of diseases, no/sous Pi.P.3.46, cf. E.Hipp.597, Pl.Prt.340e, Chrm.156b, etc.; smu/rnh|si i). ta\ e(/lkea Hdt.7.181: metaph.,
remedy, du/sgnoian, a)diki/an i)a=sqai, E.HF1107, Or.650; a)tuxi/as Isoc.6.101; dwrodo/khma Aeschin.3.69; a)sa/feian Arr.Tact.1.3: prov., mh\ tw=| kakw=| to\ kako\n i)w=, i.e. do not make bad worse, Hdt.3.53, cf. Th.5.65; mh\ kakoi=s i)w= kaka/ A.Fr.349; kakoi=s o(/tan qe/lwsin i)a=sqai kaka/ S.Fr.77: abs., ou)/te ti ga\r klai/wn i)h/somai Archil.13.
cure the effects of, counteract, a)/kratos i). to\ kw/neion Plu.2.653a.
repair, to\ blabe/n Pl.Lg.933e; th\n fu/sin th\n a)nqrwpi/nhn Id.Smp.191d; qusiasth/rion LXX 3 Ki.18.32; di/kellan Lib.Decl.27.3. Act. only aor.1 i)a/samen Gal.10.453; part. i)a/santes Sch.E.Hec.1236: aor. i)a/qhn is always Pass.,
be healed, recover, And.2.9, AP6.330（Aeschin.), IG4.951.113(Epid.), etc.; a)po\ tw=n no/swn Ev.Luc.6.17; Ion. i)h/qhn Hp.Mul.1.3, Int.1: fut. i)aqh/somai Luc.Asin.14, Gp.12.25.3, Gal.10.377; i)a/somai Aristid.2.317 J.: pf. i)/a_mai Ev.Marc.5.29.

*)ia_onau= [i^], barbarism for *)ia=on (voc.),
O Ionian, Ar.Ach.104.

*)ia/ones [i^a_], oi(,= *)/iwnes, Ionians, Il.13.685, h.Ap.147, etc.; in the mouth of a Persian = *(/ellhnes, A.Pers.178, 563(lyr.): sg., *)ia/wn rare, Theoc.16.57:—fem. *)iaoni/s, i/dos, *nu/mfaisin *)iaoni/dessin Nic.Fr. 74.8: *)iaoni/hqe,
from Ionia, ib.2: *)iao/nios, a, on, Greek, A.Supp.69 (lyr.), Pers.899(lyr., Herm. for *)io/nion); Athenian, Orac. ap. Plu.Sol. 10.
i)ao/ntus, Boeot.,= Att. e)w=sin (dat. pl.), Schwyzer 462A5(Tanagra, iii B.C.).
i)appa^paia/c [i^], exclamation of astonishment, Ar.Th.945.

i)a/ptw (A) [i^],
hurt, spoil ( = bla/ptw, Hsch.), w(s a)
 mh\ klai/ousa kata\ xro/a kalo
 i)a/pth|
mar her beauty, Od.2.376, cf. 4.749; nautili/hn A.R.2.875; of a spear,
wound, pierce, tou= d' ou) xro/a kalo
 i)/ayen Q.S.6.546; *)/erws . . o(/s me katasmu/xwn kai\ e)s o)ste/on a)/xris i)a/ptei Theoc.3.17; brotw=n, ou(\s au)ti/ka gh=ras i)a/ptei AP11.389（Lucill.); a)= deilo\s xalepoi=s e)ni\ pe/nqesi gh=ras i)a/yei Q.S.3.455; e)pei\ h)= nu/ me kh=dos i)a/ptei leugale/on ib.481:—Pass., o(\s de\ . . mello/ntwn xa/rin e(o
 i)a/ptetai ke/ar B.Fr.7.5; i)a/ptomai a)/lgesin h)=tor Mosch.4.39; w(/s moi peri\ qumo\s i)a/fqh Theoc.2.82. (Perh. cf. i)/ptomai.)

i)a/ptw (B) [i^], fut. -yw A.Th.525 (lyr.): aor. i)/aya S.Aj.700(lyr.): —
send, drive on, of missiles,
send forth, shoot, to/cois be/lh ei)/s tina A. Ag.510; xerma/da e)pi/ tini Id.Th.299(lyr.); pro/sqe pula=n kefala\n i). to
throw his head before the gates, i.e. lose it, ib.525(lyr.): metaph., e)pitu/mbion ai)=non e)p' a)ndri\ qei/w| . . i)a/ptwn Id.Ag.1548(lyr.); maka/ressin e)/pi yo/gon ai)no\n i). Rhian.1.4; i). o)rxh/mata
begin the dance, S.l.c.:— Pass., e)pi/ tini i)a/ptetai be/lh A.Th.544. c. acc. objecti, lo/gois i)a/ptein tina/
assail one with words, S.Aj.501. intr. (sc. e(auto/n),
rush, hurry, A.Supp.547 (lyr.). (Perh. cf. Lat.
jacio.）

*)ia=puc, Ion. *)ih=puc, u^gos, o(,
the NW.(or rather WNW.)
wind,= a)rge/sths, Arist.Vent.973b14, Mu.394b26. *)ia/pu^ges, Ion. *)ih/pu^ges, oi(, a people of Southern Italy, Hdt.7.170: h(

*)ia_pu^gi/a, Ion. *)ihpu^gi/h, their
country, ibid.:—Adj. *)ia_pu/gios, a, on, Iapygian, a)/kra Th.6.30.
i)=ar: ai(=ma, and i)aropo/ths: ai(mopo/ths, Hsch.; cf. e)/ar, ei)=ar.
i(a/rac, Dor. for i(e/rac, Hsch., perh. to be read in Epich.68.
i(ara/rxas and other words beginning with i(ar- = i(er-, v. i(er-.

i)arigmo/n: xara/n, kai\ qrou=n, Hsch. i)aroxrei/an: th\n o)sfu=n (Ital.), Id.:—also i)aroxrh/s: kaqaro/s, qu/simos, Id. (For i(ero-.) i)arpa/lamos: a)kro/xeiros, Id. i(a/rwma: kosma/rion paidiko/n, Id.

*)ia/s, a/dos, h(, Adj. fem. Ionic, stratih/, e)sqh/s, Hdt.5.33,87; [gunh/] Id.1.92; th=| *)ia/di suggenei/a Th.4.61; dia/lektos A.D.Adv.189.5, Str. 8.1.2; glw=tta ibid.: as Subst., Luc.Hist.Conscr.16.
the Ionian flower,= i)/on, Nic.Fr.74.2. [i^, but i_ in arsi, App.Anth.2.21.]

i)/a_si^ [i^], 3pl. pres. of ei)=mi (
ibo). i(a=si^ [i_], for i(e/asi, 3pl. pres. of i(/hmi.

i)a/simos [i_a_], Ion. i)h/simos, on, (i)a/omai)
curable, of persons, farma/kois A.Pr.475, cf. Hp.Morb.Sacr.11; opp. a)ni/atos, Pl.Lg.941d, etc.; diafqei/resqai i)a/simos w)/n Antipho 4.2.4: metaph.,
appeasable, qeo/s E. Or.399. of wounds, trau=ma i). Pl.Lg.878c: metaph., i). a(ma/rthma Id.Grg.525b; kaka/ Id.Lg.731d; i). to\ pa/qos Alex.124.4.

i)/a_sis [i_], Ion. i)/hsis, ews, h(, (i)a/omai)
healing, mode of healing, remedy, Hp.Aph.2.17, S.OT68, Pl.Smp.188c; oi(=s [ph/masin] i)/. ou)k e)/nest' i)dei=n S.El.876; [a)di/khma] ou(= mh/ e)stin i)/. Arist.Rh.1374b31, cf. Antipho 5.94, Arr.An.7.29.2; e)/legxos i). tou= lo/gou Arist.Metaph. 1009a21: pl.,
cures, i)a/seis a)potelw= Ev.Luc.13.32.
mending, repairs, zuga/strou SIG244i53(Delph., iv B.C.). Alch.,
cupellation, refining, PLeid.X.21.

i)asiw/nh, h(,
bindweed, Convolvulus sepium, Thphr.HP1.13.2, cf. Plin.HN21.105.
i)a/skein: a)/gein, Hsch.: i)assei=n: qumou=sqai, da/knein, Id. (Prob. connected with i)a/ptw.)

i)a/smh, h(,
jessamine, Jasminum officinale, Aët. ap. Ps.-Dsc.1.63 (fr. Pers.
yāsam): i)a/smi^non, to/,
oil of jasmine, ibid.:—also i)asme/laion,
to/, Aët.1.119 (who states that i)a/smh = i)a/sminon = i)asme/laion was prepared e)k tw=n a)nqw=n tw=n leukw=n tou= i)/ou, kai\ e)lai/ou shsami/nou).

i)asp-a^xa/ths [i^, xa=], ou, o(,
jasper-like agate, Aët.2.37, Plin.HN 37.139.

i)asp-i/zw,
to be like a jasper, Dsc.5.136.

i)/asp-i^s, idos (but acc. i)/aspin Orph.L.267,613), h(,
jasper, Pl.Phd.110d, IG22.1388.88, 7.2420 (Thebes, iii B.C.), Thphr.Lap.23, AP9.746 (Polemo). = xruso/gonon, Dsc.4.56. (Cf. Hebr.
yāšpheh).

i)asp-o/nuc, u^xos, o(,
jasperlike onyx, Plin.HN37.118.

*)iasti/ [i^, ti^], Adv., (*)ia/s)
in the Ionic mode (of music), Pratin.Lyr. 5, Pl.R.398e; krou/wn *)i. Com.Adesp.415; h( *)i. a(rmoni/a Heraclid. Pont. ap. Ath.14.524f: metaph., opp. *dwristi/, Pl.La.188d.
in the Ionic dialect, Call.Iamb.1.354, Str.13.4.8, A.D.Adv.134.31, Luc. Herod.2. = *(ellhnisti/, Hsch.

*)iastiaio/lios, on,
Ionic-Aeolic, of a scale, Ptol.Harm.2.1.
*)ia/stios, a, on, Ionic, in Music, Max.Tyr.7.1.

*)ia_sw/, Ion. *)ihsw/, o/os, contr. ou=s, h(, voc. *)iasoi=, （i)a/omai)
Iaso, the goddess of healing and health, Ar.Pl.701,Fr.21, Herod.4.6, Paus.1.34.3.

i)a/-teira [i_a_], Ion. i)ht-, h(,
healing, fu/sis Marc.Sid.1.

i)a-te/on,
one must heal, Hp.Flat.1, Gal.10.220.

i)a-th/r [i_], Cypr. acc. sg. i)
jath=ran Inscr.Cypr.135.3 H., Ep. i)hth/r, h=ros, o(, poet. for i)atro/s, in Hom. mostly,
surgeon, Il.2.732, Od.17.384, cf. Pi.P.3.65, etc.: generally,
healer, no/swn Theoc.Ep.8: metaph., i). kakw=n S.Tr.1209; pe/nqeos AP7.466.8（Leon.): abs.,
deliverer, Pi.P.4.270.

i)a-th/rion, Ion. i)hth/rion, to/,
mode of cure, cure, Hp.Epid.2.3.7 (cf. 6.2.4), Aret. CA1.4; i)hth/ria nou/swn Q.S.7.61.
i)a-th/s, ou=, o(, = i)ath/r, LXXJb. 13.4, PCair.Preis.20.26 (iv A.D.).

i)a-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
healing, *)apo/llwn Str.14.1.6; i)kte/rou Dsc.3.75, cf. 5.123, Gal.18(2).394, Max.Tyr. 28.7.

i)a-tori/a, Ion. i)htori/h, h(,
art of healing or
of medicine, B.1.39; xeirote/xnhs i)atori/as, of a surgeon, S.Tr.1001 (lyr.), cf. IGRom. 4.507a18,
b 7 (Pergam.).

i)a=ton [i^], to/,
drink prepared from honey, wine and violets, [Orib.] 5.33.6, Alex.Trall.1.16; e)/laion i). Aët.1.118.

i)a_to/s [i_], h/, o/n,
curable, Pi.I.8(7).15, Pl.Lg.862c,al.

i)/atr-a [i_], Ion. i)/htra, ta/,
doctor's fee, i)/htra nou/swn e)poieu/mesqa Herod.4.16, cf. Hsch.
thank-offering for cure, IG4.951.45 (Epid.),al.; *(ugiei/a, tw=| *telesfo/rw| i)/., ib.1321, 1334; i)a/trwn a)nti/ ib. 5(1).1119 (Geronthrae).

i)atr-a^lei/pths, ou, o(, (a)lei/fw)
surgeon who practises by anointing, friction, and the like, Plin.Ep.10.5(4), Cels.1.1, Gal.13.104, Paul.Aeg.3.47:—hence i)atr-a^leiptikh/ (sc. te/xnh),
practice of an i)atralei/pths, Plin.HN29.4.

i)atr-ei/a, Ion. i)htrei/h, h(, (i)atreu/w)
healing, medical treatment, Hp.Fract.34, al., Plu.Pyrrh.3, Epigr.Gr. 305.1 (Smyrna), Sammelb.1934 (Serapeum). metaph.,
curing, correcting, e)piqumi/as Arist.Pol.1267a7; th=s a(marti/as ib.1272b2, cf.1284b19, Plu.2.510c; i)atrei/as e(/neken Arist.EN1152b32: pl., ib.1104b17, al.

i)atr-ei=on, Ion. i)htrei=on, to/,
surgery, Hp.Off.2, Pl.R.405a, Aeschin.1.40, BGU647.3 (ii A.D.); kat' i)htrei=on a)no/sws dia/gein not to be so ill
as to need medical advice, Hp.Epid.1.1: metaph., yuxh=s i). D.S. 1.49.
remedy, Androm. ap. Gal.13.832. pl.,= i)/atra 1,
doctor's fee, expense of a cure, LXXEx.21.10, Poll.4.177, 6.186. = i)/atra 11, -ei=a qeoi=s e)phko/ois Roussel
Cultes Egyptiens 94, al. (Delos, ii/i B.C.).

i)a/tr-euma, atos, to/, = i)/ama, paqw=n Dam.Isid.189 (pl.): Rhet. in pl., '
specifics' for allaying prejudice, etc., Arist.Rh.1415a25.
i)a/tr-eusis, ews, h(,= i)atrei/a, Pl.R.357c, Arist.Ph.193b14,al.

i)atr-eute/on,
one must treat, Gal.10.209, Alex.Trall.Febr.3.
i)atr-eutiko/s, h/, o/n, = i)atiko/s, fa/rmaka Sch.Ar.Ach.1211.

i)atr-eu/w, Ion. pf. i)h/treuka Hp.Art.46: (i)atro/s):—
treat medically, cure, e(/kasta Id.Acut.2; ou)de\n i). th=s lu/phs Phld.Mus.p.69K.; tina Hp.Art. l.c., Pl.Lg.857d, al.:— Pass.,
to be under medical care, Id.R.357c, Grg.478bsq., al.;
to be cured, IG14.2283 (Bononia). abs.,
practise medicine, Hp.Art. 72; ti/s o)rqw=s i)a/treuken; Arist.Pol.1281b40. metaph.,
remedy, correct, Id.PA665a8.
i)a/tr-ia, h(, fem. of i)ath/r, Alex.318.

i)atr-iko/s, Ion. i)htr-, h/, o/n,
of or
for an i)atro/s, karki/nos IG22.47.16 (iv B.C.): -iko/n (sc. te/los), to/, tax
for maintenance of doctor, SIG437 (Delph., iii B.C.), PSI4.371,388 (iii B.C.); so perh. ta\ i)atrika/ PCair.Zen.36.4, 13 (iii B.C.); but -iko/n, to/, Milit.,
medical corps, Arr.Tact.2.1: h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh),
surgery, medicine, Hdt.2.84, 3.129, Hp.VM1, Pl.Grg.478b, Epicur.Fr.221, etc. Adv. -kw=s
in medical terms, e)kfe/resqai Phld. Po.5.29, etc.
skilled in the medical art, Pl.R.455e, etc.; i). e)k tw=n suggramma/twn gi/nesqai by rule, Arist.EN1181b2, etc.: Comp. -w/teros ib.1097a10; -w/teron tw=n i)atrikw=n Phld.Mus.p.6 K.: Sup. -w/tatos Pl.Smp.186d, Gal.Protr.10. Adv. -kw=s Alex.124.13, etc. metaph., i). peri\ th\n yuxh/n Pl.Prt.313e. of drugs,
efficacious, fa/rmaka Hp.Ep.16 (Sup.). i)atriko/s (sc. da/ktulos), o(,
forefinger, PLond.1821.300.

i)atr-i/nh [i_n], h(,
midwife, IG3.134, al., J.Vit. 37, Gal.8.414, Alex.Aphr.Pr.2.64, POxy.1586.12 (iii A.D.).

i)atro-klu/sths, ou, o(,
physician who uses douches, UPZ148.7 (ii B.C.).

i)atro-loge/w,
lecture on medicine, D.L.8.78.

i)atro-logi/a, h(,
study of medicine, Ph.1.302.

i)atro-ma^qhma^tikoi/, oi(,
those who practised medicine in conjunction with astrology, esp. in Egypt, Ptol.Tetr. 16, Heph.Astr.
Praef., Cat.Cod.Astr.1.126.

i)atro/-maia, h(,
midwife, Dessau Inscr.Lat.Sel.7806, CIL6.9478.

i)atro/-mantis, ews, o(,
physician and seer, of Apollo and Aesculapius, A.Supp.263, cf.Eu.62: metaph., frenw=n i). A.Ag.1623.

i)atro-ni/khs [ni_], ou, o(,
conqueror of physicians, Inscr. in Plin.HN29.9 (epitaph of Thessalus).

i)a_tro/s, Ion. i)htro/s, o(, (i)a/omai) like i)ath/r,
one who heals, physician or
surgeon, Il.16.28, al., Hdt.3.130sq.; i)htro\s a)nh/r Il.11.514; fw\s i). A.Supp.261; h(/rws i)., worshipped at Athens and elsewhere, D. 19.249, IG22.840, AB263, etc.; ou) pro\s i)atrou= sofou= qrhnei=n e)pw|da\s pro\s tomw=nti ph/mati S.Aj.581; i)atrw=n pai=des, for i)atroi/, Luc.Hist. Conscr.7; as a name of Apollo, Ar.Av.584 (anap.), Lyc.1207, IPE2.6 (Panticapaeum); i). o)fqalmw=n, kefalh=s, o)do/ntwn Hdt.2.84: as fem., of Artemis, Diog. Trag.1.5; of Aphrodite, Plu.2.143d: pl., of certain Nymphs in Elis, Hsch.;
midwife, Hellad. ap. Phot.Bibl.p.531 B., Hsch. s.v. mai=a. metaph., eu)frosu/na po/nwn i). Pi.N.4.2; w)= qa/nate, . . tw=n a)nhke/stwn kakw=n i). A.Fr.255; o( qa/natos loi=sqos i). no/swn S.Fr.698; o)rgh=s nosou/shs ei)si\n i)atroi\ lo/goi A.Pr.380, cf. Ch.699; [a)tuxi/as] Antipho 2.2.13; th=s po/lews <kakw=s> bouleusame/nhs Th.6.14; lu/phs i). xro/nos Diph.117; th=s u(/brews Ath.14.627e: Comically, boulimi/as, of a table, Timocl.13.3; gh=s i)., of a farmer, Secund.Sent. 16. [i_a_ Trag., also Antiph.259, Diph.88, Men.497, etc.: i^a in [Emp.] 157, E.Fr.1072, Ar.Ec.363, Pl.406, Philem.11, Men.282, etc.: i_a_ monosyll., TAM2(1).369.]

i)a_tro-sofisth/s, ou=, o(,
professor of medicine, Dam. ap. Suid. s.v. *ge/sios.

i)a_tro-te/xnhs, ou, o(,
practiser of medicine, Ar.Nu.332 (anap.).

i)a_tro-tomeu/s, e/ws, o(,
doctor who uses the knife, surgeon, Princeton Exp.Inscr.787 (Syria).

i)a_tro-fi^lo/sofos, o(,
scientific doctor, Baillet
Inscr. des tombeaux des rois 1298.
i)/atta, Cret. pres. part. fem. of ei)mi/ (q. v.).
i)atta^tai=, i)atta^taia/c, exclamations of astonishment, Ar.Eq.1.

i)a_tu/s, u/os, h(,
medical attendance, Hsch. (prob.).
i)a/twr [i_a_], Ion. i)h/twr, oros, o(,= i)atro/s, Alcm.23.89, IG9(2).317 (Tricca), Hsch.

i)au=, a shout in answer to one calling,
ho! holla! Ar.Ra.272.

i)auqmo/s, o(, (i)au/w)
sleeping-place, esp. of wild beasts,
den, lair, Lyc. 606 (pl.).
sleep, Hsch.
i)auoi=, exclamation of sorrow, Ar.Ra.1029.
i)/auos: koi/th, Hsch.; cf. i)au/w. *viautou=, v. e(autou=. i)/auxen, v. i)a/xw.

i)au/w [i^], poet. Verb, mostly used in pres. and impf. (Trag. only in lyr.): Ep. impf. i)au/eskon Od.9.184, Perdrizet-Lefebvre
Graffītes Grecs du Memnonion d' Abydos 528: fut. i)au/sw Lyc.101, 430: aor. 1 i)/ausa Od.11.261, Call.Aet.3.1.2:—
sleep, pass the night, *zhno\s . . e)n a)gkoi/nh|sin i)au/eis Il.14.213, cf. Od.11.261; a)u+/pnous nu/ktas i)/auon Il.9.325, Od.19.340; of beasts, e)/nqa de\ polla\ mh=l' . . i)au/eskon 9.184; a)/rsenes e)kto\s i)/auon 14.16; demni/ois du/stanos i)au/wn E.Ph.1537 (lyr.): c. acc. cogn., e)nnuxi/an te/ryin i)au/ein
enjoy the night's sleep, S.Aj.1204 (lyr.); u(paspi/dion koi=ton i)au/ein, of a soldier
sleeping under arms, E. Rh.740 (anap.); u(/pnon Theoc.3.49, Call. l.c. c. acc. et gen., Lyc.101. (Prob. redupl. form of au)/w (c), cf. a)/w (A) 11, au)lh/.)

i)a^fe/ths [i_], ou, o(, （i)o/s, a)fi/hmi)
archer, of Apollo, AP9.525.10.

i)a^x-e/w, aor. 1 i)a/xhsa h.Cer.20, AP7.745 (Antip. Sid.):— = i)a/xw,
cry, shout, used by Trag. in lyr., E.Heracl.752, El.1150, Or.826, 965, etc.: c. acc. cogn., i)axei=n me/los, ai)/linon, Id.Tr.515, HF349; [a)oida/n] Ar.Ra.217; xrhsmo/n IG7.4240b2. rarely c. acc. obj.,
bewail, ne/kun o)lo/menon E.Ph.1295, cf. [1523]:—Pass., ka=|t' i)axh/qhs . . a)/dikos
thou wert proclaimed . . , Id.Hel.1147 (prob. for kai\ i)axh\ sh/ . . ). of things,
sound, gai=a smerdale/on i)a/xhsen h.Hom.28.11; tri/podes i)axeu=si Call.Del.146, cf. Orph.A.997, etc.; o)lolu/gmata i)axei= E.Heracl. 783. [a^ in Ep.: a_^ in Trag. (it is unnecessary to write i)akx- when
a is long): a_ in IG l.c.: *vi^, cf. sq.]

i)a^x-h/, h(,
cry, shout, both of victor and vanquished, Il.15.396, etc.;
wail, shriek, Od.11.43; also,
a joyous sound, i)axa\ u(menai/wn Pi.P.3.17, cf. E.Tr.337 (lyr., pl.); krota/lwn tupa/nwn te h.Hom.14.3; au)lw=n Lyr.Adesp.96; suri/ggwn E.IA 1039 (lyr.): in pl., generally,
shouts of joy, Thgn.779, E.Ba.149 (lyr.); but polu/dakrus i). A.Pers.940, cf. E.El.142, Ph.1302 (all lyr.). (vi-, cf. Il.4.456: a vowel is not elided before it in Ep. exc. in h.Hom. 14.3, Hes.Th.708, Sc.404: Trag. only in lyr.; for the quantity cf. foreg.)

i)axro/s [i^], o/n,
melted, softened: metaph.,
at ease, tranquil, Hsch.

i)a/xw [i^, a^, v. sub fin.], lon. impf. i)a/xeske Hes.Sc.232; Aeol. i)/auxen, = i)/axen, Aristarch. ap. Eust. 1654.28:—
cry, shout, i)a/xontes e)pessu/meq' Od.4.454, etc.; of battle-shouts, *)argei=oi de\ me/ga i)/axon Il.17.317; smerdale/a i)a/xwn 19.41, Od.22.81;
shriek in alarm or pain, pro\s ko/lpon . . tiqh/nhs e)kli/nqh i)a/xwn Il.6.468, cf. 5.343, Od.10.323; dmw|ai\ . . qumo\n a)khxe/menai mega/l' i)/axon Il.18.29; gohro\n i)/axen Epigr.Gr. 790.7 (Dyme, iii B.C.): sts. of articulate speech, of a herald, E.El. 707 (lyr.); of the ship Argo, A.R.4.581,592, cf. AP5.298.10 (Agath.). of things,
ring, resound, of an echo, peri\ d' i)/axe pe/trh Od.9.395, cf. Il.21.10, Limen.15; of waves, a)mfi\ de\ ku=ma stei/rh| . . mega/l' i)/axe Il.1.482, Od.2.428, cf. Il.2.394; of fire,
roar, 23.216; of a bowstring,
twang, 4.125; of hot iron in water,
hiss, Od.9.392; of a struck shield, Hes.Sc.232; also me/laqron u(po\ molpa=s i)/axen AP7.194 (Mnasalc.). c. acc. cogn., i). me/los
sound forth a strain, Call.Cer.40; a)/ndres e)ph/raton i)/axon o)/rqion Sapph.Supp. 20c.4; [logi/wn o(do/n] tini
proclaim it to him, Ar.Eq.1016: c. acc.pers.,
sound one's
praises, i)/axon *)apo/llw
were sounding his
praises, Id.Av.772; me *neme/a i)/axen a)qlofo/ron Epigr.Gr.932
a.—Ep. only 3sg. and pl. impf. and part.: pres. i)a/xei E.El.707: pf. only in part. of the compd. a)mfiaxui=a (q. v.): i)axe/w (q. v.) is commoner in Att. Poets. (viva/xw, cf. Od.4.454, al.; when v is observed i is short and the sense pres. or impf.; when a preceding vowel is elided i is long and the sense aor., as in mega/l' i)/axe Il.1.482, al.: hence in the latter places mega/la vva/xe etc. (kai\ eu)/axe （e)/vvaxe) in 20.62, e)n prw/toisi vaxw/n in 19.424) is prob. cj.: -a^-, exc. in impf. i^a_xon (v.l. i)/akxon) Ar.Av.l.c.:
wāˇĝh- perh. cogn. with
swāˇĝh- in h)xe/w, a)xe/w B.）
*)ia/wn, onos, o(, v. *)ia/ones. i)/ba: siw/pa, Hsch.

i)banatri/s, i/dos, h(,
rope of a draw-well: i)bane/w,
draw water (nisi leg. i)bana=): i)ba/nh, h(, i)/banon, to/,
water-bucket, all in Hsch. i)ba/rbion: xalepo/n, a)nupo/staton, Id.

i)/bdhs, ou, o(,
cock or
plug in a ship's bottom, Eust.525.34, 858.38.

i)/bh, h(,= soro/s, Hsch. i)/bhna, Cret. word for
wine, Id. i)/bhnos, o(,= soro/s, Id.:—also i)/bhnos: plhsmonh/, Id.: i)/bhr, name of an animal, etym. of *)/ibhres, Id.

i)bhri/s, i/dos, h(,
pepperwort, Lepidium graminifolium, Damocr. ap. Gal.13.350; = lepi/dion, Aët. ap. Ps.-Dsc.2.174. (Prob. from its place of growth.)
i)bi/buos: paianismo/s, Hsch. i)/binos: a)eto/s, Id.

i)bi^o-bosko/s [i_b], o(,
keeper of the sacred ibis, PCair.Zen.270.7(iii B.C.), Sammelb.1178
a, b(iii B.C.), PTeb.72.410(ii B.C.), al.

i)bi^o-pro/swpos, on,
ibis-faced, PMag.Leid.V.5.6.

i)bi^o-stolisth/s, ou=, o(
maker of shrouds for the sacred ibis, PFay.246 (i/ii A.D.).

i)bi^o-ta^fei=on, to/,
tomb of the sacred ibis, Sammelb.3937 (iii B.C.), PTeb.88.53 (ii B.C.).

i)bi^o-ta/fos [a^], o(,
ibis-burier, PGrenf.2.15(2).7(ii B.C.).

i)=bis [i_b, Timocl.1], h(, gen. i)/bios Hdt.2.76, etc., i)/bews Ael.NA10.29, Porph.Abst.4.9, Gp.13.8.5, i)/bidos Suid.; acc. i)=bin Hdt.2.75: pl. i)/bies Arist. (v. infr.), Ion. acc. i)/bi_s Hdt.2.67,75; gen. pl. i)bi/wn PTeb.5.70 (ii B.C.); dat. pl. i)/besi Ph.2.570, Paus.8.22.5:—
ibis, an Egyptian bird, of which there were two species,
white ibis, I. religiosa, and
black ibis, Plegadis falcinellus, Hdt.2.75, Ar.Av.1296, Arist.HA617b27, etc.; i)bi/wn trofh/ PPetr.3p.229 (iii B.C.).

i)bi/skos, o(, Lat.
hibiscus,= a)lqai/a, v.l. in Ps.-Dsc.3.146, Erot. s.v. r(i/zh a)lqai/hs; also written e)bi/skos, q.v.

i)biw/n [i_b], w=nos, o(,
chapel of the sacred ibis, PTeb.62.23 (ii B.C.), BGU1216 (ii B.C.).
i)bri/kaloi: xoi=roi, Hsch.; cf. o)br-.

i)bu/,
loudly, Phot.: hence aor. 1 inf. i)bukinh=sai,
shout, TeleclId.58 (i)bukhni/sai EM464.44): but Subst. i)bukanhth/s, ou=, o(,= bukanhth/s,
trumpeter, read by Suid. in Plb.2.29.6 (bukanhtw=n, bukanitw=n codd.). Ion. words, acc. to Hsch.: derived from the poet Ibycus, Suid.
*)ibu/keion sxh=ma, to/, use of the termination -si in 3sg. of Subj., Hdn.Fig.p.101 S. (From the poet Ibycus.)

*)ibu/kinon, to/,
musical instrument named after the poet Ibycus, Suid.

i)bukth/r, h=ros, o(, in Cretan,
one who begins a war-song, Hsch. (-bhk- cod.). i)bu/kxa: semno/ths, h)\ swro\s krew=n, Id. (-u/hx- cod.). i)=buc, ukos,= i)=bis, Id. i)/bus, uos, o(,= eu)fhmi/a, stigmh/, Id. i)bu/w,
shout: strike, Id.; cf. i)bw=n: eu)fhmw=n, sta/zwn, Id. i)/ga, in Cretan,= si/ga, Id. i)/ggi tini/: e)piqumi/a| tini\ e(lkome/nh, Id. (leg. i)/uggi). i)/ggia: ei(=s (Cypr.), Id. i)/gdhn and i)/gnhn: a)/rshn, Id.
i)gdi/on, to/, Dim. of sq., Gp.12.19.5, Paul.Aeg.3.59.

i)/gdis, ews, h(,
mortar, Sol.39, Damocr. ap. Gal.14.130, Dsc.5.89,AP 9.642 (Agath.): cited as obsol. for quei/a by S.E.M.1.234:—the form i)/gdh in Hdn.Gr.2.523, Hp.Mul.1.103, Gal. l.c., Ps.-Democr.Alch. p.55 B. is prob. incorrect. = sq., Antiph.127, Com.Adesp.140. (Cf. Lat.
ico.）

i)/gdisma, atos, to/, (from i)gdi/zw, which is not found)
pounding: hence,
a dance, in which the loins were moved like a pestle, EM464.51, Suid.

i)gdoko/pa^non, to/,
a pestle, Sch.Il.11.147 (ap. Valck.
Animadv.ad Ammon.p.140, o)gd- cod.). i)gdo/lhs: o( e)pi\ me/rei gewrgw=n, Hsch. i)/gkros, o(,= e)gke/falos, Hdn.Gr.1.204, Hsch. i(=gmai, i(gme/nos, pf. of i(kne/omai. i)gmale/os, a, on,= i)km-, Hdn.Gr.2.523. i)gmh/: boh/, Hsch. (for i)ugmh/ or i)ugh/). i)/gnhn, v. i)/gdhn.

i)/gnhtes, wn, oi(,= au)qigenei=s, Rhodian word, A.D.Pron.56.4 (who derives it, as i(/gnhtes, from the Pron. i(/), Choerob.in Theod.1.161, Hsch.; as pr. n., coupled with *telxi=nes, Simm.11: sg., EM465.1.

i)gnu/a, Ion. i)gnu/h, h(,
the part behind the thigh and knee, ham, kat' i)gnu/hn beblhme/nos Il.13.212; par' i)gnu/h|sin e(/lice ke/rkon Theoc.25.242, cf. 26.17, AP12.176 (Strat.), APl.4.253: also in Prose, Hp.Fract.13, Ruf.Onom.121; to\ mo/rion to\ th=s a(/lsews ku/rion （kalei=tai de\ tou=to i)gnu/a) Arist.HA515b8: acc. sg. i)gnu/an Phld.Acad.Ind.p.50 M.; peri\ th\n i)gnu/an Plu.Art.11: dat. pl. i)gnu/ais LXX 3 Ki.18.21, Luc.VH1.23. —From a nom. i)gnu/s, u/os, h(, we find dat. pl. i)gnu/si h.Merc.152, v.l. in Luc. l.c.: acc. i)gnu/n Arist.HA494a8 (v.l. -u/hn), Agatharch.53; dat. i)gnu/i Gal.10.902: gen. pl. i)gnu/wn Arist.HA512b22, Herod.1.14: acc. pl. i)gnu/as is indeterminate, Plu.Galb.26. [u_ in i)gnu/h, v. ll.cc.; but u^ in i)gnu/wn, i)gnu/si.]
i)/gnus, v. i)/knus. i)gxhre/w, v. e)gxeire/w.

*)idai=os, a, on,
of Ida, v. *)/idh.

i)da/limos [i_], on, （i)=dos)
causing sweat, kau=ma Hes.Op.415.
i)dali/s, h(, a bird, Hsch. i)da/lta: i)/dia/ tina (leg. i)/di' a)/tta), Id.

i)da^niko/s [i^], h/, o/n, （i)dei=n, i)de/a)
existing in idea, ko/smos Ti.Locr.97d.

i)da^no/s [i^], o/n, （i)dei=n)
fair, comely, xa/rites Call.Fr.535.

i)da^no/xroos [i^], on,
with lovely colour, a)/nqh Epic.Alex.Adesp.9 iii 10.
i(/ddios, v. i)/dios.

i)de/ [i^], Ep. Conj.,= h)de/,
and, Il.4.147, al., Emp.20.7, etc., prob. l. in S.Ant.969 (lyr.). Cypr.,
then, in that case, Inscr.Cypr.135.12 H. (Prob. fr. the demonstrative stem
i- (cf. Lat.
is) and de/.)

i)/de (A) (Att. i)de/ Hdn.Gr.1.431), aor. 2 imper. of ei)=don,
behold, Il. 17.179, etc.: folld. by o(/ti . . , Pl.Phd.72a; used by Trag. in lyr., A.Supp.350, S.Tr.222, E.Or.1541.

i)/de (B), Ep. 3sg. of aor. 2 ei)=don, he
saw, Hom.

i)de/a [i^], Ion. i)de/h, h(, (i)dei=n)
form, i)de/a| kalo/s Pi.O.10(11).103, cf. Theoc.29.6; th\n i). pa/nu kalo/s Pl.Prt.315e; th\n i). moxqhro/s And.1.100, cf. Ar.Av.1000; i)de/hn o(re/wn Hdt.1.80; opp. xrw=ma, Id.4.109; opp. me/geqos, Pl.Phd.109b (pl.); h( i). au)tou= h)=n w(s a)straph/ Ev.Matt.28.3, etc.; of the elementary
shapes, a)/tomoi i)de/ai Democr. ap.Plu.2.1111a codd., cf. Fr.141 D.; of the four
elements, Philistion ap.Anon.Lond.20.25.
semblance, opp. reality, gnw/mhn e)capatw=s' i)de/ai
outward appearances cheat the mind, Thgn.128.
kind, sort, fu/lla toih=sde i)de/hs Hdt.1.203; fu/sin pare/xontai i)de/hs toih/nde [oi( pota/mioi i(/ppoi] Id.2.71; e)fro/neon difasi/as i). they conceived two
modes of acting, Id.6.100, cf. 119; ta\ o)/rgi' e)sti\ ti/n' i). e)/xonta/ soi; what is their
nature or
fashion? E.Ba.471; e(te/ran u(/mnwn i). Ar.Ra.384; kaina\s i). ei)sfe/rein new
forms of comedy, Id.Nu. 547; ti/s i). bouleu/matos; Id.Av.993; pa=sa i). qana/tou every
form of death, or death in every
form, Th.3.81, cf. 83, 2.51; pollai\ i). pole/mwn Id.1.109; h( u(pa/rxousa i). th=s paraskeuh=s Id.4.55; pa=san i)de/an peira/santes having tried every
way, Id.2.19; th=| au)th=| i). Id.3.62, 6.76; ou)k e)n tai=s au)tai=s i). not in the same
relations, Isoc.3.44: ei)s mi/an tina\ i). into one
kind of existence, Pl.Tht.184d; a)/llh i). politei/as Id.R.544c, etc.; a)gorai/as . . i)de/as tou= bi/ou Epicur.Fr.196. esp. in Rhet., etc., of literary
form, a)mfote/rais tai=s i)de/ais katexrh/santo pro\s th\n poi/hsin Isoc.2.48, cf. 15.47,183; h( i)ambikh\ i). Arist. Po.1449b8, cf. 1450b34, Rh.Al.1425a9, etc.; h( e)n tw=| le/gein i). Phld. Rh.2.258 S.
style, *platwnikh/, *dhmosqenikh\ i)., Syrian.in Hermog. 1.112 R.
a quality of style (e.g. safh/neia, gorgo/ths, etc.), Hermog.Id.tit., etc. in Logic,= ei)=dos,
class, kind: hence,
principle of classification, e)/fhsqa . . mia=| i)de/a| ta/ te a)no/sia a)no/sia ei)=nai kai\ ta\ o(/sia o(/sia Pl.Euthphr.6d, cf. Phdr.265d. Sph.253d, etc. pl. in Platonic Philosophy,
ideal forms, archetypes, ta\s . . i). noei=sqai me/n, o(ra=sqai d' ou)/ Id.R.507b, cf. 596b,al., Arist.Metaph.990a34, al., EN1096a17: also in sg., h( tou= a)gaqou= i). Pl.R.508e, al., cf. ei)=dos.
notion, idea, proa/gein to\n a)pokrino/menon e)pi\ th\n i). a)gnooume/nou pra/gmatos Nausiph.2. (Written ei)de/a in later Greek, as PGen.16.17 (iii A.D.), v.l. in Ev.Matt.28.3.)
i)de/atos: i)dh/ratos (Sicel), Hsch.

i)/dedros [i_], on,= i)di/wn th\n e(/dran, Did.
in D.11.22.
i)dei=n, Ep. i)de/ein, Dor. i)de/men, aor. 2 inf. of o(ra/w, v. ei)/dw.
i)de/n, dub. sens. in PStrassb.24.16, al. (ii A.D.).

i)de/rws [i^], wtos, o(, h(,
one who loves at first sight, Hsch., Suid.

i)/deskon, es, e, Ion. for ei)=don, Il.3.217. i)de/w, v.l. for ei)de/w, Ep. for ei)dw=, subj. of oi)=da,
know, 14.235, Od.16.236.

i)/dh [i_], Dor. i)/da, h(,
timber-tree, in pl., xw/rh u(yhlh/ te kai\ i)/dh|si sunhrefh/s Hdt.1.110; o)/rea . . i)/dh|si pantoi/h|si sunhrefe/a Id.7.111, cf. 4.109,175: in sg.,
wood, e)n th=| i)/dh| th=| plei/sth| in the thick of
the wood, Id.4.109; i)/dan e)s polu/dendron Theoc.17.9; i)/dh nauphgh/simos
timber for . . , Hdt.5.23: never in Att.: also in late Prose, Philostr. Dial.2, VA3.4(s.v.l.). pr. n., *)/idh, Ida, i.e.
the wooded hill, in the Troad, Il.2.821, etc.: Adv. *)/idhqen,
from Ida, 4.475; *)/i. mede/wn ruling
from I., 3.276:—Adj. *)idai=os, a, on (Aeol. *)/idaos as pr.n., Sapph.Supp.20a.3), *zeu/s Il.16.605; o)/rea 8.170, etc.; *)i. r(i/za, a plant,
Ruscus Hypoglossum, Dsc.4.44: also *)idai/a alone,= da/fnh *)aleca/ndreia, ib.145: *)i. *da/ktuloi, prop. 'dwarfs
of the forest', Hes.Fr.176, Pherecyd.47 J., Hellanic.89 J., etc.; but *)i. da/ktulos is a name for one of the fingers, PMag.Lond.46.455. in Crete, D.P.502, Paus.5.7.6.

i)/dh, h(,
sheen of metal, etc., v.l. for si/dh in Philostr.Im.1.28, 2.32.

i)/dhai, 2sg. aor. 2 subj. Med. of ei)do/mhn, Ep. for i)/dh|. i)/dhma, atos, to/,= o(/rama, Hsch.: i)dh/mwn,= ei)d-, Id.: i)dh/ratos, on,
beautiful, Id. i)dhsw=, Dor. fut. of ei)=don, I
shall see, Theoc.3.37. i)di/a|, v. i)/dios v1. 2.

i)di^-azo/ntws [i^d], Adv.
in a special or
peculiar way, Stoic.3.94, D.S.19.99, S.E.P.1.182, Cod.Just.1.3.35.3, etc.;
separately, opp. koinh=|, Sammelb.7033.53 (v A.D.).

i)di^-a/zw, (i)/dios)
to be alone, Hdn. 4.12.7, 7.6.7, D.C.66.9; i)dia/zousai Herod.6 tit.; dwma/tion i)dia/zon
secluded, Hld.7.12; i). pro/s tina
to be alone with . . , ib.25; i). qew=|
to be alone with God, Ph.1.95; i). pra/gmati
devote oneself to a thing, Com.Adesp.414:—so in Med., of members of a chorus,
sing independently, Arist.Pr.922a35.
to be peculiar, i)dia/zonta ge/nh li/qwn Phld. Sign.28, cf. Jul.Gal.143a; i). th=| fu/sei D.S.2.58; i)dia/zousa fu/sis Id.3.46, Hld.2.28; i)dia/zon sumpo/sion Ath.1.12a; ai( i)dia/zousai a)rxai/
special principles, Dam.Pr.134; of drugs, i)dia/zwn
special, superior, Dsc.1.14; a(\ a)\n i)dia/swmen, yeudo/meqa S.E.M.7.133; i). tini/
to be peculiarly adapted to . . , Ael.NA6.19; bwmo\s tw=| *dionu/sw| i)dia/zwn
appropriated to D., Hld.10.6: c. gen.,
to be the property of, J.AJ16.7.3. h( -a/zousa qermasi/a its
proper heat, Herod.Med. ap. Orib.5.30.12. Gramm.,
to be peculiar to an individual, ta\ kthtika\ -a/zei kata\ to\n kth/tora A.D. Pron.105.4, cf. Synt.128.13, al.:—so in Med., [o( basileu\s] ma=llon -a/zetai tou= *ptolemai/ou ib.84.20.
i)di^-ai/teros, i)di^/-atos, Comp. and Sup. of i)/dios (q.v.).

i)di^-asmo/s, o(,
peculiarity, Iamb.VP35.255.
particularity, o( tou= e(no\s a)pestenwme/nos i). Dam.Pr.28 bis.

i)di^-asth/s, ou=, o(,
recluse, D.L.1.25.

i)diko/s [i_d], h/, o/n, （ei)=dos) late form of ei)diko/s (q.v.),
special, Stob.2.7.11n, Ath.9.373b, Gal.1.333 (Sup.), Wilcken Chr.6.14(v A.D.), etc.; ta\ i). tw=n genw=n Ascl.Tact.12.11, etc. [i^d] （i)/dios)
proper, one's own, AP5.105 (Diotim.), Man.5.122. Adv. -kw=s Herm.in Phdr. p.185A.; opp. koinw=s, Simp.in Ph.848.21: Comp. -w/teron Ath.7.299d.

i)di^o-boule/w [i^d],
follow one's own counsel, take one's own way, Hdt.7.8.d/ (v.l. -eu/ein), D.C.43.27.

i)di^o-genh/s, e/s,
mating only with its kind, opp. koinogenh/s, Pl.Plt.265e.
peculiar in kind, Herm. ap.Stob.1.49.44, Dsc.2.66.

i)di^o/-glwssos, on,
of distinct, peculiar tongue, po/lis Str.5.2.9.

i)di^o-gnwmone/w,
hold one's own opinion, be
self-opinionated, Phld.Vit.p.30 J., cf. D.C.45.42,53.21:
i)di^o-gnwme/w is f.l. in Id.43.27.

i)di^o-gnw/mwn, on, gen. onos,
holding one's own opinion, Hp.
Aër.24, Phryn.Com.18, Arist.EN1151b12.

i)di^o-goni/a, h(,
breeding only with one's own kind, opp. koinogoni/a, Pl.Plt.265d.

i)di^o-gra^fi/a, h(,
autograph, dub. in BGU1135.10 (i B.C.).

i)di^o/-gra^fos, on,
written with one's own hand, autograph, liber Vergilii, Gell.9.14.7, cf. POxy.250.13 (i A.D.), etc.:—Subst. -grafon, to/,
autograph, PFlor. 27.13 (iv A.D.), etc.
specially or
separately written, yalmo\s i). ei)s *daui/d LXXPs.151 tit.

i)di^o-qa/na^tos [qa^], on,
dying a natural death (cf. i)/dios 1.6b), Vett.Val.19.2.

i)di^o-qa^ne/w,
die a natural death, Procl.Par.Ptol.277.
i)di^o-qhri/a, h(, ib. 223b.

i)di^o-qrone/w, Astrol., of a planet,
enjoy its proper dignity, Ptol.Tetr.51, Paul.Al.S.4.

i)di^o-kra_si/a, h(,
peculiar temperament, Procl.Par.Ptol.13 (nisi leg. -sugkrasi/an).
i)di^o/-kri^tos, on （-koiton cod.),= i)dio/rruqmos, Hsch.

i)di^o-kth/mwn, gen. onos, o(,
private owner, PTeb.124.32 (ii B.C.), Heph.Astr.1.1.

i)di^o/-kthtos, on,
held as private property, Hp.Ep.26 (dub.l.); gh= BGU1216.83 (ii B.C.), Str.14.6.5, PFay.342 (ii A.D.), Cod.Just.10.3.7; h( i). (sc. gh=) PTeb.5.111 (ii B.C.); i). paneutuxi/h
won all by himself, Epigr.Gr.443 (Namara); a)reth/ Onos. 1.25.

i)di^o-loge/w,
develop one's own ideas, prob. in Phld.Acad.Ind. p.4 M.:—Med.,
converse in private with, a)/tta soi Pl.Thg.121a; qew=| Ph.1.197; pro/s tina Charito 6.7.

i)di^o-logi/a, h(,
subjective theorizing, dub. cj. in Epicur.Ep.2p.36U. (i)dialogi/as, h)/dh a)logi/as codd.).
private conversation, Charito 4.6.

i)di^o-mh/khs, es,
of their own length, i.e.
of the same length each way, of square numbers, Nicom.Ar.2.18.

i)di^o/-morfos, on,
of peculiar form, Thphr.HP9.13.6, Str.4.6.10, Plu.Mar.25.
i)/dion, to/, v. i)/dios.

i)di^o-ceni/a [i^d], h(,
private friendship, Anon. ap. Suid.

i)di^o/-cenos, on,
private friend in a foreign state (opp. pro/cenos), D.S.13.5, Luc.Phal.2.1, etc.: as Adj., i). a)/ndres D.H.1.84: Locr. vidio/cenos (nisi leg. vidi/o_ ce/no_) IG9(1).333.12 (v B.C.).

i)di^o/omai [i^d], （i)/dios) Med.,
make one's own, appropriate, Pl.R.547c, Lg.742b; of literary plagiarism, Phld.D.1.9.
make one's friend, tina D.C.39.29. Pass.,
to be specifically constituted, Dam.Pr.34.

i)di^o-pa/qeia [i^d, pa^], h(, Medic.,
affection having a local origin, Gal. 8.31, al., Alex.Aphr.Pr.2.35.

i)di^o-pa^qe/w,
suffer from a local affection, Gal.8.31.

i)di^o-perio/ristos, on,
specially defined or
limited, fu/sis Suid. s.v. *qeo/dwros.

i)di^o/-plastos, on,
self-formed, a)gaqo/n Secund.Sent. 3, 14.

i)di^o-poie/w,
make separately, e)pi/deici/n tini Gal.2.672. prob. f.l. for ei)dop-, th\n grafh/n Str.15.1.14.
appropriate, plagiarize, Vett. Val.96.26 (Act., s.v.l.):—elsewh. Med.,
appropriate to oneself, Phld.Herc.1788.1, D.S.5.13, etc.;
win over, Id.15.29, LXX 2 Ki.15.6. Pass.,
to be invested with a specific character, Dam. Pr.75.

i)di^o-poi/hma, atos, to/,
act of appropriation, Gloss.

i)di^o-poio/s, o/n,
creating particularity, Dam.Pr.36; i). e)pistrofh/ ib.76.

i)di^o-pra_gi/a, h(,
pursuit of private interests, pleoneci/a kai\ i). Pl.Lg.875b; pro\s -pragi/an w(rmhme/nos on a
private venture, D.S.18.52.
i)di^o-pragmone/w, = i)dioprage/w, Sch.Th.1.32, Sch.E.Med.217.

i)di^o-pra/gmwn, on, gen. onos,
minding one's own business, opp. polupra/gmwn, D.L.9.112, Ptol.Tetr.161; bi/os Vett. Val.185.6.

i)di^o-proswpe/w, Astrol., of a planet,
possess its proper aspect (i.e. that of its 'house') with respect to sun and moon, Ptol. Tetr.114:—hence i)di^o-proswpi/a, h(, ib.155:
i)di^o-pro/swpos, on, ib. 50.
i)di^o-rruqmi/a, h(,= i)di/a ta/cis, Cyr.
i)di^o/-rruqmos, on,= i)dio/taktos, Hsch.: gloss on au)qe/kastos, Thom.Mag.p.25 R.

i)/dios [i^d], a, on, Att. also os, on Pl.Prt.349b, Arist.HA532b32 (v. sub fin.):
one's own, pertaining to oneself: hence,
private, personal (opp. koino/s): twice in Hom., prh=cis d' h(/d' i)di/h ou) dh/mios this business is
private, not public, Od.3.82; dh/mion h)= i)/dion; 4.314; i)/dios e)n koinw=| stalei/s embarking as
a private man in a public cause, Pi.O. 13.49; i). sto/lw| xra=sqai, opp. dhmosi/w|, Hdt.5.63; gh=s . . nosou/shs i)/. kinou=ntes kaka/ S.OT636; koino\n e)c i)di/as a)noi/as kako/n E.Hec.641 (lyr.), cf. Or.766 (troch.); i)/dia pra/sswn h)\ stratou= taxqei\s u(/po; Id.IA1363 (troch.); i)/. ke/rdea Hdt.6.100; sumfora/ Antipho 2.1.11; pro/sodos And.4.11; ta\ i)/. dia/fora Th.2.37; plou=tos i)/. kai\ dhmo/sios Id.1.80, cf. Pl.R.521a; i)/. ou) koino\s po/nos ib.535b, cf. 543b; cumbo/laia ib.443e; i). h)\ politikh\ pra=cis Id.Grg.484d; po/leis kai\ i)/. oi)=koi Id.Lg.890b, cf. 796d, etc.; ta\ i(ra/, opp. ta\ i)/., temples, opp.
private buildings, Hdt. 6.9, 8.109; to\ e)n i)di/ois discussion among
private persons, Pl.Sph. 225b.
one's own, opp. a)llo/trios, e)pikw/mia Pi.N.6.32; h( i). e)leuqeri/h Hdt.7.147; *zeu\s i)di/ois no/mois kratu/nwn A.Pr.404 (lyr.); i)di/a| gnw/ma| ib.543 (lyr.); ou)/toi ta\ xrh/mat' i)/. ke/kthntai brotoi/ E.Ph. 555; fi/lwn ou)de\n i)/., = koina\ ta\ tw=n fi/lwn, Id.Andr.376: with Pron., xwri/on h(me/teron i)/dion D.55.8. ta\ i)/.
private interests, opp. public, Th.1.82, 2.61, etc.;
one's own property, Id.1.141, etc.; ta\ i)/. pra/ttein mind
one's own business, in later Gr., Phryn.405, cf. 1 Ep.Thess.4.11; me/nein e)pi\ tw=n i). Plb.2.57.5; ei)s to\ i)/. kataqe/sqai for
self, X.An.1.3.3, etc.: with Pron., tou)mo\n i)/. ei)pei=n my
personal opinion, Isoc.6.8; ta\ e)ma\ i)/. D.50.66; ta\ au(tou= i)/. Thgn.440 (dub.l.), cf.Antipho 5.61, Isoc.8.127; ta\ u(me/tera i)/. D.19.307; ta\ i)/. sfw=n au)tw=n, ta\ i)/. ta\ sfe/tera au)tw=n, And.2.2,3.36; e)/gwge tou)mo\n i)/. I
for my own part, Luc.Merc.Cond.9. of persons,
personally attached to one, i)/dioi *seleu/kou Plb.21.6.4, cf. Arist.Pol.1315a36, UPZ146.38 (ii B.C.), 109.18 (i B.C.); a)/nqrwpos i)/dios th=| eu)noi/a| th=| pro\s . . PCair.Zen.32 (iii B.C.); tai=s eu)noi/ais i)/dioi D.S.11.26; i)/dioi, oi(,
members of one's family, relatives, BGU665 ii 1 (i A.D.), Vett.Val.70.5, etc. h( i). (sts. with kw/mh added, BGU15.13 (ii A.D.)), one's
place of origin, PTeb. 327.28 (ii A.D.), etc.: pl., kataporeu/esqai ei)s ta\s i).ib.5.7 (ii B.C.). in later Gr., almost as a possessive Pron.,= e(autou=, e(autw=n, h( i). filagaqi/a IG22.1011.71 (ii B.C.), etc.; xrw=ntai w(s i)di/ois UPZ11.14 (ii B.C.); peri\ tw=n i). bibli/wn, title of work by Galen. i)/. qa/natos
one's own, i.e. a
natural death, Ramsay
Cities and Bishoprics No. 133; i)di/ois teleutw=si qana/tois Ptol.Tetr.199; also i)di/a moi/rh| Ramsay op.cit. No.187.
separate, distinct, e)/qnos i)/. kai\ ou)damw=s *skuqiko/n Hdt.4.18, cf. 22; i)/dioi/ tine/s soi [qeoi/]; Ar.Ra.890; e(ka/stw| tw=n o)noma/twn u(po/keitai/ tis i)/dios ou)si/a Pl.Prt.349b; po/leis . . barba/rous kai\ i)di/as Decr. ap. D.18.183; o( ba/traxos i)di/an e)/xei th\n glw=ttan, th\n i). a)fi/hsi fwnh/n, a
peculiar kind of tongue, . . its
peculiar note, Arist. HA536a8,11: folld. by h)/, i)/dion e)/pasxen pa/qos h)\ oi( a)/lloi
unique and different from others, Pl.Grg.481c; so i)/dion para\ ta\ a)/lla Thphr.HP 6.4.10. i)/. lo/gos, in Ptolemaic and Roman Egypt,
private account, dedw/kamen *pu/rwni to\n e)/sxato/n sou i)/. lo/gon PCair.Zen.253 (iii B.C.), cf. PGrenf.1.16 (ii B.C.), etc.; later,
special account, a branch of the fiscal administration, Wilcken Chr.162 (ii B.C.), PAmh.2.31 (ii B.C.), PGnom.Prooem. (ii A.D.), etc.; o( gnw/mwn tou= i). lo/gou OGI669.44 (i A.D.); also as the title of the Controller, Str. 17.1.12 codd., OGI408 (ii A.D.), Mitteis Chr.372 vi 1 (ii A.D.).
strange, unusual, i)di/oisin u(menai/oisi kou)xi\ sw/frosin E.Or.558;
peculiar, exceptional, peritto\n kai\ i)/. ge/nos Arist.GA760a5; ta\ peritta\ kai\ i)/. tw=n de/ndrwn Thphr.CP2.7.1; para/docon ei)pei=n ti kai\ peritto\n kai\ i)/. Plu.2.1068b;
eccentric, of persons, ib.57e; i)/. tis e)n pa=si boulo/menos ei)=nai Id.Them.18.
peculiar, appropriate, i)/dia o)no/mata
proper, specific words, opp. perie/xonta, class-names, Arist. Rh.1407a31; o)/noma i)/. tinos Pl.R.580e; to\ i)/. tou= e)pai/nou Luc.Pr.Im. 19. i)/. lo/goi
ordinary private conversation, opp. poi/hsis, Pl. R.366e, cf. Euthd.305d; v. infr. VI. 2b. to\ i)/.
characteristic property of a species, Arist.Top.102a18, 103b11, Chrysipp.Stoic.2.75, Plot.5.5.13; but also,
distinguishing feature in a relative sense, i)/. pro/s ti Arist.Top.128b25. regul. Comp. i)diw/teros Isoc.12.73, Thphr.HP3.1.6: Sup. -w/tatos D.23.65, Thphr.HP1.14.2; also i)diai/teros, -ai/tatos, Arist.PA656a26, 658b33; -ai/tatos but not -ai/teros acc. to Thom.Mag.p.189R. Adv. i)di/ws,
peculiarly, Isoc.5.108;
severally, Pl.Lg.807b: Comp. i)diwte/rws Thphr.HP1.13.4; w(s -w/teron ei)pei=n Phld.Oec.p.68 J.; i)diai/teron Hdn.7.6.7: Sup. i)diw/tata (v.l. -ai/tata) D.S.19.1; i)di/ws kalei=sqai to be called
specifically, Arist.Mu.394b28; -ai/tata le/gesqai Id.Mete.382a3; i)di/ws, opp. koinw=s, le/gesqai Demetr.Lac.Herc.1014.41 F. (but in Gramm., to be used
as a proper name, D.T.634.13);
in a peculiar sense or
usage, Sch. Ar.Pl.115; i).*ai)sxu/los to\n *)agame/mnona e)pi\ skhnh=s a)nairei=sqai poiei= A. Ag.Arg., cf. Sch.E.Ph.1116; also,=
extra versum, to\ "feu=" i)di/ws Sch. Ar.Nu.41 (v.l. i)di/a|). i)di/a|, Ion. -ih, as Adv.,
by oneself, privately, on one's own account, qu/onti i)di/h| mou/nw| Hdt.1.132, cf. 192, Ar.Eq.467; ou)/te i)di/a| ou)/te e)n koinw=| Th.1.141; kai\ i). kai\ dhmosi/a| Id.3.45, Pl.Ap.30b; kai\ i). kai\ koinh=| Arist.Ath.40.3; i)di/a| e(/kastos Th.8.1, cf. Pl.Lg.946d, etc.: c. gen., i). th=s freno/s
apart from . . , Ar.Ra.102.
in ordinary talk, opp. u(po\ poihtw=n, Pl.R.363e, cf. 606c; v. supr. 111. kat' i)di/an
in private, Philem.169; kat' i)di/an ei)pei=n tini D.S.1.21; kat' i). labei=n tina to take him
aside, Plb.4.84.8; also,
separately, apart, Plu.2.120d; oi( kat' i). bi/oi Plb.1.71.1. (vi/dios Tab.Heracl.1.13, al., Schwyzer 324.4 (Delph., iv B.C.), IG9(1).333.12 (Locr., v B.C.), etc.; with spiritus asper, e)k tou= hidi/ou Jahresh.14Beibl.141 (Argos, v B.C.); kaq' i(di/an IG22.891.6, 5(1).6 (Lacon.), 9(2).66 (Lamia), Aët.3.159, etc.; kaq' i(ddi/an prob. in IG9(2).461.26 (Thess.).)

i)di^o/-shmos [i^d], on,
peculiar in signification, o)no/mata Sch.Hermog. in Rh.7.195 W.

i)di^o-spore/omai, Pass., of land,
to be sown by one's own labour, PFlor.64.34 (iv A.D.).

i)di^o-spori/a, h(,
sowing carried out by one's own labour, PRyl.142.18 (i A.D.), PAmh.2.131.10 (ii A.D.).

i)di^o/-sporos, h( (sc. gh=),
land sown by the landlord's own employees, PCair.Zen.292.508: so -spora, ta/, ib.60, al. (iii B.C.).

i)di^o/-stolos, on,
equipped at one's own expense, trih/rhs Plu.Alc.1;
hired for one's own use, ploi=on Ath.12.521a, cf. Philostr.VA5.20; i). pleu=sai sail
in one's own ship, Plu.Thes.26.

i)di^o-sugkra_si/a, h(, (kra=sis)
peculiar temperament or
habit of body, idiosyncrasy, Ptol.Tetr.12, Gal.10.169, al.:—also i)di^o-su/gkra_sis, ews, h(, Ptol.Tetr.142:—also i)di^o-sugkri^si/a, h(, Sor.2.56 (cj.), Herod.Med. ap. Orib.6.20.24, S.E.P.1.79 (pl.):
i)di^o-su/gkri^sis, ews, h(, Dsc.Alex.Praef. (pl.).

i)di^o-su/gkri^tos, on,
peculiarly composed, Herm. ap. Stob.1.49.44.

i)di^o-susta^si/a, h(,
peculiar constitution, prob. in Sor.2.56.
i)di^o/-taktos, on, gloss on i)dio/rruqmos, Hsch.

i)di^o/ths [i^d], htos, h(, （i)/dios)
peculiar nature, property, specific character, Damox.2.41, Epicur.Ep.1p.17U.; h( i). th=s h(donh=s X.An.2.3.16; tw=n pra/cewn Pl.Plt.305d; tou= politeu/matos Plb.1.13.13, etc.; ei)kw\n th=s i)di/as i). LXX Wi.2.23; of a mountain, Agatharch.81: pl.,
peculiarities, Plb.9.22.7, Demetr.Lac.Herc.1012.41 F.; i). e)qnikai/, of language, Phld.Rh.1.154 S.; r(uqmw=n Id.Mus.p.49K. Gramm., i)dio/thto/s tinwn mete/xein D.T.639.31, cf. A.D.Synt.16.14,al.; ei)s i)dio/thta
as a proper name, St.Byz. s.v. *qessali/a, Sch.Il.18.319.
particular existence, Chrysipp.Stoic.2.126;
individuality, a)ei\ pro/tera ta\ o)li/ghs i)dio/thtos Dam.Pr.280.
relationship, POxy.1644.21 (i B.C.).

i)di^o-tope/w [i^d], Astrol.,
occupy a congenial position in the zodiac,
Vett.Val.71.7:
i)di^o-topi/a, h(, ib.276.17.

i)di^o/-topos, on,
of their own district, basilei=s cj. in Peripl.M.Rubr.47.

i)di^o-tro/fos, on,
feeding individuals, Pl.Plt.261d. i)dio/trofos, on,
feeding on a peculiar diet, opp. pamfa/gos, Arist.HA488a15.

i)di^o/-tu^pos, on,
of a peculiar form, Herm. ap. Stob.1.49.44.

i)di^o-feggh/s, e/s,
self-shining, of the moon, v.l. in Placit.2.28.4.

i)di^o-fu^h/s, e/s,
of peculiar nature, ib.1.7.20; sa/lpigges D.S.5.30; ta\ i)., title of work by Archelaus, D.L.2.17.
i)di^o/-fu^ton, to/,= kh=mos, Ps.-Dsc.4.133.

i)di^o/-xeiros, on,
autographed, a)pografh/ Just.Nov.48.1 Intr.: Subst. -xeiron, to/, ib.49.2.1.

i)di^o/-xreos, on,
carrying a personal obligation, su/mbola Sammelb. 4638.15 (ii B.C.).

i)di^o/-xroios, on,
of peculiar colour, Ptol.Tetr.103 (v.l. -xronos):—also i)di^o/-xrwmos, on,
of natural colour, not dyed, Artem. 2.3, BGU327.6 (ii A.D.), PHolm.24.32, etc.
i)dio/w, v. i)dio/omai.

i)/di_sis [i_d], ews, h(,
sweating, perspiring, Arist.Pr.965a2.

i)di/w [i_d], aor. 1 i)/di_sa Arist.HA521a14, Thphr.Sud.28: (i)=dos):—
sweat, of the cold sweat of terror, i)/dion, w(s e)no/hsa Od.20.204; pri\n a)\n i)di/h|s kai\ dialu/sh|s a)/rqrwn i)=nas Ar.Pax85, cf. Ra.237, Eub.53, Hp.Mul. 1.38, Diocl.Fr.142; i)/disan ai(matw/dh i(drw=ta Arist. l.c., cf. Thphr.HP 5.9.8; i(dro/w is more common in Prose. [Second i in pres. and impf. short in Ep., long in Att., in aor. always long.] (Perh. cogn. with Skt.
svidyati, Lat.
sudo, Engl.
sweat.）

i)di/-wma [i^di^], atos, to/, （i)dio/w)
peculiarity, specific property, unique feature, Epicur.Ep.1p.25U., Stoic.2.25, etc.; ta\ tw=n xrwma/twn i). Epicur.Ep.2p.51U.; th=s politei/as Plb.2.38.10; tou= no/mou BGU12.18 (ii A.D.); to\ kaq' au(to\n i). threi=n Plb.2.59.2; ta\ peri\ th\n xw/ran, peri\ au)tou\s i)., Id.2.14.3, 6.3.3; to\ e)cai/reto/n tinos i). A.D.Synt.15.19; a)gaqo/thtos i). Procl.Inst.133; u(/lhs Id.Theol.Plat.5.35;
property, farma/kou Heras ap.Gal.13.785, cf. Dsc.1.71; of the properties of numbers, Theol.Ar.5,al.; to\ i). tou= e(no/s Dam.Pr.5:
special subject, th=s pragmatei/as Sor.1.126.
peculiarity of style, D.H.Amm.2tit., al.
idiom, i). *(omhriko/n A.D.Synt.157.9.
style, paianiko\n i). Ath.15.696e.

i)di-w/nu^mos, on,
appropriate, proshgori/a Dam.Pr.40.

i)di^wt-ei/a [i^d], h(,
private station, opp. turanni/s, X.Hier.8.1; opp. basilei/a, Pl.Lg.696a: pl., opp. a)rxai/, Id.R.618d; e)n i)., opp. e)n filosofi/a|, Phld.Rh.2.277 S.
uncouthness, want of education, Luc. Hist.Conscr.27, Abd.7.
defenceless condition, th=s i). h(mw=n katafronou=ntes SIG888.65 (Scaptopara, iii A.D.).

i)di^wt-eu/w,
occupy a private station, opp. dhmosieu/w, Pl.Ap.32a, R.579c; opp. a)/rxw, X. Hier.8.5; opp. turanneu/w, Isoc.2.4; opp. politeu/esqai, Aeschin.1.195; of a country,
to be of no consideration, X.Cyr.8.7.7.
practise privately, of a physician, opp. o( dhmosieu/wn, Pl.Plt.259a, cf. Grg.514esq. c. gen. rei, th=s a)reth=s i).
to be unpractised, unskilled in . . , Id.Prt.327a. in Lit. Crit.,
to be vulgar, of expressions, Longin.31.2.

i)di^w/t-hs, ou, o(, (i)/dios)
private person, individual, opp. the State, cumfe/ronta kai\ po/lesi kai\ i)diw/tais Th.1.124, cf. 3.10, SIG37.3 (Teos, v B.C.), Pl.Smp.185b, X.Vect.4.18, etc.; opp. ge/nos, SIG1013.6 (Chios, iv B.C.); opp. fatri/a, ib.987.28 (ibid., iv B.C.).
one in a private station, opp. to one holding public office, or taking part in public affairs, Hdt.1.59,123, al., cf. Decr. ap.And.1.84, Th.4.2, etc.; opp. basileu/s, Hdt.7.3; opp. a)/rxwn, Lys.5.3, Pl.Plt.259b, SIG305.71 (iv B.C.); opp. dikasth/s, Antipho 6.24; opp. politeuo/menos, D.10.70; opp. r(h/twr, Hyp.Eux.27;
private soldier, opp. strathgo/s, X.An.1.3.11, cf.PHib.1.30.21 (iii B.C.);
layman, opp. priest, OGI90.52 (Rosetta, ii B.C.), PGnom.200 (ii A.D.), 1 Ep.Cor.14.16: as Adj., i). a)/ndres Hdt.1.32,70, Th.1.115; i). qeoi/
homely (with play on i)/dios), Ar.Ra.891.
common man, plebeian, oi( i). kai\ pe/nhtes Plu.Thes.24; i). kai\ eu)telh/s, opp. basileu/s, Hdn.4.10.2. as Adj., i). bi/os
private station, Pl.R.578c; i). lo/gos
everyday speech, D.H.Dem.2, cf. Longin.31.2.
one who has no professional knowledge, layman, kai\ i)atro\s kai\ i). Th.2.48, cf. Hp.VM 4, Pl.Tht.178c, Lg.933d; i). h)/ tina te/xnhn e)/xwn Id.Sph.221c; of prose-writers, e)n me/trw| w(s poihth/s, h)\ a)/neu me/trou w(s i). Id.Phdr.258d, cf. Smp.178b; i). kai\ mhde\n au)lh/sews e)pai/+wn Id.Prt.327c; opp. to a professed orator, Isoc.4.11; to a trained soldier, X.Eq.Mag.8.1; i)diw/tas, w(s ei)pei=n, xeirote/xnais （-nas codd.) a)ntagwnisame/nous Th.6.72; opp. a)skhth/s, X.Mem.3.7.7, cf. 12.1; opp. a)qlhth/s, Arist.EN 1116b13; opp. a professed philosopher, Id.Pol.1266a31, Phld.Lib. p.5<*> O., D.1.25; in Music, Id.Mus.p.42 K.; opp. dhmiourgo/s, Pl.Prt. 312a, Thg.124c: as Adj., o( i). o)/xlos, opp. artificers, Plu.Per.12. c. gen. rei,
unpractised, unskilled in a thing, i)atrikh=s Pl.Prt.345a, cf. Ti.20a; e)/rgou X.Oec.3.9; i). kata\ tou\s po/nous, kata\ to\n u(/pnon, Id.Cyr. 1.5.11; i). ta\ a)/lla Hdn.4.12.1; i). w(s pro\s h(ma=s a)gwni/zesqai X.Cyr. l.c., cf. Luc.Herm.81. generally,
raw hand, ignoramus, a)/n te deinoi\ la/xwsin a)/n te i)diw=tai . . D.4.35; paida/ria kai\ i)., of slaves, S.E. M.1.234 (cf. i). oi)ke/tai Luc.Alex.30); a)maqh\s kai\ i)., opp. texni/ths, Id.Ind.29; voc. i)diw=ta, as a term of abuse, Men.Sam.71. '
average man', opp. a person of distinction, Plu.2.1104a. i)diw=tai, oi(,
one's own countrymen, opp. ce/noi, Ar.Ra.459.

i)di^wt-i/zw,
pronounce in the local manner, Eust.145.10 (Pass.).

i)di^wt-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for a private person, private, si=tos kai\ e(wutou= kai\ i). Hdt.1.21; pu/rgos Id.4.164; opp. dhmo/sios, i(era/ SIG1015.9 (Halic.); opp. koino/s, oi)ki/ai ib.987.5 (Chios, iv B.C.); opp. basiliko/s, Pl.Criti.117b, cf. Isoc.9.72; i). su/ggramma, opp. politiko/n, Pl.Phdr.258d; i). trih/reis, opp. the Paralos, D.21.174; oi)wno\s ou)k i)., i.e. indicating royalty, X.An.6.1.23; i). tra/peza
private bank, PLond.3.1168.21 (i A.D.); da/neia, opp. dhmo/sia, ib.932.8 (iii A.D.); sumbo/laia D.H.10.57; i). lo/goi speeches
in private suits, Id.Dem.56; kaqaro\s a)po\ dhmosi/ou h)\ i). free from public or
private encumbrance, BGU446.15 (ii A.D.); i). kanw/n impost
on private land, POxy.2124.10 (iv A.D.).
not done by rules of art, unprofessional, amateurish, Pl.Euthd.282d; fau=lon kai\ i). Id.Hp.Ma.287a, Ion532e; le/cis S.E.M.1.234; lh/mmata Gal. 5.213; of language,
commonplace, everyday, to\ i). Arist.Po.1458a21, 32, cf. D.L.10.13 (Sup.); but also,
vulgar, Phld.Po.2.71, Longin. 43.1. Adv., mh\ fau/lws mhde\ -kw=s Pl.Lg.966e; i). kai\ geloi/ws Id.Euthd.278d; i). e)/xein Id.Cra.394a; i). to\ sw=ma e)/xein, i.e. to neglect gymnastic exercises, Id.Lg.839e, X.Mem.3.12.1; also,
in a special way, Phld.D.3.8. of persons,
unprofessional, Apollon.Cit. 3. a)/rtoi i).
common bread, UPZ94.17 (ii B.C.). i). bi/os
cloistered life, Marcellin.Puls.138.

i)di^/wt-is, idos (nom. pl. -w/ties IG 5(1).1390.17 (Andania, i B.C.)), h(, fem. of i)diw/ths, J.AJ8.11.1; opp. filo/sofos, Muson.Fr.3p.11H.; i)diw/ties, opp. i(erai/, IGl.c.; i). po/lis, opp. h(gemoni/s, App.BC4.16,95.
unskilled, uninstructed, Luc. Im.13, Alciphro 2.4; i). a)koai/
unlearned ears, Dam.Pr.5.

i)di^wt-ismo/s, o(,
way or
fashion of a common person, Epict.Ench.33.6, S.E.M.1.67, Dam.Isid.223; in language,
homely, vulgar phrase, Phld.Po.2.71, Longin.31.1, D.L.7.59. Rhet.,
argumentum ad hominem, usu. in the form of a hypothetical question, Rufin.Fig.10.

i)di^wfelh/s [i^d], e/s,
of private benefit, opp. koinwfelh/s, no/mos Archyt. ap.Stob.4.1.138, cf.Alex.Aphr.in Top.234.16, Sch.Arr.Epict.4.10.12.

i)dma/n, a=nos, o(,
one who knows, Hdn.Gr.1.13: i)dmh/, h(,= i)dmosu/nh, Hsch.
i)/dmen, Ion., Aeol., Dor. for i)/smen: i)/dmen, i)/dmenai, Ep. for ei)de/nai; v. oi)=da.

i)dmosu/nh, h(,
knowledge, skill, APl.4.273 (Crin.): in pl., Hes.Th. 377.

i)/dmwn, on, gen. onos, (i)/dmen,= ei)de/nai)
having knowledge of a thing, eu)nomi/hs i)/. po/lis AP7.575 (Leont.).

i)dno/omai, Pass.,
bend oneself, double oneself up, esp. for pain, i)dnw/qh Il.2.266; i)dnw/qh de\ pesw/n 13.618; i)dnwqei\s o)pi/sw, of a snake in the clutches of an eagle, 12.205; also, of one throwing up a ball perpendicularly, Od.8.375, cf. APl.4.97; of the womb, h)\n . . i)dnwqh=| Hp. Mul.1.2; i)dnou=tai ib.10:—Act., i)dnw= only in Hdn.Gr.1.451.

*)idogenh/s [i_], e/s,
born on Ida, Orac. ap. Paus.10.12.3.
i)/doi: o)fqalmoi/, Hsch.
i)domalia/dai, = oi( ta\s o)/yeis kosmou/menoi, Alc.150 (ap.Hsch.); v. ei)domali/das.

i)=dos, eos, to/,
sweat: pl.,
sweats, Hp.Coac.105 (s. v.l.).
warmth, Emp.62.5, prob. in Id.21.4;
violent heat, Hes.Sc.397, Call. Fr.124 (prob.), D.P.966; cf. i)di/w.
i)do/s: o(do/s, sw=ma, Hsch.

i)dou=( i)/dou Hdn.Gr. ap. Choerob.in Theod.2.140), aor.2 imper.Med. of o(ra/w; but, i)dou/ (on the accent v. Hdn.Gr.1.417, al.), as Adv.,
lo! behold! (even with words of hearing, i)dou\ dou=pon au)= klu/w tina/ S.Aj.870 (lyr.), cf.El.1410): with Nouns and Prons., i). xelidw/n Klein Meistersign.133 (Attic vase, vi B.C.), etc.; i). e)gw/
here am I, LXX Ge.27.1,al.; i). h( mna= soi Ev.Luc.19.20; ou)k i). *)aarw/n; LXXEx.4.14. with Verbs, in the imper., i). qea=sqe S.Tr.1079, Ar.Ach.366; esp. in offering a thing,
take it! i). de/xou pai= S.Ph.776. in ind. of all tenses, i). pei/qomai E.Or.143 (lyr.): freq. in LXX and NT with past tenses, Ge.24.15,al., Ev.Matt.27.51, al.; in the middle of a sentence, Ev.Luc.13.16. with questions, i)., ti/ e)/stin; Ar.Nu.825, Eq.157. in repeating another's words quizzingly, as i)dou/ g' a)/kraton wine,
quotha! ib.87; i). le/gein ib.344; i)dou/ ge kle/ptein Id.Th.206, cf. Ec.136.

i)drei/a, Ion. i)di^wt-ei/h, h(, (i)/dris)
knowledge, skill, i)drei/h| pole/moio Il.16.359; ou)de/ ti i)drei/h| (Aristarch. for vulg. ou)de/ t' a)i+drei/h|) 7.198, cf.A.R. 2.72, Q.S.4.226, Theoc.22.85.

i)/dr-is, gen. i)/drios, Att. i)/drews, o(, h(, neut. i)/dri: voc. i)/dri AP9.559 (Crin.), prob. in ib.6.182 (Alex. Magnes.): pl. i)/dries; also i)/drida S.Fr.1056, i)/drides Phryn.Com.90 (= Phryn.Trag.22), cf. polu-i/dridi Sapph.166 (but these forms are censured by Hdn.Gr.2.40): (oi)=da):— poet. Adj.
experienced, knowing, skilful, a)nh\r i)/dris Od.6.233: c. inf., i)/dries . . nh=a qoh\n e)ni\ po/ntw| e)laune/men 7.108: c. gen.rei, po/nou kai\ o)i+zu/os Hes.Sc.351; kalw=n Pi.O.1.104; e)/rgwn Archil.39, cf.A.Ag.446(lyr.), S.El.608, Ichn.124, Call.Jov.74, etc.: in late Prose, i)/. tw=n ou)rani/wn Vett.Val.4.19: with Preps., kata\ gnw/man i)/dris S.OT1087 (lyr.); ou)de\n i)/dris Id.OC525 (lyr.); e)n pole/moisi D.P.857. as Subst.,
the provident one, i.e.
the ant, Hes.Op.778.
i)dr-i/tas, ou, o(,= i)/dris, dub.l. in AP6.182 (Alex. Magnes.).

i(drosu/nh, h(,
sweating, toil, sw/matos IGRom.4.607 (pl., Phrygia).

i(dro/w [i^ by nature, cf. a)fi^drwson Com.Adesp.3 D.], v. sub fin.: fut. -w/sw Il.2.388: aor. i(/drwsa 4.27, X.Cyr.8.1.38: pf. i(/drwka Luc.Merc. Cond.26:—Pass., pf. i(/drwtai Id.Herm.2: (i)=dos):—
sweat, perspire, esp. from toil, to\n d' i(drw/onta Il.18.372; i(/ppous lu=san . . i(drw/ontas Od.4.39; of a hunted deer, h)/i+ce . . speu/dous' i(drw/ousa Il.11.119; i(drw/sei . . telamw\n a)mfi\ sth/qesfin it
shall reek with sweat, 2.388: c. acc. cogn., i(drw= q' o(\n i(/drwsa mo/gw| 4.27; dia\ ti/ to\ pro/swpon ma/lista i(drou=sin; Arist.Pr.867b34, cf. 866b28.—The contr. forms (really from i(drw/-w) have w, w| for ou, oi (cf. r(igo/w), fem. part. i(drw=sai Il.11.598; 3pl. i(drw=si Thphr.Sud.36; opt. i(drw/|h Hp.
Aër.8: codd. of X.
vary between i(drou=nti and i(drw=nti, HG4.5.7, Cyr.1.4.28, but i(drou=nti An.1.8.1, i(drou=si Arist. Il.cc.; w(s a)\n i(drw=ntes, corrupted to w(sanei\ drw=ntes, Ph.1.490: pres. i(drw/w in Luc.Syr.D.10,17; Ep.part. i(drw/ousa, -onta (v. supr.), -ontas Ar.Pax1283 (hex.).

i(/dr-u_ma, atos, to/,
establishment, foundation, *)ia/sonos i(/. Str.6.1.1, cf. Plu.Marc.20; *poih=ssan xari/twn i(/. Call.Aet.3.1.73.
temple, shrine, qew=n Hdt.8.144, A.Ag.339, cf.Ch.1036, E.Ba.951, Pl.Lg.717b, etc.;
statue, daimo/nwn i(/. A.Pers.811, cf. Arr.Epict.2.22.17. to\ so\n i(/. po/lews the
stay, support of thy city, of chieftains, E.Supp.631 (lyr.). [i(/dru^ma Call. l.c. (s. v.l.); i^ by nature, Lyc.1032.]

i(/dr-u_sis, ews, h(,
founding, foundation, esp. of temples, i(erw=n -seis Pl.R.427b, cf.IG22.337 (iv B.C.): abs., Pl.Lg.909e; e(/. coa/nwn
setting up of statues, D.H.2.18; po/lews i(/drusin lambanou/shs Plu.Rom.9. *(erme/w i(dru/sies
statues of Hermes, AP6.253 (Crin.).
settlement, abode, Str.8.7.1, Plu.2.408a: metaph., ou)k e)/xein i(/. ib.651d, etc. [u^ only in later Poets, AP l.c.]

i(dr-u_te/on,
one must set up, of a statue, Ar. Pax923, Max.Tyr.8 tit. intr., ou)x i(.
one must not
sit idle, S.Aj. 809.

i(dr-u/w, fut. -u/sw （kaq-) E.Ba.1339: aor. i(/dru_sa Il.15.142, E. Ba.1070: pf. i(/dru_ka （kaq-) Arist.PA665b20:—Med., fut. -u/somai E. Heracl.397, Ar.Pl.1198: aor. i(dru_sa/mhn Hdt.6.105, Anacr.104, Ar. Pl.1153:—Pass., fut. i(druqh/somai D.H.Comp.6: aor. i(dru/qhn Ar.Fr. 245, etc.; freq. written i(dru/nqhn in codd., as Il.3.78, Hp.Coac.309, A.R.3.1269: pf. i(/dru_mai, used both in pass. and med. sense (v. sub fin.). [i^ by nature, E.Ba.1070, Ar.Fr.26 D., etc., but freq. lengthd. by position, E.Hipp.639, Ar.Pl.1153, etc.: u_ by nature, even in i(dru/etai E.Heracl.786; but i(/dru^e Il.2.191; kaqi/dru^e Od.20.257: u_ in fut. and aor. 1, exc. in late Poets, as AP7.109 (e)n-, <D.L.>), Man.3.80 (dub.), Arch.Pap.2.570, Nonn.D.4.22: pf. Pass. i(/dru_mai A.Supp. 413, E.Heracl.19, Hel.820, Theoc.17.21, etc.:—
make to sit down, seat, au)to/s te ka/qhso kai\ a)/llous i(/drue laou/s Il.2.191; i(/druse qro/nw| e)/ni qou=ron *)/arha 15.142, cf. Od.3.37; i(. tina\ ei)s qro/nous E.Ion 1573; o)/zwn e)/pi Id.Ba.1070; i(/druse th\n stratih\n e)pi\ potamw=|
encamped the army, Hdt. 4.124, cf. Th.4.104:—Pass.,
to be seated, sit still, toi\ d' i(dru/nqhsan a(/pantes Il.3.78; kat' oi)=kon i(/drutai gunh/ E.Hipp.639; of an army,
lie encamped, Hdt.4.203,al., Th.7.77, al.; *pelopo/nnhsos a)sfale/ws i(drume/nh
secure, Hdt.6.86.a/; e)n qew=n e(/draisin w(=d' i(drume/nas A.Supp.413; h( stratia\ bebai/ws e)/docen i(dru=sqai seemed
to have got a firm
footing, Th. 8.40; i(. e)pi\ tw=n i(/ppwn Ael.Tact.2.4.
settle persons in a place, ei)s to/nde do/mon E.Alc.841; e)n toi=s a)stoi=sin *)/arh e)mfu/lion i(.
to give a footing to, i.e.
excite, intestine war, A.Eu.862; i(. pollou\s e)n po/lei Plu.Pomp. 28:—Pass.,
to be settled, Hdt.8.73; pou= klu/eis nin i(dru=sqai xqono/s; S. Tr.68; e)s *kolwna\s i(druqei/s Th.1.131; metacu\ frenw=n o)mfalou= te i(dru=sqai Pl.Ti.77b; of local diseases, po/nos e)s sth=qos i(drunqei/s Hp.Coac. 309; to\ e)n kefalh=| . . i(druqe\n kako/n Th.2.49. Med.,
establish, tina\ a)/nakta gh=s E.Ph.1008; tina\ e)s oi)=ko/n tinos Id.Hel.46; i(dru/sasqai tou\s bi/ous
to choose settled modes of life, D.H.1.68; i(. oi)/khsin Pl. Smp.195e. pf. Pass. i(/drumai, of places,
to be situated, lie, of a city, Hdt.2.59, cf. A.Pers.231, Pl.Lg.745b. Pass.,
settle down, become quiet, Hp.Epid.3.17.ie/.
set up, found, esp. in Med.,
dedicate temples, statues, etc., Anacr.104, Simon.140, etc.; *pano\s i(ro/n Hdt.6.105, cf. 1.105, al.; bre/tas E.IT1453; bwmou/s Pl.Prt.322a, al.; i(dru/sasqai [*(ermh=n]
set up a statue of H., Ar.Pl.1153; *ei)rh/nhn Id.Pax 1091: also c. dat., th\n dai/mon' h)\n a)nh/gagon e)s th\n a)gora\n a)/gwn i(dru/swmai boi/+ Id.Fr.26D.:—Pass., e)c ou(= to\ i(ro\n i(/drutai Hdt.2.44, cf. 1.172; bwmo\s -u/qh Ar.Fr.245; [*plou=tos] -ume/nos Id.Pl.1192; at Athens, h(/rwes kata\ po/lin i(drume/noi the heroes
who had statues erected to them, Lycurg.1: pf. Pass. in med. sense, Hdt.2.42, Men.202.

i(/drwa or i(drw=a, ta/, (i(drw/s)
heat-spots, pustules, Hp.Aph.3.21, cf. Gal.adloc. v. i(drw/ion.

i(dr-w/dhs, es,
accompanied by perspiration, Hp.Epid.5.73, 7.51.

i(dr-w/eis, essa, en,
causing sweat, po/nos B.12.57.

i(dr-w/ion or i(dr-w=|on, to/,
cloth for wiping perspiration, as a piece of harness,
PLond. ined.2383 B (iii B.C.), PSI5.527 (iii B.C.), dub. in PTeb.116.34 (ii B.C.).

i(dr-w/s (v. fin.), w=tos, o(, and Aeol. h(, Sapph.2.13; dat. i(drw=ti, acc. i(drw=ta; Hom. has dat. i(drw=| (not i(drw= as Choerob. in Theod.1.248) Il.17.385,745; acc. i(drw= 11.621,22.2, cf. A.R.2.87, 4.656: (i)=dos):—
sweat, Hom.(v. infr.), etc.; meta\ i(drw=tos Pl.R.350d; kata\ d' i(. e)/rreen e)k mele/wn Od.11.599; i(. a)nh/|ei xrwti/ S.Tr.767; sta/zein i(drw=ti (v. sta/zw）; r(e/esqai i(drw=ti Plu.Cor.3; of
sweat as the sign of toil, th=s a)reth=s i(drw=ta qeoi\ propa/roiqen e)/qhkan Hes.Op.289; i(drw=ta pare/xein X.Cyr.2.1.29: pl., Hp.Aph.4.36, Arist.Pr.867a13, etc.; i(drw=tes chroi/, opp. the effect of baths, Pl.Phdr.239c.
exudation of trees,
gum, resin, smu/rnhs E.Ion 1175; druo/s Ion Trag.40; *bromia/dos i(drw=ta phgh=s, of wine, Antiph.52.12. metaph.,
anything earned by the sweat of one's brow, ou) ga\r to\n e)mo\n i(drw=ta . . e)kbalw= Ar.Ec.750, cf. Chor.p.270 B. (pl.). [i_ in Ep. and Lyr.: i^ in E.l.c.] (Cf. i)di/w.)

i(/dr-wsis, ews, h(,
sweating, Philostr. Jun.Im.11 (s. v.l.), Olymp.in Mete.103.5.
i(dr-w/ssw, Att. i(/dr-ttw, = i(dro/w, Gal.16.778, Sch.Ar.Ra.238.
i(dr-wta/ria, ta/,= i(/drwa, Orib.Fr.117.

i(dr-wth/rion, to/,
sudatorium, Gloss.: pl.,
sudorifics, Paul.Aeg.3.74.
i(dr-wti/des, ai(,= i(/drwa, Steph.in Hp.2.370 D.

i(dr-wtiko/s, h/, o/n,
sudorific, Hp.Vict.3.72, Orib.2.58.78; du/namis Gal.11.711.
apt to perspire, Thphr.Sud.36, Gal.14.290 (Comp.). Adv. Comp. -kwte/rws, diakei=sqai Arist.Pr.870b7.
i(dr-w/tion, to/, Dim. of i(drw/s, Hp.Epid.7.5.

i(dr-wtoeidw=s, Adv.
after the manner of sweat, kenou=sqai Steph.in Hp.1.112 D.

i(drwtopoi-e/w,
induce perspiration, Orib.Fr.128:—Pass.,
to be made to perspire, Arist.Pr.870b31: hence i(drwtopoi-poii/+a, h(, ib.38 (pl.), Philum.Ven.4.9, Paul.Aeg.5.3.

i(drwtopoi-o/s, o/n,
sudorific, Dsc.3.68, Philum. ap. Aët.9.12.
i)du/bolai: profai/netai, Hsch.
i)dui=a [i^], h(, Ep. for ei)dui=a, part. fem. of oi)=da; v. ei)/dw.
i)dui=oi, Att. i)du=oi, = suni/stores, ma/rtures, Lex Solon. ap. Ar.Fr.222, Paus.Gr.Fr.151;= oi( ta\s fonika\s di/kas kri/nontes, Hsch.; cf. bidiai=oi.
i)du/leuma: ma/qhma, Hsch. i)dulitri/xes, sine expl., Id. i)dunagh/s: ma/ntis, Id. i)=duc, ukos, o(,= i)/ktis, Alex.Mynd. ap. Hdn.Gr. 1.44.

i)e/, shortd. form of i)h/, in Paeans, Aristonous 1.4, al., Isyll.37,al., cf. Ephor.31（
b) J.

i)/e, i)/en, Ep. 3sg. impf. of ei)=mi (
ibo); also as imper., Hsch. i(/ei, Ion. and Att. 3sg. impf. of i(/hmi. i(ei/+as: ta\s kuri/as, oi)kogenei=s, Hsch. i)ei/h, Ep. for i)/oi, 3sg. pres. opt. of ei)=mi (
ibo). i)/elos, = i)/leos (i.e. ei)l-), Id. i(e/men, i(e/menai, Ep. pres. inf. of i(/hmi: i(e/menos, pres. part. Pass.:—hence Adv. i(eme/nws,
eagerly, Sch.A.R.3.890. i(/en, Ep. 3pl. impf. of i(/hmi.

i(era/, h(, a kind of
serpent, v.l. for i(ero/n, Arist.HA607a31. a name for many medicines in the Greek pharmacopoeia, Gal.13.126, al.; of a plaster, ib.778; esp. of aloes, Id.6.354; i(era\ pikra/ Id.13.129. v. i(ero/s.

i(er-a/ggelos, o(,
one who proclaims a festival, Hsch.

i(er-a_ge/w,
carry offerings, Sammelb.6753a (iii B.C.).

i(er-a^gwgo/s, o/n,
carrying offerings, mu/stai Hedyl. ap. Ath.11.497d; nau=s Plb.31.12.11; a)/ndres D.H.16.3: as Subst., Inscr.Délos 291b8 (iii B.C.), IG12(1).1035 (Carpathos), 12(8).190.45 (Samothrace).

i(er-a/zw,
serve as priest, toi=s *diosko/rois ib.12(5).129.56 (Paros); tw=| *)asklhpiw=| SIG2588.43 (Delos, ii B.C.): also c. gen., tou= *)askl. ib.45: abs., IG12(7).237.27 (Amorgos):—Boeot. i(areia/ddw ib.7.3169 (Orchom.): aor. part. i(areia/casa ib.1816.2 (Leuctra, iv/iii B.C.), 2876.3 (Coronea, ii B.C.), BCH50.409, al.(Thespiae); i(erea/casa ib.26.292 (ibid.).
i(era_k-a/rios [i^e], o(,= i(erakotro/fos, Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).217.

i(era_k-ei=on, to/,
shrine of the hawk, PTeb.5.70 (ii B.C.).

i(era_/k-eios, a, on,
of a hawk, pro/swpon Porph. ap. Eus.PE3.12.
i(era_k-i/a bota/nh,= i(era/kion 1, Horap.1.6.
i(era_k-ia/s, a/dos, h(,= foreg., Alex.Trall.2.

i(era_k-i^deu/s, e/ws, o(,
young hawk, eyass, Eust.753.56.

i(era_k-i/dion, to/,
statuette of a hawk, Roussel
Cultes Egyptiens 219 (Delos, ii B.C.).

i(era_k-i/zw,
behave like a hawk, Thphr.Sign.16, Arist.Fr.253.

i(era_/k-ion, to/,
hawk-weed: i(. to\ me/ga,=
Urospermum picroides, i(. to\ mikro/n,=
Hymenonema graecum, Ps.-Dsc.3.64.
a compound eyesalve, Gal.12.783.
i(era_k-i/skos, o(, Dim. of i(e/rac, Ar.Av.1112.

i(era_k-isti/, Adv.
in hawks' language, PMag.Leid.W.2.42.

i(era_k-i/ths [i_t], ou, o(,
stone of the colour of a hawk's neck, Plin.HN37.167, Gal.12.207, PMag.Par.2.221. = i(era/kion 1, ib.1.901.

i(era_ko-bosko/s, o(,
hawk-feeder, falconer, PPetr.3p.239 (iii B.C.), Ael.NA7.9.

i(era_ko-kto/nos, on,
hawk-killing, Hsch. s.v. fabokto/nos.

i(era_ko/-morfos, on,
hawk-shaped, of the Egyptian god Phrê (the Sun), represented with a hawk's head, Ph.Bybl. ap. Eus.PE1.10, Horap.1.6, S.E.P.3.219, PMag.Leid.W.9.43.
i(era_ko-po/dion, to/,= luxni\s a)gri/a, Ps.-Dsc.3.101.

i(era_ko-pro/swpos, on,
hawk-faced, PMag. Leid.W.1.39, Porph. ap. Eus.PE3.12.

i(era_ko-ta/fos [a^], o(,
one who buries sacred hawks, PStrassb.91.5 (i B.C.), etc.

i(era_ko-tro/fos, on,= i(erakobosko/s, Cat.Cod.Astr.7.118,al.
pupil of Hierax, Eun.Hist. p.268 D.

i(era_kw/dhs, es,
hawk-like, Eun.Hist.p.206 D.
i(era/moiboi: profh=tai qew=n, Hsch.

i(eranqesi/a, h(, only Dor. i(ar-,
dedication, i.e.
manumission, IG9 (1).193.31,al.

i(era_nome/w,
hold office as commissioner of sacred rites, Mon.Ant.23.179 (Iotape).

i(e/rac [i^], a_kos, o(, Ion. and Ep. i)/rhc [i_], hkos (the longer form first in Alcm. 28, E.Andr.1141, Ps.-Orac. ap. Ar.Eq.1052):—
hawk, falcon, i)/rhc w)ku/pteros Il.13.62, cf. 819, Od.13.86, Hes.Op.212, Hdt.2.65, Arist.HA620a17; sacred to Apollo, Ar.Av.516. a kind of
fish, Epich.68 (in Dor. form i(a/rac), Epaenet. ap. Ath.7.329a. name for a grade of initiates in Mithras-worship, Porph.Abst.4.16. name of a
bandage, Sor.Fasc.12.

i(era^oido/s, o(,
sacred bard, Hsch.

i(era/omai, Ion. i(r-, fut. -a/somai [a_] J.AJ4.2.3; Ion. -h/somai SIG 1003 (Priene, ii B.C.): aor. -hsa/mhn ib.708.34 (Istropolis, ii B.C.); pf. part. i(erhme/nos ib.5:—Pass., aor. 1 part. i(eraqei=sa Philol.71.41 (Delph.):—
to be a priest or
priestess, qeou= Hdt.2.35, cf. SIG1037.4 (Milet., iv/iii B.C.),al.; qea=s D.H.2.19; qew=| Paus.6.11.2, cf. Philol. l.c.: abs., Th.2.2, Ph.2.157, al.; c. acc. cogn., i(erwsu/nhn i(era/sasqai Aeschin.1.19 (v.l. i(erw/sasqai): freq. in Inscrr., i(erasa/menos th=| patri/di CIG4069 (Ancyra), etc.; cf. i(ero/w.

i(era_-pole/w,
to be a i(erapo/los, IG4.1444,1536; of a woman, *)arx: *delt. 2.app.49 (Palaerus).

i(era_-po/los, o(, (te/llw)
chief priest, Pi. Parth.1.6, IG14.256 (Gela), 5(1).29 (Sparta): i(erhpo/los TAM2(1).174E9 (Sidyma).

i(era/rxhs, ou, o(,
president of sacred rites, high-priest, IG7.303 (Oropus), 9(1).32 (Stiris): Boeot. i(a^ra/rxa_s Schwyzer515.4,al.:—hence Boeot. i(a^rarxi/w,
to be high-priest, ib.544.4.

i(era_t-ei/a, h(,
priesthood, Arist.Pol.1328b13, OGI90.52 (Rosetta, ii B.C.), LXXEx.29.9, Ev.Luc.1.9, IG5(2).516 (Lycosura, i A. D.), etc.: Ion. i(rhth/h Schwyzer692 (Chios, V B.C.); later i(erhtei/h and i(e/ra_t-a GDI ivpp.885-6 (Erythrae, iv B.C.), SIG1014.14 (ibid., iii B.C.), 1015.5 (Halic.).

i(era_t-ei=on, to/,
a sanctuary, Procop.Aed.1.4.

i(era_/t-euma, atos, to/,
priesthood, LXXEx.19.6, 1 Ep.Pet.2.9.
body of priests, ib. 5.

i(era_t-eu/w, Ion. i(erht- GDI5394 (later also in Northern Greece, Boeot., IG7.3097 (perh. i B.C.); Phoc., ib.9(1).32.40 (Stiris, ii B.C.),
al.; Thess., ib.9(2).333 (i A.D.), cf. SIG2588.110 (Delos, ii B.C.); Lesb. i)rhteu/w IG12(2).527.45):—
to be priest or
priestess, qew=n OGI 90.51 (Rosetta, ii B.C.); *kai/saros prob. ib.767.4 (Cyrene); tou= *dio\s tou= *swth=ros IG7.2727 (Acraeph., i B.C.); ta=| *)aqa/na| ib.9(1).65 (Daulis), cf. Hdn.5.6.3: abs., SIG1044.19 (Halic., iv/iii B.C.), al., LXX Ex. 28.1, Ev.Luc.1.8:—also i(era_t-eu/omai, IGRom.4.539 (Cotiaeum). Pass.,
to be made holy, Zos.Alch.p.108B.

i(era_t-iko/s, h/, o/n,
priestly, sacerdotal, qusi/ai Arist.Pol.1285b10; u(pomnh/mata Plu.Marc.5; ste/fanos, a(gistei=ai, Id.2.34e, 729a; o)no/mata Luc.Philops.12; lo/gos Ptol.Tetr. 87 (-athtiko/s codd.); bi/os Jul.Ep.89b; h( i(. (sc. te/xnh), = i(eratei/a, Pl.Plt.290d; oi( i(. the
priestly caste, Hld.7.11, cf. Dam.Pr.399. Adv. -kw=s
in a sacerdotal sense, ib.256; i(. zh=n
as a priest should, Jul. l.c.; semnw=s kai\ i(. kri/nein di/kas Just.Nov.79.1. i(. bu/blos, xa/rths, name of a kind of papyrus, Str.17.1.15, PMag.Par.1.2105; ko/llhma, pitta/kion, made of this material, ib.2068,3142.
devoted to sacred purposes, ta\ i(. the
sacred fund, IGRom.3.1137 (Syria, iii A.D.). i(era_t-iko/n, to/, name of a
plaster, Gal.13.183.

i(erau/lhs, ou, o(,
flute-player at sacrifices, IG3.1041.19, 1048.14, al.

i(era_fori/a, h(,
bearing of holy vessels, D.H.16.3.

i(era_fo/ros, o(,
bearer of holy vessels, Plu.2.352b, SIG2754 (Pergam.): i(erofo/ros, IG9(1).486.16 (ii/i B.C.), Ptol.Tetr.181.

i(e/reia, h(, Ion. i(rei/h, as v.l. in Hdt.5.72, 8.104: scanned -ei^a in Trag., S.Fr.456, E.Or.261 (with v.l. i(eri/ai), Ba.1114, and perh. to be written i(ere/a, as in IG12.4.13, 843a3, etc., and prob. in Pi.P.4.5: Ep. i(ere/h Call.Epigr.41: i(erh=, Schwyzer725 (Milet., vi B.C.), GDI5562 (Panticapaeum), 5584 (Priene), al.: i(are/a or i(a/rea (pl. i(areai) ib. 4847: i(a/reia dub. in IG7.2465 (Thebes):—fem. of i(ereu/s,
a priestess, th\n . . e)/qhkan *)aqhnai/hs i(e/reian Il.6.300, al., cf. Ar.Th.758, Th.4.133, Pl.Phdr.244b, al., BCH6.24 (Delos, ii B.C.), etc.

i(erei/a, h(, (i(ereu/w)
sacrifice, festival, LXX4 Ki.10.20. = i(eratei/a, CIG3491.23 (Thyatira). Cypr.i)erhvi/
ja,
sanctuary, ta=s *)aqa/nas Inscr.Cypr.135.20H. (v B.C.).
i(ereia/zw, v. i(era/zw.

i(erei=on, to/, Ion. i(erh/i+on or i(rh/i+on (the former in Hom. (pl. written i(erh/iia SIG57.14 (Milet., v B.C.)), the latter in Hdt.), Dor. i(a^rh/i+on Berl.Sitzb.1927.159 (Cyrene), prob. in Leg.Gort.10.38:—
victim, animal for sacrifice, i(reu/ein i(erh/i+on Od.14.94; i(erh/i+a polla\ parei=xon ib.250; e)pei\ ou)x i(. ou)de\ boei/hn a)rnu/sqhn Il.22.159 (prov. for 'no trifling stake', Cic.Att.1.1.4), cf.
