Hdt.1.132, 6.57, Ar.Lys.84, Pax1091, And.1.126; opp. <a(gna\> qu/mata, Th.1.126; i(erei=on kai\ i(era/ Test.Epict.5.35; freq. of sheep, OGI214.62 (Didyma, iii B.C.), IPE12.76 (Olbia, perh. iv B.C.); of pigs, PCair.Zen.161 (iii B.C.). in Od.11.23 (pl.),
offering for the dead, for which, acc. to Sch., to/mion or e)/ntomon was more correct.
cattle slaughtered for food, Hp.Aff.52, Mnesith. ap. Orib. 2.68.6: in pl., X.Cyr.1.4.17; of sucking-pigs, Gal.1.578, 10.489.
i(ereiteu/w, later spelling of i(eriteu/w. Thess. spelling of i(erhteu/w, Schwyzer 616a (Phalanna).
i(erei=tis, v. i(eri=tis. i(ereo/omai, v. i(ero/w.

i(er-eu/s [i^], e/ws, Ion. -h=os, Cypr. -h=vos Inscr.Cypr.59 H., o(, Att. pl. i(erh=s: gen. sg. and pl. written i(erei/ws, i(erei/wn, PStrassb.83.2,9 (ii B.C.):—Ion. nom. i(reu/s Il.5.10, 16.604, Od.9.198: Dor. i(a^reu/s IG 4.1182, al. (gen. i)are/os ib.1580); acc. pl. to\s i(are/s Schwyzer 236 (Cyrene); nom. pl. oi( i(are/s ibid.; nom. sg. i(are/s GDI4846 (Cyrene):— also i(e/rews (Att. and proparox. acc. to Choerob. in Theod.1.253) SIG1037.4 (Milet., iv/iii B.C.); gen. i(e/rew IPE12.32A23, al. (Olbia, iii B.C.); dat. i(/rew| Schwyzer692 (Chios, v. B.C.); acc. i(e/rew Milet. 1(7).203b3 (ii B.C.): i(erh/s IG5(2).115.1 (Tegea, iv/iii B.C.), cf. Inscr.Cypr.100 H.:—Arc. i(arh/s IG5(2).13.10 (iii B.C.): acc. i(erh/n ib.3.1 (Tegea, iv B.C.): (i(ero/s):—
priest, sacrificer, diviner, Il.1.62, 16.604, Pi.P.2.17, Hdt.2.2, And.1.124, etc.; e)f' i(ere/ws, as a date, SIG332.1 (Potidaea, iv/iii B.C.), etc. (freq. unaspirated, e)p' i)ere/ws IG12(1).890, etc. (Rhodes)); of the Jewish High Priest, D.S.34/5.1; i(. o( me/gas LXXLe.21.10, Ph.2.591; i(. o( xristo/s LXXLe.4.5; at Rome, =
pontifex, Mon.Anc.Gr.6.9; i(. o( me/gistos, =
pont. maximus, D.S.27.2. metaph., i(. tis a)/tas
a minister of woe, A.Ag.735 (lyr.); comically, leptota/twn lh/rwn i(ereu= Ar.Nu.359; i(. *dionu/sou, of a winebibber, Eup.19; i(. filosofi/as Lib.Or.52.42.

i(er-eu/simos, on,
fit for sacrifice, Plu.2.729d.

i(e/r-eusis, ews, h(,
slaying, sacrificing, Sch.E.Hec. 224.

i(er-eutiko/s, h/, o/n,
belonging to a i(ero/n, [gh=] PTeb.5.236 (ii B.C.): -ka/, ta/, ib.257.

i(er-eu/w, Ion.i(reu/w Od.14.94, al.; Ion.impf. i(reu/eskon 20.3: 3sg. plpf. Pass. i(e/reuto Il.24.125: (i(ero/s):—
sacrifice, bou=s . . h)/nis h)ke/stas i(ereuse/men 6.94; tau/rous [potamw=|] 21.131; toi=si de\ bou=n i(e/reuse . . *zhni/ Od.13.24, etc.: abs.,
offer sacrifice, th=| qew=| Ant. Lib.20.2.
slaughter for a feast, bou=s i(ereu/ontes . . ei)lapina/zousin Od.2.56; a)/ceq' u(w=n to\n a)/riston, i(/na cei/nw| i(ereu/sw 14.414, cf. 8.59; also dei=pnon d' ai)=ya suw=n i(ereu/sate o(/s tis a)/ristos 24.215:—Med., Bou=s i(reu/sasqai oxen
to slaughter for themselves, 19.198; mh=la A.R.2.302.
consecrate, devote to a god, i(ereuome/nh parqe/nos Paus.3.18.4.
sacrifice, i.e.
slay, Ph.2.34, Procop.Goth.2.25.
i(erewsu/nh, v. i(erwsu/nh.
i(erh/, h(, = i(e/reia, AP7.733 (Diotim., nisi leg. i(erh=): Att. i(era/ Pl. ap.AB100.
i(erh/i+on, to/, Ion. for i(erei=on, Hom.
i(erhi/+s, i/+dos, h(, poet. for i(e/reia, IG7.113 (Megara).
i(erh/s, v. i(ereu/s. i(erhtei/a, i(erhteu/w, Ion. for i(era_t-. i(eri/a, Ion. -i/h, v. i(e/reia.

i(er-i/zw,
consecrate, purify, Hsch. s.v. a(gniths.

i(er-i/s, i/dos, h(, = i(e/reia,
priestess, dub. in Plu.2.435b.

i(er-ismo/s, o(,
sacred service, ei)s -ismo/n Inscr.Délos 338 Aa19 (iii B.C.), BCH6.23 (Delos, ii B.C.).
i(e/r-issa, h(, = i(e/reia, PStrassb.84.14(ii B.C.), BGU994 ii8, PLond.3.880.7 (ii B.C.), CIG4009b (Iconium).

i(er-isth/s, ou=, o(,
one who presides at spondai/, IG11(2).145 (iv B.C.), 161 A88 (iii B.C.), cf. Hsch. s.v. a(gni/ths (prob.).

i(er-i_teu/w,
serve as priest, ta=| *da/matri IG 5(2).266 (Mantinea, i B.C.): Dor. i(a^riteu/w GDI5117 (Crete, iv/iii B.C.), 4841 (Cyrene): pf. part. i(ariteuwko/tes Abh.Berl.Akad.1925 (5).7 (ibid.): later i(ereiteu/w GDI4842 (ibid.).
i(er-i=tis, idos, h(,= i(ke/tis, A.Fr.93 ap.Hsch. (-ei/thn cod., cf. Theognost.Can.45).
i(ero-bo/ai, oi(, dub. l. in Hsch. s.v. a)/fetoi.
i(ero-bota/nh [a^], h(, = i(era\ bota/nh (cf. bota/nh), Isid.Etym.17.9.55.

i(eroglu^f-e/w,
represent hieroglyphically, zw/|dia Eust.632.52; o)ri/ganon Horap.2.34.

i(eroglu^f-iko/s,, h/, o/n,
hieroglyphic: i(eroglufika/, with or without gra/mmata, ta/, D.S.3.4, Plu.2.354f, Ps.-Luc.Philopatr.21, Dam.Isid.98, etc. Adv. -kw=s PMag.Leid.V.8.29:

i(eroglu^f-isti/,
in hieroglyphic characters, PMag.Leid.W.2.37,al.

i(ero/glu^f-os, o(,
carver of hieroglyphics, UPZ81 iv 2 (ii B.C.), POxy.1029 (ii A.D.), Sammelb.3570 (Fayûm), Ptol.Tetr.180.

i(ero-glwsso/komon, Dor. i(a^ro-, to/,
sacred deed-box, Hermes64.64 (Epid., ii A.D.).

i(ero/-glwssos, on,
of prophetic tongue, Epigr. ap. Paus.6.17.6: -glwsson, to/,
sacred formula, PMag.Berol.2.69.

i(ero-gramma^teu/s, e/ws, o(,
sacred scribe, a lower order of the Egyptian priesthood, Eudox. Ars3.21, OGI56.4 (Canopus, iii B.C.), 90.7 (Rosetta, ii B.C.), Luc. Macr.4, J.Ap.1.32, al., Herasap.Gal.13.776, Aët.15.13, etc.

i(ero-gra^fiko/s, h/, o/n, gra/mmata
sacred signs, Man.Hist.p.512M.

i(ero/-dakrus, u, gen. uos, epith. of li/banos,
with hallowed tears or
gum, Melanipp. 1.

i(ero-di^da/ska^los, o(,
teacher of holy things at Rome, =
pontifex, D.H. 2.73 (pl.).

i(ero-do/kos, on,
receiving sacrifices, or i(ero/dokos,
received in temples, A.Supp.363 (lyr., dub. l.).

i(ero-doulei/a, h(,
company of i(ero/douloi, IG14.914 (Ostia):—also i(ero-douli/a, ib.1024 (Rome).

i(ero/-doulos, o(, h(,
temple-slave, PCair.Zen.451 (iii B.C.), PHib.1.35.3 (iii B.C.), UPZ34.13 (ii B.C.), PTeb.6.25 (ii B.C.), SIG996.29 (Smyrna), BMus.Inscr.986.4 (Cyprus), OGI383.174 (Nemrud Dagh, i B.C.), etc.; newko/roi kai\ i(.Ph.2.420; of the Nethinim, LXX 1 Es.1.2, al.; esp. of
templecourtesans at Corinth and elsewhere, Str.8.6.20, 6.2.6; also of men, Id.11.4.7, al.

i(ero/-dromos, on,
flowing in a sacred stream, u(/dwr Epigr.Gr.835b4 (Berytus): poet. i(ro/-,
running in sacred races, Philox. 15.
i(ero-ergo/s, o/n, v. i(erourgo/s.

i(ero-qallh/s, e/s,
blooming holily, Orph. H.40.17 (Herm. -qhlh/s).

i(ero-qe/sion, to/,
monument, mausoleum, OGI383.36 (Nemrud Dagh), 403.1 (Kara Kush, i B.C.).

i(ero-qete/w,
ordain sacred rites, f.l. in EM468.57.

i(ero-qh/kh, h(,
depository for holy things, sanctuary, Gloss.

i(ero-qrhskei/a, h(,
divine worship, Edict. Maximiniap.Eus.PE9.7.

i(ero/-qroos, contr. i(ero/-qrous, oun,
of mystic sound, Mim.Oxy.413.90.

i(ero-qu/sion [u^], to/,
place of sacrifice, Paus.4.32.1.
i(ero-qu^tei=on, to/, = foreg., IG12(1).847 (Rhodes), 1033 (Carpathos).

i(ero-qu^te/w,
sacrifice, bou=s Heraclit.Incred.39, cf. *)arx. *)ef. 1911.59, IG14.290 (Segesta), 12(1).67 (Rhodes): Arc. pres. part. nom. sg. masc. i(eroqute/s ib.5(2).3.7 (Tegea, iv B.C.).
i(ero-qu/ths [u^], ou, Dor., etc.

i(ero/-ta_s, a, o(,
sacrificing priest, IG5(2).3.5 (Tegea, iv B.C.), SIG492.5 (Euboea, iii B.C.), Paus.8.42.12, cj. in Theopomp. Hist.76: as title of magistrate, IG14.952 (Agrigentum):pl., ib. 12(3).1270 (Syme).

i(ero/-qu^tos, on,
devoted, offered to a god, kapno/s smoke
from the sacrifices, Ar.Av.1265; qa/natos death
as a sacrifice for one's country or
any holy cause, Pi.Fr.78; u(podh/mata derma/tina i(. IG5(1).1390.23 (Andania, i B.C.); oi)=s i(. SIG624.43 (ii B.C.): -quta, ta/,
sacrifices, Theopomp.Hist.76 (s. v.l.), Arist.Oec.1349b13, Plu.2.729c; of meats
offered to idols, 1 Ep.Cor.10.28.

i(ero-kaute/w,
sacrifice as a burnt-offering, Phryn.PSp.88 B.:—Pass.,
to be burnt as a sacrifice, D.S.20.65.

i(ero-khru_keu/w,
to be a i(erokh=ruc, Aristeas 184, SIG444.6 (Delph., iii B.C.):
i(ero-khru_ke/w, IGRom.3.711 (Lycia, iii A.D.).

i(ero-kh=ruc, u_kos, o(,
herald or
attendant at a sacrifice, D.59.78, Herm.Hist.2, prob. in IG12.6.89, cf. Supp.Epigr.2.258.23 (Delph., iii B.C.), SIG577.33 (Milet., iii/ii B.C.), OGI332.43 (Elaea, ii B.C.), etc.: Dor. i(ero-ka=ruc IG12(1).155.31 (Rhodes, ii B.C.).

i(ero-ko/mos, o(,
one who takes charge of a temple, ib.14.621 (Rhegium).

i(ero-kora^kika/, ta/,
symblos of the ko/rakes, in the cult of Mithras (cf. ko/rac), CIL6.751b(iv A.D.).

i(ero-kti/sths, ou, o(,
founder of a sanctuary, Cat. Cod.Astr.8(4).165.

i(ero/-kti^tos, on,
established as a sanctuary, pe/tra, of Delphi, Aristonous 1.1.
i(ero/las, o(,= i(ereu/s, S.Fr.57 (dub.; for the termination cf. maino/lhs).

i(ero/-lhptos, on,
inspired, Man.4.227.

i(ero-logi/a, Ion. i(rologi/h, h(,
mystical language, Luc.Astr.10.

i(ero-lo/goi, oi(,
authors of i(eroi\ lo/goi, Dam.Pr.38.

i(ero/-mantis, ews, o(,
holy seer, Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).148.
i(e/ro-mas: tw=n i(erw=n e)pimelou/menos, Hsch.; uncontr. i)aro/maor Schwyzer 414, cf. 411 (Elis).

i(ero-mhvi/a, h(, (mh/n)
sacred month, during which the great festivals were held and hostilities suspended, i(. *nemea/s, of the Nemean games, Pi.N.3.2; i(. a( *puqia/s IG22.1126.44 (Amphict.); e)n spondai=s kai\ prose/ti i(eromhni/a Th.3.56; e)n spondai=s kai\ i(eromhni/ais ib.65 (s. v.l.); i(. a)/gein D.24.29: in pl.,
sacrifices offered during the sacred month, IG11(2).154.11 (Delos, iii B.C.); = Lat.
supplicatio, App.BC5.130: pl., D.C.39.53 (i(ero-mh/nia, ta/, of the *ka/rneia (q.v.), is prob. f.l. in Th.5.54).

i(ero-mhniako/s, h/, o/n,
of the i(., h(me/rai Inscr.Mus.Alex.47 (i A.D.).

i(ero-mnhmone/w, Dor. i(ero-mna_mone/w,
to be i(eromnh/mwn, Ar.Nu.624, Plb. 4.52.4, SIG545.2 (Delph., iii B.C.), etc.

i(ero-mnhmoniko/s, Dor. i(ero/-mna_m-, h/, o/n,
of a i(., ya=fos ib.554.21 (Thermon, iii B.C.).

i(ero-mnhmosu/nh, Dor. i(ero-mna_mosu/na, h(,
right to appoint a i(eromnh/mwn, Klio 16.162,163 (ii B.C.).

i(ero-mnh/mwn, Dor., Arc. i(ero-mna/mwn [a_], onos, o(,
mindful of sacred
things, o(/rkwn Alciphr.2.4. as Subst.,
representative sent by each Amphictyonic state to the Delphic Council, D.18.148, Jusj. ap. eund.24.150, IG22.1126.10, 1299.80, etc.; also at the Amphictyony of Calauria, ib.4.842 (ii B.C.).
magistrate who had charge of temples or
religious matters, ib.4.823 (Troezen, iv B.C.), 5(2).3.22,26 (Tegea), 14.423.3 (Tauromenium), Decr.Byz. ap. D.18.90, etc. at Rome,=
pontifex, D.H.8.55,10.57, Str.5.3.2. generally,
recorder, registrar, Arist.Pol.1321b38.

i(ero-mosxosfra_gisth/s, ou=, o(,
sealer of sacred calves for sacrifice, PGen.32.4 (ii A.D.).
i(ero/-murtos, h(,= mursi/nh a)gri/a, Ps.-Dsc.4.144.

i(ero-mu/sths, ou, o(,
one who initiates in sacred things, Phot., Suid.
i(ero/n, to/, v. i(ero/s 111.2.

i(ero-ni/khs [ni_], ou, o(,
conqueror in the games, OGI332.34 (Elaea, ii B.C.), SIG1073.4 (Olymp., ii A.D., in form -nei/khs), Phld.Mus. p.105K., Luc.Hist.Conscr.30, etc.: Dor. i(ero-ni/kas IG5(1).668 (Laconia).

i(ero-nome/w,
to be a i(erono/mos, SIG982.2 (Pergam.), 1219.1 (Gambreum, iii B.C.).

i(ero-no/moi, oi(,
temple-wardens, ib.982.23, IGRom. 4.461 (Pergam., sg.), OGI219.20 (Sigeum, iii B.C.); of the
pontifices at Rome, D.H.2.73.

i(ero-noumhni/a, h(,
feast of the new moon, coined by Sch.Pi.N.3.1.
i(ero-o/steon, to/,= i(ero\n o)stou=n, prob. in PMag.Lond.121.212.

i(ero-pare/kths, on, o(, (pare/xw)
priest's attendant, IG 14.617,621 (Rhegium).

i(ero/-plokos, on,
religious, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).212 (s.v.l.).

i(eropoi-e/w,
serve as i(eropoio/s, -poiw=n kai\ qu/wn u(pe\r th=s dhmokrati/as Antipho 6.45, cf. Pl.Ly.207d, IG11(2).144A (Delos, iv B.C.); th=| *)aqhna=| ib.22.1257 (iv B.C.); tw=| *)apo/llwni SIG1037.6 (Milet., iv/iii B.C.), etc.: c. acc., i(. ei)sithth/ria u(pe\r th=s boulh=s D.21.114; oi( ta\ musth/ria -poih/santes IG2.872; i(. ta\ *)apollw/nia BCH36.413 (Delos, ii B.C.).
deify, Aristid.1.191 J.

i(eropoi/-hma, atos, to/,
sacrifice, Jahresh.23 Beibl. 27,28 (Maeonia, iii A.D.).

i(eropoi-i/a, h(,
sacred service, festival, Aen. Tact.17.1 (pl.), BSA24.154 (Halimus, iv B.C., pl.); ai( ei)s to\n qeo\n i(. Decr.Halic. ap. J.AJ14.10.23, cf. Arist.Rh.Al.1423b13 (pl.), Str.5.2.9, Porph.Abst.2.18; i(ereu\s pentekaide/kandros e)pi\ tw=n -poiw=n,=
XVvir sacris faciundis, IGRom.3.172 (Ancyra).

i(ero/poi-on (for -poi/ion), to/,
office of i(eropoioi/, IG11(2).144A104 (Delos, iv B.C.); i(eropoi-poi/i+on
Inscr. Déios 316.69 (iii B.C.).

i(eropoi-o/s, o(, (poie/w)
overseer of temples and sacred rites, title of magistrates at Athens and elsewhere, IG12.5, al., D.4.26, Arist.Pol.1322b24, Ath.54.6, Decr.ib.30.2, IG12(8).264 (Thasos, iv B.C.), SIG410 (Erythrae, iii B.C.), Inscr.Prien.14.25 (iii B.C.), etc.; i(eropoioi\ tw=n semnw=n qew=n were different, D.21.115, Din.Fr.8.1.
sacrificer, D.H.1.40. as Adj., i(. neani/skos, parqe/noi, ib.80,9.40.

i(ero/-polis, ews, h(,
holy city, Ph.2.146; of the cities of refuge, ib. 308,321.

i(ero-pompo/s, o(,
one who conveys the sacred tribute, ib.224, 578.
i(ero/-praktos, o(,= i(eropoio/s, Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).138 (s.v.l., fort.
i(ero-pra/ktwr).

i(ero-preph/s, e/s,
bseeming a sacred place, person or
matter, o)/noma Pl.Thg.122e; te/xnh, of cookery, Men.130; kni=sa Luc. Sacr.13; of persons, -e/statos tw=n progegenhme/nwn X.Smp.8.40, cf. D.C.56.46, LXX 4 Ma.9.25, Ep.Tit.2.3. Adv. -pw=s Michel 163.21 (Delos, ii B.C.), Inscr.Prien.109.216 (ii B.C.), Str.12.5.3, Beros. ap. J. Ap.1.19.

i(ero-pro/spolos, o(,
sacred attendant, priest, Ptol.Tetr.159.

i(ero/pths, ou, o(,= Lat.
haruspex, D.C.52.36,64.5.

i(ero/s (v. sub fin.), a/, o/n, also o/s, o/n in the phrase i(ero\s a)kth/ Hes. Op.597, 805, Orac. ap. Hdt.8.77: Ion. and poet. i(ro/s, h/, o/n (v. sub fin.): Dor. and N. Greek i(a^ro/s IG22.1126.20, etc.: Aeol. i)=ros Sapph.Supp.23.25, Alc.Supp.8.4, but i)/aros (corr. from i)/er-) Sapph. Supp.20a.6: Sup. i(erw/tatos Ar.Eq.582 (lyr.), Pl.Lg.755e.
filled with or

i(/zw, imper. i(/ze (not i(=ze) Od.24.394, E.Hec.145 (anap.): impf. i(=zon Il.20.15, E.Alc.946, Ion. i(/zeskon Od.3.409: aor. ei(=sa Il.23.359, Hdt. 3.61, IG3.701, Hymn.Is.5, etc.; imper. ei(=son Od.7.163 codd.; part. e(/sas 10.361, Cyren. acc. e(/ssanta (v. infr.); inf. e(/ssai Pi.P.4.273 (the only tenses in Hom.): aor. i(/zhsa D.C.50.2, 58.5, etc.: pf. i(/zhka （e)n-) Gal.2.691, 15.452, (sun-) Philostr.Im.2.20:—Med., v. infr. 1 and 111, and cf. e(/zomai.—Mostly in Poets and late Prose, the Att. Prose form being kaqi/zw: (Redupl.
si-sd-ō, aor. (augmented)
e-sed-s-, cf. e(/zomai, e(dos): causal,
make to sit, seat, place, set, mh/ m' e)s qro/non i(/ze Il.24.553, cf. Hdt.3.61; boulh\n i(=ze Il.2.53; i(/zei ma/ntin e)n qro/nois A.Eu.18; o(/s m' e)pi\ bousi\n ei(=s'
set me over the oxen, Od.20.210; skopo\n ei(=se
set as a spy, Il.23.359; lo/xon ei(=san
laid an ambush, 4.392; ei(=sen de\ (v.l. d' e)n） *sxeri/h|

having caused (the suppliant)
to sit on the threshold, Berl.Sitzb.1927.170 (Cyrene): rare in Trag., su\ ga/r nin ei)s to/d' ei(=sas au)/xhm' for
thou didst throne her in this pride, S.OC713 (lyr.). later in aor. 1 Med. ei(sa/mhn, 3sg. ei(/sato IG12(5).615 (Iulis, v B.C., written esato), 2.1298.4 (ii B.C.), 1336.1 (ii B.C.):—
set up and dedicate temples, statues, etc. in honour of gods, Thgn.12, Hdt.1.66; te/menos e(/ssanto Pi.P.4.204; e(/ssato bwmo/n Id.Oxy.408.37: Dor. 3sg. ji/sato IG9(1).704 (Corc., vi B.C.), i(/ssato ib.4.569 (Argos); 3pl. [h(/]ssanto BCH33.171 (ibid., iii B.C.); part. e(ssa/menos IG4.840.7, 841.23 (Calauria, iii B.C.): Att. part. prob. e(sa/menos, qusi/as ta\s patri/ous tw=n e(same/nwn （e(ss-, e)ss-, ei)s- codd.) . . a)fairh/sesqe Th.3.58; later ei(sa/menos IG22.1364 (i A.D.), Plu.Them. 22, Thes.17, Pyrrh.1, Luc.Syr.D.1, also Hdt.1.66 codd.: late fut. ei(/somai i(ero/n A.R.2.807. intr.,
sit, sit down, Il.2.96, 792, etc.; i(=ze e)n me/ssoisi he
sat in the midst, 20.15; i(/zein e)s qro/non Od.8.469, Hdt.5.25; e)s qa=kon S.Ant.1000; e)pi\ qro/nou Il.18.422, cf. Od.17.339; e)pi\ [li/qoisin] 3.409; e)p' a)/krias h)nemoe/ssas 16.365; e)pi\ kw/phn, of rowers, Ar.Ra.199; e)pi\ kw/pa| phdali/w| te E.Alc.441 (lyr.); e)pi\ tou\s new/s Epicr.3.12; ne/fessi . . *)olu/mpoio . . i(/zwn *zeu/s Pi.Pae.6.93: c. acc. loci, i(/zein qro/non A.Ag.982 (lyr.); bwmo/n E.Ion1314: c. acc. cogn., i(/. klwpika\s e(/dras Id.Rh.512.
sit still, be quiet, h.Merc.457 (dub.). metaph.,
sink, ei)s o)xeto\n a)/tas i(/zoisan po/lin
sink into . . , Pi.O.10(11).38; ei)s e(te/ran i(/zei e(/dran Pl.Ti.53a. Med. in signf. 11,
sit, pa/roiq' . . i(/zeu e)mei=o Il.3.162; *dio\s . . poti\ bwmo\n e(rkei/ou i(/zoito Od.22.335; i(ssa/menos e)pi\ tw=| damosi/w| i(arw=| Berl.Sitzb.1927.169 (Cyrene); late fut. ei(/setai Phylarch.44J.: Dor. pres. imper. i(/sdeu

i)h/ [i^], exclam. of joy or enthusiasm, i)h/, i)h/, i)h/, Ar.Pax195; esp. used in the cult of Apollo, i)h\ paiw/n ib.453, al.; i)h\ paih=on Call.Ap.21, 103, Hec.1.1.10; a)lalai\ i)h\ paih/wn Ar.Lys.1291; cf. i)e/. of grief, A.Pers.1004, Supp.114, Ag.1485 (all lyr.). (i(/h v.l. in Call.Ap.ll.cc., where it is associated with i(/ei, imper. of i(/hmi.)

i)hgorei=n: e)grhgore/nai (Lacon.), Hsch. i)hdw/n, o/nos, h(, (i)ai/nw)
joy, formed like a)lghdw/n, Id. (pl.); cf. i)ai/nw. i)hqene/ousa, v. i)aqenei=.

i)h/i+os, a, on, also os, on (v. infr. 11), epith. of Apollo, the god
invoked with the cry i)h/ or i)h\ paiw/n (v. i)h/）, i)h/i+e paia/n Pi.Pae.2.35, cf. A.Ag.146, S.OT154 (both lyr.), 1096, Ar.V.874, A.R.2.702, Duris 79J.
mournful, grievous, i)h/i+oi ka/matoi S.OT174 (lyr.); i)h/i+os boa/, go/os, a cry
of mourning, E.Ph.1036, El.1211 (both lyr.). (From the cry i)h/, as *eu)/ios from eu)oi(/; but also associated with i)a/omai, Hsch. (hence applied to Asclepius, IG3.171); and, as i(h/i+os, with i(/hmi, Hsch., Macr.Sat.1.17.16.)
i)/hla, v. i)a/llw. i)h/lemos, i)hlemi/zw, i)hlemi/stria, *)ihluso/s, Ion. for i)a_l-. i)hlene/s: porfurou=n, me/lan, Hsch.
i)/hma, Ion. for i)/ama; but found in IG22.1121.15 (iv A.D.).

i(/hmi, i(/hs (v.l. i(/eis S.El.596, Castorio 2), i(/hsi, 3pl. i(a=si, Ion. and Ep. i(ei=si; imper. i(/ei Il.21.338, E.El.593 (lyr.); subj. i(w=; opt. i(ei/hn (also a)f-i/oimi, X.HG6.4.3); inf. i(e/nai; part. i(ei/s:—thematic forms of the pres. (as if from i(e/w) are also found, esp. in compds., cf.
meqi/hmi, su/nihmi: also, as if from i(/w, 3sg. pres. i(/ei A.R.4.634, imper. cu/n-ie Thgn.1240b codd.: impf. 3sg. i(/ei Il.1.479, Dor. a)n-i/h SIG1 (Abu Simbel, vi B.C.); 3pl. i(/esan E.Ba.1099, i(/en Il.12.33, cu/n-ien (v.l. -ion) 1.273; also 2sg. i(/eis Ar.V.355; Ion. impf. i(/eske （a)n-) Hes.Th.157: fut. h(/sw Il.17.515, etc.: aor. 1 ind. h(=ka Il.5.125, etc., Ep. e(/hka 1.48 (mostly in compds.); 3sg. subj. h(=|si 15.359; 3sg. opt. ei(/h 3.221; inf. ei(=nai Ar.Ra.133, Ep. e)c-e/menai Od.11.531: pf. ei(=ka, only in compds. (a)f-, kaq-, par-, sun-), also e(/wka （a)f-) PCair.Zen.502.4 (iii B.C.), Hdn.Gr.2.236:—Med., pres. i(/emai Od.2.327, etc.; also 3pl. pro-i/ontai PCair.Zen.151.4 (iii B.C.): impf. i(e/mhn Ar.Eq.625, etc.: fut. h(/somai （met-) Hdt.5.35, (pro-) D.1.12, (e)can-) E.Andr.718: aor. 1 h(ka/mhn (only in compds. pros-, pro-): aor. 2 ei(/mhn, Ep. and Ion. e(/mhn, of which we find ei(=to （e)f-) S.Ph.619, (a)f-) X.Hier.7.11, e(/to （sun-) Od.4.76, e(/nto （e)c-) Il.9.92, etc.; imper. e(/o （e)c-) Hdt.5.39, ou(= （a)f-) S.OT1521; subj. w(=mai （sun-) Il.13.381; opt. ei(/mhn （a)f-) Ar.Av.628, or oi(/mhn （pro-) Pl.Grg.520c; inf. e(/sqai （pros-) Ar.V.742; part. e(/menos （pro-) Th.6.78, Isoc.4.164, etc.:— Pass., fut. e(qh/somai （a)n-) Th.8.63: aor. ei(/qhn (only in compds. a)f-, kaq-, par-): pf. ei(=mai (only in compds.); also e(/wmai in compds. a)n-, a)f-, e)f- (q.v.): plpf. ei(/mhn (only in compds.).—Of the Pass. and Med. Hom. has only pres., impf., and 3pl. aor. 2 Med. e(/nto.—For varieties peculiar to special compds., v. a)n-, a)f-, u(f-i/hmi. (Perh. cogn. with Lat.
Ja-c-io or with Lat.
sēmen:—Med. i(/emai prob. from vi_-, cf. ei)/somai 11, Skt.
véti (pl.
vyánti) 'press forward, desire', Lat.

invitus.) [i^ generally in Hom. and Ep., i_ in Att.; sts. i_ in Hom., i(/ei Il.16.152, etc.; i(ei=sai Od.12.192; also in inf. i(e/men, i(e/menai, part. i(e/menos, etc., cun-i_/ete Archil.50: i^ sts. in Trag., i^hsi A.Th.309 (lyr.), i^e/nta ib.493, i^ei/s, i^ei=sa, E.IT298, IA1101, Hec.338; i^ei=san Id.Supp.281; in Com., suni^hmi Ar.Av.946 (s. v.l.), Strato Com.1.3: with variation of quantity, plei=ston ou)=lon i(/ei [i^], i)/oulon i(/ei [i_] Carm.Pop. 1.]:—
release, let go, h(=ka . . po/das kai\ xei=re fe/resqai Od.12.442; h(=ke fe/resqai
let him float off, Il.21.120;
let fall, ka\d de\ ka/rhtos h(=ke ko/mas
made his locks
flow down from his head, Od.6.231; [e)qei/ras] i(/ei lo/fon a)mfi/ Il.19.383; e)k de\ podoi=in a)/kmonas h(=ka du/w I
let two anvils
hang from his two legs, 15.19; e)k d' a)/ra xeiro\s fa/sganon h(=ke xama=ze Od.22.84, cf. Il.12.205; i(/eis sauto\n kata\ tou= tei/xous Ar.V.355; h(=kan e(autou/s
let themselves
go, X.An.4.5.18; i(/esan fugh=| po/da E.Rh.798. of sounds,
utter, o)/pa Il.3.152, Od.12.192; e)/pea Il.3.221; glw=ssan Hdt. 1.57; *(ella/da glw=ssan i(.
to speak Greek, Id.9.16; *dwri/da, *)attikh\n glw=ssan, Th.3.112, Sol.36.10; fwnh\n *parnhsi/da A.Ch.563; du/sqroa ba/gmata Id.Pers.636 (lyr.); e)k sthqe/wn a)/lgos Id.Th.865 (lyr.); me/gan kwkuto/n S.Aj.851, etc.; but pa=san glw=ssan i(.
to let loose every kind of speech, Id.El.596; pa=san （to\ lego/menon） fwnh\n i(e/nta Pl.Lg. 890d; to\ ta=s eu)fa/mou sto/ma fronti/dos i(e/ntes, i.e. speaking not in words, but in silent thought, S.OC133 (lyr.); h(=ke abs. (sc. fwnh/n), Plu.2.973e; of instruments, a)/lla me/lh tw=n xordw=n i(eisw=n Pl.Lg. 812d.
throw, hurl, la=an, be/los, do/ru, Od.9.538, Il.4.498, E.Rh. 63; i(e/nai (sc. tina/） pe/tras a)/po E.HF320, cf. S.Tr.273: c. gen. pers.,
to throw or
shoot at one, o)i+sto/n tinos Il.13.650; e)p' a)llh/lois i(/esan be/lea Hes.Th.684: metaph., e)k malqaka=s freno\s o)i+stou\s i(e/ntes Pi.O.2.90. abs.,
throw, shoot, to/sson ga\r i(/hsin Od.9.499, cf.8.203, Il.17.515, Pl.Tht.194a, etc.; a)/nw i(e/ntes X.An.3.4.17; di/skoisin te/rponto . . i(e/ntes Il.2.774, al.: c. gen. objecti, tw=n mega/lwn yuxw=n i(ei/s
shooting at great spirits, S.Aj.154; e)pi\ sto/xon （stoi/xwn codd.) at a mark, X. Ages.1.25: c. dat. instr., i(/hsi th=| a)ci/nh| Id.An.1.5.12. of water,
let flow, spout forth, r(o/on Il.12.25; [*)acio\s] u(/dwr e)pi\ gai=an i(/hsi 21.158; r(e/os A.Pr.812: abs., [potamo\s] e)pi\ gai=an i(/hsin the river

send, of living beings, ti/s ga/r se qew=n e)moi\ a)/ggelon h(=ke; Il.18.182; *ai)nei/an . . e)c a)du/toio h(=ke 5.513; of omens or portents, toi=si de\ decio\n h(=ken e)rw|dio/n 10.274; e)/lafon . . ei)s o(do\n au)th\n h(=ken Od. 10.159; te/ras 21.415; generally of things, i)/kmenon ou)=ro/n tini Il.1.479, etc. Med.,
speed oneself, hasten, freq.in part. with Advs., pro/sw i(/esqe Il.12.274; e)nqe/nd' i(e/mhn Ar.Eq.625; i(. *troi/hnde, *)/erebo/sde, Od.19.187, 20.356: with Preps., i(/esqai kata\ th\n fwnh/n Hdt. 2.70; pro/s tina Id.9.78; dro/mw| i(/esqai e)s tou\s barba/rous Id.6.112; i(/et' eu)qu\ pro\s ta\ numfika\ le/xh S.OT1242; e)s o)/rea E.Ba.140 (lyr.); ei)s *kolwno/n Pherecr.134; i(/. e)pi/ tina
spring upon, of the lion, Arist.HA 629b24: abs., i)do/ntes i(e/mesqa S.Ant.432; i(e/menos r(ei=
rushing, Pl.Cra. 420a, etc. metaph.,
to be eager, desire to do a thing, c. inf., i(/eto ga\r bale/ein Il.16.383; bale/ein de/ e( i(/eto qumo/s 8.301; i(/eto qumw=| tei/sasqai . . 2.589: c. gen.,
to be set upon, long for a thing, in part., i(e/menoi po/lios, ni/khs, 11.168, 23.371; no/stoio Od.15.69; lexe/wn S.Tr.514 (lyr.); i(e/menos potamoi=o r(oa/wn
setting thyself toward, Od.10.529: abs. in part., i(e/meno/s per
eager though
he was, 1.6, etc.
i)/hna, aor. 1 Act. of i)ai/nw.

*)ihpai-h/wn, onos, o(, epith. of Apollo, from the cry i)h\ paih=on, h.Ap. 272.
hymn sung to him, ib.500, 517.

*)ihpai-wni/zw,
cry i)h\ paiw/n! Ar.Eq.408.
i)h/ria, ta/,= i)ath/ria, dub. in Supp.Epigr.1.414.4(Crete, v/iv B.C.).

i)/h|si, Ep. 3sg. pres. subj. of ei)=mi (
ibo). i)h/simos, i)/hsis, Ion. for i)as-.
*)ihsou=s, ou=, dat. oi=, Joshua, LXXJo.1.1, al., Act.Ap.7.45; in NT, with dat. -ou=, JESUS, Ev.Matt.9.27, al.
i)h/teira, i)hte/on, i)hth/r, i)hto/rion, i)htro/s, etc., Ion. for i)at-.
i)h/ths: toco/ths, i)obo/los, Hsch.

i)qa_genh/s [i^], e/s, or i)qaig-, Od.14.203 (v.l.), Hdt.2.17 (v.l.), A. Pers.306(v.l.), Alex.Aet. (v. infr.):—
born in lawful wedlock, a)lla/ me i)=son i)qagene/essin (so most codd. and A.D.Adv.187.24: v.l. i)qaig-） e)ti/ma honoured me like
his true-born sons, of a no/qos, Od. l.c., cf. A.R.Fr.12.2 (i)qag- cod.), Alex.Aet.3.2 (i)qaig- cod.). of a nation,
from the ancient stock, aboriginal, opp. e)/phlus, i). *ai)gu/ptioi Hdt.6.53, cf. A.Pers.306; ou)x u(p' i)qagenw=n h)/rxonto Str.7.7.8, cf. Agath.2.15,25. i). ku/hma, opp. an abortion, Hp.Mul.1.71; of some mouths of the Nile,
natural, original, opp. o)rukta/, Hdt.2.17; i). no/tos, ze/furos,
genuine, Arist.Mete.364a16,18. (Glossed au)to/xqwn by Hsch., au)qigenh/s by Erot.;
originalis, indigena, by Gloss.; perh. i)qa^-genh/s [a_ metri gr.], cf. Skt.
ihá, Avest. ida (fr.
*idhá) 'here'; cf. pr. n. *)iqage/nhs Plu.Per.26, Ps.-Hdt.Vit.Hom.1, but *)iqaige/nhs IG 12(9).192 (iv B.C.).)
i)qai/nw, = eu)fronw=, Hsch.: etym. of i)qagenh/s, A.D.Adv.187.25; i)/qaine qumo/n Anon. ap. An.Ox.1.61 (cf. i)qaina/qumos Theognost.Can. 81). (Cogn. with i)qaro/s.)

*)iqa/kh [i^, a^], h(, Ithaca, Od.1.18, etc.: *)iqa^kh/sios, o(, Ithacan, Il. 2.184, Od.2.25, B.Fr.25, etc.:—*)iqa/khnde,
to Ithaca, Od.16.322; *)ihpai/-hqen,
from it, Q.S.7.187.
i)/qana: sxoini/a, Hsch. i)=qar, = ei)=qar, Id.

i)qa^ro/s [i^], a/, o/n,
cheerful, glad, in Comp. -w/teros Alc.Supp.4.18.
pure, kra=nai Simm.25.6; cf. i)qarai=s: taxei/ais, kou/fais, i(larai=s, kalai=s, kaqarai=s, Hsch.
i)qei/h, h(,= a(/maca (Thess.), Hsch. i)qh/, h(, = eu)frosu/nh, Id.

i)/qi^, imperat. of ei)=mi (
ibo),
come, go (q.v.): used as Adv. of encouragement,
come! well then! Il.4.362; i)/. nun Ar.Ra.519, etc.
i)qi/tas: o( blenno\s kai\ mwro/s, Hsch.

i)/qma, atos, to/, (ei)=mi
ibo), always in pl.,
step, motion, peleia/sin i)/qmaq' o(moi=ai Il.5.778, h.Ap.114.
feet, Call.Cer.58.
i)qmai/nw: a)sqmai/nw, Hsch. i)qmi/a: h( tw=n melissw=n e)ruqra\ ko/pros, Id. i)qmi/n (sic): peristo/mion, peritraxh/lion, h)\ stefani/s, Id. (cf. i)/sqmion).

i)/qri^s, o(,
eunuch, restored from Hsch. for i)/dris in AP6.219 (Antip.).

i)qu/-bi^os [i_qu^], on,
straightforward, honest, IG5(2).474 (Megalopolis, ii/iii A.D.; ei)q- lapis).

i)qu-bo/los, on,
straight-hitting, a)ko/ntion Apollod.3.15.1: Sup. -w/tatos, a)kontisth/s J.BJ1.21.13: metaph.,
sagacious, fu/sis Dam.Isid.160.

i)qu/-grammos, on,
rectilinear, sxh/mata Agath.5.9.

i)qu-di/khs [di^], ou, o(,
giving right judgement, Hes. Op.230, APl.4.35.

i)qu/-di^kos, on,
righteous, Epigr.Gr.906 (Gortyn).

i)qu-dromi/a, h(,
straight course, dia\ tw=n po/rwn Harp.Astr. in
Cat. Cod.Astr.8(3).148.

i)qu-dro/mos, on,
straight-running, pri/wn AP6.103 (Phil.).

i)/qu-qric, tri^xos, o(, h(,
straight-haired, opp. ou)lo/qric (woollyhaired), Hdt.7.70, Hp.Epid.1.19.

i)qu-ke/leuqos, on,
straight-going, Nonn.D.15.365.

i)qu-krh/demnos, on, epith. of ships, prob.
with canvas set, Pamphosap.Paus.7.21.9.
i)qu-kte/a^non: to\ i)qu\ pefuko\s kai\ o)rqo\n de/ndron, Hsch.; cf. sq. and eu)kte/anos (B).
i)qu-kti/wn, v. i)qupti/wn.

i)qu/-ku_fos, h, on, of parts of the normal spine,
frontally concave, Hp.Art.45（i)qu-ku_fh/s, e/s,Mochl.1); opp. i)qu/-lordos, h, on （os, on Mochl.l.c.),
frontally convex, ll. cc., cf. Gal.18(2).542.

i)qu-ma^xi/a, Ion. -i/h, h(,
fair, stand-up fight, i). poie/esqai Hdt.4.120; i)qumaxi/h| diw/sasqai strato/n ib.102.

i)qu-ma/xos [a^], on,
fighting fairly and openly, Simon.137.

i)/qumbos, o(,
Bacchic dance and song, Poll.4.104, Hsch., Phot. (For the termination cf. i)/ambos, diqu/rambos.)

i)/qu_na, hs, h(, = eu)/quna,
penalty, fine, SIG986.12 (Chios, v/iv B.C.), GDI5654 (ibid.).
i)qu/n-tata [i_], Adv., Sup. of i)qu/s (A) (q.v.).
i)qu/n-teira, h(, fem. of sq., as epith.of *di/kh, Orph.A.352.

guiding, directing, S.Ichn.73. Subst. -th/rion, to/,
laurel-bough, used by diviners, Hsch.; =
regimen, Gloss. -thri/a, h(,=
canalis, ib. (prob.).

i)qun-th/s, ou=, o(, = i)qunth/r, Hsch. s.v. dii+qunth/s; =
rector, Gloss.:
i)qu/n-twr, Orph.A.122; i)qu/ntoros a)nqupa/toio IG4.1603（Corinth).

i)qu/n-w, Ion. impf. i)qu/neskon Q.S.1.273, al., Hymn.Is.153: aor. 1 i)/quna Od.23.197:—Med. (v. infr. 2), aor. 1 inf. i)qu/nasqai Q.S.14.500:—Pass., aor. 1 i)qu/nqhn Il.16.475: pf. i)/qummai D.P.341, a)p-i/quntai Hp.Fract.7: (i)qu/s A). [i_qu_nw: i^- only in APl. 74]:—Ion. and Ep. for eu)qu/nw (sts. used in Trag., generally with v.l. eu)qun-; never in Com. or Att. Prose),
make straight, straighten, e)pi\ sta/qmhn i)/qunen by the rule, Od.5.245, 23.197, al.:—Pass., e)k sta/qmhs i)qumme/nos D.P. l.c.
guide in a straight line, i(/ppous te kai\ a(/rm' i)qu/nomen (Ep. for -wmen)
let us drive them
straight, Il.11.528; nh=a qoh\n i)qu/nei [the pilot]
keeps it
straight, 23.317; th\n d' a)/nemo/s te kubernh/ths t' i)/qune Od.11.10, etc.; tro/pin Hymn.Is.l.c.; i). dro/mon, kw=lon, E.Hipp. 1227 (v.l. eu)q-), Or.1016 (lyr.); ke/ntra Id.Ph.178 (lyr.); be/los d' i)/qunen *)aqh/nh she
sped it
straight, Il.5.290: in late Prose, leptoi\ u(/pnoi i)qu/nontes ta\ siti/a Philostr.Gym.48:—Med.,
guide or
steer for oneself, of missiles, e)p' *)antino/w| i)qu/neto pikro\n o)i+sto/n
aimed his arrow
straight at . . , Od.22.8; phdali/w| i)qu/neto (sc. sxedi/hn) 5.270; h(ni/oxos i)qu/neto a(/rma Hes.Sc.324: c. gen., a)llh/lwn i)qunome/nwn . . dou=ra
as they drove their spears
straight at each other, Il.6.3:—Pass.,
run straight or
evenly, of horses yoked abreast, tw\ d' i)qunqh/thn Il.16.475 (but,
to be guided, ou) ga\r a)/ter ma/stigos i)qu/netai i(/ppos APl. l.c.); of a boat,
to be steered, Hdt.1.194.
guide, direct, rule, *zeu\s . . pa/nt' i)qu/nei Il.17.632; a)mhxani/h i). no/on Parm.6.6; i). strato/n (corr. from hu)/q- in cod. M) A.Pers.773; i). e(orta/s Orac. ap. D.21.52; zwh/n AP6.68(Jul.Aegypt.); of a judge, mu/qous i).
put straight, rectify unjust judgements, Hes.Op. 263 (dub.), cf. Call.Jov.83; i). to\ ple/on tini/
adjudge the greater part
to him, Theoc.5.71:—Pass., i)qu/nesqai qana/tw|
to be visited with the penalty of death, Hdt.2.177.
i)qu^petei=n [i_] （i)qunp- cod.): e)p' eu)qei/as o(rmh=sai, Hsch.

i)qu^-pore/w [i_],
go straight on, Hp.Oss.15.

i)qu^-po/ros, on,
going straight on, grammh/, grafi/des, AP6.64 (Paul. Sil.), 68 (Jul. Aegypt.).

i)qu^-pti/wn [pti_], wnos, o(, h(, only in Il.21.169 meli/hn i)qupti/wna *(asteropai/w| e)fh=ke, from pe/tomai,
straight-flying (cf. i)qu/s (A) 11):—Zenod. read i)qukti/wna,
straight-fibred (fort. -ktei/wna, cf. eu)qukte/anon, kthdw/n).
i)qu/r: to\ sidh/rion tou= a)/conos to\ tribo/menon, Hsch.

i)qu/rropos [i_], on, （r(oph/)
hanging perpendicularly, Hp.Art.44.

i)qu/s (A) [i_], i)qei=a, i)qu/, Ion. fem. i)qe/a Hdt.2.17, Eus.Mynd.63 (but i)qei/hs, h|, an are prob. in oblique cases)<*> Comp. i)qu/nteros Hdn.Gr.2.927: Sup. i)qu/ntatos or -u/tatos (v. infr.):—Ion. and Ep. form of Att. eu)qu/s:
straight, used by Hom. in this sense only in Adv. i)qu/s (infr. 11); i)qei/h| te/xnh|
straightway, forthwith, Hdt.9.57; i)qe/a o(do/s Id.2.17; i)qei=an (sc. o(do/n)
straight on, Id.7.193; e)k th=s i)qei/hs
outright, openly, Id.2.161, al.; i). a)trapo/s Nic.Th.265, cf. AP10.3; i)qu/ntaton i)/xnos D.P.651; grafi/des i)qu/tatai AP6.63 (Damoch.); i)qu/taton o)/ros
steepest, App.Hisp.1. in moral sense,
straight-forward, just, ei) d' a)/g' e)gw\n au)to\s dika/sw, . . i)qei=a ga\r e)/stai [h( di/kh] Il.23.580; i)qei/h|si di/kh|sin h.Cer.152, Hes.Th.86, cf.Op.36; opp. skoliai\ di/kai, ib.224: in Sup. Adv., di/khn i)qu/ntata ei)pei=n to give judgement
the most fairly, Il. 18.508; later ou)/pote doulei/h kefalh\ i)qei=a pe/fuken Thgn.535; prh/cies i)qu/terai Id.1026; *di/ka i)qei=a B.14.54; i)qu/s te kai\ di/kaios Hdt.1.96; lo/gos i) ib.118. i)qu/s, or less freq. i)qu/, as Adv.,
straight at, mostly c. gen. objecti, bh= r(' i)qu\s *diomh/deos Il.5.849, cf. 16.584; i)qu\s ki/en oi)/kou went
straight towards the dwelling, 24.471, cf. Od.15.511; i)qu\ be/los pe/tet' ou)d' a)polh/gei Il.20.99; e)/plee i)qu\ tou= *)/istrou Hdt.4.89; i)qu\ th=s a)rxh=s th=s *tomu/rios 1.207, cf. 6.95, al.; i)qu\ badi/zein Semus 20; i)qu\s pro\s tei=xos e)/kion Il.12.137; i)qu\s e)pi\ *qessali/hs Hdt.5.64. abs., i)qu\s frone/wn resolving to go
straight on, Il.12.124, cf. 13.135; i)qu\s memaw/s 11.95, etc.; of a bird's flight, SIG1167.7 (Ephesus, vi B.C.); i)qu\s maxe/sasqai to fight
face to face, Il.17.168; me/nos xeirw=n i)qu\s fe/ron 5.506; also te/trapto pro\s i)qu/ oi( (v.l. pro\s i)qu/n, cf. sq.) he fronted him
face to face, 14.403; kat' i)qu\ gou/nasin
opposite, i.e.
vertically below, the knees, Hp.Off.3; of Time,
straightway, Hdt.3.58. regul. Adv. i)qe/ws Id.2.121.b/, al.; ple/ein i)qe/ws e)pi\ to\n *(ellh/sponton Id.8.108.

i)qu/s (B) [i_qu_], h(, used by Hom. only in acc. i)qu/n: a)n' i)qu/n,=
against, pro\s r(o/on a)i/+ssontos a)n' i)qu/n
against the stream, Il.21.303; e)pei\ dh\ sfai/rh| a)n' i)qu\n peirh/santo in throwing
straight upwards, Od. 8.377; pro\s i)qu/n v.l. in Il.14.403.
enterprise, oi(=si ma/lista pepoi/qea pa=san e)p' i)qu/n Od.4.434; a)/ristoi pa=san e)p' i)qu/n e)ste ma/xesqai/ te frone/ein te Il.6.79; gunaikw=n gnw/omen i)qu/n their
mood, designs, Od.16.304; e)mh\n i). dub. in h.Ap.539.

i)qu-sko/lios [i_q], on,
curved in one direction, though straight in another, of the normal spine, Hp.Art.45.

i)qu-te/neia, h(,
extension in length, Ptol.Geog.1.2.4.

i)qu/ths [i_], htos, h(, （i)qu/s A)
straighteness, o(dou= Aret.CA2.6.

i)qu-tmh/s [i_], h=tos, o(, h(,
straight-cut, Nonn.D.2451, 5.282.
i)qu/-tonos, on,= i)qutenh/s, sta/likes AP6.187 (Alph.; v.l. -tenw=n).

i)qu/-trhn (neut. sg.),= i)qu/trhton,
bored straight, Democr.128.

i)qu-falliko/s, h/, o/n,
ithyphallic, of metre, Heph.15.2, Hermog.Id.1.6; ta\ i).
poems in such metre, D.H.Comp.4 (i)qufa/llia codd.), Poll.4.53.

i)qu/-fallos, o(,
fascinum erectum, the phallos carried in the festivals of Bacchus, Cratin.14, etc.
ode and dance performed at such festivals, Hyp.Fr.50, Duris 13J.
one who danced in such dance, Hippoloch. ap.Ath.4.129d, Semus 20, Democh.2 J.: metaph.,
lewd fellow, D.54.14.

i)qu-fa/neia [fa^], h(,
direct incidence of light, kat' i)qufa/neian Damian.Opt.12:—Adj. i)qu-fa^nh/s, e/s, in phrase kat' i)qufane/s,= kat' i)qufa/neian, ibid.

i)qu-foriko/s, h/, o/n,
moving in a straight line, Phlp. in Mete.30.18.

i)qu/w [i_], aor. i)/qu_sa (v. infr.),
go straight, press right on, rare in pres., o( de/, kreiw=n e)rati/zwn, i)qu/ei [u^] Il.11.552; e)/nqa kai\ e)/nq' i)/quse ma/xh pedi/oio the tide of war
set straight over the plain . . , 6.2; i)qu/ei ta/xista delfi/s Pi.Fr.234; i)qu/ei to\ e)/mbruon pro\s to\ h(=par Hp.Mul.1.32, cf. 2.145 vulg.: c. gen. objecti, w(\s *(/ektwr i)/quse neo/s
dashed straight atit, Il. 15.693; i)/qusan d' e)pi\ tei=xos 12.443; i)/qusan pro/s . . Hdt.4.122. c. inf.,
to be eager, strive to do, tw=n o(po/t' i)qu/seie . . e)pi\ xersi\ ma/sasqai Od.11.591; i)/quse/n r(' o)lolu/cai 22.408; o(/kh| i)qu/s eie strateu/esqai whichever way he
purposed to march, Hdt.1.204, cf. 3.39; i)qu/onta strateu/esqai Id.7.8.b/. c. acc.,
desire eagerly, ti meta\ fresi/n A.R.2.950. abs., ti/ makra\n glw=ssan i)qu/sas e)lau/nw e)kto\s o(dou=; why
in my zeal do I drive, etc., B.9.51. (Signf. 1 never in Od., signf. 11 never in Il.）

i)qu^wri/h [i_q], h(, Ion. for eu)quwri/a,
direction, straightness, of a limb, etc., Hp.Off.15 (pl.), Fract.30, al.
i)qw/n: pugh/, lagaro/s, kai\ prwkto/s, Hsch. (fort. i)/qwn).

i)i/zw, (i)o/s)
to be like rust, ferruginous, Dsc.5.75, 103.

i(ka^no-dosi/a [i^k], h(,= Lat.
satisdatio, Cod.Just.2.12.27.2 (also in pl.), Just.Nov.131.15
Intr..

i(ka^no-dote/w,= Lat.
satisdare, POxy.259.29 (i A.D.).

i(ka^no-do/ths, ou, o(,
one who gives security, BGU1189.3.
one who requites, o( i(. qeo/s PMasp.6ii82(vi A.D.).

i(ka^no-poie/w,
make satisfaction, Gloss.

i(ka^n-o/s [i^], h/, o/n, （i(kne/omai)
sufficing, becoming, befitting; prose Adj., used two or three times by Trag. (v. infr.): of persons,
sufficient, competent to do a thing, c. inf., Hdt.3.45, Antipho 1.15, etc.; i(. tekmhriw=sai
sufficient to prove a point, Th.1.9; -w/tatos [ei)pei=n] kai\ gnw=nai Lys.2.42; ti/s sou= -w/teros pei=sai; X.Cyr.1.4.12; i(. zhmiou=n
with sufficient power to punish, Id.Lac.8.4; i(. bohqei=n Pl. Phdr.277a, cf. R.365a; i(. w(/ste gnw=nai Id.Lg.875a, cf. Phdr.258b; i(. kata\ th\n e)pifa/neian Plb.25.3.6, al.: c. acc. rei, a)nh\r gnw/mhn i(. a man of
sufficient prudence, Hdt.3.4; i(. th\n i)atrikh/n
sufficiently versed in medicine, X.Cyr.1.6.15: c. dat. rei, i(. e)mpeiri/a| kai\ h(liki/a| Pl.R. 467d; oi( toi=s xrh/masin -w/tatoi X.Eq.2.1: c. dat. pers.,
a match for, equivalent to, ei(=s e)/xwn i)atrikh\n polloi=s i(. i)diw/tais Pl.Prt.322c, cf. Tht.169a: abs., i(. *(apo/llwn S.OT377; oi( -w/tatoi tw=n politw=n Isoc. 12.132; krith\s -w/teros Id.10.38; i(. sofisth/s Pl.Ly.204a; au)lhtai\ i(. w(s pro\s i)diw/tas
very tolerable in comparison with . . , Id.Prt.327c; gunh\ i(. me/n, a)/groikos de/ Luc.DDeor.20.3; o( *(i.
the Almighty, LXXRu. 1.21. in bad sense,
capable, i(. ei)= lalw=n katako/yai pa/nta Men.Sam.69. of things, in amount,
sufficient, adequate, ta\ a)rkou=nq' i(. toi=s ge sw/frosin E.Ph.554; i(. ta\ kaka\ kai\ ta\ parakei/mena Ar.Lys.1047; i(kana\ toi=s polemi/ois hu)tu/xhtai they have had successes
enough, Th.7.77; i(. ei)/s, e)pi/, pro/s ti, X.Hier.4.9, Pl.R. 371e, Prt.322b; [pro/bata] i(. e)s forbh/n Hdt.4.121; of size,
large enough, ou)x i(kanh=s ou)/shs th=s *(attikh=s Th.1.2; ou)d' h)=n i(kana/ soi . . me/laqra . . e)gkaqubri/zein not
large enough to riot in, E.Tr.996; xw/ra i(. tre/fein tou\s to/te Pl.R.373d, al.; of number or magnitude,
considerable, lu=pai Antipho 2.2.2; me/ros tw=n o)/ntwn ib.2.1.6, etc.; of Time,
considerable, long, i(. xro/non Ar.Pax354 (lyr.); i(. xro/nos tini\ e)pilaqe/sqai Lys.3.10; i(kano/n e)sti/ tini Damox.1.1: with personal constr., e)/fh i(kano\s au)to\s a)tuxw=n ei)=nai Is.2.7.
sufficient, satisfactory, i(. marturi/an pare/xesqai Pl.Smp.179b; i(. lo/gw| a)podei=cai Id.Hp.Mi.369c; to\ i(. lamba/nein to take
security or
bail, Act.Ap.17.9, OGI629.100 (Palmyra, ii A.D.); to\ i(. poiei=n give
security, Plb.32.3.13, D.L.4.50, Just.Nov.86.4 (but simply,
satisfy, tw=| o)/xlw| Ev.Marc.15.15); i(. dou=nai PSI6.554.23 (iii B.C.), POxy.294.23 (i A.D.); e)f' i(kano/n,= i(kanw=s, Plb.11.25.1, D.S.11.40. Adv. -nw=s
sufficiently, adequately, Th.6.92, etc.; lago/nes laparai\ i(. X.Cyn.5.30, cf. Arist.Phgn. 807b26; i(. ei)/rhtai peri/ tinos Id.EN1096a3, al.; later,
considerably, amply, Philostr.VA3.6, VS1.8.3, Ant.Lib.7.7;
fully, mia=s w(/ras i(. parelqou/shs Ptol.Alm.4.6.
excessively, ou)/te ga\r i(. u(gro/n e)sti not
too moist, Gal.6.765, cf. 767,768; i(. blabera/ Id.Vict.Att.8; paxu\ i(. ai(=ma ibid. i(. e)/xein to be
sufficient, Th.1.91, etc.; i(. e)xe/tw let this be
enough, Pl.Sph.245e; i(. e)/xei pro/s ti Id.R.430c, cf. X.Cyr.6.3.22; peri/ tinos Pl.R.402a; i(. e)/xein tini/ to be
sufficiently supplied
with . . , Id.Grg.493c; i(. e)/xein tou= ba/qous Id.Tht.194d; e)pisth/mhs Id.Phlb.62a; i(. pefuke/nai pro\s ta)=lla Id.Chrm.158b: abs., Antipho 2.1.1: Sup. -wta/tws Hp.de Arte12; -w/tata Pl.Phlb. 67a.

i(ka^n-o/ths, htos, h(,
sufficiency, fitness, Id.Ly.215a.
a sufficiency, pai/dwn Id.Lg.930c.

i(ka^n-o/w,
make sufficient, qualify, 2 Ep.Cor.3.6:—Pass.,
to be empowered, PTeb.20.8 (ii B.C.);
to be made complete, brought to perfection, of the soul, tw=| perie/xonti Hierocl. p.9A. Pass.,
to be satisfied, content, tini D.H.2.74: abs., Telesp.39 H., cf. LXXMa.3.10; i(kanou/sqw u(mi=n, c. inf.,
let it suffice you . . , i.e. do it no more, LXX 3 Ki.12.28, al.: abs., ib.Nu.16.7.
i(/kanti, v. i(/kw. i)ka/ntin: ei)/kosin, Hsch. (cf. vi/kati).

i(ka/nw [i^ka_], impf. i(/ka_non [i_ by the augm.], used only in these tenses, the fut., aor., and pf. being supplied by i(kne/omai:—lengthd. form of i(/kw, found in Ep. and Lyr., sts. in Trag.,
come, e)s *xru/shn, e)s *skaia\s . . pu/las, Il.1.431, 9.354; e)pi\ nh=as 2.17; e)nqa/de Od.15.492; so oi)/kade A.Ag.1337 (anap.); oi(= i(ka/nomen S.El.8; pro\s e)sxatia/n Pi.O. 3.43, cf. B.10.96: in Hom. mostly c. acc.,
to come to, i(ka/nw nh=as *(axaiw=n Il.24.501; i(kane/men h(me/teron dw= Od.4.139; later i(. do/mous A. Pers.159 (troch.): abs., h)= fi/loi a)/ndres i(ka/neton Il.9.197; eu)= i(ka/neis S. El.1102.
reach, attain to, [e)la/th] di' h)e/ros ai)qe/r' i(/kanen Il.14.288; fwnh\ de/ oi( ai)qe/r' i(/kanen 15.686; [a)/nemos] ai)pu\n i(. ou)rano/n Sol.13.21; h(/bhs me/tron i(. Od.18.217, 19.532. c. acc. pers., esp. of grief, hardship, etc.; me pe/nqos i(ka/nei Od.6.169; me/ga pe/nqos *(axaii/+da gai=an i(ka/nei Il.1.254; ta/fos de/ oi( h)=tor i(/. Od.23.93; a)/lgos, gh=ras, du/h, ka/matos, kh=dos, o)i+zu/s, mo/ros, i(ka/nei tina/, 2.41, Il.4.321 (v.l.), Od.18.81, 5.457, Il.15.245, Od.5.289, Il.18.465; o(/te min gluku\s u(/pnos i(ka/noi 1.610; me palai/fata qe/sfaq' i(ka/nei they
are fulfilled upon me, Od.9.507: c. dupl. acc., min a)/xos kradi/hn kai\ qumo\n i(. Il.2.171: rarely c. dat., sfw=i+n e)eldome/noisin i(ka/nw Od.21.209. of a suppliant, so/n te po/sin sa/ te gou/naq' i(ka/nw 7.147, al. Med., in signf. 1.1, oi)=kon i(ka/netai 23.7; in signf. 11.1, xreiw\ ga\r i(ka/netai Il.10.118; in signf. 11.2, ta\ sa\ gou/naq' i(ka/nomai 18.457, Od.3.92, 4.322. (Fr. i(k-a^nv-w, i(k-
ṇv-w (cf. i(kne/omai); Aeol. i)/ka^ne dub. in Alc.Supp.34, [i^<*>ka_]ne prob. in Sapph.Oxy.2076.16; i(/ka^non f.l. in Od.15.101.)
*)ika/rios [i_ka^], a, on, Icarian, po/ntos Il.2.145; pe/lagos Hdt.6.96.

i)ka/s [i_], a/dos, a(, Dor. etc. for ei)ka/s,
twentieth of the month, SIG 1025.47 (Cos), IG9(2).517.10 (Larissa); hika/s ib.12(3).1324 (Thera, vi/v B.C.). (vik- in pr. n. vika/dios ib.5(2).271.8 (Mantinea).)

vi/kati, v. ei)/kosi:—hence i)kasto/s, = ei)kosto/s, IG5(2).4.18 (Tegea, iv B.C.): vi_kati/deios, o(,
twenty feet broad, [a)/ntomos] Tab.Heracl.2.18, al.
vi_kative/ths, v. ei)kosae/ths. v
i_kati/pedos, on, v. ei)kosi/pedos.

i)/kelos [i^], h, on, poet. and Ion. form of ei)/kelos,
like, resembling, tini Il.11.467, al., Hes.Sc.198, Sapph.Supp.20b.1, B.Fr.19, Hdt.3.81, Hp.Epid.3.4, Ar.Av.575, Theoc.2.51, etc.; o)rgai=s a)lwpe/kwn i).
like foxes in disposition, Pi.P.2.77; e)piqumi/h kuni\ i). Democr.224: c. gen., qe/as i)ke/lan dub. in Sapph.Supp.25.4. Adv. i(ka^/n-lws, c. dat.,
in the same way as, Hp.Gland.8, Diotog. ap. Stob.4.1.133.

i)kelo/w [i^],
make like, AP9.83 (Phil.).
i)kena/s: o)rxh/seis, Hsch. (cf. sikanoi/, si/kinnis).

i(kes-i/a, h(, (i(ke/ths) (replaced by i(ketei/a in Att., cf. Phryn.3, PS p.77 B., but found in IG12.434; used later, SIG781.11 (Nysa, i B.C.), 888.11 (Scaptopara, iii A.D.), etc.):—
the prayer of a suppliant, supplication, E.Or.1337, Plu.Sol.12, J.AJ11.8.4, AP5.215 (Agath.); pro\s pantoi/an i(. traph=nai D.S.20.14: pl., Ph.2.2; i(kesi/aisi sai=s at thy
entreaties, E.Ph.91; i(kesi/as poiei=sqai, on behalf of the state, Aeschin. 3.121; = Lat.
supplicatio, D.H.8.43. = i(ke/teuma, Plu.Them.24. [i^, but i_ metri gr. in AP l.c., Procl.H.1.36.]

i(ke/s-ios, a, on, or os, on (v. infr.),
of or
for suppliants, epith. of Zeus, their protector, A.Supp. 616, S.Ph.484, E.Hec.345, SIG929 (Cos); also *(ike/sios alone, IG12 (3).402 (Thera); pro\s *(ikesi/ou Luc.Pisc.3; i(kesi/a *qe/mis *dio/s A.Supp. 360 (lyr.).
of or
consisting of suppliants, parqe/nwn i(. lo/xos Id.Th.111 (lyr.).
suppliant, i(kesi/ous pe/mpwn lita/s S.Ph.495; i(kesi/an . . prostropa/n E.Heracl.108 (lyr.); i(kesi/ois su\n kla/dois Id.Supp. 102; i(kesi/a| xeri/ ib.108; a)na/gkas i(kesi/ous lu=sai ib.39; of persons, i(ke/sio/s se li/ssomai S.Ant.1230; i(kesi/a te gi/gnomai E.Med.710: i(ke/sios, o(, as Subst.,
suppliant, Berl.Sitzb.1927.167 (Cyrene). h( *(ike/sios (sc. e)/mplastros), name of a
plaster, Paul.Aeg.3.62, 7.17; h( *(ikesi/ou Id.3.64. [i^k-, exc. metri gr. in A.R.2.215.]

i(keta_do/kos, on,
receiving suppliants, skoph/ A.Supp.713.

i(ket-ei/a [i^], h(, more Att. form of i(kesi/a (q.v.),
supplication, Th.1.24; i(ketei/an poiei=sqai/ tinos to supplicate him, Id.3.67; i(ketei=ai qew=n
addressed to them, Lys.2.39; e)f' i(ketei/an trapo/menos Pl.Ap.39a; meta\ deh/sews kai\ i(. PPetr.2p.60 (iii B.C.), cf. SIG1181.12 (Jewish): pl., -ei/as poiei=sqai Pl.Smp.183a, etc.

i(ke/t-euma, atos, to/,
mode of supplication, me/giston i(. Th.1.137, cf. D.C.68.21.
i(ke/t-eusis, ews, h(,= i(kesi/a, Suid.

i(ket-eute/os, a, on,
to be besought or
entreated, Luc.Merc.Cond.38.

i(ket-eutiko/s, h/, o/n,
supplicatory, Sch.S.OT 143; =
precarius, Gloss. Adv. -kw=s Hsch. s.v. a)nth/dhs.

i(ket-eu/w, fut. -sw E.IA462 (cj. Markl.), Isoc.7.69: aor. 1 i(ke/teusa: used by Hom. only in impf. and aor. with i^ metri gr., but in Trag. i_ from the augm.:—Med. and Pass. (v. infr.):—
approach as a suppliant, e)pei/ se fugw\n i(ke/teusa Od.15.277, al.; e)s *phlh=' i(ke/teuse Il.16.574; e)s *qh/bas i(. Hes.Sc.13; i(. se tw=nde gouna/twn, pro\s gona/twn se, E.Hec.752, Med.854 (lyr.): abs., Hdt.3.48, Isoc.7.69, Phld.Piet. 63.
supplicate, beseech, c. acc. pers. et inf., o( de/ me ma/la po/ll' i(ke/teuen i(ppo/qen e)ce/menai Od.11.530, cf. Hdt.1.11, S.OC1414, E.Ion 468 (lyr.); de/omai u(mw=n kai\ i(. kai\ a)ntibolw= . . bohqh=sai D.27.68; deo/menon kai\ i(keteu/onta sofi/as metadido/nai Pl.Euthd.282b; i(. to\n qeo/n, i(/na . . Aristeas 233; i(keteu/eis i(/na a)feqh=|s Arr.Epict.3.24.76; i(. w(s . . Luc.Anach.1: c. gen. pers. et inf.,
beg of one that . . , E.IA 1242: c. dat., interpol. in Is.2.8:—Pass., tou= qeou= i(keteuqe/ntos u(po\ sou= J.AJ6.2.2. c. acc. rei, u(pe\r oi)/kou . . i(. ta/de E.Or.673; o(/sa pro\s i(eroi=s i(ke/teusan Th.2.47; peri\ w(=n e)/docen e)/nnoma i(keteu/ein e)n th=| boulh=| IG22.218.8, cf. 337.34:—Pass., ta\ -o/mena Aristeas 192. in Trag., freq. parenthetic, i(keteu/w or i(keteu/w se, S.Ph.932, 1183 (lyr.), E.Hec.97 (anap.), cf. Ar.Nu.696, al.:—Med., Id.Ec.915 (lyr.).

i(ket-h/rios, poet. i(kth/rios, a, on, as Adj. in the latter form only,
of or
fit for suppliants, i(. qhsauro/s, of hair offered to a god, S. Aj.1175; kla/doi Id.OT3; i(kth/rioi,= i(ke/tai, ib.327; fwtw=n i(kth/ria, = fw=tas i(kthri/ous, Id.OC923. i(kethri/a, poet. i(kthri/a, Ion. -i/h (sc. r(a/bdos), h(,
olive-branch which the suppliant held in his hand as a symbol of his condition, leukostefei=s i(kthri/as A.Supp.192; i(kethri/hn labei=n, fe/rein, Hdt.5.51, 7.141; i(kethri/an e)/xein Ar.Pl.383; kataqei=nai e)n tw=| *)eleusini/w| And.1.110, cf. UPZ1.9 (iv B.C.); esp. of petitions laid before the Athenian people, i(. qei=nai And.l.c., Arist.Ath.43.6 (less correctly qe/sqai Poll.8.96, wh. is a later use, cf. SIG2666.6 (Samos)); u(pe\r qugatro\s i(. tiqeme/nh PTeb.326.3 (iii A.D.); i(. e)/qhken par' u(mi=n,= i(ke/teusen u(ma=s, D.18.107, cf. 24.12; u(pe\r tou= misqou= i(. qei=nai ei)s th\n boulh/n Aeschin.1.104, cf. 2.15; later i(. pe/mpein, proba/llesqai, Plu.Pomp.28, Ael.VH3.26; i(kethri/as prosene/gkas, i(kethri/an prosa/gein, Ep.Hebr.5.7, POxy.71 i 3 (iv A.D.): metaph., i(kethri/an de\ go/nasin e)ca/ptw se/qen to\ sw=ma tou)mo/n, where the suppliant represents herself as the olive-branch, E.IA1216; nomi/zete to\n pai=da toutoni\ i(kethri/an prokei=sqai D.43.83. = i(kesi/a, v.l. in Isoc.8.138 (pl.), cf. Plb.3.112.8 (pl.), Jul.
ad Ath.275c, Hld.7.7.
i(ket-hri/s, i/dos, h(, pecul. fem. of i(keth/rios, Orph.H.3.13,34.27.

i(ke/t-hs, ou, o(, (i(kne/omai)
one who comes to seek aid or
protection, suppliant; freq. in Hom. of
one who comes to seek for purification after homicide, a)nh\r i(. Il. 24.158, cf. Od.9.270,al.: later generally, i(ke/tai i(zo/menoi tou= qeou= Hdt.2.113, cf. 5.71; i(. se/qen e)/rxomai Pi.O.5.19, cf. S.OC634, Th.1.136; i(. patrw/|wn ta/fwn Id.3.59; de/casqai i(ke/thn A.Supp.27 (anap.); of pilgrims to a healing shrine, e)gkekoimis me/nwn tw=n i(keta=n IG4.951.90 (Epid.); u(bri/zein . . ei)s i(ke/tas Phld.Ir.p.35 W.:—wrongly expld.as
protector of suppliants by some Gramm. in Od.16.422.

i(ket-h/sios, a, on, epith. of Zeus,= i(ke/sios, 13.213.
suppliant, Nonn. D.36.379.
i(ket-iko/s, h/, o/n,= i(keth/rios, Ph.2.546, Aq.Pr.27.6. Adv. -kw=s Sch.Par.A.R.1.824, Sch.E.Hec.147.
i(/ket-is (parox.), idos, h(, fem. of i(ke/ths, Hdt.4.165, 9.76, A.Supp.350,428 (both lyr.), S.OT 920, IG4.951.4 (Epid.), A.R.4.743, etc.
i(ketodo/xos, on,= i(ketado/kos, Eust.1807.9.

i(ketw/suna (sc. i(era/), ta/,
purifications, Hsch.
i(/khai, Ep. for i(/kh|, 2sg. aor. 2 subj. of i(kne/omai.
i)/kkos, o(,= i(/ppos, EM474.12; cf. i(/ppos sub fin.

i)km-a^dw/dhs, es,
moist, wet, Hsch.s.v. i)/kmenos, dub. in Sch.Arat. 1065: i)kmatw/dhs in Ach.Tat.Intr.34.

i)km-a/zw, = sq., Nic.Fr.70.17.
filter through, ooze, Alex.Aphr.in Mete.87.27.
evaporate moisture, dry up, i)kmasqe/ntos de\ tou/tou Plu.2.954e codd.; i)kma/zein: kataskeleteu/ein, Hsch.

i)km-ai/nw,
moisten, Nic.Al.112:— Med., de/mas i)kmai/nesqai
anoint one's body, A.R.3.847:—Pass.,
to be wetted, to be wet, Nic.Fr.70.8, A.R.4.1066.

i)km-ai=os, o(, (i)kma/s) epith. of Zeus,
god of rain, Id.2.522, Nonn.D.5.270.

i)km-a^le/os, a, on,
damp, wet, Ath.Med. ap. Orib.inc.23.23, Aret.SD2.1, Opp.H.3.595.
full of fluid, of the liver, Hp.Mul.1.7.
i)/kmar, to/,= sq., Hsch. (Rather i)kma/r, if Lacon.) v.l. ant. for i)/ktar (B), Erot.

i)km-a/s, a/dos, h(,
moisture, e.g. of oily leather, Il.17.392; i)kma/dos e)sti\ e)n au)th=| [th=| *libu/h|] ou)de/n Hdt.4.185; a)niei\s e)k tou= sw/matos i)kma/da, of a corpse exposed to the sun, Id.3.125, cf. Hp.
Aër.8; of
moisture in the soil, Ev.Luc.8.6; also qano/ntwn i)si\n ou)k e)/nest' i)kma/s no
blood, A.Fr.229 (prob.); of the bodily
humours, Hp.Morb.4.40; of all kinds of
animal juices or
moist secretions, to\ peri/ttwma th=s u(gra=s i). o(\n kalou=men i(drw=ta Arist.PA668b4; h( tw=n katamhni/wn i). Id.GA727b11, cf. HA556b27, al.: com. metaph., th\n i). th=s fronti/dos Ar.Nu.233; i). *ba/kxou, i.e. wine, AP5.133 (Posidipp.); i). druo/s, i.e. gum, ib.6.109 (Antip.).
i)km-a^si/a, h(,= i)kma/s, Hsch., Gloss.
i)kma/w (A),= likma/w, Hsch. (Act. and Pass.):—also i)kma/sai: e)formh=sai, Id. (For nikma/w, n being lost by dissimilation; v. neikhth/r.)

i)kma/w (B), in Pass., Cypr. acc. pl. masc. pf. part. i)kmame/nos
wounded, Inscr.Cypr.135.3 H. (or i)gm- as Schwyzer 679.3). (Perh. cogn. with Lat.
ico.）

i)/kmenos, only in the phrase i)/kmenos ou)=ros, of
a fair breeze, Il.1.479, Od.2.420, al.; not
moist, as Hsch. (Perh. not related to i(/kw, i(kne/omai.)

i)/kmh, h(, (i)kma/s)
a plant growing in moist places, duckweed, Lemna minor, Thphr.HP4.10.1.

i)/kmios, a, on,
moist, Nonn.D.2.490. = i)kmai=os, as epith. of Aristaeus, Call.Aet.3.1.34.

i)kmo/bwlon, to/,
wet clod of earth, Dsc.2.106.

i)kmw/dhs, es,
moist, wet, Sch.rec.A.Pr.88.
i)kna/: trofei=a, i)knei/an: trofei/an, i)knei=os: trofeu/s (Rhodian words), Hsch.

i(kne/omai, lengthd. form of i(/kw (q. v.), i(ka/nw, wh. are the Homeric forms of the pres. (exc. i(kneu/menai, i(kneu/mesqa, Od.9.128, 24.339), first in Alc.98 (s. v.l.): impf. i(knei=to S.OC970: fut. i(/comai Il.6.502, Parm. 3.2, A.Supp.159 (lyr.); Dor. i(cou=mai AP9.341 (Glauc.): aor. 2 i(ko/mhn Il.8.149, etc.; inf. i)/kesqai Sapph.Supp.1.2 [i^, exc. when lengthd. by the augm.]; for part. i)/kmenos v. sub voce: pf. i(=gmai S.Tr.229, part. i(gme/nos Id.Ph.494: non-thematic aor. 2 i(=kto Hes.Th.481, [Simon.] 179.4, Euph.2: (a)fikne/omai is used in early Prose, exc. in signf. 111; i(/konto is f.l. in Th.5.40, i(/khtai is a poet. reminiscence in Pl.Phdr.276d; but i(/keto is found in Hdt.1.216, i(/khtai Hp.Loc.Hom. 47; also in later Prose, Luc.Salt.5, DDeor.6.4, Procop.Pers.1.4, 2.21):—
come, ai)=ya d' i(/konto Il.18.532; o(po/te *krh/thqen i(/koito when he
came to us . . , 3.233; u(po/tropon oi)/kad' i(. Od.22.35; e)s xw=ron Il.4.446; e)pi\ nh=as 6.69; kata\ leimw=na Od.24.13; pro\s gou/nata Hes.Th. 460; u(po\ pto/lin Il.11.182; ei)s o(mo/n Parm.8.46; pro\s o(moi=on Emp.62.6; tui=d' i)/kesqai Sapph. l.c.: freq. in Hom., c. acc.,
arrive at, i(/keto nh=as Il.8.149; te/los i(/keo mu/qwn 9.56; oi)=kon . . kai\ sh\n e)s patri/da gai=an Od.23.258; later i(ke/sqai gai=an Pi.P.4.118 codd.; be/nqos Emp.35.3; a)/lsos A.Supp.556 (lyr.); ste/gas S.OT534, etc.
reach, attain to, posi\n ou)=das i(. Od.8.376; ou)d' i(/keto xro/a kalo/n, of a spear, Il.11.352; ou)d' o)ste/on i(/keto Od.19.451 (v. u(peri/hmi); so of things, h)xh/, kapno\s ai)qe/r' i(., Il.13.837, 18.207; e)/mphs e)s gai=a/n te kai\ ou)rano\n i(/ket' a)u+tmh/ 14.174; e)s po/lin i(/ket' a)u+th/ Od.14.265; of Time, h(/bhs me/tron or h(/bhn i(., Il.11.225, 24.728, etc.; gh/raos ou)do/n Od.15.246; so e)pi\ gh=ras 8.227; h)w= i(.
live till morn, 17.497; also o)le/qrou pei/raq' i(. Il.6.143; le/ktroio palaiou= qesmo\n i(/konto Od.23.296, cf. 354; qi/lhn e)pi\ ge/nnan i(/. Emp. 110.9; e)s a)/peiron Xenoph.28; e)s to\ tuqh=nai Hdt.1.216; ei)s to\ lh/qhs gh=ras Pl.Phdr. l.c.:—in various phrases, i(. meta\ kle/os
come in quest of glory, Il.11.227; e)s xei=ras i(.
come into one's power, 10.448; o(/ ti xei=ras i(/koito whatever
came to hand, Od.12.331; i(. e)s genea/n tinos into his family, Pi.N.10.14; e)s lo/gous tou\s sou\s i(. to speak with thee, S.El.315; e)nqa/d' i(/comai
shall come to this
at last, Id.Aj. 1365; h)/n pote dasmo\s i(/khtai if ever a division
come about, Il.1.166. with a person as object, tina ib.139, etc.; e)/s tina Od. 6.176; but also,
come to his
house, 20.372; *phlei+/wna/d' i(/.
to the hut of the son of P., Il.24.338; meta\ *trw=as i(. 3.264: rarely c. dat., e)peigome/noisi d' i(/konto
came to them at need, 12.374; cf. i(ka/nw 11. of suffering, desire, anger, etc.,
come upon, *)axillh=os poqh\ i(/cetai ui(=as *)axaiw=n Il.1.240; ti/ se fre/nas i(/keto pe/nqos; ib.362; o(/n tin' i(/khtai a)/lh kai\ ph=ma kai\ a)/lgos Od.15.345; o(ppo/te min ka/mato/s te kai\ i(drw\s gou/naq' i(/koito Il.13.711; a(/dos, se/bas i(/. tina qumo/n, 11.88, 18.178; me i(/. a)/xos kradi/hn 23.47.
approach as suppliant, th\n i(ko/mhn feu/gwn 14.260, cf. 22.123; ta\ sa\ gou=na i(ko/meq' Od.9.267; qeou\s prostropai=s i(knoume/nh A.Pers.216 (troch.); *zh=na . . i(co/mesqa su\n kla/dois Id.Supp.159 (lyr.); [qeo\n] que/essin i(knei=sqai
approach a god with offerings and prayer, Theoc.Ep.8.3. Poet. in pres.,
supplicate, beseech, ta/sde ta\s qea\s kalw=n i(knou=mai S.OC1011; kai/ se pro\s tou= sou= te/knou kai\ qew=n i(knou=mai mh/ . . Id.Aj.588, cf. OC275, Ph.470; tau/ths i(knou=mai/ s' E.Or.671: c. inf., pa/ntes s' i(knou=ntai . . qa/yai nekrou/s Id.Supp.130: freq. parenthetic, S.Ph.932, El.136 (lyr.), Ar.Ec.958, Tim.Pers.139. pres. and impf.,
it becomes, befits, pertains to, c. acc. et inf., fame\n h(me/as i(kne/esqai h(gemoneu/ein Hdt.9.26; tou\s ma/lista i(kne/etai (sc. keka/rqai) Id.2.36; i(kne/etai
it is usual that . . , Hp.Art.63; later, not impers., ou(= h( i(erourgi/a i(knei=to D.C.Fr.25.5; o(/[sa ta=s di/kas i(] knei=tai SIG953.46
(Cnidos, ii B.C.). au)to\s kai\ w(=n i(knei=tai, of a man and
those to whom he belongs, i.e. his family, ib.46.25, al. (Halic.). freq. in part., to\ i(kneu/menon
that which is fitting, proper, Hdt.6.84; o( i(., with or without xro/nos,
the fit, proper time, Hp.
Aër.7, Hdt.6.86.a/; e)n i(knoume/na| a(me/ra| Orac. ap. D.43.66; to\ i(. a)na/lwma
the quota of expense, Th.1.99; kata\ tou\s i(. xro/nous Arist.GA750b13 (also of
the latter days, D.H. 1.66); i(. kairoi/ Thphr.CP1.13.3; ta\ -ou/mena mege/qh Arist.GA772a8; h( i(. e)pisth/mh Id.Pol.1288b16; th=s i(. h(liki/as tuxei=n ib.1332b41; also i(knou/menai a)podei/ceis
convincing proofs, Phld.Piet.79; ou)de\n ei)/rhtai i(. S.E.M.1.205; lo/gos tini\ i(knou/menos
favourable, SIG679.77 (Magn. Mae., ii B.C.). Adv. i(knoume/nws, Ion. -eume/nws,
fittingly, aright, Hdt. 6.65, Hp.Mul.2.135, M.Ant.5.12.

i)/knus, uos, h(,
dust or
ashes, ta
 i)/knun a)po\ tw= bwmw= . . a)fele
 e)s kaqaro/n Berl.Sitzb.1927.159 (Cyrene); cf. i)/knuon: koni/an, smh=ma, Hsch.; th

entryFree.sense: oi)/nw| diatri/yas, dou=nai piei=n Hp.Nat.Mul.88 (v.l. i)/gdhn).

div0.entryFree:
i)/kria, ta/ (sg. v. infr. 111; for the accent v. Hdn.Gr.1.357),
halfdeck at the stern of a ship, nhw=n i)/kri' e)pw/|xeto makra\ biba/sqwn Il.15.676; [kubernh/ths] ka/ppes' a)p' i)krio/fin Od.12.414; ei)s i)/kria nho\s e)/bainon prw/|rhs (i.e. from the prow) ib.229; nho\s e)p' i)krio/fin katale/cetai 3.353; eu)pa/ktwn e)p' i)kri/wn staqei\s o)/rouse B.16.83: wrongly expld. by Eust. as = e)gkoi/lia in Od.5.252, but perh. so used by Nonn. D.40.447,452; expld. as = kerai/a in A.R.1.566 by Sch., but prob. wrongly, cf. Lyc.751. generally,
platform, stage, i)/kria e)pi\ staurw=n u(yhlw=n . . e(/sthke Hdt.5.16, cf. Str.12.3.18, Hsch.
scaffolding, IG12.94.28 (prob. in 374.151), 4.39 (Aegina, v B.C.), BCH6.27(Delos, ii B.C.).
benches in a theatre, Cratin.323, Ar.Th.395, Ath.4.167f. dub. sens. in Thphr.HP5.6.2. sg.,= i(sto/s,
mast, Eust.1533.31;
pole, dub. l. in Nic.Th.198; set up on a cenotaph, Marcellin.Vit. Thuc.31.

i)kria/s, h(,=
pergula, Gloss. (dub.).

i)/krinon, to/,=
tabulum, Gloss. (dub.).
i)krio-poie/w,= i)krio/w 1, Rev.Phil.50.69 (Didyma, ii B.C.), Inscr.Délos290.241 (iii B.C.).

i)krio-poi/hsis, ews, h(,
erection of scaffolding, ib.240 (prob.).

i)krio-poio/s, o(,
maker of scaffolding or
benches, Poll. 7.125.

i)kri-o/w,
erect scaffolding, IG12.371.22, 374.74 (i(k-).
furnish with benches, qe/atron D.C.43.22:—Pass., ib.59.7.

i)kri/-wma, atos, to/,
scaffold, IG12.374.67 (i(k-), Hsch. s.v. kath=liy. in pl.,= a)nth/rides, Eust.903.54.

i)kri-wth/r, h=ros, o(,
upright supporting a gallery or loft, IG22.1668.78: pl., ib.12.313.110 (i(k-). in pl. -h=res, oi(,
flooring of the deck, ib.22.1629.1156, 1631.339(or perh.
joists which support it). = i)kriw/mata, Demioprat. ap. Poll.10.157.
i(ktai=os, a, on,= i(ke/sios, A.Supp.385 [lyr., with penult. short].

i)/ktar (A), Adv.
close together, thickly (= puknw=s, Hsch.), keraunoi\ i)/. a(/ma bronth=| te kai\ a)steroph=| pote/onto Hes.Th.691. Prep. c. gen.,
close to, hard by, i)/. mela/qrwn A.Ag.116 (lyr.); i)/. h(/menoi *dio/s Id.Eu.998(lyr.): c. dat., Alcm.23.80: abs., tau=ta pro\s tu/rannon . . ou)d' i)/. ba/llei do not strike even
near him, are quite wide of the mark, prov. in Pl.R.575c, cf. Ael.NA15.29.

i)/ktar (B), to/,=
pudendum muliebre, Hp.Mul.2.174 (restored fr. Erot. and Gal.19.105: h(=par （h)=par) codd. Hp.).

i)/ktar (C), o(, some kind of
fish, Call.Fr.38:—also i)kta/ra, h(, Hsch.; =
albula, Gloss.; cf. kta/ra.
i)kte/a: a)ko/ntion, Hsch.

i)kter-i/as li/qos, o(,
a yellowish kind of
stone, Plin.HN37.170.

i)kter-ia/w, (i)/kteros)
to be ill of the jaundice, v.l. in Dsc.3.1, M.Ant.6.57, Hld.3.8, S.E.P.1.44, Gal.18(1).250.

i)/kter-is,=
aurugo, Gloss.

i)kter-i/ths,=
rosmarinum, ibid.; but i)kter-i=tis, Ps.-Dsc.3.75, Apul.Herb.80 (v.l.
-es):
i)kter-iw/dhs, es,= i)kteriko/s, Hp.Aph.5.72, Dsc.3.1; and i)kter-o/eis, essa, en, xlo/os Nic.Al. 475.

i)kter-o/omai, Pass.,
have the jaundice, Hp.Prorrh.1.32, Gal.16.574.

i)/kter-os, o(,
jaundice, Hp.Aph.4.62(pl.), Morb.2.38, Int.35(pl.), etc.
a bird of a yellowish-green colour, by looking at which a jaundiced person was cured—the bird died! Plin.HN30.94 (who identifies it with
galgulus, the
golden oriole).
i)kter-w/dhs, es,= i)ktesiko/s, Hp.Epid.3.17.ig/.
i)/kteu: kratei=s (Lacon.), Hsch. i)kth/,= i)kti/n, Ruf.Fr.79.
i)/kthr, eros, o(,= i)/kteros, acc. i)/ktera v.l. in LXXLe.26.16.

i(k-th/r, h=ros, o(,= i(ke/ths,
a suppliant, S.OT185(lyr.), E.Heracl. 764(lyr.): as Adj., i(. kla/doi S.OT143; qallo/s E.Supp.10. *zeu\s i(kth/r
the protector of the suppliant, A.Supp.479.
i(k-th/rios, a, on, v. i(keth/rios.
i(/k-ths, ou, o(,= i(ke/ths, Lyc.763, Hsch., Theognost. Can.15.
i)kti/deos, a, on, (i)kti/n) v. kti/deos.

i)kti/n, i=nos, o(,= sq., Lyr.inPhilol.80.336 (-tein Pap.): acc. sg. i)kti=na Ar.Fr.628, Pl.Com.243, Jul.Mis.366a: gen. sg. i)kti=nos ibid.: nom.pl. i)kti=nes Paus.5.14.1: dat. pl. i)kti=si Ctes.Fr.57.11: nom. sg. also i)kti/s, Gloss., prob. in Hsch. (Pamph.).

i)/kti_nos (Sch.Il.Oxy.1087.60 (i B.C.), Choerob.in Theod.1.267, but i)kti=nos Hdn.Gr.1.183), o(,
kite, Miluus regalis, Semon.12, Hdt.2.22, S.Fr.111,767, Ar.Av.502,al., Pl.Phd.82a, Men.926; i)kti/nou a)gxistro/fou h)=qos Thgn.1261; feu/geis i)kti/nou sxe/tlion h)=qos e)/xwn Id.1302. a kind of
wolf, Opp.C.3.331. (Cf. Arm.
[cnull ]in 'kite'.)

i)/kti^s, i^dos （i)kti=das is f.l. in Ar.Ach.880), h(,
the galh= a)gri/a or
yellow-breasted marten, Ar. l.c., Arist.HA612b10, Nic.Th.196, cf. Sch.adloc., Aret.SD1.15. (i is prothetic, cf. kti/deos.)
i(ktoreu/w, poet. for i(keteu/w, S.Fr.58.
i)kto/s, in neut. i)kto/n: to\ e)oiko/s, and i)ktu/s: o(moi/wma, ei)kw/n, Theognost. Can.15,16.
i(/ktwr, oros, o(,= i(ke/ths, but used of women in A.Supp.653(lyr.).

i(/kw [v. sub fin.], chiefly Ep., Lyr., and Dor., never in Hdt. or Trag. (in A.Supp.176 Pors. restored h(/kete); cf. i(ka/nw, i(kne/omai; Dor., Arc. i(/kw IG4.329 (Corinth), 952.16(Epid.), Schwyzer323C37 (Delph.), IG5(2).3.12（Tegea), written ei(/kw in Epich.35.13 codd., but i(/kei correctly in Ar.Lys.87; 3pl. i(/kanti,= h(/kousin, Hsch. (cf. pari/kw): impf. i(=kon Il.1.317: poet. fut. inf. i(ce/men Pi.Pae.6.116; Dor. fut. i(cw= Megar. in Ar.Ach.742: Ep. aor. i(=con (v. infr.); also aor. 1 i(=ca Q.S.12.461 (v.l.): for i(/comai, i(=gmai, v. i(kne/omai:—
come, of persons, e)s do/mon i(/kei Od.18.353; i(=cen d' e)s *pria/moio Il.24.160, cf. 122; ei) de/ ken oi)/kad' i(/kwmi fi/lhn e)s patri/da gai=an 9.414; e)s *(ro/don i(=cen a)lw/menos 2.667; e)pi\ *qrh|kw=n . . te/los i(=con i)o/ntes 10.470; i(=ce d' e)p' e)sxatih/n 20.328; potamoi=o kata\ sto/ma . . i(=ce ne/wn Od.5.442: in Hom. freq. c. acc.,
come to, do/mon Il.18.406, etc.; *maleia/wn o)/ros Od.3.288; ei) *qemi/stion i(/keis w(/st' a)ei/dein Pi.N.5.50, cf. O.5.9; ai)/ k' au)to\s i(/kh, a)nele/sqw prob. in IG5(2).159.2 (Class.Phil.20.134). of things, *frugi/hn . . kth/mata perna/men' i(/kei
come or
are brought to . . , Il.18.292; also o(po/te xro/nos i(=ce dikaspo/los Maiist.52.
attain to, reach, kni/sh d' ou)rano\n i(=ken Il.1.317, cf. 2.153, 14.60; ai)/glh di' ai)qe/ros ou)rano\n i(=ke 2.458; o)rumagdo\s . . ou)rano\n i(=ke di' ai)qe/ros 17.425; kle/os ou)rano\n i(/kei Od.9.20; u(/bris te bi/h te . . ou)rano\n i(/kei 15.329; *)iqa/khs ge kai\ e)s *troi/hn o)/nom' i(/kei 13.248; i(/kh| t' e)s a)/kron a)ndrei/as Simon.58.6. of sufferings, feelings, etc., o(/te ke/n tina . . xo/los i(/koi
come upon him, Il. 9.525; toi pinuth\ fre/nas i(/kei Od.20.228; xreiw\ i(/kei tina/ 2.28, 5.189: abs., xreiw\ to/son i(/kei Il.10.142. [In i(/kw, i_ always; in i(ka/nw, and the unaugmented moods of i(ko/mhn, i^ always.—i(/kont' is prob. for i(/konto [i^] in Pi.P.2.36.] (Prob. cogn. with h(/kw.)
i)/la_ [i_], h(, Dor. for i)/lh.

i)la^do/n [i_], Adv., (i)/lh)
in troops, Il.2.93, Hdt.1.172 (vv.ll. i(l-, ei)l-): generally,
in abundance, kako/thta kai\ i). e)/stin e(le/sqai Hes. Op.287.

i(la/eira^, h(,
mildly-shining, flo\c i(la/eira [i^la^] Emp.85; i(la/eira [i_la_] selh/nh Id.40: as pr. n., Cypr.Fr.8. (Prob. from i(laro/s.)
i(la/eis, entos, o(, contr. i(la=s (q.v.), Ion. i)lh=s (q.v.), Aeol. i)lla/eis, = i(/laos, i)lla/enti qu/mw| Alc.Supp.4.19: for i)la/eos: i)daro/s, Hsch., read i(la/eis: i(laro/s. [a_ by nature.]
i(/laqi, v. i(/lhmi.
*)ilai=os, o( (sc. mh/n), name of month at Delphi, SIG2847.2, al. (Perh. connected with i)/lh.)
i(/la^mai,= i(la/omai, i(/lamai de/ s' a)oidh=| h.Hom.19.48, 21.5; *)/artemin i(/lasqai qe/lcai q' u(perh/nora qh=ra Orph.A.944; cf. i(/lhmi. [i^ in h.Hom., i_ in Orph.]

i(la/omai [i^la^], Ep. pres. for i(la/skomai, tau/roisi kai\ a)rneioi=s i(la/ontai Il.2.550; i(la/esqai A.R.2.847:—also i(le/omai, A.Supp.117(lyr.): i(leo/omai, Pl.Lg.804b and later Prose, as Luc.Salt.17, Porph.Antr. 20, D.C.59.27, Procop.Aed.3.6, Ps.-Callisth.1.6:—also i(lao/omai, MAMA1.230 (Laodicea Combusta).

i(/laos [v. sub fin.], on, Ep. and Lyr. (incl. lyr. of Trag., A.Eu.1040, S.OC1480, Ar.Th.1148): irreg. gen. i(la/onos UPZ1.8 (iv B.C.); Att. and later i(/lews, wn (also in Herod.4.25, v.l. for i(/leon in Hdt.6.91), dual i(/lew Pl.Euthd.273e; nom. pl. i(/lew| S.OC44, X.Mem.1.1.9 (later i(/lews indecl. as nom. pl., SIG985.47 (Philadelphia, ii or i B.C.), as acc. sg., LXX 2 Ma.7.37, 10.26, as gen. sg., ib.2.22); neut. i(/lea Pl. Phd.95a: i(/leos, on, Hdt.4.94, 6.91 (v. supr.); also Cret., SIG527.92 (Dreros, iii B.C.), GDI5039.26（Hierapytna), Hsch.: i(/lhvos, dub. in IG5(1).1562（Olymp., vi or v B.C.,= Epigr. ap. Paus.5.24.3, where i(la/w|); Aeol. i)/llaos Hdn.Gr.2.524, cf. i(la/eis:—of gods,
propitious, gracious, e)/peiq' i(/laos *)olu/mpios e)/ssetai h(mi=n Il.1.583, cf. Hes.Op.340, Thgn.782, Archil.75, Pi.O.3.34, Trag.et Ar. ll. cc., Theoc.5.18: in Prose, Pl.Lg.712b, LXXGe.43.23, al., UPZ78.24 (ei(/l-, ii B.C.), Ep.Hebr.8.12, etc.; in deprecation, i(/lew/s soi, ku/rie (sc. o( qeo/s), i.e. be it far from thee, Ev.Matt.16.22; i(/. h(mi=n *pla/twn kai\ e)ntau=qa OGI721.10 (Egypt, iv A.D.). of things,
propitious, blameless, atoned for, i(/laon h)=nai, opp. i)nmenfe\s h)=nai, IG5(2).262(Mantinea, v B.C.). of men,
gracious, kindly, su\ d' i(/laon e)/nqeo qumo/n Il.9.639; soi . . qumo\s e)ni\ fresi\n i(/. e)/stw 19.178; i(/lews klu/ein S.El.655; de/casqai Id.Aj.1009, cf.Tr.763; e)poi/hse/ q' i(laro\n . . ka)pe/deicen i(/lewn Ephipp.6.7: sts. almost,= i(laro/s, meidh=sai gela/sai te kai\ i(/laon sxei=n qumo/n h.Cer. 204, cf. Pl.Smp.206d; o( oi)=nos to\n a)/nqrwpon poiei= i(/lewn Id.Lg. 649a. Adv. i(la/ws and i(le/ws, Hsch. [i_ always: a_ Il.1.583, h.Cer.204, Hes. and A. ll. cc., Euph.12, Pae.Erythr.19, Theoc.5.18, Epigr. ap. Paus. l.c., IG12(2).476, Parth.Fr.4; elsewh. a^, v. supr., also Id.Fr.32, etc.]

i(la^r-ei/a [i^], h(,
rejoicing; in pl.,= i(la/ria, ta/, Sallust.4.

i(la^r-eu/omai,
to be joyful, exult, Sm.Ca.1.4, al., Dosith.p.431 K. (prob.).

i(la^r-i/a, h(, （i(laro/s） = i(laro/ths, Herod.Med. ap. Orib.5.27.20, Vett.Val.3.27, PFlor.391.43 (iii A.D.), dub. in Luc.Am.17; meta\ pa/shs xara=s kai\ i(lari/as Sammelb.991 (iii A.D.). pet name for a galh=, interpol. in Artem.3.28.

i(la^/r-ia (sc. i(era/), ta/,= Lat.
hilaria, festival of rejoicing in various cults, e.g. Isis, CIL12.p.334; esp. of Magna Mater, Jul.Or.5.168d, Macr.Sat.1.21.10, Dam.Isid.131.

i(la^ropoie/w [i^],
gladden, Gloss.

i(la^ro/s [i^], a/, o/n, （i(/laos)
cheerful, merry, fe/ggos Ar.Ra.456(lyr.); i(laroi\ a)nti\ skuqrwpw=n X.Mem.2.7.12; i(laro\s i)/sqi Thphr.Char.17.9, i(laro\n ble/yai AP12.159（Mel.), cf. Phld.Mus.p.85 K., Philostr.Im.1.16; i(. do/ths 2 Ep.Cor.9.7, cf. LXXPr.22.8: in later Greek,= i(/lews<*>
gracious, PMag.Leid.W.14.12, etc.: to\ i(.,= i(laro/ths, Plu.Sull.34,
Heraclid.Pont. ap. Ath.14.624d; -wte/ra a)ggeli/a
more cheerful news, Jahresh.23 Beibl.283 (Ephesus). Adv. -rw=s X.Ap.33, LXXJb.22.26, Phld.Mus.l.c., Plu.Ages.2. of blood,
quick-pulsing, Philostr. Gym.48 (Comp.). of imitation gold,
bright, PLeid.X.17 (iii/ iv A.D.). Adv. i(larw=s (leg. i(larw=|) ib.87.

i(la^ro/ths [i^], htos, h(,
cheerfulness, gaiety, LXXPr.18.22, D.S.3.17, Ep.Rom.12.8, Plu.Ages.2, Alciphr.3.43; i(. h( pro\s pa/ntas Vit.Philonid. p.10C.: pl., Phld.Mus.p.85 K.

i(la^rotra^gw|di/a [i^], h(,
burlesque tragedy, invented by Rhinthon, Suid. s.v. *(ri/nqwn.

i(la^r-o/w [i^],
gladden, brighten, LXXSi.7.24,al., Aristeas 108; lo/gous Phld.Mus.p.99 K.:—also i(la^r-u/nw, LXXPs.103(104).15:—Pass., fut. -unqh/somai, aor. -u/nqhn, PMag.Leid.W.12.30, 5.20.

i)l-a/rxhs (later written ei)l-, cf. beila/rxas), ou, o(, (i)/lh)
commander of a troop of horse, PPetr.3p.8 (iii B.C.), al., Ascl.Tact.7.2, Plu.Tim. 31 (pl.), Arr.An.2.7.3; = Lat.
praefectus turmae, Plb.6.25.1, 6.35.8.
commander of eight elephants, Ascl.Tact.9, Ael.Tact.23:— hence i)l-arxe/w, Boeot. vilarxi/w,
command cavalry, IG7.3087 (Lebad.), 3206 (Orchom.), 2466 (Thebes). at Rome,
to be sevir equitum, D.C.55.10.

i)l-arxi/a, h(,
contingent of eight elephants, Ael.Tact.23.

i)/l-arxos, o(,= i)la/rxhs 1, IG4.487.2, al. (Nemea, iii B.C.); =
praefectus turmae, App.Hisp.43.

i(la^r-w|do/s [i^], o(, （w)|dh/)
singer of joyous (not 'comic')
songs, Aristocl.Hist.8:—hence i(la^r-w|de/w, Id.7; i(la^r-wdi/a, Aristox.Fr.Hist.58, cf. Ath.14.621c.

i(la^r-w=pis, h(,
of gracious aspect, prob. in PMag.Lond. 121.382.
i(la=s [i_], a=ntos, o(,= eu)menh/s, Hdn.Gr.2.657, cf. 318, al.: pl. i(la=ntes （i)la/ntes cod.) Hsch. (contr. fr. i(la/eis -entos, q.v.).
i(la^s-i/a [i_], h(,= i(lasmo/s, IGRom.3.1297 (Arabia).

i(la^/s-imos, on,
placable, pro/noia M.Ant.12.14.

i(la^/s-komai, fut. i(la/somai [a^] Pl. Phd.95a, Ep. i(la/ssomai Orac. ap. Paus.8.42.6, also i(la/comai A.R. 2.808: aor. 1 i(la^sa/mhn, Ep. part. i(lassa/menoi Il.1.100, Ep. subj. 2sg. i(la/sseai 1.147, -hai A.R.3.1037; inf. i(la/ssasqai Ant.Lib.25.2 codd.; also i(la/casqai A.R.1.1093:—Pass. (v. infr. 11). [i_ regularly (written i, not ei, SIG1044.6,9 (Halic., iv/iii B.C.)); i^ Il.1.100, 147]: (i(/laos):—
appease, in Hom. always of gods, qeo
 i(. ib.386, cf. 100, al., Od.3.419; molph=| qeo
 i(la/skonto Il.1.472; spondh=|si qu/essi/ te i(la/skesqai (sc. qeou/s) Hes.Op.338; o)/fr' h(mi=n e(ka/ergon i(la/sseai Il.1.147; c. part., i(la/skomai pe/mpwn by presenting, Pi.O.7.9; tou=ton (sc. qeo
） i(la/skou pow=n mhde
 a)/topon Men.Epit.558; of the dead as heroized, qusi/h|si/ tina i(. Hdt.5.47. of men,
conciliate, i(. tina\ xrh/masi Id.8.112; pw=s i(laso/meqa kai\ ti/ni lo/gw|; Pl.Phd.l.c.; i(. th
 o)rgh/n tinos Plu.Cat.Mi.61.
expiate, ta\s a(marti/as Ep.Hebr.2.17. Pass. with fut. i(la/somai, also i(lasqh/s omai v.l. in LXX 4 Ki.5.18: aor. 1 i(la/sqhn ib.Ex.32.14,al.:—
to be merciful, gracious, tini ll.cc.; i(la/sqhti/ moi tw=| a(martwlw=| Ev.Luc.18.13; tai=s a(marti/ais tinw=n LXXPs.77(78).38: c. inf., i(la/sqh ku/rios peripoih=sai to
 lao/n ib.Ex.32.14.

i(/la^s-ma, atos, to/,
propitiation, Orac. ap. Phleg.Macr.4.

i(la^s-mo/s [i_], o(,
a means of appeasing, in pl., Plu.Sol.12, Orph.A.39,554,etc.
atonement, sinoffering, LXXEz.44.27, 2 Ma.3.33, 1 Ep.Jo.2.2,4.10, Ph.1.121.

i(la^s-th/rios, a, on （os, on PFay.337 (ii A.D.)),
propitiatory, offered in propitiation, mnh=ma J.AJ16.7.1; qa/natos LXX 4 Ma.17.22; qusi/ai PFay. l.c. i(lasth/rion e)pi/qema,
the mercy-seat, covering of the ark in the Holy of Holies, LXXEx.25.16(17): i(lasth/r_ion alone as Subst., ib.Le.16.2,al., Ep.Hebr.9.5, cf. Ph.2.150. (sc. a)na/qhma)
propitiatory gift or
offering, Ep.Rom.3.25; of a monument, Inscr.Cos 81,347.
monastery, Men.Prot.p.15 D.

i(la^s-th/s, ou=, o(,
propitiator, Aq., Thd.Ps.85(86).5, f.l. in LXX 1 Es.8.53.
i(la^t-eu/w, = i(lh/kw, LXXDa.9.18.

i(la^t-h/rion, to/,
expiatory or
propitiatory offering, Chron.Lind.B.49.
i)leas, ta/s, dub. sens. in Abh.Berl.Akad.1928(6).16（Cos): perh. Coan for ta\s i)/las （i)/lh) or ta\s i(le/as （i(/lews).
i(le/omai, i(leo/omai [i_], v. i(la/omai. i)leo/s [i_], o(,= ei)leo/s 1 and 11, Hsch. i(/leos, = i(/laos; and i(/lews, wn, Att. for i(/laos (q.v.).

i(le/-wsis [i_l], ews, h(,
propitiation, Plu.in Hes.26.
i(le-wth/rion, to/,= i(lasth/rion, Phot., Suid.

i)/lh [i_], Dor. i)/la_ (Boeot. vil- in vilarxi/w), h(,
band, troop of men, Hdt.1.73,202; eu)/frones i)=lai merry
companies, Pi.N.5.38; also i)/la leo/ntwn E.Alc.581 (lyr.). as a military term,
troop of horse, prop. of sixty-four men, cf. Arr.Tact.18.2; but varying in number, Ascl.Tact.7.2;= Lat.
turma, Plb.6.25.1, al., D.H.6.12, al., Plu.Caes. 45,al.; later,= Lat.
ala, IGRom.3.272 (Galatia), BGU69 (ii A.D.), J. AJ17.10.9, etc.; kata\ i)/las,= i)lado/n, opp. kata\ ta/ceis, X.An.1.2.16: generally,
troop or
company of soldiers, S.Aj.1407 (anap.). at Sparta, subdivision of the a)ge/la (q.v.), X.Lac.2.11; kat' i)/lhn Plu. Lyc.16.
i)lhdo/n [i_], Adv.,= i)lado/n, Q.S.1.7,al.

i(lh/kw [i_], （i(la/skomai)
to be gracious, of a god, once in Hom. in subj., ei)/ ken *)apo/llwn h(mi=n i(lh/kh|si Od.21.365; elsewh. in opt., i(lh/koi *)apo/llwn h.Ap.165; i(lh/kois, *de/spoina AP5.72 (Rufin.); i(lh/kois, *poliou=xe ib.9.154 (Agath.); qeoi\ ma/kares, i(lh/koite Alciphr.3.68, cf.Hld. 8.11, 9.25. (Prob. ei(l-, cf. sq.)

*i(/lhmi [i_],= foreg., only in imper. i(/lhqi, in prayers,
be gracious! Od.3.380, 16.184, h.Hom.20.8, etc.: Aeol. e)/lla_qi (q. v.): Dor. i(/la^qi Theoc.15.143, Luc.Epigr.22; both together, i(/la^q', a)/nac, i(/lhqi AP 12.158 (Mel.): pl., i(/la^te A.R.4.984, Man.6.754. (Prob. pf. imper. fr.
se-sl-; Aeol. e)/ll- points to ei(/l- as the true Ion. spelling; Dor. pf. part. dat. i(lao/ti (leg. ei(l-) Hsch.: i_ is genuine in i(/lews, i(la/skomai [fr.
si-sl-].)
i)/lhoi: qhri/a dia\ fruga/nwn, ktl., Hsch. (fort. qhri/dia f.; cf. ei)lu/i+os, e)leio/s 111).
i)lh=s [i_], Ion. contr. fr. i)lh/eis,= i(la/eis (q. v.), prob. for ei)lh=s (q.v.).
i)/lia: dw=ra gunaikei=a, Hsch.

*)ilia/dai [i_l], oi(,
descendants of Ilos, i.e. Trojans, Sapph.Supp. 20a.13, AP9.77 (Antip. Thess.): as Adj., *)i. basilh=es E.Andr.1023 (lyr.).

*)ilia^ko/s [i_l], h/, o/n,
Ilian, Trojan, mu=qoi AP9.192 (Antiphil.); po/lemos Str.1.2.9;
concerning the Iliad, prosw|di/a, title of work by Hdn. Gr. i)liaka/, ta/, word of doubtful meaning in PTeb.61（
b).319, cf. 68.88, al. (ii B.C.).

*)ilia/s [i_], a/dos, h(, pecul. fem. of *)iliako/s, xw/rh Hdt.5.94, cf. A.Ag. 453(lyr.), E.Hec.102(anap.), 923(lyr.), etc.; epith. of Athena, Hdt. 7.43, IG9(1).350 (ii B.C.). as Subst., (sc. gh=)
Troy, the Troad, Hdt.5.122. (sc. gunh/)
a Trojan woman, E.Hel.1114 (lyr.), Tr.245 (lyr.), etc. (sc. poi/hsis)
the Iliad of Homer, Hdt.2.116, Arist.Po.1448b38, al.: prov., kakw=n *)ilia/s, i.e.
an endless string of woes, D.19.148, D.S.36.6, etc. a kind of
thrush, perh.
the redwing, Turdus iliacus, Arist.HA617a21 (s.v.l.); cf. i)lla/s 111.

i)ligg-ia/w [i_],
become dizzy, lose one's head, as when one looks down from a height, i)liggiw=n a)f' u(yhlou= kremasqei/s Pl.Tht.175d; from drunkenness, yuxh\ i). w(/sper mequ/ousa Id.Phd.79c; i). ka/ra li/qw| peplhgme/nos Ar.Ach.1218; i). kai\ xasma=sqai Phld.Rh.2.176S.; from perplexity, e)skotw/qhn kai\ i)liggi/asa Pl.Prt.339e; i). u(po\ th=s tou= lo/gou a)pori/as Id.Ly.216c; u(po\ tou= de/ous Ar.Ach.581; e)pi/ tini Luc.Tox.30; pro\s th\n qe/an Hld.5.6:—also written ei)liggia/w, freq. in codd. of Pl., cf. AP7.706 (Diog.), Plu.Alex.74; i)l- Phld. l.c.; ei)liggia/w but i)/liggos acc. to Sch.Ar.Ach.581, Suid. s.v. ei)liggiw=.

i)/ligg-os, o(, (i)/llw, ei)/lw)
spinning round; esp.
swimming in the head, Hp.Aph. 3.17(pl.), Pl.R.407c (pl.); skotodini/an i)/liggo/n te e)mpoiei=n tini Id.Lg. 892e; also,
disturbance of the bowels, Nic.Al.597. in pl.,
eddies or
wreaths of smoke, A.R.4.142.
whirlpool, Procop.Goth.4.6.
agitation of mind, Plu.2.1068c:—also written ei)/liggos, A.R. l.c., Nic. l.c., Plu.Caes.60, and codd. Pl.

i)ligg-iw/dhs (ei)l- cod.), es,=
verticulosus, Gloss.

i)=ligc, iggos, h(,
whirling, whirlpool, D.S.17.97, Alex.Aphr.Pr.2.71. v.l. for i)/liggos, 1, Gal.UP7.13. (Written i)/lic in Hsch.:— also i)li/ggh, h(, Id.)
i)/lion: to\ th=s gunaiko\s e)fh/baion dhloi=, kai\ ko/smon gunaikei=on para\ *kw/|ois, Hsch.

*)iliopo/ros [i_l], on,
faring to Ilium, Tim.Pers.132.
*)iliorrai/sths, f.l. for *)ilorai/sths (q.v.).

*)/ilios [i_l], ou, h(, Ilios or
Ilium, the city of Ilus, Troy, Il.5.210, al., Alc. Supp.8.4, E.Andr.103 (eleg.): *)/ilion, to/, Hom. only in Il.15.71, but always in Trag. (exc. E.l.c.):—hence Ep. genitives, *)ilio/qen,
from Troy, Il.14.251, Od.9.39; *)ilio/qi pro/
before Troy, 8.581, etc.; *)ilio/fi kluta\ tei/xea the walls
of Troy, Il.21.295. as Adj., *)/ilios, a, on,
Ilian, Trojan, *)aqa/na E.Hec.1008: -os, on is f.l. in Id.Hel.1164 (lyr.).

i)lis,=
volumen, Gloss. (dub.); i)lis sine expl., Hsch.; cf. i)lli/s.

*)ili_so/s [i_l], ou=, o(,
the Ilissus, in Attica, Pl.Criti.112a, Hdn.Gr.1.213, etc.: *(iliso/s,
the god I., IG12.324.89, cf. 310.206: *)ilisso/s freq. f.l. in codd., as Hdt.7.189, Str.9.1.24, A.R.1.215, D.P.424: *ei)lisso/s f.l. in Paus.1.19.5.
i)li/ssai: katwxh=sai, Hsch. (fort. ei)lu=sai: kataxw=sai).
i)lla/eis, v. i(la/eis.

i)lla/zw,
bind up, make into a bundle, Hsch. i)/llai: sustrofai/, Id.

i)llai/nw,
look awry, squint, Hp.Epid.3.1.g/; of the eyes,
to be distorted, Id.Coac.214, Epid.4.12:—so also in Pass., i)llai/nomai, Id.Morb.3.12. i)/llaos, v. i(/laos.

i)lla/s, a/dos, h(, (i)/llw, ei)/lw)
rope, band, bou=s, to/n t' ou)/resi bouko/loi a)/ndres i)lla/sin . . dh/santes a)/gousin Il.13.572. as Adj.,
close-packed, herding together, of cattle, i)lla/des gonai/ S.Fr.70, E.Fr.837. = *)ilia/s 111, Ath.2.65a, Eust.947.8.

i)ll-i/zw,
look askance, leer, glossed by dianeu/w, Suid.
i)ll-i/s, i/dos, h(, fem. of sq., Hsch.

i)ll-o/s, o(, (i)/llw)
squinting (acc. to Moer., Att. for strabo/s）, i). gegenh=sqai to get a
squint, Ar.Th.846: Comp. i)llo/teros Sophr.158, cf. Gal.17(1).680.
i)/ll-os, o(, Ion. = o)fqalmo/s, Poll. 2.54.
i)/ll-oy, opos, o(, h(, coined as etym. of e)/lloy, Ath.7.308b,c, cf. Plu.2.728e.

*)illu^rioi/, oi(, Illyrians, Hdt.1.196, etc. (*(ill- IG12.329.24): *)illuri/a, h(, Illyria, St.Byz.:—also *)illuri/s, h(, Ptol.Geog.2.16.1, App. Ill.6; gonh/ S.Fr.601:—Adj. *)illuriko/s, h/, o/n, Illyrian: -kh/, (sc. i(stori/a), h(, title of work by Appian: -ko/n, to/, the
region or
province of Illyria, Ep.Rom.15.19: *)illuri/zw,
speak the Illyrian language, St. Byz.s.v. *)illuri/a:—hence Adv. *)illuristi/, ibid.

i)/llw, v. ei)/lw: aor. 1 Med. i)lla/mhn,
plait, ploka/mous IG5(2).472.11 (Megalopolis, ii/iii A.D.).

i)ll-w/dhs, es,
squinting, distorted, o)/mmata Hp.Mul.1.41.

i)ll-wpe/w, i)ll-wpi/zw, = i)lli/zw,
squint, both in Sch.Ar.Eq.292, cf. Suid.:
i)ll-w/ptw, Com.Adesp.1019, Adam.1.23, Hsch. (For the termination cf. gorgw/yato.)

i)/ll-wsis, ews, h(,
distortion, o)fqalmw=n Hp.Prorrh.1.69, cf. Aret.SD1.7.
i)/lmh: desmo/s, seira/, Theognost.Can.15 (i)lmhdesmo/s cod.).

*)ilorai/sths, Dor. i)/ll-ta_s, a, o(, (r(ai/w)
destroyer of Ilus, i.e.
of Troy, prob. in Dosiad.Ara17.

vi/lsis, iios, a(,
distress, Schwyzer 686.2 (Pamphylia, iv B.C.).

i)/lu_ma [i_], atos, to/,
sediment deposited in water, Gal.13.45 (sed leg. lu/mata).

i)lu^o/eis [i_], essa, en, （i)lu/s)
muddy, potamo/s A.R.2.823; za/los Nic. Th.568: metaph., a)xlu\s i)., of the soul's material envelope, App.Anth.3.146 (Theon).

i)lu_o/s [i_], o(,= ei)leo/s 11, ei)luo/s,
den, lair, Call.Jov.25.

i)lu/s [i_], u/os, h(,
mud, slime, teu/xea . . kei/seq' u(p' i)lu/os kekalumme/na Il.21.318, cf.IG12.94.20, 23, Zeno Stoic.1.29, Inscr.Délos 354.19, etc.; of alluvial soil, Hdt.2.7; i). kai\ ya/mmos Hp.
Aër.9.
dregs, sediment, Id.Mul.1.66; of wine, Arist.GA753a24, al.
impurity, ai(/matos Gal.1.603, cf. 616; ste/rnwn Androm. ap. eund.14.35. [i)lu_s -u_n Choerob.in Theod.1.331; gen. i)lu^os APl.4.230 (Leon.), A.R. 1.10, but i)lu_os (metri gr. Hdn.Gr.2.117) Il. l.c.] (Cf. Russ.
il, Polish
it 'mud', 'potter's clay'.)

i)lusp-a/omai [i_],
crawl, like a worm, Hp.Genit.5, Pl.Ti.92a, Meno Iatr.37.32, J.AJ1.1.4, BJ3.7.21, Plu.2.567b, Max.Tyr.26.6, Ael. NA8.14,9.32. (ei)lusp- Meno l.c., v.l. in Pl. l.c.)

i)lu/sp-a^sis, ews, h(,
crawling, Arist.IA709a28.

i)lusp-astiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for crawling, Id.HA487b21.

i)lu/-w [i_], （i)lu/s)
cover with slime or
dirt, Hsch. = ei)lu/w, Id.

i)lu-w/dhs, es,
muddy, slimy, Hp.Coac.512, Max.Tyr.41.3, S.E. M.5.75; u(/dwr Str.4.1.6; phlo/s Arr.Ind.41.3; peri/ttwma Gal.1.616; to\-w=des Plu.2.935a.
i)m- in compds.,= i)n, Arc., Cypr., Cret. for e)n.
i(=ma, atos, to/,= ei(=ma, Hsch.

i(mai=os [i^], a, on, （i(ma/w)
of or
for drawing water, i(mai=on (sc. me/los)
song of the draw-well, Call.Hec.1.4.12, cf. Trypho ap. Ath.14.618d.
*(ima/lios, o( (sc. mh/n), v. sq.

i(mali/s, i/dos, h(, Syrac. epith. of Demeter, Polem. Hist.39:—hence i(malia/, h(,= to\ e)pi/metron tw=n a)leu/rwn, Hsch.: i(ma/lios, a, on,
abundant, Id.: as name of a month at Hierapytna, GDI5040.4. Dor. word for o( no/stos kai\ ta\ e)pi/metra tw=n a)leu/rwn Trypho ap.Ath.14.618d;= e)pimu/lios w)|dh/, Hsch., Poll.4.53.
i(manh/qrh [i_], h(,= i(monia/, Herod.5.11.

i(mant-a/rion [i^], to/, Dim. of i(ma/s, BCH29.536 (Delos, ii B.C.), POxy.326 (i A.D.).
halyard, Hsch.

i(mant-eligmo/s, ou=, o(,
pricking the tape, 'fast and loose', a trick practised at fairs, etc., Poll.9.118, Eust.979.28.

i(mant-elikth/s, ou=, o(, (e(li/ssw)
pricker of tapes (cf. foreg.): metaph., '
thimble-rigger', of sophists, Democr.150.

i(ma/nt-hris (sic cod., fort. -h=res),=
corrigiae, Gloss.
i(mant-i/dion, to/, Dim. of i(ma/s, EM 671.8.

i(ma/nt-i^nos, h, on,
of leathern thongs, Hdt.4.189, Hp.Art. 78.

i(ma/nt-ion, to/, Dim. of i(ma/s,
strap, Id.Mochl.41. = i(ma/s 11, Aret.SA1.8.
i(mant-i/skos, o(, Dim. of i(ma/s, Herod.6.71.

i(mant-ismo/s, o(, in building,
