insertion of bonding courses, PTeb.402.32 (ii A.D.).

i(manto/-desmos [i^], o(,
leathern band, Hsch. s.v. zeu/glas.

i(manto/-detos, on,
bound with thongs, gloss on trhtoi=si, Sch.Od.1.440.

i(manto-ma/xos [ma^], on,
fighting with the caestus, Orac.in Tz.H.7.422.

i(manto-pa/roxos, o(,
purveyor of straps, etc., for the races, CIG2758 D6 (Aphrodisias).

i(manto-pe/dh, h(,
leathern noose, of a polypus' leg, AP9.94 (Isid. Aeg.).

i(manto/-pous, podos, o(, (i(ma/s 111)
spindle-shanked; esp., name of a tribe of Ethiopians, Plin.HN5.46, Apollod. ap. Tz.H.7.767. kind of
water-bird, Dionys.Av.2.9.
i(manto-skelh/s, e/s,= foreg., Tz. l.c.

i(manto-tome/w,
cut straps, Poll.7.81,83.

i(mant-o/w [i^],
furnish with straps, in Pass., Hsch. s.v. puc<i/nhn>.

i(mant-w/dhs, es,
fibrous, of the hair, Pl.Ti.76c; floio/s, klw=nes, Dsc.1.84, 3.15; of asbestos, Id.5.138. of hair,
ropy, Gal.1.615; of the uvula when diseased, Id.10.988.
sinewy, wiry, of athletes, Philostr. Gym.37.

i(ma/nt-wma, atos, to/,
hawser, Hsch. s.v. si/ra.

i(ma/nt-wsis, ews, h(,
binding with thongs, Id.; of the
straps of a car, Poll.1.142.
piece of timber used instead of a bond-stone, LXXSi.22.16, Phot., etc.

i(ma^oido/s [i^], o(,
one who sings the i(mai=on me/los, Poll.4.53, Hsch. (i)l- cod.).

i(ma/s, o(, gen. i(ma/ntos (not i(ma=s, i(ma=ntos Hdn.Gr.2.939): Ep. dat. pl. i(ma/ntessi:—
leathern strap or
thong, Il.10.262, etc.; i(ma/nta boo/s 3.375; boe/ous i(ma/ntas 22.397: mostly in pl., in various senses:
traces, 10.475,499,al.
reins, 23.324, etc.; tmhtoi=s i(ma=si S.El. 747, cf. E.Hipp.1222.
straps on which the body of the chariot was hung, Il.5.727.
lash of a whip, formed by several thongs, 23.363.
boxing-glove, consisting of
several straps put round the hand, ib.684, Pi.N.6.35, Pl.Prt.342c; i(. puktikoi/ Eup.22 D. in sg., the magic
girdle of Aphrodite, Il.14.214, 219.
chin-strap of the helmet, 3.371.
thong, by which the bolt was shot home into the socket, Od.1.442, cf. 4.802, 21.46. after Hom.,
thong or
latchet of a sandal, X.An.4.5.14, Ephipp.14.9, Men.109.2, Ev.Marc.1.7.
rail-rope, Aristag.5.
well-rope, Poll.10.31, Moer.
dog-leash, X.Cyn.7.6: prov., h)=sq' i(ma\s ku/neios you were tough as a dog-
leash, Ar.V.231; also su\n tw=| kuni\ kai\ to\n i(ma/nta Phot.
whip, scourge, e)/cw tis do/tw i(ma/nta Antiph.74.8, cf. Men.Sam.106; h( dia\ tw=n i(. ai)kei/a POxy.1186.2 (iv A.D.), cf. Act.Ap.22.25; i(ma/ntes paidagwgw=n Lib.Ep.911.2.
cord, Gal.10.1001, cf. 1.616.
diseased condition of the uvula, Id.17(1).379. i(ma/ntes, in Archit.,
planks laid on rafters, IG12.372.82, 373.236, al., 22.1668.55, 1672.305; on strwth=res (q.v.), ib.463.66. (Cf.Skt.
sināti 'bind', Lat.
saeta.) [^_, usually; but also i_ in Ep., Il.8.544, etc.: in derivs. and compds. always i^.]

i(ma/sqlh [i^], h(, （i(ma/s)
thong of a whip,
whip, Il.23.582, Od.13.82, Eranos 13.88(pl.): metaph., nho\s i(., i.e. ship's
rudder, AP6.28（Jul.); later,
any thong, Opp.C.4.217.

i(ma/skw, dub. sens., perh.
flog or
imprison (i(ma/s), Schwyzer 409 (Elis).

i(massi/a, h(, perh.=
scaffolding (cf. i(ma/s), or = ai(masia/, IG4.823.26 (Troezen).

i(ma/ssw [i^], fut. i(ma/sw [a^]: aor. i(/ma^sa: (i(ma/s):—
flog horses, tou\s i(/mas' *)anti/loxos Il.5.589, cf. 11.531; of men, ei) . . se plhgh=|sin i(ma/ssw 15.17, cf. Hes.Th.857; i(/mase xqo/na xeiri/
smote it, h.Ap.340; o(/te . . gai=an i(ma/ssh| when he
smites it
with lightnings, Il.2.782:—Pass., i(masso/menos de/mas au)/rais AP7.696 (Arch.), cf. Nonn.D.42.491.

i(ma^t-eu/omai [i_],
to be a clothier, IGRom.4.1209 (Thyatira) (nisi leg. pragmat-).

i(ma^t-hgo/s, o/n,
loaded with apparel, nau=s Thphr.Lap. 68.
i(ma^t-i_da/rion, to/, Dim. of i(ma/tion, Ar.Fr.90.
i(ma^t-i/dion [i_d], to/, Dim. of i(ma/tion, Id.Pl.985, Lys.Fr.316S., BGU1103.12 (i B.C.); by crasis with the Art., qai)mati/dia Ar.Lys.401.

i(ma^t-i/zw, fut. -iw=,
furnish with clothing, UPZ2.14 (ii B.C.), etc.:—Pass., tou= paido\s trefome/nou kai\ -ome/nou POxy.275.14 (i A.D.); gunh\ i(matisme/nh e)/xidna Secund.Sent.8; i(matisme/nos Ev.Marc.5.15.

i(ma^tio-qh/kh [i_m], h(,
wardrobe, IG22.1672.229, 309, Hsch. s.v. kanduta/nai.

i(ma^tio-ka/phlos [ka^], o(,
clothes-seller, Luc.Merc.Cond.38, Pseudol.21.

i(ma^tio-kle/pths, ou, o(
clothes-stealer, D.L.6.52.

i(ma^tio-mi/sqhs, ou, o(
one who lets out actor's costumes, IG12(9).207.22 (Eretria, iii B.C.), SIG424.85 (Delph., iii B.C.), Poll.7.78, AB100.
i(ma^tio-misqwth/s, ou=, o(,= foreg., Poll.7.78.

i(ma/tion [i_ma^-], to/, in form a Dim. of i(=ma (i.e. ei(=ma),
a piece of dress; in usage always of
an outer garment, formed by an oblong piece of cloth worn above the xitw/n, Ar.Ec.333, IG22.1524.205, al., D.24.114, etc.; lampro\n i(. e)/xwn Epich.[277]; qoi)ma/tion by crasis for to\ i(m-, Ar.Nu.179, al.; qoi)ma/tion kaqei\s a)/xri tw=n sfurw=n D.19.314; i(mati/wn e(/lceis Pl.Alc.1.122c; of the Roman
toga, Plu.Brut.17, Cor.14: hence e)n i(mati/ois, of civilians,=
togati, Id.Cam.10; but i(. *(ellhniko/n, opp. the toga, Luc.Merc.Cond.25. i(ma/tia, ta/, generally,
clothes, Hdt.1.9, Pl.Plt.279e, D.27.10; by crasis, qai)ma/tia Hippon.83.1, Ar.V.408 (lyr.), Lys.1093; of
grave-clothes, e)n ei(m. trisi\ [qa/ptein] IG 12(5).593.2 (Iulis, v/iv B.), cf. Plu.Sol.21. metaph., i(ma/tia po/lews tei/xh Eust.1871.50. generally,
cloth, Hdt.4.23, D.S. 14.109, Ael.VH8.7, Iamb.VP21.100. [i(m- in Att. Inscrr., IG12.427, 386.18, 22.1514.16, etc.; ei(m- ib.12(5) l.c. (em- lap.), 5(1).1390.16, al.(Andania, i B.C.), which is easier to explain, v. ei(=ma, ei(matismo/s.]

i(ma^tio-paralh/mpths [i_], ou, o(,
collector of deliveries in kind in the form of clothing, BGU1564.1 (ii A.D.).
i(ma^tio-plu/ths [u^], ou, o(,= knafeu/s, dub. in ib.118iii7 (ii A.D.).

i(ma^tio-poii/+a, h(,
clothes-making, Gloss.
i(ma^tio-pra/ths [a_], ou, o(,= sq., Stud.Pal.22.95.2 (iii A.D.).

i(ma^tio-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
clothes-dealer, CritiasFr.64D., UPZ8.32 (ii B.C.), AJP 38.418 (Egypt), Ephes.3p.146 (ei(m-), Ptol.Tetr.179:—also in form ei(matop., Gloss.:—fem. i(ma^tio/-pwlis, idos, IG2.3650, Ath.3.76a; h( i(. a)gora/ Poll.7.78:

i(ma^tio-pwliko/n (sc. te/los), to/,
tax on clothes-dealers, PLeipz.5.7 (
Ber.Sächs.Ges.d.W.37.245 (iii A.D.)).

i(ma^tiourgiko/s [i_], h/, o/n,
skilled in making clothes: h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh)
the tailor's art, Pl.Plt.280a, Gal.Thras.26.
i(ma^tio-fo/rion, to/,= sq., Sammelb.7033.42,43 (v A.D.).

i(ma^tio-fori/s, i/dos, h(,
portmanteau, POxy.116.10(ii A.D.), Ammon.Diff.p.135 V.(cf. Ptol.Ascal.p.406H.), Ael.Dion.Fr.206.

i(ma^tio-fu^la^ke/w,
take care of clothes, Luc.Hipp.8.

i(ma^tio-fu^la/kion, to/,
wardrobe, Gloss.:—also in form ei(matof-, ib.

i(ma^tio-fu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(, h(,
keeper of the wardrobe, LXX 4 Ki.22.14:—in form ei(mato-, Gloss.

i(ma^tismo/s [i_], o(,
clothing, apparel, Thphr.Char.23.8, Aen.Tact.31.15, SIG1015.35 (Halic., iii B.C.), PHib.1.54(iii B.C.), PCair.Zen.28.1 (iii B.C.), BCH6.24 (Delos, ii B.C.), Plb.11.9.2, Ev.Luc.7.25, Plu. Alex.39: ei(m- PEleph.1.4(iv B.C.), IG5(1).1390.15 (Andania, i B.C.), etc.

i(ma/w, Att. inf. i(mh=n Phot.:—
draw up, esp. water from a well, Ath.8.352a; ka/dw| Orib.Eup.1.1.2:—Pass.,
to be tapped of, yield, ga/la Arist.HA522b12, PA688b10. (From i(ma/s 2f, acc. to Ael.Dion. Fr.211; i(ma/w has i_ (v. kaqima/w), like i(monia/, i(manh/qrh, but i(mai=os has i^.)

vimba/nai (gimb- cod.): zeu/gana, Hsch. i)/mbhris, = e)/gxelus, at Methymna, Id. (cf. Lith.
ungur[ytilde]s 'eel').

*)/imbros, h(, the island of Imbros, Il.13.33, etc.: also, epith. of Pelasgian Hermes, St.Byz. s.v.: hence *)/imbrioi, oi(,
the Imbrians, IG12.198.101.

i(mei/rw [i_], Aeol. i)me/rrw Sapph.1.27, Alc.Supp.26.5, cf. Hdn.Gr. 2.949: (i(/meros):—
long for, desire, c. gen., ti/ kakw=n i(mei/rete tou/twn . . ; Od.10.431, cf. 555, Hes.Sc.31; mega/lwn B.1.62; ma/xhs A.Ag.940; bi/ou S.Fr.952, cf. Ar.Nu.435: c. inf.,
long or
wish to do, Alc. l.c., Sol.13.7, A.Pers.233, S.OT587, Ichn.128; o)/ssa moi te/lessai qu=mos i)me/rrei Sapph. l.c.: c. Adj. neut., gnwta\ kou)k a)/gnwta/ moi prosh/lqeq' i(mei/rontes S.OT59: abs., Id.El.1053; a)sme/nois . . kai\ i(mei/rousin . . to\ fw=s e)gi/gneto Pl.Cra.418d. Med. i(mei/romai, aor. 1 i(meira/mhn ll.14.163:—Pass., aor. 1 i(me/rqhn Hdt.7.44: c. gen., o(ppo/t' a)\n h(bh/sh| te kai\ h(=s i(mei/retai ai)/hs (Ep. aor. subj.) Od.1.41; xrhma/twn i(. mega/lws Hdt.3.123: c. inf., ei)/ pws i(mei/raito paradraqe/ein filo/thti (cf. i(/meros) Il.14.163, cf. Od.1.59, Hdt.6.120, S.OT386.—Ep., Ion. (Hdt. and Hp.Morb.4.39), and Trag. word: never in Att. Prose; introduced as etym. in Pl.Cra. l.c.

i)/men, i)/menai [i^], Ep. inf. of ei)=mi (
ibo).
i(me/ra, h(, old collat. form of h(me/ra, acc. to Pl.Cra.418c, 418d.

i(mera/mpuc [i_], u^kos, h(,
with lovely diadem, qea/ B.16.9.

i(mero/-guios [i_], on,
with lovely limbs, B.12.137.

i(mero/-eis, essa, en, (i(/meros)
exciting desire, lovely, charming, in Hom. always of things,
i(mero/enta . . e)/rga ga/moio Il.5.429, etc.; xroo\s i(mero/entos 14.170; a)oidh/, e)/pea, Od.1.421, 17.519; go/os (cf. i(/meros) 10.398; *xari/twn xoro\n i(mero/enta 18.194, cf. Il.18.603; i(mero/en kiqa/rize ib.570; so later kisso/s D.P.947; e)/rwtes AP5.277 (Agath.); of persons, Pi.Fr.87 (Sup.), Thgn.1365 (Sup.), Theoc.7.118; nu/mfh Coluth.295.

i(mero-qa_lh/s, e/s, (qa/llw) Dor. for -qhlh/s,
sweetly blooming, e)/ar AP9.564 (Nicias): vulg. h(meroq-.

i(mero/-nous, oun,
lovely of soul, Orph.H.56.8.

i(mero/-omai, Pass., of a female,
have sexual intercourse with, tou= a)ndro/s, or abs., Hp.Mul.1.12,24.

i(mero/-pnous, pnoun,
breathing sweetness, BMus. Inscr.1084.

i(/meros [i_], o(,
longing, yearning after, c. gen. rei, si/tou . . peri\ fre/nas i(/meros ai(rei= Il.11.89, etc.; go/ou i(/meron w)=rse raised [in them]
a yearning after tears, i.e. a desire of the soul to disburden itself in grief, 23.14; u(f' i(/meros w)=rto go/oio Od.16.215, etc.: with gen. obj. added, patro\s u(f' i(/meron w)=rse go/oio
for his father, 4.113; i(/meron e)/xein, = i(mei/resqai, c. inf., Hdt.5.106,7.43; i(/meros e)/xei me . . i)dei=n S.OC1725 (lyr.), cf. Sapph.Supp.24.11; i(/. e)pei/resqai/ moi e)ph=lqe/ Hdt.1.30, cf. 9.3; tw=n (sc. dendre/wn） gluku\s i(/. e)/sxen . . futeu=sai Pi.O.3.33: in pl., polloi\ ga\r ei)s e(\n cumpi/tnousin i(/. various
impulses or
emotions, A. Ch.299, cf. Phld.Ir.p.37 W., Piet.20. abs.,
desire, love, w(/s seo nu=n e)/ramai kai/ me gluku\s i(/. ai(rei= Il.3.446; do\s nu=n moi filo/thta kai\ i(/. 14.198; dame/nta fre/nas i(me/rw| Pi.O.1.41, cf. Sapph.Supp.25.16; i(me/rw| peplhgme/nos A.Ag.544; i(me/rou nikw/menos Id.Supp.1005, cf. Pr.649, S.Tr.476, Ar.Ra.59; blefa/rwn i(/. S.Ant.796(lyr.). personified, *xa/rite/s te kai\ *(/i. Hes.Th.64; *)/erws . . xari/twn, i(me/rou, po/qou path/r Pl.Smp.197d, cf. Luc.DDeor.20.15, Nonn.D.1.68, al. as Adj., only in neut. as Adv., i(/meron au)lh/santi AP9.266 (Antip.); i(/mera meli/zesqai, dakru=sai, ib.7.30 (Antip. Sid.), 364 (Marc. Arg.).— Poet., exc. in Pl. and Ion. and later Prose, as Hdt. ll. cc., Hp.
Aër. 22, Phld. ll. cc., Acad.Ind.p.56M. (Sts. derived fr.
is-mero-, cf. Skt.
i[snull ][tnull ]ás 'desired',
i[snull ]más 'god of love', but Aeol. texts have i)/meros, i)me/rrw, never i)mm-; cf. h(merto/n: e)pe/raston, Hsch. (s.v.l.).)

i(mero/-frwn [i_], onos, o(, h(,
lovely in spirit, Doroth. ap. Heph.Astr.3.9.

i(mero/-fwnos, on,
of lovely voice or
song, a)hdw/n Sapph.39, Alcm.26 (vulg. i(erof-), Theoc.28.7.
i)me/rrw [i_], Aeol. for i(mei/rw (q.v.).

i(merto/s [i_], h/, o/n, （i(mei/rw)
longed for, desired, lovely, *titarh/sios Il. 2.751; u(/data A.R.2.939; *salami/s Sol.1.1; ki/qaris h.Merc.510; ste/fanoi Hes.Th.577; ko/ma Sapph.119; le/xos Pi.P.3.99; a)oidai/, do/ca, Id.O.6.7,P.9.75; i(. h(liki/h
dear life, Simon.115; of persons, AP5.297 (Jul.); epith. of Apollo and Dionysus, ib.9.524.10,525.10.— Poet. and later Prose, as Epicur.Fr.165, Luc.DDeor.20.15: i(merto/n, to/, Plu.2.926f; e)f' i(mertoi=sin prob. from a poet, ib.394b.
i(merw/dhs [i_], es,= i(mero/eis, Callistr.Stat.11.

i)me/sos, Prep.,c.gen.,
between, i). *peleia=n Schwyzer664.17(Orchom. Arc., iv B.C.); also i)me/soun toi=s *didu/moiun ib.25; prob. fr. i)n( = e)n）mes-.

i)/mestos: di/kh (Sicel), Hsch. i(mhto/s [i_], h/, o/n, （i(ma/w)
drawn out as from a well, Id. i)mi/trao(n: u(po/zwson （-ston cod.) (Cypr.), Id.
i)mmemfh/s (i)nmenf- lap.), v. e)mmemfh/s.

i)/mmenai, poet. for i)/menai, i)e/nai, inf. of ei)=mi (
ibo).

i(monia/ [prob. i_, cf. An.Ox.1.217], h(, (i(ma/s)
well-rope, Alex.174.9, Apollod.Gel.1 (pl.), Ph.2.89 (pl.), Luc.Icar.7, JConf.8, Hsch.; i(monia/n (abs.)
a rope's length, i.e. as long as a bucket takes to go down and come up a well, Ar.Ec.351.

i(moniostro/fos, o(,
water-drawer, Ar.Ra.1297.

i)/moroi: po/lemoi, Hsch. i)/mpasis, v. e)/mpasis. i)mpa/tao(n: e)/mbleyon (Paph.), Id. i)mplati/a, h(, Arc. for e)mpl-, a sacrificial
cake, IG5(2).4 (Tegea, iv B.C.). i)mpola/, v. e)mpolh/. i)mpo/lhs: lhpth/s, Hsch. (perh. Arc. for e)mpoleu/s). i)/mptw, v. i)/ptw. *)/imyios, epith. of Poseidon in Syria, Hsch. i(/n, dat. and acc. of the old pers. Pron. i(/ (q.v.). i)n, Arc., Cypr., and Cret. for e)n (q.v.).
i(/n or ei(/n, gen. ei(no/s, to/, an Egyptian and Jewish liquid measure, LXXEx.29.40, al., J.AJ3.9.4, Eust.1282.51 (indecl. in LXX ll. cc.); cf. i(/nion.

i(/na, Adv., of Place,
in that place, there, once in Hom.,i(/. ga/r sfin e)pe/fradon h)gere/qesqai Il.10.127 (acc.to Eust.). elsewh. relat.,
in which place, where, 2.558, Od.9.136, Hdt.2.133,9.27,54, Pi.O.1.95, B.10.79, A.Pr.21, al., S.El.22,855, Ar.Ra.1231, etc.: rarely in Att. Prose, Lys.13.72 (v. infr.), Pl.Ap.17c, Phlb.61b; i(/. h( *ni/kh (sc. e)sti/n) IG22.1407.13: rare in later Greek, Arr.An.1.3.2, Luc.Cont.22, Ind.3: with particles, i(/. te Il.20.478; i(/. per 24.382, Od.13.364, Lys. l.c.; i(/n' a)/n c. subj.,
wherever, S.OC405, E.Ion315; as indirect interrog., Hdt.1.179, 2.150, E.Hec.1008. after Hom., like other Advs. of Place, c. gen., i(/. th=s xw/rhs Hdt.1.98; e)/maqe i(/. h)=n kakou=
in what a calamity, Id.1.213; ou)d' o(ra=n i(/n' e)= kakou= S.OT367; i(/n' e(/stamen xrei/as ib.1442; i(/n' h)=men a)/ths Id.El.936; o(ra=|s i(/n' e)sme\n au)tou= pe/ri th=s a)pori/as Pl.Sph.243b. with Verbs of motion,
whither, Od.4.821, al.; o(ra=|s i(/n' h(/keis S.OT687, al., Din.2.10; (/inaper w(/rmhto Th. 4.74. of circumstance, ga/mos . . , i(/. xrh/
at which, when, Od.6.27; i(/. me\n e)ch=n au)toi=s . . , e)ntau=qa . .
when it was in their power, Antipho 6.9. = e)a/n, dub. in Il.7.353 (v.l. i(/n' a)/n, cf. Sch.), Archil. 74.7 codd., v.l. in Din.1.1, and Pl.Chrm.176b. Final Conj.,
that, in order that, from Hom. downwards, mostly first word in the clause, but sts. preceded by an emphatic word, Pl.Chrm.169d; i(/. dh/ Il.7.26, 23.207, Hdt.1.29, Pl.R.420e, 610c: never with a)/n or ke (if found, these particles belong to the Verb, as in Od.12.156, E.IA1579). general usage: with subj., after primary tenses of ind., also subj. and imper.: pres. ind., Il.3.252, Od.2.111, X.Mem.3.2.3, Cyr.1.2.11, Isoc.3.2: pf. ind., Il.1.203, Isoc.4.129: fut., Od.2.307,4.591, X.Cyr.1.2.15; subj., S.OT364; imper., Il.19.348,al., A.Pr.61, S.Ph.880, Ar.Ra.297, Pl.R.341b, Men.71d. after historical tenses, in similes, where the aor. is gnomic, Od.5.490 (au)/oi codd.); where aor. is treated as equiv. to pf., Il.9.99, Od.8.580, Hdt.5.91, Lys.1.4, D.9.26: when the purpose is regarded from the point of view of the speaker's present, se\ pai=da poieu/mhn i(/. moi . . loigo\n a)mu/nh|s Il.9.495, cf. Hdt.1.29, 6.100, Th.1.44, al., Lys.1.11,12,al. after opt. and a)/n, when opt. with ou)k a)/n is used with sense of imper., Il.24.264, Od.6.58; after bouloi/mhn a)/n . . , Lys.7.12. after impf. with a)/n, D.23.7. with opt., after historical tenses, Il.5.3, Od.3.2, A. Th.215, Lys.3.11, Pl.Prt.314c, etc.: after the historical pres., E. Hec.11: sts. both moods, subj. and opt., follow in consecutive clauses, Od.3.77, Hdt.8.76,9.51, D.23.93,49.14. after opt., Od.18.369, S.Ph.325; bou/loint' a)\n h(ma=s e)colwle/nai, i(/na . . la/boien Ar. Pax413. rarely after primary tenses, by a shifting of the point of view, Od.17.250, Ar.Ra.24, Pl.R.410c. with past tenses of ind., after unfulfilled wishes, Id.Cri.44d. after ind. with a)/n, to express a consequence which has not followed or cannot follow, S.OT1389, Pl.Men.89b, D.29.17: esp. after e)boulo/mhn a)/n . . , Ar. V.961, Lys.4.3. after such Verbs as e)xrh=n, e)/dei, E.Hipp.647, Pl.Prt.335c, Smp.181e, Euthd.304e, Isoc.9.5, D.24.48, Men.349.5, etc.: whenan unfulfilled obligation is implied, teqau/maka o(/ti ou)k ei)=pen ( = e)/dei ei)pei=n） . . i(/ . . . Pl.Tht.161c; a)nti\ tou= kosmei=n ( = de/on kosmei=n） . . i(/ . . . D.36.47. after pres. ind. in general statements (including the past), ou)de\ ga\r to\ ei)=nai e)/xei h( u(/lh, i(. a)gaqou= tau/th| metei=xen Plot.1.8.5. i(/. mh/ as the neg. of i(/na,
that not, Il.19.348, etc. special usages: like o(/pws, after Verbs of command and entreaty, is common only in later Gr. (but cf. Od.3.327 with ib.19), a)ciou=n i(/ . . . Decr. ap. D.18.155; deh/sesqai i(/ . . . D.H.1.83; parakalei=n i(/ . . . Arr.Epict.3.23.27: freq. in NT, e)kh/rucan i(/. metanoh/swsin Ev.Marc.6.12, al.; of will, o(/sa e)a\n qe/lhte i(/. poiw=sin . . ib.25: hence i(/. c. subj. stands for infin., e)n tou/tw| i(/. karpo\n fe/rhte ( = e)n tw=| fe/rein) Ev.Jo.15.8, etc.; prw=to/n e)stin i(/. koimhqw= Arr.Epict.1.10.8, cf. M.Ant.8.29; also for w(/ste, LXX Ge.22.14,al., Plu.2.333a, Porph.Abst.2.33, etc.
because, i(/. a)nagnw= e)timh/qhn I was honoured
because I read, Anon. ap. A.D.Synt.266.5, cf. Conj.243.21, Choerob.in Theod.2.257, al.; not found in literature. elliptical usages, where the purpose of the utterance is stated, *zeu\s e)/sq', i(/n' ei)dh=|s 'tis Zeus,— [I tell thee this]
that thou may'st know it, S.Ph.989; i(/. mh\ ei)/pw o(/ti ou)demia=| Pl.R.507d; i(/. sunte/mw D.45.5; i(/n' e)k tou/twn a)/rcwmai Id.21.43; i(/. dw=men . .
granted that . . , S.E.P.2.34, cf. 1.79. in commands, introducing a principal sentence, i(/. sunta/ch|s
order him . . , PCair.Zen. 240.12 (iii B.C.); i(/. lalh/sh|s PSI4.412.1 (iii B.C.); i(/. e)lqw\n e)piqh=|s ta\s xei=ras au)th=| Ev.Marc.5.23,cf. 2 Ep.Cor.8.7, LXX 2 Ma.1.9, Arr.Epict.4.1.41, Did. ap. Sch.S.OC156. i(/. ti/ (sc. ge/nhtai);
to what end? either abs. or as a question, Ar.Ec.719; or with a Verb following, Id.Pax 409, cf. Pl.Ap.26d, etc.; i(/. dh\ ti/; Ar.Nu.1192. in indignant exclamations,
to think that . . ! *swkra/ths i(/. pa/qh| tau=ta Arr.Epict.1.29.16. in later Gr. with ind., LXXEx.1.11,al., Ep.Gal.2.4, 4.17, etc.

i)nai/a, h(,
force, strength of a swell or current at sea, Peripl.M.Rubr. 46 (i)ndi/a cod.), Hsch.
i)nali/nw, v. e)nali/nw.
i)/nanti [i^n], Cret.,= e)/nanti, GDI5125a1.

i)na/rion [i_], to/, Dim. of i)/s,
strand, fibre, i). lepto\n kai\ makro/n Phlp. in Mete.61.31.

i)na/ssw, fut. -a/sw,= i)no/w, i)sxu\n pare/xw, Choerob. in Theod.2.154, EM100.39, Suid.; o(/tan m' i)na/ssato (sic cod.) Call.
Fr.anon.126.
*)/ina^xos [i_], o(, Inachus, a river of Argolis, A.Fr.168, E.El.1. son of Oceanus, king of Argos, A.Pr.663,al.:—Adj. *)ina/xeios, a, on, ib.590.
i(mero-i/nda, adverbial termin. of words signifying a game or sport, mostly with pai/zein, Poll.9.110, Theognost.Can.164.
i)ndali/mh, epith. of the Moon, dub. sens. in PMag.Par.1.2273.

i)nda/llomai, almost always used in pres. and impf.: aor. i)nda/lqhn Lyc.597,961, Max.163:—
appear, seem, a)/lloi moi doke/ousi paroi/teroi e)/mmenai i(/ppoi, a)/llos d' h(ni/oxos i)nda/lletai Il.23.460; i)nda/lleto de/ sfisi pa=si teu/xesi lampo/menos megaqu/mou *phlei/+wnos 17.213 (-qu/mw| -wni Aristarch., cf. 2), cf. Od.3.246, h.Ven.178: w(/s moi i)nda/lletai h)=tor as my memory
seems to me, or perh., as my heart
pictures him, Od.19.224; also in Att., w(/st' e)/moig' i)nda/lletai o(moio/tatos klhth=ros ei)=nai pwli/w| Ar.V.188; tou=to ga/r moi i). dianooume/nh [h( yuxh/], ou)k a)/llo ti h)\ diale/gesqai it
seems to me to be merely engaged in a dialogue, Pl. Tht.189e; ta\ di' o)fqalmw=n i)ndallo/mena h(mi=n Arist.Mu.397b18, cf. lamb.Myst.2.3;
flash on one's mind, a)mfi\ de\ . . melhdo/nes i)nda/llonto
appeared, A.R.3.812, cf. 2.545. c. dat.,
resemble, qeoi\ ce/nois -o/menoi Pl.R.381e, cf. Lg.959a; a)rgu/rw| Theoc.22.39; ku/knois Lyc. 597. (Never in Trag.; connected with
vid-, *ei)/dw.)

i)/ndal-ma, atos, to/,
form, appearance, LXX Wi.17.3, Ael.NA17.35; i)/. yuxh=s,= ei)/dwlon, IG3.1403: pl., i). zwh=s Plot.1.4.3; krufi/wn i)nda/lmata pursw=n AP5.250 (Iren.);
mental image, i). kai\ do/khsis yuxh=s Them.Or.26.327d: in pl.,
hallucinations, Luc.Gall.5, Aret.SD1.6.
i)ndal-mati/zomai,= i)nda/llomai, dub. in Lib.Descr.30.1.
i)ndal-mo/s, o(,= i)/ndalma, in pl., Hp.Ep.18: title of work by Timon, D.L.9.65,105.

i)nda/rion, to/, name of an
eye-salve, Aët.7.118.
i)nde/a: meshmbri/a (Maced.), Hsch. i)ndika/zw, i)/ndikos, v. e)nd-.

i)ndikopla/sths (-pleu/sths cod.),
dyer, Gloss.

*)indiko/s, h/, o/n, Indian: h( *)i. xw/rh Hdt.3.98: Sup. -w/tatos Philostr. VA1.10:—fem. *)indi/s, i/dos, f.l. in Nonn.D.17.377. *)indiko\n fa/rmakon
a kind of
pepper, Hp.Mul.1.81; but,
indigo (cf. infr. 2), PHolm.11.2; also called i). me/lan ib.9.8. the plant
indigo, Indigofera tinctoria, Dsc.5.92. name of an
eye-salve, Gal.12.780, al.

*)indisti/, Adv.
in the Indian language, Ctes.Fr.57.4.

*)indogenh/s, e/s,
born in India, Man.1.297.

*)indole/ths, ou, o(,
Indian-killer, of Dionysus, AP9.524.

*)indo/s, h/, o/n, Indian, Hdt.3.38, al., cf. A.Supp.284; esp. of the drivers of elephants, Phylarch.36 J., Plb.1.40.15, al. *)indo/s, o(, the river Indus, Hdt.4.44, etc. name of a
fallacy, Plu.2.133b. as Adj.,= *)indiko/s,
Indian, AP9.544.1 (Addaeus). *)indh/, h(, (sc. e)/mplastros) name of a
plaster, Orib.Fr.88.

*)indosku^qi/a, h(,
the country on the banks of the Indus, Ptol.Geog.7.1.

i)/ndouros, o(,
mole (a)spa/lac), Hsch.
*)indofo/nos, o(,= *)indole/ths Nonn.D.17.387.
*)indw=|os, a, on,= *)indiko/s, Nonn.D.17.380, St.Byz.

*)inei=on, to/,
sanctuary of Ino, Sch.Euph.Oxy.2085Fr.1.15.
i)neu/ei: tei/nei, Hsch.

i)n-e/w or i)n-a/w,
carry off by evacuations, Ion. word, Hsch., Phot.: fut. Med. i)nh/somai Hp.Mul.1.52, and prob. l. ib. 119; in pass. sense, Id.Loc.Hom.27:—Pass., i)nw=ntai, -w/menos, ibid., ib.33.
i)/nvoikos, o(, Arc. for e)/noikos, IG5(2).343 (Orchom. Arc., iv B.C.).
i)/nh [i_], h(,= i)/s (A), tai=s a)po\ tw=n kala/mwn i)/nais Peripl.M.Rubr.65.

i)n-hqmo/s, o(,
emptying, purging, Hp.Loc.Hom.16,33.
i)/n-hsis, ews, h(,= foreg., ib.20 (nh=sis codd., cf. Erot. s.v. i)nh/setai), Pherecyd.66 J.

i)ni/on [i_n], to/, （i)/s *a)
occipital bone, occiput, [tou= trixwtou= krani/ou] . . to\ o)pi/sqion [e)sti\n] i)ni/on Arist.HA491a33, cf. Gal.UP9.17, al.; kefalh=s kata\ i)ni/on Il.5.73; dia\ i)ni/ou h)=lqen [do/ru] 14.495, cf. Hp.Aph.3.26, Pherecyd.66 J., Theoc.25.264, Euph.41, Plu.Mar.33. (i)- codd., kat' i)n- Gal. l.c., but cf. e)fini/ous: ta\s e)pi\ tou= i)ni/ou sa/rkas, Hsch.）

i(/nion, to/, Dim. of i(/n (q.v.), an Egyptian measure of capacity, PSI 4.333.6 (iii B.C.), Kalbfleisch Ind.Lect.Rost.1902.10 (ii A.D.),
PLond. ined.186 (ii A.D.), Gal.19.769.

i)=nis, o(,
son, A.Eu.323, Supp.42, prob. in Id.Ag.717, cf. E.Tr.571, HF354, Lyc.570, Isyll.53 (dub.), Call.Aet.3.1.63, IG12(8). p.vii (Egypt):—fem. i)=nis, h(,
daughter, E.IA119.—Trag. only in lyr.; Prose only in Cypr. dialect, Inscr.Cypr.101, al.
i)nkapa/tao(n: e)gkata/bleyon, Hsch.
i)nmenfh/s, v. e)mmemfh/s.
i)/nnhn: ko/rhn mikra/n, kai\ th\n e)n tw=| o)fqalmw=|, Hsch.
i)/nos, o(,= gi/nnos (q.v.):—also i)/nnous: pai=das, Hsch.

i)no/w [i_], （i)/s)
make strong and nervous, Hdn.Epim.49:—Pass., i)nw=ntai (also i)nnou=ntai), glossed by zw=sin, Hsch.

i)/ntu^bos, o(, (i)/ntoubos Edict.Diocl.6.3) = e)/ntubos,
endive, Gal.6.628: —also i)ntu^bola/xa^non, to/, [Id.] 14.321.
i)nu/etai (i)nn- cod.): klai/ei, o)du/retai, Hsch.:—also i)nu/esqai: kosmei=n, i(dru/nesqai, and i)nu/reto: e)mu/reto, Id. i)/nuc,= i)/ugc, Id. i)nforbi/ein, i)nforbismo/s, v. e)mf-.
*)inw/ [i_], o/os contr. ou=s, h(, Ino, daughter of Cadmus, worshipped as a sea-goddess by the name of Leucothea, Od.5.333, Hes.Th.976, Alcm.84, Pi.O.2.30, etc.: prov., *)inou=s a)/xh Zen.4.38.

*)inwpo/s, o(, name of a stream on Delos; also of a building at its source, IG11(2).144A72 (iv B.C.):—hence *)inwpofu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(,
warden of the I., ib.142.52, 144C10 (iv B.C.).

i)/c (on the accent v. Hdn.Gr.1.396), i)ko/s, h(,
worm or
grub that destroys the vine-buds, Alcm.43. (i_, perh. cogn. with i)/y.)

i)ca^lh= (i)ca/lh in codd., but i)calh= Ael.Dion.Fr.398), h(,
goat's skin (telei/as ai)go\s de/rma, Erot.), Hp.Fract.29, cf. Gal.19.106; used as a dress for actors in satyric dramas, Poll.4.118. (i)za/lh Hsch., i)za/nh Poll. l.c., i)sa/lh Sch.Ar.Nu.72; cf. the forms i)sse/la, i)tqe/la, i)sqlh= Hsch., i)sse/lh Theognost.Can.14: cf. sq.)

i)/ca^los, on, epith. of the Ibex,= te/leios acc. to Ar.Byz. ap. Eust. 1625.33, or
bounding, springing (as Sch.Il., Hsch., etc.), or = tomi/as (as Porph. ap. Sch.Il.), i)ca/lou ai)go\s a)gri/ou Il.4.105, cf. AP6.32 (Agath.), 113 (Simm.), 9.99 (Leon.). (Perh. borrowed fr. Asia Minor.)

i)/c-euma, atos, to/,=
aucupium, Gloss.

i)c-euth/r, h=ros, o(,
fowler, Man.4.339.

i)c-euth/rios, a, on,
like birdlime, v. i)ceu/tria. i)ceuth/rion, to/,=
aucupium, Gloss.

i)c-euth/s, ou=, o(,
fowler, birdcatcher, Lyc.105, LXXAm.8.1, AP9.824 (Eryc.), Cat.Cod.Astr.1.166, Apollod.Poliorc.152.2, Porph.Abst.1.53; i). kw=ros BionFr.9. as Adj.,
catching with birdlime, i). ka/lamoi AP6.152 (Agis).

i)c-eutiko/s, h/, o/n,
of an i)ceuth/s, Artem.2.19; ta\ *)i., title of lost poem by Opp.: h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh) Poll.7.139.
i)c-eu/tria, h(, fem. of i)ceuth/r, epith. of *tu/xh, Plu.2.322f:—written i)ceuthri/a, ib.281e (s.v.l.).

i)c-eu/w, (i)co/s)
catch by birdlime, Artem.2.19, EM471.53:—Med., Poll.7.135.

i)ci/a, h(,= i)co/s 1, Thphr.HP3.16.1, CP2.17.1, prob. in Dsc.3.89. = xamaile/wn leuko/s,
pine-thistle, Atractylis gummifera, Dsc.3.8, Plin. HN22.45; h( i). h( e)n *krh/th| Thphr.HP9.1.3. = sq., Sch.Nic.Al. 279. = kirso/s,
varicocele, Arist.HA518b25, Pr.878b37, Plu.2.202b.

i)ci/as, ou, o(,= xamaile/wn me/las,
chamaeleon-thistle, Cardopatium corymbiferum., Dsc.3.9, Alex.21, Gal.14.140.

i)ci/nh [i_], h(,= i)ci/a 11,
pine-thistle, Atractylis gummifera, Thphr.HP 6.4.3; a)/kanqa h( i). ib.9.1.2, al.: confused with e(lci/nh by Plin.HN21.94,22.41.

i)cio/eis, essa, en,
made from i)ci/as, pw=ma Nic.Al.279.

i)ci/on, to/,
leaf of xamaile/wn leuko/s ( = i)ci/a 11), Gal.19.106.
*)/icios, o(, epith. of Apollo in Rhodes, from a place *)ici/ai, Artem. ap. St.Byz. s.h.v.

i(/cis, Ion. i)/cis,, ews, h(, (i(/kw)
coming, E.Tr.396 (prob.l.); ou) ptu/sis a)ll' a)nagwgh\ kale/etai, th=s a)/nw i)/cios [th=s o(dou=] tou)/noma e)/xousa Aret. SA2.2; oi)=nos w)ku\s e)s th\n a)/nw i)/cin Id.CA2.4.
passage through, ou)damh= . . kata\ th\n tou= qw/rhkos i)/. Hp.Acut.15 (but perh. simply, 'at no point
in the q.'）; i(/cin pare/xesqai allow
free passage, dub. in Sch. Epicur.Ep.1p.8U. (fort. ei)=cin).
direction, straight line, esp.
vertical line, kaqhme/nw| po/des e)s th\n a)/nw i)/. kat' i)qu\ gou/nasi his feet when he is seated should be
vortically opposite his knees, Hp.Off.3; e)pidei=n decia\ e)p' a)ristera/, a)ristera\ e)pi\ decia/, plh\n kefalh=s: tau/thn de\ kat' i)/cin
vertically, ib.9; ba/llesqai xrh\ to\ o)qo/nion kat' au)th\n th\n i)/. tou= e(/lkeos directly
over the wound, Id.Fract.26; tou\s na/rqhkas . . mh\ kata\ th\n i)/. tou= e(/lkeos prostiqe/nai ibid.; o(ko/sa koinwnei= toi=si th=s knh/mhs o)ste/oisi kai\ au)te/h| th=| i)/cei ib.9 codd. (kata\ th\n i)/cin Gal.18(2).423; kat' au)th\n th\n i)/. Ermerins). kat' i)/cin c. gen.,
corresponding to, on the same side as, h)/lghsen kata\ boubw=na, splhno\s kat' i)/., i.e. on the spleen or left side of the body, Hp.Epid.1.26.g/, cf. 4.35,37, Art.33, Fract.16, 18, Mul.1.17; tw=n o)do/ntwn tw=n te a)/nw kai\ tw=n ka/tw kat' i)/. Id.Art.31; =
ex ipsa parte, Cass.Fel.37; e)n puretoi=si a)po\ splhno\s kai\ h(/patos dia\ r(inw=n ai(morrage/ousi, kat' i)/. tou= spla/gxnou tou= mukth=ros r(e/ontos the nostril
corresponding to the organ in question, Aret.SA 2.2; h( kat' i)/. klhi/s the
corresponding (i.e. liver or right side) collarbone, ib.2.7, cf. CA1.10; kata\ th\n o)/pisqen i)/.
at the back of the leg, Hp.Art.60. more generally,
in line with, kat' i)/. tou= pugai/ou poihsa/menon th\n sani/da ib.75; kat' i)/. th=| e)ntomh=| th=| e)s to\n toi=xon ib.47.

*)ici/wn [i_], onos, o(, Ixion, Pi.P.2.32, etc.: perh. connected with i(ke/ths, cf. A.Eu.441: pl., *)ici/ones
tragedies on the subject of I., Arist. Po.1456a1.

i)co-bole/w,
practise bird-liming, ou)k i)di/hn -bolw=n mele/thn AP9.273 (Bian.).

i)co-bo/los, on,
setting limed twigs: as Subst.,
fowler, Man. 4.243.

i)co-bo/ros, on, (bora/)
eating mistletoe-berries, h( i). (sc. ki/xlh)
missel-thrush, Turdus viscivorus, Arist.HA617a18; cf. i)cofa/gos.

i)co-eide/s, to/,=
viscidum, Gloss.

i)co-ergo/s, o(,
one who uses birdlime, fowler, AP9.264.5 (Apollonid. vel Phil.), 273 tit.
i(=con, es, e, aor. of i(/kw.

i)co/omai, Pass.,
to be smeared with birdlime, Thphr.Ign.61.

i)copoie/w,
make viscous like birdlime, of a plaster, Paul.Aeg.2.43.

i)co/s, o(,
oak-mistletoe, Hozanthus europaeus, Arist.GA715b30, Dsc. 3.89.
mistletoe-berry, Thphr.CP2.17.8.
birdlime prepared from the mistletoe-berry, E.Cyc.433; qhreuth\s i). AP5.99.
oak-gum, used for the same purpose, Ath.10.451d, cf. Plu.Cor.3, Philox. ap. Gal.13.742.
any sticky substance, Hp.Mul.1.74, IG 12.314.42 (i(-), 22.1673.63. metaph., i). o)mma/twn of one who causes the eyes to be
fixed upon him, Tim.Com.2; e)kfugw\n to\n i). to\n e)n pra/gmati Luc.Hist.Conscr.57; kaqa/per i)cw=| tini prose/xetai toi=s toiou/tois h( yuxh/ Id.Cat.14.
skinflint, miser, Ar.Fr.718. (Prob. vico/s, cf. Lat.
viscum, viscus.）
i)co-fa/gos [a^], on,= i)co-bo/ros, Ath.2.65a.

i)co-foreu/s, e/ws, o(,
limed, do/nakes i)coforh=es AP9.209.

i)co-fo/ros, on,
having mistletoe growing thereon, dru/es S.Fr.403: read by Agathocl. in Il.14.398.
limed, do/nac Opp.H.1.32.

i)cu^o/qen, Adv.
from the loins, Arat.144; prob. l. for i)cuo/fin in Opp. C.2.6.

i)cu/s, u/os, h(,
waist, of women, peri\ de\ zw/nhn ba/let' i)cui= (contr. for i)cu/i+) Od.5.231, cf. Longus 1.4; of a man, Arat.310; of centaurs, Opp. C.2.6; of a deer, APl.4.96: pl., i)cu/es, oi(,
loins, Hp.Fract.20, cf. Gal. 19.106: sg.,= o)sfu/s, [Id.]14.706. (Perh. akin to i)sxu/s, cf. i)sxi/on.） [u_ in nom. and acc. sg., Choerob. in Theod.1.331; u^ in trisyll. cases.]

i)cw/dhs, es,
like birdlime, sticky, clammy, Hp.Ulc.12, Luc.Tim.29.

*)ioba/kx-eia [i^], ta/,
festival in honour of Bacchus, Jusj. ap. D.59.78.
*)ioba/kx-ios, o( (sc. mh/n), name of month at Astypalaea, IG12(3).169.15, 170.14; at Amorgos, ib. 12(7).67A6.

*)io/bakx-os, o(,
Bacchus invoked with the cry of i)w/, APl.4.289, Max.496, Corn.ND30, Hsch. in pl.,
worshippers of the God, name of a guild at Athens, SIG1109.35, al. (ii A.D.).
hymn beginning with i)w\ *ba/kxe, such as were ascribed to Archilochus, Heph.15.9.

i)o-ba/pths [i^], ou, o(,
violet-dyer, Gloss.

i)o-ba^fh/s, e/s,
violetcoloured, Democr.Eph.1; of water, Ath.2.42e.

i)o-ble/fa^ros, Dor. i)ogle/f-, on,
violet-eyed, Pi.Fr.307; *xa/rites, *mou=sai, B.18.5, 8.3, cf. Man.5.145, Luc.Im.8.

i)o-bole/w [i_],
shoot arrows, dart, A.R.4.1440, AP5.187 (Leon.); e)s e)mh\n kradi/hn ib.5.9 (Alc.).
emit poison, Gp.2.47.12.

i)o-bo/los, on, (i)o/s)
shooting arrows, to/con AP6.34 (Rhian.).
shedding venom, venomous, of animals, Numen. ap. Ath.7.304f, Hdn.3.9.5: Sup., J.AJ17.5.5; i)obo/la, ta/,
venomous animals, Arist.HA607a28; peri\ i)obo/lwn zw/|wn, title of work by Philumenus; ta\ tw=n i). a)/kh Philostr.VA3.44. of arrows,
poisoned, Orph.H.12.16; ai(=ma AP11.237 (Demod.): metaph., i). ge/nues, of Momus, APl.4.266.2.

i)o-bo/ros, on, (i)o/s B)
poison-eating, Opp.C.3.223; of a serpent, diya/s IG4.620 (Argos).
eating venomously, puqedo/nes Nic.Th. 467.

i)o-bo/stru^xos [i^], on,
dark-haired, *mou=sai Pi.I.7(6).23.

i)o/-glhnos,
h, on,
dark-eyed, Hsch.

i)o/-detos, on, (de/w)
violet-twined, ste/fanoi Pi.Fr.75.6.

i)o-dnefh/s, e/s, (dno/fos)
dark as the flower i)/on (v. i)/on 1v),
purple-dark, ei)=ros Od.4.135,9.426.

i)odo/kos [i_], on, （i)o/s A)
holding arrows, fare/trh Il.15.444, Od.21.12, Pittac.Lyr.1: i)odo/kh (sc. fare/tra), h(,
quiver, A.R.2.679, 3.156,279, AP6.296 (Leon.), 12.45 (Posidipp.): i)odo/xh, Hsch., Phot.
containing poison, o)do/ntes i).
poison-fangs, Nic.Th.184.

i)oeidh/s [i^], e/s, （i)/on)
like the flower i)/on 1,
purple, in Hom. always of the sea, i)oeide/a po/nton, whether calm or stormy, Il.11.298, Od.5.56, 11.107, Hes.Th.844; krh/nh ib.3. (i)o/s B)
poisonous, ke/ntron Nic.Th.886; loigo/s ib.243. [Nic. makes i^ short, as conversely he has i_a/si from i)/on (q.v.).]

i)o/eis [i^], esa, en, （i)/on)
violet-coloured, dark, i)o/enta si/dhron Il.23.850, cf. Phoronis Fr.2, Q.S.6.48; i)o/enta qa/lassan Nic.Al.171. i)o/eis, (i)o/s B)
poisonous, a)/kanqai Androm. ap. Gal.14.38 [who makes i^ short; cf. foreg.11].

i)o/-zwnos [i^], on, （zw/nh)
with purple girdle, Hsch., dub. in Call. in Stud.Ital.7(1929).9.

i)o-qa_lh/s, e/s,
blooming with violets, ste/fanoi Philox.2.42.
i)o/-kolpos, on, = i)o/zwnos, Alc.63 (Sapphus est), Sapph. Supp.17.5.
i)o/-kouros, o(, = bio/kouros, Ephes.3p.165.

i)olo/xeutos [i_], on, （i)o/s B)
born of venom, Procl.H.1.41.

i)/omen, Ep. for i)/wmen, 1pl. pres. subj. of ei)=mi (
ibo).

i)omi^gh/s [i_], e/s, （i)o/s B)
tainted with poison, qhlh/ AP9.1 (Polyaen.).

i)o/mwroi, oi(, twice in Hom., *)argei=oi i)o/mwroi, e)legxe/es Il.4.242; *)argei=oi i)o/mwroi, a)peila/wn a)ko/rhtoi 14.479. (Expld. by Sch. as
caring for arrows (cf. me/rimna), but i^ is against this: perh.
noisy (cf. i)a/).)

i)/on [i^], to/, heterocl. dat. pl. i)a/si^ [i_a^] Nic.Fr.74.2:—
violet, Viola odorata, ste/fanoi i)/wn Sapph.Supp.23.12, cf. Pi.O.6.55, etc.; kai\ to\ i)/on me/lan e)nti/ Theoc.10.28, cf. AP4.21 (Mel.); kuanauge/s ib.5.73 (Rufin.); i)/. to\ me/lan Thphr.HP1.13.2, CP1.13.12; i)/on alone, Dsc. 4.121:—in Od.5.72, leimw=nes malakoi\ i)/ou h)de\ seli/nou qh/leon, there were vv.ll. si/ou (Ptol. Euerg.) and qru/ou. i)/on to\ leuko/n ( = leuko/i+on, q.v.)
gilliflower, Matthiola incana, Thphr.HP6.6.3; also i)/on alone, ib.6.8.1. = kri/non, Philin. ap. Ath.15.681b. generally, any
flower, EM473.10. a precious stone of dark colour, Plin.HN37.170. (vi/on, cf. gi/a: a)/nqh, Hsch., Lat.
viola.）

i)onqa/s, a/dos, h(,
shaggy, epith. of the wild goat, Od.14.50.

i)/onqos, o(,
root of a hair, young hair, i)o/nqous e)kqlibome/nous Phld. Sign.13, cf. Eun.Hist.p.250 D., Phryn.PSp.77 B.
eruption on the face, which often accompanies the first growth of the beard, etc., Hp.Epid.1.26.b/, Arist.HA556b29, Pr.963b40, Erot. s.v. o)loflukti/des :—hence i)onqw/dhs, es, e)pa/rseis Thphr.Sud.16, cf. Gal.12.824.

*)io/nios [i_], a, on, （*)iw/)
of or
called after Io, epith. of the sea between Epirus and Italy, at the mouth of the Adriatic sea, across which Io swam, po/ntios muxo\s . . *)io/nios keklh/setai, th=s sh=s porei/as mnh=ma A.Pr. 840; another expl. in Theopomp.Hist.125; *)i. ko/lpos Hdt.6.127, Th.1.24; qa/lassa, po/ros, Pi.P.3.68, N.4.53; also simply o( *)io/nios Th. 6.30; later *)io/nion pe/lagos AP6.251 (Phil.).

i)o/omai, Pass., (i)o/s c)
become or
be rusty, Arist.Col.793b6, Thphr. Char.10.14, Dsc.5.78, Antig.Mir.151.
become acrid, embittered, Hsch.:—Act. i)o/w, only late,
rust, o( si/dhros ma=llon i)oi= Olymp.in Mete. 266.26, cf. 270.14;
convert into i)o/s, Zos.Alch.pp.148,238B.

i)o/-peplos [i^], on,
with violet robe, Hsch.

i)o-plo/ka^mos, on,
with dark locks, *moi=sai Pi.P.1.1,cf. Simon.18.
i)o/-plokos, on, = foreg., Alc.55; ko/ra, *nhrh/ides, B.8.72, 16.37; *moi=sai Lyr.Adesp.53; of Apollo, AP9.524.10.
i)opoi/hsis [i_], ews, h(, = i)/wsis, Zos.Alch.p.252B.
i)o/ppa: mico/dhs, Hsch. i)/orkos, o(, v. dorka/s.

i)o/s (A) [i_], o(, pl. i)oi/, heterocl.i)a/ Il.20.68 (Cypr., acc. to AB1095):—
arrow, i)o\n e(/hke Il.1.48; blh/menos h)\ i)w=| h)\ e)/gxei+ 8.514, cf. A.Pers.461; h(=ken komh/thn i)o/n S.Tr.567. (Cf. Skt.
í[snull ] 'arrow'.)

i)o/s (B) [i_], o(,
poison, as of serpents, A.Eu.478, S.Tr.771, E.Ion 1015, Plu.2.562c, etc.;
venom of a mad dog, Ruf.Fr.118; i)o\s a)memfh\s melissw=n, of honey with which snakes fed Iamos, Pi.O.6.47: metaph., of envy, A.Ag.834. (Cf. Skt.
vi[snull ]ám 'poison', Lat.
vīrus.）

i)o/s (C) [i_], o(,
rust on iron, or
verdigris on copper and bronze, Sapph.141 (dub.), Thgn.451, Pl.R.609a, Ti.59c, Theoc.16.17; i). sidh/rou Dsc.5.80; i). xalkou= Hp.Mul.1.75, Dsc.5.79, Gal.12.218;
patina on bronze statues, o(/pws kaqaro\s i)ou= e)/stai o( a)ndria/s SIG284.15 (Chios, iv B.C.), cf. Plu.2.395b. (Perh. identical with i)o/s B.）

i)o/s [i^], i)/a^, i)o/n,
one, commonest in fem. (v. ei(=s): neut. i)w=| ki/on h)/mati Il.6.422: masc. dat. i)w=|, = e)kei/nw|, Leg.Gort.8.8; but, = e(ni/, ib.7.23; acc., to/n g' i)o\n e)niauto/n the
same year, IG5(1).1390.126 (Andania, i B.C.); i)o/s, = mo/nos, acc. to Trypho ap.A.D.Pron.56.4.
i(o/s, Boeot. for e(o/s (q.v.).

i)o-sa/kxar [i^], to/,
sugar of violets, Ruf.Fr.80.

i)o-ste/fa^nos, on,
violet-crowned, epith. of Aphrodite, h.Hom.6.18, Sol.19.4; of the Muses, Thgn.250; esp. of Athens, Pi.Fr.76, cf. B.5.3, Ar.Ach.637, Eq.1323.

i)o/ths [i^], htos, h(,
will, desire, Ep.and Lyr. almost always in dat., qew=n i)o/thti
by the will of the gods, Il.19.9, Od.7.214,al., cf.Alc.13A; mhtro\s e)mh=s i)o/thti
at her
will, Il.18.396; kakh=s i). gunaiko/s Od.11.384; mnhsth/rwn i). 18.234; a)llh/lwn i). Il.5.874; a)naidh/tw| i). with shameless
will, A.R.4.360: acc. only in Il.15.41 di' e)mh\n i). once in Trag.,
for the sake of, i)o/tati ga/mwn A.Pr.558 (lyr.).—Hsch. explains it by boulh/sei, ai)ti/a, o)rgh=|, xa/riti.

i)o-to/kos [i_], on, （i)o/s B)
poison-bearing, venomous, Opp.C.3.73.

i)o-tu^ph/s, e/s, (i)o/s A)
arrow-stricken, AP5.86 (Rufin.),9.265 (Apollonid. or Phil.).

i)ou/ or i)ou= (v. sub fin.), Interj., a loud cry expressive of sorrow, joy, or surprise, of grief of annoyance, usu. twice repeated, i)ou\ i)ou/ D.19.209; i). i). du/sthnos or du/sthne, S.Tr.1143, OT1071; i). i). boa=n, kekrage/nai, Ar.Nu.543, Pax345: c. gen., i). i). tw=n . . kigkli/dwn Jul. Caes.330d: rarely once, fu= （feu= codd.), i). th=s a)sbo/lou Ar.Th.245; or thrice, Id.Pax110: with other Interj., i). i). w)\ w)\ kaka/ A.Ag.1214; i). i). po/pac Id.Eu.143 (lyr.). of joyful surprise,
hallo!, hurrah!, Id.Ag.25, E.Cyc.464, 576, Ar.Eq.1096, Pl.R.432d, Grg.499b, Smp. 223a. (Sch.Ar.Pax345,316 says that i)ou\ i)ou/ is of woe, i)ou= i)ou= of joy: the rule is not observed in codd. In Att. Poets it sts. stands extra versum, A.Ag.25, Ar.Nu.1.)

*)ioudai=os, o(,
a Jew: *)ioudai/a,
a Jewess; h( *)ioudai/a (sc. gh=) Judaea: —*)iouda-i+ko/s, h/, o/n, Jewish, LXX 2 Ma.8.11, etc. Adv. -kw=s J.BJ6.1.3, Ep.Gal.2.14, Cod.Just.1.1.7.4:

i)o-i/+zw,
side with or
imitate the Jews, LXXEs.8.17, Ep.Gal.l.c.:
i)o-i+smo/s, o(, Judaism, LXX 2 Ma.2.21, Ep.Gal.1.13:

i)o-i+sti/,
in the Hebrew tongue, LXX 4 Ki.18.26.
i)/oukai: pepo/reutai, Hsch.

*)ioulai=os, o( (sc. mh/n), name of month in Lesbos (?), CIG6850A; in Cyprus, Cat.Cod.Astr.2.139:—also *)iouli/hos, CIG2827, 2836 (Aphrodisias): *)iou/lios,= Lat.
Julius, Hemerolog.Flor.

i)ouli/zw [i^],
become downy or
hairy, Tryph.53, cf.Phot.

i)ouli/s [i^], i/dos, h(,
rainbow-wrasse, Coris iulis, Arist.HA610b6, AP 7.504.5 (Leon.), Numen. ap. Ath.7.304f, Artem.1.14.

i)oulo/pezos [i^], on, （i)/oulos 1v)
footed like the centipede, i.e.
manyfooted, many-oared, of a ship, Lyc.23.

i)/oulos [i^], o(,
down, the first growth of the whiskers and beard, in pl., pri/n sfwi+n u(po\ krota/foisin i)ou/lous a)nqh=sai Od.11.319: later in sg., stei/xei d' i)/. a)/rti dia\ parhi/+dwn A.Th.534; pra=ton i)/. a)po\ krot a/fwn kataba/llein Theoc.15.85; e)/ti xnoa/ontas i)ou/lous a)nt e/llwn A.R.2.43; u(po\ krota/foisin i)ou/lous keira/menos AP6.198 (Antip. Thess.); i)ou/lois plh=sai pareia/s IG14.1601.
corn-sheaf, whence Demeter is said to be named *)ioulw/, Semus 19, Carm.Pop.1.
song in honour of Demeter, Semus l.c., Apollod.Hist.149 J., Eratosth.Fr.10.
catkin, Thphr.HP3.5.5,3.7.3;
tendril, ib.3.18.11.
creature like the centipede, prob. the
wood-louse, Arist.HA523b18, PA682b3, Thphr.Sign.19,Arat.959;
earthworm, Numen. ap. Ath.7.305a. = i)ouli/s, Eratosth.Fr.12 (pl.). (Perh. cogn. with ou)=los, q.v.)

i)oulofo/ros [i^], on,
downy, ge/nus Demitsas *maked.No.410 (Thessalonica, ii A.D.).

*)ioulw/ [i^], ou=s, h(,
goddess of sheaves, epith. of Demeter, Semus 19; cf. i)/oulos 11.

i)oulw/dhs [i^], es,
scolopendra-like, Arist.PA682a5.
i)o/f, prob. corrupt in A.Supp.828: interj. expressing aversion, acc. to Sch.

i)o-fo/ros [i_], on, （i)o/s B, fe/rw)
poison-bearing, Opp.C.3.433.

i)o-xe/aira, h(, (i)o/s A)
arrow-pourer, shooter of arrows, epith. of Artemis, Il.5.53, etc.; i). parqe/nos Pi.P.2.9: as Subst., *)ioxe/aira Il.21.480, Od. 11.198, Schwyzer 758 (vi B.C.), IG14.1389i53; later i). fare/tra AP 6.9 (Mnasalc.). (i)o/s B)
poison-shedding, of serpents, Nic.Fr. 33. (-xe/vaira from xe/w, not as expld. by Apollon.Lex. etc. from xai/rw.） [i_ as in i)o/s: yet i^ in Pi.l.c.]

*)ioxia, ta/, name of a festival, perh. Parilia (
parelia, pardia codd.), Gloss.
i(/pama: ka/mnh, Hsch. i)/par, Aeol. for u(/par, Jo.Gramm.Comp. 3.15. i)pnasi/a: gasth/r (Tarent.), Hsch.

i)pneu-th/s, ou=, o(, =
furnarius, Gloss.; prob. for i)pni/ths in AP6.299 (Phan.).

i)pneu/-w, (i)pno/s)
dry or
bake in the oven, Hsch., prob. in IG 12.4.15 (jipn-).

i)/pnh, h(,
woodpecker, Ant.Lib.21.6; cf. i)/ppa （i(/pta cod.): = druoko/lay, Hsch.: i)pnh/: e)fippi/s (Sicel), Id.
i)pn-i/on, to/, Dim. of i)pno/s, Dieuch. ap. Orib.4.5.2.

i)/pn-ios, a, on, (i)pno/s 1)
of an oven:—hence i)/pnia, ta/,
soot, Hsch., cf. Sch.Ar.V. 832. (i)pno/s Iv)
of a dunghill, Call.Fr.216.

i)pn-i/ths [i_t], ou, o(,
baked in the oven, oi( i). a)/rtoi Hp.Vict.2.42, Polem.Hist.86, IG5 (1).363.18 (Sparta, i A.D.: written -ei/tan): without a)/rtos, Timocl. 33; i). fqoi/+s AP6.299 (Phan., sed leg. -euth/s).
i)pno-do/man: th\n frugi/an (Cret.), Hsch.

i)pno-ka^h/s, e/s, (kai/w)
baked in the oven, Luc.Lex.6.

i)pno-kau/sths, =
furnarius, Gloss. (also i)pno-kau/ths, ibid.).
i)pno-kh/ion: fru/gion, oi( de\ th\n u(po/kausin tou= i)pnou=, Hsch.

i)pno-le/bhs, htos, o(,
boiler, cauldron, Luc.Lex.8, Ath.3.98c.
i)pno-lebh/tion, to/, Dim. of foreg., Poll.10.66.

i)/pnon, to/,
mare's-tail, Hippuris vulgaris, Thphr.HP4.10.1.

i)pnopla/qos [a^], o(, （pla/ssw)
oven-maker, fire-clay moulder, worker in terra-cotta, much like koropla/qos (q. v.), Pl.Tht.147a:—later i)pnopla/qhs, Poll.7.163, Tim.Lex., Harp.:—also i)pno-pla/sths, ou, o(, Gal.Thras.43:
i)pno-poio/s, o/n, Luc.Prom.Es2, Them.Or.21.256d.

i)pn-o/s, o(,
oven, furnace, Hdt.5.92.h/, Hp.Morb.2.47, Antiph.176.4, Diph.Siph. ap. Ath.2.54a, Archestr.Fr.46; esp. for heating water for the bath, Ar.V.139,Av.437 (i^pn-).
the place of the oven, i.e.
the kitchen, Semon.7.61, Ar.V.837, Lycurg.Fr.73.
lantern, Ar.Pax841, Pl.815, SIG1027.13 (Cos, 1v/iii B.C.), Ael.NA2.8. = koprw/n,
dunghill, privy, Ar.Fr.353, Hsch. (Prob. cogn. with Engl.
oven.）

i)pn-w/n, w=nos, o(,
kitchen, IG11(2).287 A147, al. (Delos, iii B.C.).

i)pokto/nos [i_], on, （i)/y)
killing the worms in vines, epith. of Heracles at Erythrae, Str.13.1.64.

i)=p-os, h( (so in Pi. l.c.) or to/ (Eust.844.39), in a mouse-trap,
the piece of wood that falls and catches the mouse, Ar.Pl.（815?)ap.Poll. 10.155, Id.7.41, Eust.16.40,etc. cf. ei)=pos.
any weight, fuller's
press, Archil.169; i)=. a)nemo/essa, of Aetna as the weight which holds Typhoeus down, Pi.O.4.8;
press used in surgery, Hp.Mochl.38. (Perh. cf. i)/ptomai.)

i)p-o/w,
press, squeeze, Cratin.91; esp. in surgery, Hp.Art.47; i). th\n kefalh\n tou= braxi/onos Heliod. ap. Orib.49.13.8:—Pass.,
to be weighed down, i)pou/menos r(i/zaisin *ai)tnai/ais u(/po A. Pr.365; i)pou/menos tai=s e)sforai=s Ar.Eq.924.
i)/ppa, h(, v. sub i)/pnh: as pr. n. *(/ippa, Hippa, nurse of Dionysus, Orph.H.48.4.

i(pp-agre/tai, w=n, oi(, (a)gre/w) three officers at Lacedaemon,
who chose 300, the flower of the e)/fhboi,
to serve as a body-guard for the kings (v. i(ppeu/s 11.1), X.HG3.3.9, Lac.4.3, Archyt. ap. Stob.4.1.138: sg., Th.4.38 (unless it be pr. n.).

i(/pp-agros, o(,= i(/ppos a)/grios,
wild horse, Opp.C.3.252.

i(pp-a^gwgo/s, o/n,
carrying horses; esp. of ships used as
cavalry transports, ploi=a Hdt.6.48; ne/es ib.95; nau=s Th.2.56, 4.42, Arr.An.2.19.1; trih/reis D.4.16, D.S.11.3; i(ppagwgoi/ alone, Ar.Eq.599, D.4.21: *(ippagwgo/s as pr. n. of a ship, IG22.1623.14.

i(pp-a/zomai, Dor. fut. 3sg. i(ppasei=tai Dialex.6.4:—
drive horses, drive a chariot, *)anti/lox', a)frade/ws i(ppa/zeai Il.23.426; later,
ride, Hdt.4.114, Hp.
Aër.17, Ar.Nu.15, etc.; i(. e)f' i(/ppwn Hdt.4.110; i(/ppw| X.Eq.10.1: metaph., a( cusma\ e)k podo\s ei)s kefala\n i(ppa/zetai Sophr. 53:—rare in Act., i(ppa/sai pw=lon ap.Poll.1.182. Pass., of the horse,
to be ridden or
driven, Pl.Ion540e;
to be broken in for riding, X.Eq.3.1. c. acc. loci, i(ppa/zesqai xw/ran
ride over a country, Plu.Cam.23; ta\s o(dou/s D.S.13.88.

i(pp-a_i/+s, i/+dos, h(, hyperdor. for i(pphi/+s, fem. of i(ppiko/s 1.3,
of a knight, po/rpa, i.e.
fibula which fastened the
trabea of a Roman
eques, Epigr.Gr.985.1 (Philae).

i(pp-aixmi/a, h(,
cavaliy-action, Sch.Pi.N.1.23 (pl.).

i(/pp-aixmos, on,
fighting on horseback, equestrian, Pi.N.1.17.

i(pp-a/kh [a^], h(,
mare's-milk cheese, used by the Scythians, Hp.
Aër.18, A.Fr.198, Theopomp.Hist.48, Thphr.HP9.13.2, Dsc.2.71:—also i(ppa/khs, ou, o(, Eust.916.16.
horse's rennet, Dsc.2.75.
a leguminous plant, Ph.Bel.86.25, Plin.HN25.83.

i(pp-a^kontisth/s, ou=, o(,
mounted javelineer, Ael. Tact.2.13, Arr.An.4.4.7, Poll.1.131.

i(pp-a/kopon, to/, (cf. a)/kopos)
remedy for horses, Hippiatr.130.

i(pp-a^lektru^w/n, o/nos, o(,
horsecock, gryphon, a fabulous animal in A.Fr.134, cf. Ar.Ra.932, Av. 800.
i(pp-a^le/os, a, on, poet. for i(ppiko/s, Opp.C.1.169,242, etc.

i(/pp-a^los, o(, name of the
monsoon in the Indian Ocean (from the name of the pilot who observed it), prob. in Peripl.M.Rubr.57.

i(pp-anaba/ths [ba^], ou, o(,
mounted man, PLond.1821.80.

i(pp-a/nqrwpos, o(,
centaur, Gal.UP3.1, Eust.1909.53.
i(ppa^pai=, a cry of the *(ippei=s, a parody of the boatmen's cry (r(uppapai=), Ar.Eq.602.

i(pp-a/rion,, to/, Dim. of i(/ppos,
pony, PCair.Zen.30,al. (iii B.C.), Arr.Tact.19.3.
wretched horse, in contempt, X.Cyr.1.4.19, Plu. Phil.7, Them.Or.24.306d.
statuette of a horse, IG11(2).203B 84 (Delos, iii B.C.).

i(pp-armosth/s, ou=, o(, Laced. for i(/pparxos,
commander of cavalry, X.HG4.4.10,5.12; cf. i(/pfarmos.

i(pparx-ei=on, to/,
head-quarters of the i(/pparxos, IG22.895 (ii B.C.).

i(pparx-e/w,
to be i(/pparxos,
command cavalry, c. gen., th=s i(/ppou Hdt.9.20, 69; i(pparxhkw\s a)ndrw=n kalw=n ka)gaqw=n Din.3.12; i(ppe/wn D.21.164: abs., X.Ages.2.4, Lys.26.20, D.21.172; oi( i(pparxhko/tes Hyp.Lyc. 17; of the Roman
magister equitum and
praefectus equitum, D.C.43.48, App.BC5.8:—Pass.,
serve under an i(/pparxos, Arist.Pol.1277b10.
i(ppa/rx-hs, Dor. i(pparx-a/rxas, Ion. gen.

i(pparx-a/rxew IG12(8).194.7 (Samothrace), Michel 596 (Cyzicus), o(,= i(/pparxos, OGI217 (Caria, iii B.C., pl.), Plb.10.22.6 (Achaean), 18.22.2 (Macedonian), cf. LXX 2 Ki.1.6, PTeb.54.2 (i B.C.), Plu.Tim.32; at Sparta, IG5(1).32A, al.; = Lat.
magister equitum, Plb.3.87.9, D.H.5.75, Nic.Dam.130.17J., etc.; =
praefectus equitum, App.BC2.102; =
praefectus alae, J.BJ2.14.5.

i(pparx-i/a, h(,
office of i(/pparxos, X.Ath.1.3 (pl.); of the
magister equitum, D.C. Fr.36.26, Lyd.Mag.2.13.
a squadron of horse such as he commands, Plb.10.23.4, D.S.17.57, Str.17.1.12, Plu.Eum.7, Arr.An. 1.24.3; consisting of 512 men, Ascl.Tact.7.11, etc.

i(pparx-iko/s,, h/, o/n,
of or
for a i(/pparxos, h(gemoni/a i(.,= i(pparxi/a, Suid.s.v. i(/pparxos; i(. e)sti/ it is
part of his duty, X.Eq.Mag.5.1: -iko/s, o( (sc. lo/gos), title of treatise by Xenophon.

i(/pparx-os, o(,
ruling the horse, epith. of Poseidon, Pi.P.4.45.
commander of cavalry, th=s i(/ppou Hdt.7.154; at Athens, IG22.116.15 (iv B.C.), Ar.Av.799, Lys.16.8, Pl.Lg.755c, 880d, X.Eq.Mag.1.7,al.; i(/. ei)s *lh=mnon xeirotonei=n Hyp.Lyc.17, cf. D. 4.26; in other states, Th.4.72, IG7.2466 (Thebes, iii B.C.), etc.; in the Achaean league, ib.5(2).344.7 (Orchomenus), etc.; = Lat.
magister equitum, D.S.12.64, Plu.Cam.5, etc.; =
praefectus equitum, App.Hisp.47; cf. i(ppa/rxhs.

i(pp-a/s, a/dos, h(, pecul.fem. of i(ppiko/s, i(. stolh/
a riding-dress, Hdt. 1.80; = Lat.
equester, i(. e)sqh/s D.C.38.14. as Subst., h( i(. (sc. ta/cis)
the order of knights (i(ppei=s) at Athens, Arist.Pol.1274a21; qusi/ai, bou=s i(ppa/des of sacrifices
offered by the knights, Hsch.; pu/lai i(., name of a gate at Athens, Plu.2.849c.
knights' tax, i(ppa/da telei=n Is.7.39, Arist.Ath.7.4, Plu.Sol.18; qhtikou= a)nti\ te/lous i(ppa/d' a)meiya/menos Epigr. ap. Arist.Ath.l.c. at Rome,=
ordo equester, D.C.40.57,al.; in full h( i(. ta/cis Hdn.5.1.5. a boy's game, Poll. 9.122. = i(/ppos, h(,
mare, Opp.C.1.162, Hippiatr.14, BGU21iii 8 (iv A.D.).

i(pp-a^si/a, h(,
riding, horse-exercise, Ar.Ach.1165 (lyr.); i(. poiei=sqai,= i(ppa/zesqai, to take
a ride, X.Eq.8.9, cf. An.2.5.33; i(. i(ppa/sasqai Id.Oec.11.17;
horsemanship, Id.An.2.5.33; as a subject of competition, IG7.3087 (Lebad.).
chariot-driving, Luc. DDeor.12.1, etc.
cavalry, Arr.An.4.4.7.

i(pp-a/simos [a^], h, on,
fit for horses, fit for riding, *ai)/gupton to\ pri\n e)ou=san i(ppasi/mhn kai\ a(maceuome/nhn, opp. a)/nippos, Hdt.2.108, cf. 5.63,9.13, X. Cyr.1.4.14, Aen.Tact.6.6, Plb.10.49.5, Onos.31.1, etc.; to\ i(ppa/simon, i.e. to\ pedino/n, X.HG7.2.12; ta\ i(. th=s xw/ras a)/nippa poiei=n Aen.Tact.8.4: metaph., toi=s ko/lacin e(auto\n a)neikw\s i(ppa/simon allowing himself
to be ridden by flatterers, Plu.Alex.23.
i(pp-a/sion, to/, Dim. of i(/ppos, Theognost.Can.125.

i(/pp-asma, atos, to/,
a ride, Ach. Tat.1.13.

i(pp-asmo/s, o(,
riding, Sch.E.Hel.1355.
i(pp-asth/r, h=ros, o(,= sq., metaph. of the mu/wy, AP5.202 (Asclep.); khmo/s ib.7.424 (Antip. Sid.).

i(pp-asth/s, ou=, o(,= i(ppeuth/s, Luc.Am.46. as Adj.,
fit for riding, of a horse, X.Eq.10.17.

i(pp-asti/, Adv.
like a horseman, kaqi/zein Hsch.

i(pp-astiko/s, h/, o/n,
fond of riding, Plu.Alc.23.

i(pp-asto/s, h/, o/n,
that can be ridden, Arist.HA576b17.

i(pp-a/striai ka/mhloi, ai(,
dromedaries, Plu.Eum.15.

i(pp-a/fesis, ews, h(,
starting-post in a race-course, Plb.Fr.52(pl.), Abh.Berl.Akad. 1904(2).9 (Pap., ii B.C.), D.H.3.68 (pl.), Epigr. ap. Paus.6.20.14 (Olymp.), prob. in SIG251Hii63, 253U (Delph., iv B.C.):—also i(ppa/fia, ta/, Tab.Defix.Aud.234.21 (Carthage, i A.D.).

i(pp-afi/des,
caballi ammissi, carceres, Gloss. (prob. -afe/seis).

i(pp-ei/a, h(, (i(ppeu/w)
riding or
driving of horses,
horsemanship, racing, S.El.505 (lyr.): pl., E.HF374 (lyr.).
cavalry, X.An.5.6.8,Ages.1.23.
breed of horses, e)ndo/cou genome/nhs e)nqe/nde i(. Str.5.1.9.

i(/pp-eios, a, on, (i(/ppos)
of a horse or
horses, zugo/n, fa/tnh, Il.5.799, 10.568; ka/pai Od. 4.40; i(/. lo/fos
horse-hair crest, Il.15.537; e)/ntea Pi.N.9.22; ge/nos, ma/ndrai, S.Ant.341 (lyr.), Fr.659.3; e)/qeirai Theoc.16.81; to\ i(/ppeion [ga/la] Arist.HA522a28, Posidon. ap. Gal.19.712; ka/lw i(ppei/w du/o IG 12.330.19. Adv. -ei/ws Dam.Pr.58. i(/ppeios, o( (sc. mh/n), name of month at Thronion, Klio16.176 (Delph.). (i(/ppios is the usual form in Trag., i(ppiko/s in Prose.)
i(pp-ela/teira [a^], fem. of sq., Orph.H.32.12.

i(pp-ela/ths [a^], ou, o(,
driver or
rider of horses, Opp.C.1.95.

i(pp-e/la^fos, o(, lit.,
horse-deer, perh.
nylghau, Portax picta, Arist.HA498b32; h( qh/leia i(. ou)k e)/xei ke/rata ib.499b2.

i(pp-erasth/s, ou=, o(,
lover of horses, Ael.NA2.28.

i(/pp-eros, o(,
horse-fever, formed after i)/kteros, u(/deros, etc., with a pun on e)/ros ( = e)/rws), Ar.Nu.74.

i(/pp-euma, atos, to/,
ride on horseback or
journey in a chariot, E.IT1428; [*nu/c], makro\n i(/. diw/keis Id.Fr.114 (lyr.).

i(pp-eu/s, gen. e/ws （-e/w dub. in Hsch.), Ep. h=os, o(, (i(/ppos)
one who fights from a chariot, Hom. (only in Il.), opp. pezo/s, 2.810; either of
the driver or of
the hero who fights, 12.66, 15.270; also of
one who drives in a chariot-race, 23.262.
horseman, rider, cavalryman, i)pph/wn stro/tos Sapph.Supp.5.1, cf. Hdt.3.88,9.49, A. Pers.14 (anap.), Arist.Pol.1270a29, etc.; th=s politei/as i(. a public
courier, Aristaenet.1.26.
groom, Class.Rev.27.12 (Laodicea Combusta), 24.12, JHS18.108 (near Lysias). i(ppei=s, in social and political sense,
knights, forming an aristocracy in early Greek communities, Arist.Pol.1297b18, etc.; at Eretria, ib.1306a35, Ath. 15.2; at Sparta, a royal bodyguard, Hdt.8.124, cf. 1.67, etc.; esp. at Athens, the Second Class in Solon's constitution, Arist.Ath.7.3; later, an aristocratic corps of cavalry, Ar.Eq.225, And.3.5, Philoch. 100, etc. of the Roman
equites, D.S.37.8, D.H.4.24, App. BC1.22, etc.; i(ppeu\s *(rwmai/wn,= Lat.
eques Romanus, Mon.Anc.Gr. 7.17, IG3.768a, IGRom.3.204 (Ancyra), OGI547.2 (ibid.), 645.7 (Palmyra), prob. in IGRom.4.1213 (Thyatira).
nimble kind of
crab, Arist.HA525b8. kind of
comet, Plin.HN2.90, Lyd. Ost.11.
girl's ornament, Hsch., cf. Ostr.323 (ii B.C.). a
measure, purw=n, a)mugda/lwn, a)leu/rwn, Supp.Epigr.2.710（Pednelissus).

i(/pp-eusis, ews, h(,
riding, in pl., Sch.E.Ph.791.
i(pp-euth/r, h=ros, o(,= sq., pw=los, i(. pedi/wn, ou)x a(lo/s AP9.295 (Bianor).

i(pp-euth/s, ou=, o(,
rider, horseman, Pi.P.9.123: as Adj., *trw=es B.12.160; strato/s E.HF408 (lyr.).

i(pp-eu/w,
to be a horseman or
rider, ride, Hdt.1.136, etc.; i(. tai=s kuou/sais i(/ppois Arist.HA576a21; i(. e)p' o)/nou Luc.Bacch.2; of a people, i(ppeu/ei tau=ta ta\ e)/qnh Hdt.7.84, cf. 87:—also in Med., Id.1.27,79. metaph., of the wind, zefu/rou pnoai=s i(ppeu/santos E.Ph.212 (lyr.); sela/na i(ppeu/ousa di' o)rfnai/as Id.Supp.994 (lyr.); also,
rush, pro\s fo/non Id.HF1001.
serve in the cavalry, Lys.14.7, X.HG3.1.4, Pl.Lg.756b, etc. at Rome,
to be an eques, D.C. 49.12; to\ -eu=on the
ordo equester, Id.60.7. of a horse, as we say 'the horse
rides (i.e.
carries his rider) well', X.Eq.1.6,3.4, 10.3.
drive a team, Ar.Nu.1406.

i(pp-hge/ths, ou, o(,
driver of horses, of Poseidon, Lyc.767.
i(pp-hgo/s, o/n, （a)/gw） = i(ppagwgo/s, nh=es (expressed or understood) Philoch.132, Plb.1.27.9, D.S.20.83; trih/rhs *(ipphgo/s as pr. n., IG22.1628.423,1629.944.

i(pp-hdo/n, Adv.
like a horse, A.Th.328 (lyr.), Supp.431 (lyr.).
like a horseman, Ar.Pax81.

i(pp-hla^si/a, h(, (e)lau/nw)
driving or
riding of horses, Hld. 8.14, Them.Or.15.188a, 18.216d:—Adj. i(pp-hla/sios, a, on,
fit for riding or
driving, i(. o(do/s
chariot-road, Il.7.340.

i(pphla^t-e/w,
ride or
drive, Ar.Av.1443.

i(pphla^/t-hs, ou, o(,
driver of horses, one who fights from a chariot, Hom. (always in Ep. from i(pphla/ta, and only in nom.), as an epith. of honour, Knight, i(. *tudeu/s, ge/rwn i(. *phleu/s, *foi=nic, *oi)neu/s, Il.4.387,7.125,9.432,581; *ne/stwr Od.3.436: generally i(pphla/tai E.Rh.117: as Adj., i(. lew/s, opp. pedostibh/s, A.Pers.126 (lyr.).

i(pph/la^t-os, on,
fit for horsemanship or
driving, nh=sos Od.4.607; gai=a 13.242; o(do\s i(.
chariot-road, Luc.Rh.Pr.3, Poll.9.37; i(. oi)=dma Nonn.D.20.157; qa/lassa Agath.4.29, cf. 5.11; i(. e)/rgon *)aqh/nhs, i.e. the Trojan horse, Tryph.2; to\ di' h(donh=s kaqa/per i(. ti xwri/on Porph.Marc.6.

i(pphmolg-i(a, h(,
milking of mares, Scymn.855 (pl.).

i(pphmolg-oi/, oi, (a)me/lgw)
the Mare-milkers, a Scythian or Tartar tribe, Il.13.5, cf. Str. 7.3.2; *sku/qai i(. Hes.Cat.Oxy.1358Fr.2.15; i(. *kimme/rioi Call.Dian.252.

*(ippia/zw,
ape Hippias, Philostr.VS2.21.3.

i(ppia/nac [a^n], aktos, o(,
king of horsemen, A.Pers.996 (lyr.).
i(ppi/as, ou, o(,= i(ppeu/s 1v, Apul. ap. Lyd.Mens.4.7.

i(ppiatr-o/s (on the accent v. Hdn. Gr.1.229), o(,
veterinary surgeon, farrier, IG9(2).69.5 (ii B.C.), PGen.42.35 (iii A.D.), Hippiatr.12, etc.; cf. i(ppoi+atro/s:—Adj. i(ppiatr-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for farriery: i(ppiatriko/n, to/,
a work on farriery, Suid. s.v. *xei/rwn: -ka/, ta/, title of extant compilation: also -ko/n, to/,
tax on farriers, PHib.1.45.21 (iii B.C.).

i(ppi/dion, to/,
a kind of
fish, Epich.44.

i(ppiko/s, h/, o/n, (i(/ppos)
of a horse or
horses, freq. in Trag., i(. e)k pleumo/nwn A.Th.61; i(. frua/gmata ib.245, cf. S.El.717, 719; o)xh/mata, a)/ntuges, ib.740, Aj.1030; fa/tnai E.Ba.509.
of horsemen or
chariots, a)gw/n Hdt.1.167, And.4.26 (pl.); in i(ppikw=n a)gw/n S.El.698, i(ppikw=n is prob. neut. (v. infr. iv); dro/mos ib.754; naua/gia ib.730; a)=qlon Pl.Lg.949a. = Lat.
equester, ta/cis, a)ci/wma, D.H.12.1, Plu.Pomp.23; of persons,
of equestrian rank, i(. a)/ndres Str.3.4.20, cf. IGRom.3.474 (Lycia, iii A.D.), etc.
of riding or
horsemanship, equestrian, X.HG5.3.20; i(. a)/skhsis training
in horsemanship, IG22.1042.21, al.; i(. h(gh/twr leader
of the knights, ib.3.693;
skilled in riding, opp. a)/fippos, Pl.Prt.350a, al.: Comp., Satyr.1, Phld.Mus.p.6 K.: Sup., Arr.Tact.16.9. h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh),
horsemanship, riding, Ar.Nu.27, etc.; peri\ -kh=s, title of treatise by Xenophon; i(. e)pisth/mh Pl.La.193b; i(. lo/goi X.HG5.3.20; ta\ i(. [pra/gmata] Pl. Alc.1.124e, cf. Thg.126a; h( e)mh\ i(. this
riding of mine, Lys.24.10.
fit for riding, Sup. -w/taton, xrh=ma gunh/ Ar.Lys. 677. to\ i(. the
horse, cavalry, Hdt.7.87, E.Supp.682, X.An. 6.5.29, etc.; ta\ i(. Plb.3.114.5.
course or
space of four stadia, Plu.Sol.23. the
circus at Rome, Tab.Defix.Aud.187.59. Adv. -kw=s
like a horseman: Sup. -kw/tata
with best horsemanship, X. Oec.21.7.

i(/ppios, a, on, (i(/ppos) poet. form of i(/ppeios (q. v.),
of a horse or
horses, lo/foi crests
of horsehair, Alc.15.2; sqe/nos i(/. Pi.P.2.12; *)/argos i(/. (cf. i(ppo/botos) Id.I.7(6).11, B.18.15; dromeu/s, prob. l. in E.El.825; a)/nassai(.
Queen of the Amazons, Id.Hipp.307; epith. of Poseidon as creator of the horse, B.16.99, A.Th.130 (lyr.), Ar.Eq.551, Nu.83, IG 12.310.142, etc.; hence, of Colonos as sacred to him, Arg.S.OC, Paus.1.30.4 (but cf. Pherecr.134); also of Athena, Pi.O.13.82, S.OC 1070 (lyr.), Harp.; of Hera, at Olympia, Paus.5.15.5; of Ares, Id.5.15.6, cf. Tryph.105.
of horsemen or
the horse-race, i(/. no/mos Pi.O.1.101; i(ppi/an e)/sodon Id.P.6.50; a)/eqla AP6.312 (Anyte); sc. a)gw/n SIG1064.8 (Halic., i B.C.). *(/ippios, o( (sc. mh/n), month at Rhegium, IG14.612.

i(ppio-xai/ths, ou, o(,
shaggy with horsehair, lo/fos Il.6.469.

i(ppio-xa/rmhs, ou, o(,
one who fights from a chariot, 24.257, Od.11.259, Hes. Fr.7; later,
horseman, rider, A.Pers.29 (anap.). as Adj., i(. klo/noi the tumult
of the horse-fight, ib.105; cf. i(ppoxa/rmhs.

i(pp-i/skos, o(, Dim. of i(/ppos, name of a play by Alexis, Ath.3.120b.
small statue of a horse, Michel832.41 (Samos, iv B.C.).
an ornament for the head (cf. i(ppeu/s v), Cratin.Jun.5, Hsch.

i(pp-isti/, Adv., = i(pphdo/n,
astride, *)afrodi/th i(. kaqhme/nh e)pi\ *yuxh=s PMag.Par.1.1724.
i(pp-i/tas: i(ppoforbo/s, Hsch.
i(pp-iw/n, w=nos, o( (sc. mh/n), month at Eretria, IG11 (4).1066b21 (found in Delos).

i(ppo-ba/mwn [a_], on, gen. onos, (bai/nw)
going on horseback, equestrian, *)arimaspo\n i(ppoba/mona strato/n A.Pr.805; strato\s i(., of centaurs, S.Tr.1095.
trotting like a horse, or
used for riding, ka/mhloi A.Supp.284 (cj. Turneb.). metaph., r(h/mata i(.
high-paced words,
bombast, fustian, Ar.Ra.821.

i(ppo-ba/ths [a^], ou, o(,
horseman, A.Pers.26 (anap.). i(. i(/ppos or o)/nos,
stallion, Str.8.8.1, Hippiatr.14; cf. i(ppobo/ths.
*(ippo/bi_nos, o(, (bine/w) comic distortion of the pr. n. *(ippo/nikos,= i(ppo/pornos, Ar.Ra.433.

i(ppo-bo/sion, to/,
horses' keep, Theognost.Can.125.

i(ppo-bosko/s, o/n, (bo/skw)
feeding horses, Ael.NA6.10, Suid., Gloss.

i(ppo-bo/ths, ou, o(, (bo/skw)
feeder of horses, *)atreu/s E.Or.1000 (lyr., but prob. -bw/ta), IA1059 (but prob. -ba/tas). i(ppobo/tai, oi(, at Chalcis in Euboea a social class (cf. i(ppeu/s 11), Knights, Hdt.5.77, 6.100; h( i(ppobotw=n politei/a Arist.Fr.603.

i(ppo/-botos, on, (bo/skw)
grazed by horses, Od.4.606, E.Andr.1229 (anap.), IG12.1034, Just.Nov.25.1; h( i(., at Chalcis, Ael.VH6.1 (cf. foreg.); esp. of the plain of Argos, from the rich pastures of Lerna, Il.2.287, al., B.10.80, E.Supp.365 (lyr.).

i(ppo-bouko/los, o(,
horse-herd, horse-keeper, S.Fr.1057, E.Ph. 28.

i(ppo/-brotoi w)di=nes pangs that gave birth
to a horse and man (Pegasus and Chrysaor), Lyc.842.

i(ppo-ge/ra^noi, oi(,
crane-cavalry, Luc.VH1.13.

i(ppo-gnw/mwn, on, gen. onos,
judging well of horses: hence generally,
quick in judging, tinos A.Fr.243, cf. Hsch.

i(ppo/-gu_poi, oi(,
vulture-cavalry, Luc.VH1.13.
i(ppo-da^masth/s, ou=, o(, = i(ppo/damos, Poll. 1.181, Hsch.
i(ppo-da/mnois: e)fi/ppwn, Id.

i(ppo/-da^mos, on, (dama/w)
tamer of horses, Hom., epith. of heroses, Il.2.23, Od.3.17; *trw=es Il.4.352, etc.; *gerhnoi/ Hes.Fr.15; h(/rwes Pi.N.4.29:—fem. *(ippo-da/meia, as pr. n., Hippodamia, Il.2.742, etc.

i(ppo-da/seia [a^], h(, fem. Adj., Ep. epith. of ko/rus and kune/h,
bushy with horsehair, 3.369, Od.22.111, etc.

i(ppo/-desma, wn, ta/,
horse-bands, reins, E.Hipp.1225: Adj. daktu/lioi

i(ppo/desmoi,
snaffle-rings, IG22.1542.25.

i(ppo-de/ths, ou, o(,
binding horses, r(uth/r S.Aj.241 (anap.); epith. of Heracles at Thebes and Onchestos, Paus.9.26.1.

i(ppo-di/nhtos [i_], on,
whirled in chariots, *surako/sioi, B.5.2.

i(ppo-di^w/kths, ou, o(, Dor. i(/ppo-tas, = i(pphla/ths,
driver or
rider of steeds, Theoc.14.12, Hsch.; a kind of gladiator, IGRom.4.1455 (Smyrna).

i(ppo-dromi/a, h(,
horse-race or
chariot-race, Pi.P.4.67, I.3.13, X.Smp.1.2, Pl.Ion537a, Arist.Ath.60.1, IG22.784 (iii B.C.), SIG730.30 (Olbia, i B.C.); i(. a)/gein Ar.Pax900; poiei=n Th.3.104; i(. paidikh/, h(\n kalou=si *troi/an,= Lat.
ludus Troiae, Plu.Cat.Mi.3.

i(ppo-dromiko/s, h/. o/n,
of horse-racing, a)gw/n Sch.Il.23.757.

i(ppo-dro/mios, on,
of
the horse-race: -dro/mios, o( (sc. mh/n), name of month in Boeotia, IG7.531,al. (Tanagra), cf. Plu.Cam.19; at Delphi, GDI1987, al.; at Naupactus, IG9(1).359. epith. of Poseidon (cf. i(/ppios), Pi. I.1.54.

i(ppo/-dromos, o(,
chariot-road, lei=os d' i(. a)mfi/s Il.23.330.
race-course for chariots, Pl.Criti.117c, D.47.53; at Olympia, Paus. 6.20.15; at Delphi, SIG636.24 (ii B.C.); at Andania, IG5(1).1390.31; at Rome, the
circus, D.H.1.79; o( me/gas i(.,=
circus maximus, Id.5.36, Mon.Anc.Gr.10.8: comic metaph., i(. ou(=to/s e)sti/ sou mageirikh=s Posidipp.26.23. i(ppodro/mos, o(,
light horseman, i(. yiloi/ Hdt. 7.158.
i(ppo-zw/nh, h(, acc. -zw/nhn, f.l. for u(po\ zw/nhn, Hippiatr.26; the gloss in Hsch. is missing.

i(ppo/qen, Adv., (i(/ppos)
forth from the horse, of the heroes descending from the Trojan horse, Od.8.515, 11.531.

i(ppo-qh/leia, h(,=
equa, Gloss.

i(ppo-qh/lhs, ou, o(,
ass which has been suckled by a mare, such being kept for the stud, acc. to Arist.HA577b17.

i(ppo/-qoos, on,
swiftriding, Hsch.: in Il. only as pr. n.

i(ppo-qo/ros, o(, (qo/rnumi)
covering mares, esp. of a he-ass kept for breeding mules, Hsch. as Adj., i(. no/mos a tune
played to a mare, while she was being covered, Plu. 2.138b,704f.

i(ppo-qow/nteion, to/,
sanctuary of Hippothoon, Hsch.

i(ppo-qu^te/w,
sacrifice horses, tw=| *(hli/w| Str. 11.8.6.
i(ppo-i/atros, = i(ppiatro/s, Hippiatr.27, CIG1953 (Maced.), POxy.92 (iv A.D.).

i(ppo-ka/mpion, to/, Dim. of i(ppo/kampos, Epich.115. a kind of
ear-ring, Poll.5.97.

i(ppo/-kampos, o(,
monster with horse's body and fish's tail, on which the sea-gods rode, Men.831; e(sth/kei *poseidw=n xa/lkeos, e)/xwn i(. e)n th=| xeiri/ Str.8.7.2, cf. Philostr.Im.1.8. a small fish,
the sea-horse, Dsc.2.3, Ael.NA14.20, Gal.12.362.
i(ppo/-kamptos: strouqi/on ti, Hsch.

i(ppo-ka/nqa^ros, o(,
horse-beetle, Com. word in Ar.Pax181.

i(ppo-kentau/reios, a, on,
of a centaur, S.E.M.9.125.

i(ppo-ke/ntauros, o(,
horse-centaur, half-horse half-man, Pl.Phdr.229d, X.Cyr.4.3.17: also as fem., qh/leian i(. e)poi/hsen Luc.Zeux.3.

i(ppo-ke/ntwr, oros,
stinging horses, Tz.H.9 No.290tit.

i(ppo-klei/dhs, ou, o(, (klei/w)
pudenda muliebria, Ar.Fr.703.

i(ppo-koina/rion, to/,
stable, Raccolta Lumbroso 374.

i(ppo-kome/w,
groom horses, i(. ka/nqaron
groom his beetle, Ar.Pax74.

i(ppo-ko/mos, o(, (kome/w)
groom, esquire, who attended the i(ppeu/s
in war, Hdt.3.85,88, X.HG2.4.6: generally,
groom, Pl.Plt.261d, PSI4.371.13 (iii B.C.), Plb.13.8.3, etc.; i(. tw=n kamh/lwn Philostr.VA2.1. Adj. i(ppo/-komos, on, (ko/mh)
decked with horsehair, epith. of a helmet (not in Od.), ko/rus Il.13.132, cf. S.Ant. 116 (anap.); ph/lhc Il.16.797; trufa/leia 13.339.
i(ppo-ko/ru^qos, on, coined as compd. of i(/ppos and ko/rus, Porph. ad Il.2.1 (v.l. i(ppo-ko/ruqes as nom. pl.).

i(ppo-korusth/s, ou=, o(,
marshaller, arranger of chariots, a)ne/res i(ppokorustai/ Il.2.1, 24.677; epith. of the Paeonians, 16.287, 21.205.

i(ppo-ko/smia, ta/,
horse-trappings, Hsch. s.v. fa/lara, Charis. p.549K., Gloss.

i(ppo-kou/rios, o(,
tender of horses, epith. of Poseidon at Sparta, Paus.3.14.2.
i(ppo-kra/teios, a, on, Hippocratic, didaskali/a Gal.6.753, cf. 15.147; a)poli/nwsis Paul.Aeg.6.78. Adv. -ws Gal. UP8.3.

i(ppo-kra^te/w,
to be superior in horse, D.19.148, Plb.3.66.2, Onos.31.1:—Pass.,
to be in ferior in horse, Th.6.71.

i(ppo-kra^ti/a, h(,
victory in a cavalry action, X.Cyr.1.4.24.
i(ppo-kra/twr [a^], oros, o(, the constellation Centaurus, Teucerin Boll Sphaera 20.

i(ppo/-krhmnos, on,
tremendously steep, i(. r(h=ma
a neck-breaking word, Ar.Ra. 929.
i(ppo-krh/nh, h(,= *(/ippou krh/nh, the spring of Pegasus on Helicon, v.l. in Str.9.2.25.

i(ppo/-krotos, on,
sounding with the tramp of horses, o(do/s Pi.P.5.92; gumna/sia E.Hipp.229 (anap.); i(. da/peda gumna/sia/ te Id.Hel.207 (lyr.), cf. AP12.131 (Posidipp.): in late Prose, Chor.Lyd.17.

i(ppo-ku/wn [u^], -ku^nos, h(,
half-mare half-bitch, epith. of the moon-goddess, PMag.Par.1.2614.

i(ppo-la/pa^qon [la^], to/,
Rumex aquaticus, dock-sorrel, Dsc.2.115, Gal.12.56.

i(ppo-leixh/n, h=nos, o(, a sort of
moss used in farriery, Sch.Nic.Th.945.

i(ppole/tas, ou, o(, (o)/llumi)
destroyer of horses, Hdn.Epim.211.

i(ppo-lexh/s, e/s,
having given birth to a horse, *dhw/ Orac. ap. Paus.8.42.6.
i(ppo-lh/ptras: ta\s trixi/nous seira\s *pa/rqui ou(/tw kalou=sin, Hsch. (-lhmpra cod., fort. -lh/mptras).
i(ppo-lou/stras: e)/nqa tou\s i(/ppous a)pe/nizon, Id.

i(ppo-lofi/a, h(,
horse's mane, Iamb. post Polem.p.50 Hinck.

i(ppo/-lofos, on,
with horsehair crest, ko/rus IG12(2).129 (Mytilene); i(. lo/goi, by comic metaph., Ar.Ra.818.

i(ppo/-lu^tos, on,
letting horses loose, dub. l. in APl.4.44 (fort. i(ppela/ths).

i(ppo-ma^ne/w,
to be a-horsing, of mares, Arist.HA572a10.

i(ppo-ma^nh/s, e/s,
abounding in, swarming with horses (cf. karpo-, u(lo-, fullo-manh/s）, leimw/n S.Aj.143 (anap.); variously expld. by Sch. as Subst., i(ppomane/s, e/os, to/, an Arcadian plant,
thorn-apple, Datura stramonium, of which horses are madly fond, or
which makes them mad, Theoc.2.48; f.l. for -fae/s in Thphr.HP9.15.6. = ka/pparis, Dsc.2.173; = a)po/kunon, Ps.-Dsc.4.80.
small black fleshy substance on the forehead of a new-born foal, which, if procured before it was eaten off by the dam, was held to be a powerful fi/ltron, Arist.HA577a9, 605a2, Thphr.Fr.175, Ael.NA3.17, 14.18.
mucous humour that runs from mares a-horsing, used for like purposes, Arist.HA572a21, Paus.5.27.3.

i(ppo-ma^ni/a, h(,
mad love for horses. Luc.Nigr.29.

i(ppo-ma/ra^qon [ma^], to/,
horse-fennel, Prangos ferulacea, Diocl.Fr.155, Thphr. HP6.1.4, Dsc.3.71, Zopyr. ap. Orib.14.64.1, etc.: sts. misspelt -ma/raqron in codd.

i(ppoma^x-e/w,
fight on horseback, Th.4.124, X.Cyr.6.4.18; i(. pro\s o(pli/tas
to fight, cavalry against infantry, Id.Ages.2.3.

i(ppoma^x-i/a, h(,
horse-fight, action of cavalry, Th.2.22, 4.72, Pl.La.193b, etc.

i(ppoma^x-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of a horse-fight, ni/kh St.Byz. s.v. *)ala/banda.

i(ppo/ma^x-os, on (parox.,
Hdn.Gr.1.230),
fighting on horseback, trooper, Il.10.431 (v.l. -damoi), Simon.107.8 (= IG7.53), Luc.Macr.17, IG9(1).871(Corc., iii/ii B.C.).

*(ippo-me/dwn, ontos, o(,
horse-ruler, as a pr. n., A., etc. [In Th.488, with the 2nd syll. long, metri gr.]

*(ippo/-mhtis, o(, h(,
skilled in horses or
in riding, Pi.I.7(6).12.

*(ippo-mi^gh/s, e/s,
partly a horse, half-horse half-man, Ael.VH9.16.
*(ippo-molgi/a, *(ippo-molgo/s, ff.ll. for i(pph-.

*(ippo/-morfos, on,
horse-shaped, horse-like, Pl.Phdr.253c.

*(ippo-mu/rmhc, hkos, o(,
horse-ant, dub. in Arist.HA606a5. pl.,
ant-cavalry, Luc.VH 1.12.

*(ippo/-ni_kos, on,
victorious in the chariot-race, Gloss., prob. l. in B.13.22: freq.as pr. n.

*(ippo-nomeu/s, e/ws, o(,
horse-keeper, Gloss.

*(ippo-no/mos, on,
keeping horses, Poll.1.181. i(ppo/noma, ta/, prob.
horsehire, Hsch.

*(ippo-nw/mas, ou, o(,
guiding or
keeping horses, S.Aj.232 (lyr., Pors. for i(ppono/mous), E.Hipp.1399, Ar.Nu.571 (lyr.).

i(ppo/omai, Pass.,
have the concept or
idea of a horse, opp. its real existence, Plu.2.112od,1121a; cf. a)nqrwpo/omai.

i(ppo-pa/rh|os [a^], on,
with large cheeks, Apollon.Lex. s.v. i(ppo/boton.

i(ppo-pe/dh, h(,
horse-fetter, Hippiatr.106. a name given by Eudoxus to a
figure-of-eight curve described by a planet, Simp.in Cael.497.3, Procl.in Euc.pp.127,128F.

i(ppo-ph=rai, w=n, ai(,
saddlebags, Sen.Ep.87.7.

i(ppo/-podes, oi(,
horse-hoofed men, name of a fabulous tribe in Sarmatia, D.P.310.

i(ppo-po/los, on,
herding horses, of the Thracians, Il.13.4, 14.227. (Cf. ai)-po/los, bou-ko/los.)
i(/ppopor, prob. corrupt for i(/ppor, Lacon. for i(/ppos, Hsch.: i(ppo/pori: koila/s, au)lh/, dw=ma, Id.

i(ppo/-pornos, o(, h(,
excessive prostitute, Ath.13.565c, Alciphr.1.38, al.; cf. i(/ppos v11; also,
one on horseback, Diog. ap. Eust.1909.63.

i(ppo-po/ta^mos, o(,
hippopotamus, Dsc.2.23, Gal.14.241, Dam. Isid.98:—also i(ppo-pota/mis (for -pota/mios), o(, POxy.1220.21 (iii A.D.).

i(ppo-pro/swpos, on,
horse-faced, epith. of the Moon-goddess, PMag.Par.1.2549; of a fabulous tribe, Peripl.M.Rubr.62.

i(/ppos, o(,
horse, h(,
mare, most freq. fem. in Poets; in full qh/lees i(/ppoi Il.5.269; i(/ppoi qh/leiai 11.680, Od.4.635; a)/rsenes i(/ppoi 13.81, cf. Hdt.3.86, Pl.Hp.Ma.288b: pl., i(/ppoi
team of chariot-horses, Il.16.370, al.: freq. in dual, 5.237, 8.41, al.: hence, of
the chariot itself, a)f' i(/ppoiin, a)f' i(/ppwn, from
the chariot, Il.5.13,19,al.; kaq' i(/ppwn a)=lto, e)c i(/ppwn bh=se, ib.111,163; i(/ppwn e)pibhso/menos intending to mount
his chariot, ib.46; opp. pezoi/, plh=to de\ pa=n pedi/on pezw=n te kai\ i(/ppwn Od.14.267, cf. 9.49; i(/ppoi te kai\ a)ne/res Il.2.554; lao/s te kai\ i(/ppoi 18.153; of riders, nw=q' i(/ppwn e)piba/ntes e)qu/neon Hes.Sc.286; freq. of race-horses, i(/. a)kamanto/podes Pi.O.3.4; a)ello/podes Simon.7; a)qlhtai/ Lys.19.63: metaph., a(lo\s i(/., of ships, Od.4.708, cf. Secund. Sent.17. the constellation Pegasus, Eudox. ap. Hipparch.1.2.12, Ptol.Tetr.27, Vett.Val.12.11. title of Hecate in the Mithraic cult, Porph.Abst.4.16. perh. an instrument of torture, Lat.
eculeus, Plu.Luc.20(pl.). as Collective Noun, i(/ppos, h(,
horse, cavalry, h( tw=n *qessalw=n i(/. Hdt.5.64, etc.: always in sg., even with numerals, i(/. xili/h a thousand
horse, Id.7.41; muri/h ibid.; muri/a, trismuri/a, A.Pers.302,315; h( diakosi/a i(/. Th.1.62; i(/ppon e)/xw ei)s xili/an X.Cyr.4.6.2.
a sea-fish, Antim. et Numen. ap. Ath. 7.304e; but o( i(/. o( pota/mios
the hippopotamus, Hdt.2.71, Arist.HA 502a9; o( i(/. tou= *nei/lou Ach.Tat.4.2.
lewd woman, Ael.NA 4.11.
pudenda muliebria et virilia, Hsch.
a complaint of the eyes, such that they are always winking, Gal.16.611,al. (also in Hp., acc. to [Gal.]19.436). title of ministrants ('chuckersout') in certain religious ceremonies, IG22.1368.144 (Athens, ii A.D.), 3.1280a. in compds., to express
anything large or
coarse, as in our
horse-chestnut, horse-laugh, v. i(ppo/-krhmnos, -la/paqon, -ma/raqon, -pornos, -se/linon, -tufi/a, and cf. bou-. (From i)/kvos, v. i)/kkos; cf. Skt.
aśvas, Lat.
equus: the i)/- (in place of
e-) and the aspirate are unexplained; the latter acc. to Gell.2.3.2 was confined to Attic; cf. *leu/k-ippos, *glau/k-ippos.)

i(ppo-sei/rhs, ou, o(,
one who leads a horse by the rein, Anacr.75.6.

i(ppo-se/li_non, to/,
Alexanders, Smyrnium olus-atrum, Thphr. HP2.2.1, Arist.Pr.923a34, Dsc.3.67: metaph., gela=n i(ppose/lina Pherecr.131.4.

i(ppo-skelh/s, e/s,
with horse's legs, a)/nqrwpos Gal. UP3.1.

i(ppo-sko/pos, o(,
inspector of horses, PPetr.3pp.157,158(iii B.C.).

i(ppo-so/as, ou, o(, (seu/w)
driving horses, a)/ndres Pi.P.2.65; *)io/laos Id.I.5(4).32:—fem. i(pposo/a, epith. of Artemis, Id.O.3.26 (as Subst., Pae.9.7):—also i(pposso/os, on, Nonn.D.37.320.
i(ppo-sta/sion [a^], to/,= sq., Lys.Fr.56S.: pl., App.Pun.95, Mith.84:—also i(ppo-sta^si/a, h(, Hippiatr.29.

i(ppo/-sta^sis, ews, h(,
stable, Plb.13.8.3, Ph. 2.307 (pl.), Poll.1.184, Anon.Oxy.1368.46: metaph., *)aeli/ou knefai/a i(ppo/stasis the dark
stable of the Sun, i.e. the West, E.Alc.594 (lyr.); but *(/ew faenna\s *(hli/ou q' i(pposta/seis, of the East, Id.Fr.771.5.

i(pposu/nh, h(, (i(/ppos)
the art of driving the war-chariot: generally,
driving, horsemanship, i(pposu/nh| . . pepoiqw/s Il.4.303, cf. 11.503; e)/coxoi i(pposu/na| Simon.108 ( = IG12.946): in pl., lelasme/nos i(pposuna/wn Il.16.776, Od.24.40; i(pposu/nas e)di/dacan Il.23.307. = i(/ppos 11,
horse, cavalry, Orac. ap. Hdt.7.141.
i(ppo/su^nos, h, on,= i(ppiko/s, *dardani/a E.Or.1392 (lyr.); unless i(pposu/na is Dor. gen. from nom. i(pposu/nhs, o(, cf. Sch., or i(pposu/na| be read.
i(ppo/ta^, o(, Ep. form of i(ppo/ths.
i(ppo-taktika/: i(/ppwn ta/ceis misqofo/rwn, Hsch.

i(ppo/-tauros, o(,
horse-bull, Hld.10.29.

i(ppo-te/ktwn, onos, o(,
maker of the Trojan horse, Lyc.930.

i(ppo/ths (A), ou, o(,
driver or
rider of horses, horseman, knight, Hdt. 7.55,9.49,69; in Hom. always in Ep. nom. i(ppo/ta^, as *gerh/nios i(ppo/ta *ne/stwr Il.2.336, etc.; i(ppo/ths *kolwno/s S.OC59; i(ppo/ths
on
horseback, Luc.Tox.47; toi\ i(ppo/th, Boeot. for oi( i(ppei=s, IG7.3087 (Lebad.), cf. Ascl.Tact.10.2. Adj., i(ppo/tai laoi/ Pi.P.4.153; i(. lew/s
the horse, A.Th.80 (lyr.); lew\n a)/nippon i(. te S.OC899; i(. o)/xlos E.Supp.660; strato/s Plu.Aem.9.—Never used in correct Att. Prose.

i(ppo/ths (B), htos, h(,
horse-nature, the concept of horse, Antisth. et Pl. ap. Simp.in Cat.208.30,32, Sch.AristId.p.167F.

i(ppo/-tigris, idos, o(,
a large kind of
tiger, D.C.77.6; cf. i(/ppos v11.

i(ppo/-ti_los, o(, (tila/w)
diarrhoea of horses, Hippiatr.56.
i(ppo/tis, idos, fem. of i(ppo/ths, Tryph.670, Nonn.D.1.172.

i(ppo-to/kos, on,
horse-bearing, of Medusa, Nonn.D.47.693.

i(ppo-tocei/a, h(,
the art of the i(ppotoco/ths, Tz.H.6.996,998.

i(ppo-toco/ths, ou, o(,
mounted bowman horse-archer, Hdt.9.49,4.46; employed as police at Athens, Th.2.13,Lys.15.6: Com., i(e/rakas i(. Ar.Av.1179.

i(ppo-tra^ge/la^fos, o(,
horse-goat-stag, a fabulous monster: used of a
cup made to represent it, Philem.87.

i(ppotrof-ei=on, to/,
place for horse-breeding, stud-stable, Str.5.1.4, 16.2.10 (-tro/fion).

i(ppotrof-e/w, aor. -tro/fhsa Paus.3.8.1: pf. -tro/fhka D.L.8.51, (kaq-) Is.5.43; but i(ppotetro/fhka Lycurg.139 codd.:—
breed or
keep horses, Lycurg. l.c., Isoc.16.33, Hyp.Lyc.16, Satyr.1; i(ppotrofou=sa po/lis Aen.Tact.26.4;
feed horses, poa=| xlwra=| Dsc.4.15 (v.l. po/an xlwra/n).

i(ppotrof-i/a, h(,
breeding or
keeping of horses, esp. for racing, i(. ga\r ou) *zaku/nqw| . . o)padei= Simon.15: freq. in pl., i(ppot rofi/as nomi/zein Pi.I.2.38, cf. X.Oec.2.6, Pl.Ly.205c, Arist.Pol.1289b35, Anon.Oxy.664.27: sg., Th.6.12, Plu.Ages.20. as a liturgy, a)telh\s e)/stai . . -i/as SIG1003.26(Priene, ii B.C.).

i(ppotrof-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for horse-keeping: -ko/n, to/,
allowance made to i(ppotro/foi, PTheb.Bank6.8 (ii B.C.).

i(ppo/trof-os, on, (parox.)
horse-feeding, abounding in horses, of Thrace, Hes.Op.507; of Argos, Pi.N.10.41; po/lis B.10.114. of persons,
breeding and keeping race-horses, Pi.I. 4(3).32, etc.; me/gas kai\ lampro\s i(. D.18.320, cf. Plu.Them.5, Paus. 6.2.1. generally,
horsebreeder, POxy.2110.6(iv A.D.), Hippiatr. 34.

i(ppotu_fi/a, h(, (tu=fos)
horse-pride, i.e.
excessive pride or
conceit, Luc.Hist.Conscr.45, Pl. ap. D.L.3.39.

i(ppou/r-aion, to/,= i(/ppouros,
horse-tail, Arat.438.
i(ppour-eu/s, e/ws, o(, = i(/ppouros, Hices. ap. Ath.7.304c.

i(/ppour-is, idos, h(, (ou)ra/) as fem. Adj.,
horse-tailed, decked with a horse-tail, freq. in Hom. (esp. Il.), in nom. and acc. i(/ppouris, -in, ko/rus Il.6.495; trufa/leia 19.382; kune/h Od. 22.124. as Subst.,
horse-tail, Ael.NA16.21;
Satyr's tail, Phryn.PSp.77B. a water-plant,
horse-tail, Equisetum silvaticum, Dsc.4.46, Ps.-Democr.inGp.2.6.27; also,=
Equisetum maximum, Dsc.4.47.
a complaint in the groin, caused by constant riding, dub. in Hp.Epid.7.122.

i(/ppour-os, on, (ou)ra/)
horse-tailed: as Subst., a sea-fish,
Coryphaena hippurus, Epich.51, Arist.HA 543a23, Numen. ap. Ath.7.304d, Opp.H.1.184.
a kind of
insect, Ael.NA15.1. = i(/ppouris 11.2, Hippiatr.27.

i(ppofa/goi [a^], oi(,
horse-eaters, name of a Scythian tribe, Ptol. Geog.5.9.

i(ppofa^e/s, e/os, to/, a kind of
spurge, Euphorbia spinosa, used for carding cloth, Asclep. ap. Gal.Nat.Fac.1.13, Dsc.4.159 (also i(ppo/faos ibid., i(ppofanh/s Ps.-Dsc.ibid.). = sq., Ps.-Dsc.4.160; = i(ppo/fews, Gal.19.106; as a drug, Thphr.HP9.15.6.

i(ppo/faiston, to/, a plant,
Centaurea spinosa, Dsc.4.160, Plin.HN 27.92, Ruf. ap. Orib.7.26.37.

i(ppo/-fews, ew, o(,
spurge, Euphorbia acanthothamnos, gen. -few (v.l. -fae/ws, -fe/ws) Hp.Int.13,25,26; nom. -fews Thphr.HP6.5.2. = e)pi/qumon, Plin.HN26.55, Gloss.

i(ppo/-flomos, o(,
giant flo/mos, i.e.
belladonna, Atropa belladonna, Plin.HN25.148.

i(ppo-foba/s, a/dos, h(,
horse-fear, a fabulous plant, Ps.-Democr. ap. Plin.HN24.161.
i(ppoforb-eu/s, e/ws, o(,= i(ppoforbo/s, Poll.7.185:—fem. i(ppoforb-a/s, a/dos, Sch.Luc.Ind.5:

i(ppoforb-e/w,=
keep horses, Choerob.in Theod.2lxxxv.

i(ppoforb-i/a, h(,
horse-keeping, Pl.Plt.299d.

i(ppofo/rb-ion, to/,
herd of horses, Hdt.4.110, X.HG4.6.6, Arist.HA576a20. = i(ppotrofei=on, E.El.623, Arist.HA576a25, Ph.2.307.

i(ppoforb-o/s, o/n, (fe/rbw)
horse-keeper, Pl.Plt. 261d, Arist.HA577a15, Jul.Or.7.227c: as Adj., i(. gh= D.H.1.37. au)lo\s i(. a flute
used by i(ppoforboi/, made of laurel bark, Poll.4.74.
i(ppo-xa/rmhs, ou, o(,= i(ppioxa/rmhs, Pi.O.1.23, Pae.2.104.
i(ppo/-xqwn, onos, dub. sens., Tab.Defix.Aud.38.29 (Alexandria, iii A.D.).

i(pp-w/dhs, es,
horse-like, X.Eq.1.11 (Comp.), Poll.1.192; kefalh/ Hippiatr.14.

i(pp-w/khs, es,
riding in a swift chariot, a)e/lios B.10.101.

i(pp-w/n, w=nos, o(,
place for horses:
stable, IG12.336 (pl.), X.Eq.4.2, Moschio ap.Ath.5.207f, PCair.Zen.193.5 (iii B.C.).
posting-house, station, X.Cyr.8.6.17, Supp.Epigr.2.481 (Scythia, iii A.D.).

i(pp-wne/w, (w)ne/omai)
buy horses, X.Eq.Mag.1.14,Eq.11.13.

i(pp-wni/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
buying of horses, Id.Eq.Mag.1.12 (with v.l. i(ppwnei/a, which is found in codd. of Eq.1.1,3.1), Poll.1.182.
tax on sale of horses, SIG4 (Cyzicus, vi B.C.).
i(/ptamai, -pe/tomai, Mosch.3.43, Babr.65.4, Jul.Or.2.72a, etc.; censured by Luc.Sol.7,Lex.25.

*i)/ptomai, fut. i)/yomai: aor. 1 i)ya/mhn:—
press hard, oppress, me/ga d' i)/yao lao\n *)axaiw=n Il.1.454, 16.237; ta/xa d' i)/yetai ui(=as *)axaiw=n 2.193: generally,
hurt, harm, su\ to/nde mhro\n i)/yw; Theoc.Adon.19, cf. Str. 8.6.7:—Act., i)/ptw, = bla/ptw, only in EM481.3; i)=yai, i)/yas, Hsch. (Perh. related to i)a/ptw (B) or to i)=pos.)
i)pu/a, h(,= sipu/a, Hsch. (prob. i(pu/a).
i(/pfarmos: a)rxh/ tis, Hsch. (prob. = i(pparmosth/s).

i)/p-wsis [i_], ews, h(, （i)po/w)
pressing hard, squeezing, esp. in reducing
dislocations, Hp.Art.47, Heliod. ap. Orib.49.27.5 and 32.7.

i)p-wth/rion, to/,
olive- or
wine-press, i). lhnou=, Gloss.; o(/lmoi kai\ i). PRev.Laws 49.13, cf. 51.2 (iii B.C.). in surgery,
bougie, Heliod. ap. Orib. 50.9.7, Antyll. ap. eund.44.23.61, Meges ap.eund.44.24.9. name of a plaster, Heracl.Tarent. ap. Gal.13.725, Orib.Fr.52.

i)p-wtri/s, i/dos, h(,
for pressing in dislocated joints, spa/qh Heliod. ap. Orib.49.32.4 and 17.9.
i)=rai, w=n, ai<*>, v.l. for ei)=rai, Il.18.531; v. ei)/rh.
i)ra/na, v. ei)rh/nh. i)ra/nqemon, to/,= h)ra/nqemon, Hippiatr.44.
i(ra/omai, Ion. for i(era/omai. i(re/a, i(re/h, i(rei/a, i(rhi+/h, v. i(e/reia. i)/reros, v.l. for ei)/reros. i(reu/s, i(reu/w, i(rh/i+on, Ion. and Ep. for i(er-.
i)rh/n, e/nos, o(, Ion. for ei)rh/n, prob. in Hdt.9.85.
