i)/rhc, hkos, o(, Ion. and Ep. for i(e/rac.

i(rh/teira, h(, (i(era/omai)
priestess, Hsch.

i)ri/zw [i_],
to be iridescent, PHolm.7.6.
i)rika/n: i(/ppos oi)nwpo\s xrw/mati, Hsch.
i)ri/neos [i_ri^n], a, on,= i)/rinos, Nic.Al.203,241.

i)ri^no/miktos [i_], on,
mixed with iris-oil, Philox.2.40.

i)/ri^nos [i_], h, on,
made from the iris, mu/ron Pl.Com.69.7, Cephisod. 3.2, Alex.62.8, Thphr.HP9.9.2, Plb.30.26.2.

i)rioeidh/s [i_r], e/s,
rainbow-like, Luc.Hist.Conscr.19, Olymp.in Mete.230.21, al.

*)=iris, idos, h(, acc. *)=irin, voc. *)=iri:—Iris, the messenger of the gods among themselves, Il.8.398 (never in Od.), Hes.Th.780, etc. (Perh. fr. *vi=ris, cf. w)ke/a *)=iris Il.2.786, al., Hes. l.c.; w)=ka de\ *)=iris Il.23.198 (Pap.); possibly also fr. **)evi=ris: *ei)=ris is the name of a ship, IG22.1611c137 (iv B.C.), but i)=ris is written in Michel832 (Samos, iv B.C.): allegorized as proforiko\s lo/gos and derived from ei)/rw by Stoic.2.43.) as Appellat., i)=ris, h(, gen. i)/ridos Thphr.CP6.11.13, also ews Androm. ap. Gal.14.43, POxy.1088.34 (i A.D.), Gp.6.8.1; acc. i)=rin Michel l.c., Plu.2.664e, i)/rida Nic.Al.406; Ep. dat. pl. i)/rissin (v. infr.):—
rainbow, dra/kontes . . , i)/rissin e)oiko/tes, a(/s te *kroni/wn e)n ne/fei+ sth/rice, te/ras mero/pwn a)nqrw/pwn Il.11.27, cf.Arist.Mete.375a1, Epicur. Ep.2p.51U. any
bright-coloured circle surrounding another body, as
the lunar
rainbow, Arist.Mete.375a18;
halo of candle, Thphr.Sign.13; round the eyes of a peacock's tail, Luc.Dom.11;
the iris of the eye, Ruf.Onom.24, [Gal.] 14.702; also,
section through the ciliary region, Gal.UP10.2.
iridescent garment, Michell.c. various species of the botanical genus
iris, e.g.
the purple Iris, I. germanica or
pallida, eu)a/nqemon i)=rin AP4.1.9 (Mel.); to\ a)/nqos polla\s e)/xei e)n au(tw=| poikili/as Arist.Col.796b26, cf. Plin.HN21.40; also,
the white variety of it, I. florentina, from the rhizome of which
the orris-root of commerce is made, Thphr.HP1.7.2, CP6.11.13, etc.; i)=ris *)illurikh/ Dsc.1.1, cf. Plin.HN13.14: in this sense some wrote it oxyt. i)ri/s, i/dos, Eust.391.33, Sch.Nic.l.c. a precious stone, Plin.HN 37.136.

i)riw/dhs, es,
like the rainbow, Arist.Mete.374a28.

i)rmofo/ros, o(, perh.
sack-bearer, Schwyzer 230 (vi B.C.).
i(ro-, Ion. and Ep. contr. for i(ero-.
i(rodro/mos, o(, poet. for i(erodr- (q.v.).
i(ro/n, to/, Ion. for i(ero/n: i(rorgi/h, v. i(erourgi/a.

i(ropo/los, o(, h(,
priest or
priestess, IG3.736, 5(2).461 (Megalop.).
i(ro/s, Ion. and Ep. for i(ero/s, but also in Att. Poets, v. i(ero/s sub fin.: i)=ros, Aeol. for i(ero/s.

*)=iros, o(, Irus, a name given by the suitors to the Ithacan beggar Arnaeus because he carried messages (cf. *)=iris), Od.18.5 sq.: hence, later as Appellat.,
an Irus, i.e.
a beggar, Lib.Or.18.140: pl., *)=iroi Luc.Nav.24.
i(ro-fa/nths, o(, Ion. for i(erof-.

i(ro/-xqwn, o(, h(, gen. onos,
of sacred earth, bw=los IG14.1389ii 27.

i)rw/n, w=nos, o(, perh.=
region, dub. word in Inscr.Cypr.135.8,31 H. (where
toironi may be toi= oi)rw=ni; v. oi)rw/n).

i(rwsti/, Ion. for i(erwsti/,
in sacred fashion, Anacr.149.

i(rwsu/nh, h(, Ion. for i(erwsu/nh,
priesthood, v.l. in Hdt.4.161.

i)/s (A) [i_], h(, gen. i)no/s, acc. i)=na, nom.pl. i)=nes, dat. i)/nesi Il.23.191, also i)si/n Sor. (v. infr.), Suid. s.v. i)=nes, cj. Nauck for ei)si/n in A.Fr.229:—
sinew, tendon, sg. once in Hom., w(s d' o(/t' a)\n . . a)nh\r . . i)=na ta/mh| dia\ pa=san Il.17.522: usu. in pl.,
sinews, ou) ga\r e)/ti sa/rkas te kai\ o)ste/a i)\nes e)/xousin Od.11.219, cf. Il.23.191; i)=nes a)/rqrwn Ar.Pax86, cf. Archil.138; i)=nes au)to\ mo/non kai\ lepth\ dora/, of a person wasted by disease, Ph.2.432; dora/s, sa/rkas, i)=nas ib.527: metaph., *trwi/as i)=nas e)ktamw\n dori/ Pi.I.8(7).57. later,
the fibrous vessels in the muscles, Pl.Ti.84a, Arist.HA515b27, al.; in blood,
fibrine, Id.PA650b14, cf. Pl.Ti.82c, Meno Iatr.17.34: metaph., of metals, Plu.2.434b.
rib in the leaves of plants, Thphr.HP3.12.7 (sg.).
strip of papyrus, tai=s tw=n xartw=n i)si/n Sor.1.13: sg., Gal.10.1000. lepth\ i)/s a small
fibre of papyrus, Id.17(1).795.

i)/s (B) [i_], h(, three times in acc. sg. i)=na (elided i)=n') Il.5.245,7.269, Od.9.538, freq. in instr. i)=fi (q.v.), elsewh. only nom. sg.:—
strength, force, of persons, a)ll' a)/ra kai\ i)\s e)sqlh/ Il.12.320; e)pe/reise de\ i)=n' a)pe/leqron 7.269; h)/ moi e)/t' e)sti\n i)/s, oi(/h pa/ros . . Od.21.283, cf. 11.393, 18.3: freq. in periphr., i(erh\ i)\s *thlema/xoio the
strong Telemachus, 2.409; kraterh\ i)\s *)odush=os Il.23.720; i)\s *(hraklh=os Hes.Th.951; and in twofold periphr., i)\s bi/hs *(hraklhei/hs ib.332; also of things, i)\s a)ne/mou or a)ne/moio, Il.15.383, 17.739, Od.9.71; i)\s potamoi=o Il.21.356; kra/tai' i)/s was read by Ptol.Asc.in Od.11.597; v. kratu/s. (vi_-, cf. gi/s: i)sxu/s, Hsch., pr. n. vifia/das IG7.3172.70, Lat.
vis, vim; prob. cogn. with i(/emai but not with i)/s (A).)

i)s-a/ggelos, on,
like an angel, Ev.Luc.20.36, Hierocl.in CA4p.425M.

i)s-a/delfos [a^], on,
like a brother, of Pylades, E.Or.1015 (anap.); eu)/noia IPE12.359.

i)s-a/zw:—Pass., fut. i)sasqh/somai Arist.EE 1243b31: aor. 1 i)sa/sqhn Id.EN1133a14: pf. i)/sasmai ib.b5: (i)/sos):—
make equal, balance, of a person holding scales, staqmo\n . . kai\ ei)/rion . . a)ne/lkei i)sa/zous' Il.12.435; i). ta\s kth/seis
to equalize them, Arist.Pol. 1265a38; i). to\ a)/nison Id.EN1132a7; th\n fili/an ib.1163b33:—Med.,
make oneself equal to another, ou(/nek' a)/ra *lhtoi= i)sa/sketo (sc. *nio/bh) Il. 24.607:—Pass.,
to be made or
to be equal, qeoi=s Pl.Ti.41c: abs., Arist. EN1133a14, al.; mh/kei podo\s i)/xnos i)sa/zetai Nic.Th.286; di/stixa yh/foisin i)sa/zetai AP9.356 (Leon.). intr. in Act.,
to be equal, Pl.Lg.773a, Arist.EN1154b24; a)llh/lois Id.Pol.1304a39.
to be even, normal, Hp.Morb.4.49. [i_ in Hom.; i^ in Nic.Th.286, 886.]

i)s-aqa/na^tos [a_qa^], on,
equal to the Immortals, karpo/s Arist. Fr.675.7 as quoted by Did.in D.（6.37).

i)s-ai=os [i_], a, on, late poet. form of i)/sos, Nic.Th.360:—h( i)sai/a (sc. moi=ra),
equality, e)p' i)sai/h| Call.Jov.63, cf. Philostr.Jun.Im. 3; ta\ i)sai=a （i)sea lapis)
an equal share, SIG57.10 (Milet., v B.C.).
i)sai/teros, i)sai/tatos, v. i)/sos.

i)sa/ki^s [i^sa^], Adv. from i)/sos,
the same number of times, as many times, Str.3.5.8; i). pollapla/sios c. gen.,
the same multiple of . . , Euc.7 Def.21, al.; i). pollapla/sia
equimultiples, Id.5Def.5, al.; i). i)/sos, of a number,
equal multiplied by equal, i.e.
square, Pl.R.546c, Tht. 147e, 148a, Euc.7 Def.19, Ph.1.11, etc.; i). i)/sos i).
equal multiplied by equal multiplied by equal, i.e.
cube number, Euc.7 Def.20, etc.

i)sa/ktios, on,
ranking with the Actian games, CIG4472.11 (Laodicea ad Mare).

i)sa_me/rios, ou, Dor. for i)shme/rios,
lasting an equal time, fu/llois ai)gei/rou S.Fr.593.2.

i)/sa_mi, v. *ei)/dw (B), and add: i)/sa_mi Theoc.5.119; i)/sais (2sg.) Id.14.34; i)/sa_ti Id.15.146; i)/sa^te Periand. ap. D.L.1.99; i)/santi Theoc. 15.64; inf. gisa/menai (i.e. vis-）: ei)de/nai, Hsch.; Arc. i)sa/men （ismen lapis), IG5(2).357.12; 3pl. subj. i)/santi Schwyzer 190 (Cretan).

i)s-a/millos [a^], on,
equal in the race: neut. pl. as Adv., i)sa/milla dramei=n tini AP9.311 (Phil.).
i)s-a/mmoros: du/smoros, Hsch. (leg. ka/mmoros).

i)/san,
they went, 3pl. impf. Ep. of ei)=mi (
ibo), Hom.
they knew, 3pl. plpf. Ep. of oi)=da, Il.18.405, Od.4.772.
i)sa/nan: i)sa/nion, r(hti/nhn, Hsch.

i)s-ana/tolos, on,
taking the same time to rise, zw/|dia Vett.Val.142.27:—also i)s-ana/foros, on, ibid., cf. Paul.Al.E.4, S.2.

i)/s-andros, on, (a)nh/r)
like a man, Hsch.

i)s-a/nemos [a^], on,
swift as the wind, E.IA 206(lyr.).

i)s-a/rgu^ros, on,
worth its weight in silver, porfura=s i). khki=da A.Ag.959, cf. Achae.5, Ephipp.21.4.

i)s-a^riqme/w,
to be equal in number, tini Tz.H.1.939.
i)s-a^ri/qmios, on,= sq., c. gen., *mousw=n IG14.1747.

i)s-a/riqmos [a^], on,
equal in number with, yuxai\ i), toi=s a)/strois Pl.Ti.41d, cf. Lg.845a, Arist.EN1156a7, al., Call.Del.175, Puchstein Epigr.Gr.p.9; ei)sari/qmois e)/pesi,= i)soyh/fois, IG5(1).257（Laconia): poet. i)sh/riqmos, AP6.84 (Paul. Sil.), 328 (Leon.), Lyc.1258. Adv. i)sa/riqmws Gal.19.469, Them.Or.33.367b. Gramm.,
of the same grammatical number, A.D.Synt.170.13. Adv. -mws ib.143.9.

i)s-a/rxaios, on,
equally ancient, Choerob.in Theod.2.55.

isthmus, Hsch. *)/isqmia (sc. i(era/), ta/,

neck, Emp.100.19; i). kai\ o(/ros th=s te kefalh=s kai\ tou= sth/qeos Pl.Ti.69e: metaph., bi/ou braxu\n i)sqmo/n S.Fr.568 (lyr.).
pharynx, fauces, Gal.18(2).961, Aret.SA1.6.

isthmus, o( i). th=s *xersonh/sou Hdt.6.36; of Athos, Id.7.22; *kimmeriko/s A.Pr.729; o( i). th=s *pallh/nhs Th.1.56; o( *leukadi/wn i). Id.3.81. *)isqmo/s (also *)iqmo/s SIG507 (Delph., iii B.C.), cf. foreg.) o( （h( in Pi., as O.7.81, 8.48),

to be of equal force, S.E.M.10.81.

i)sokra^t-h/s, e/s,
of equal power, possessing equal rights with others, i)sokrate/es . . ai( gunai=kes toi=si a)ndra/si Hdt.4.26; i). kai\ o(mo/timoi Plu.2.827b: generally,
evenly balanced, h( i)shmeri/a e)sti\ xeimw\n kai\ qe/ros i)sokrath/s Arist.Pr.942b37; i). oi)=nos
half-and-half, Hp.Morb.2.42 (nisi leg. i)sokrah/s）; e)k th=s a)mfoi=n -ou=s mi/cews Gal.6.528; i). kra/seis
normal temperaments, Ruf. ap. Orib.8.24.61. Adv. -tw=s, a)poma/xesqai Ph.1.198;
with even balance, Zeno Stoic.1.27, Iamb.in Nic.p.79 P.

i)sokra^t-i/a, h(,
equality of strength or
power, Ti.Locr.95c. = i)sonomi/a,
equality of rights, republic, opp. turanni/s, Hdt.5.92.a/ (pl.).
i)so/-kra_tos, on,= i)sokrah/s, Praxag. ap. Ruf.Onom.226.

i)so/-kri_qos, on,
equal to barley in price, Plb.2.15.1.

i)so/-kti^tos, on, (kti/zw)
made alike, Hsch., Phot.

i)so/-ktu^pos, on,
sounding like, tini Nonn.D.27.92.

i)so/-kuklos, on,
equally round, Philox.2.10.

i)so-kwli/a, h(,
equality of members or
clauses, Hermog.Id.1.12(pl.).

i)so/-kwlos, on,
of equal members or
clauses, Arist.Top.148b33; to\ i).
a sentence consisting of equal members, Demetr.Eloc.25, Plu.2.350e: in pl., D.S. 12.53, Ath.5.187c.
formed of an equal number of strands, xordai/ Nicom.Harm.6.
i)so-la^xh/s, e/s,= i)so/moiros, cj. in Philol. 6.

i)so-lexh/s, e/s,
with the same bed, Apollon.Lex.Hom.

i)so-loge/w,
speak freely with, tini Sch.E.Hipp.702.

i)so-logi/a, h(,= i)shgori/a, Plb.30.31.16; -logi/an e)/xein pro/s tina Id.24.10.9. in pl.,
counterbalancing arguments, S.E.M.1.144.
i)so-lo/gxhtos, on,= o( ta\ i)/sa laxw/n (cf. lo/gxh), dub. in IG9(1).309 (Thronium).

i)solu/mpios, on,
like those rendered to the Olympians, timai/ Ph. 2.181, cf. 567.
ranking with the Olympic games, [a)gw\n] gumniko/s SIG630.13 (Delph., ii B.C.), cf. IG12(7).506.7 (Nicuria), etc.

i)so/-lu^ros, on,
like the lyre, Sch.S.Tr.643.

i)so-ma/twr [a_], Dor. for i)so-mh/twr, o(, h(,
like one's mother or
dam, a)mno/s Theoc.8.14; said to be Cret. by Hsch.

i)so/-ma^xos, on,
equal in the fight, D.H.3.52; a)reth/, ki/ndunos, D.S.16.12, 17.83: tisi Ant.Lib.14.2.

i)so-mege/qhs, es,
equal in size, X.Cyn.5.29, Plb.10.44.2, Phld.Mort.3, Herod.Med. ap. Orib.10.8.2: c. dat., ku/stis i). lhku/qw| Aen.Tact.31.10; i). gh=| Jul.Gal. 135c. Adv. -qws Aristid.Quint.3.6.

i)so-me/reia, h(,
equality, e)c -meri/as Sammelb.6266.17 (vi A.D.).

i)so-merh/s, e/s,
equally divided, do/seis BGU1122.12 (i B.C.);
of equal length, ib.393.12 (ii A.D.): generally,
equal, ke/rdos Just.Nov.97.1.

i)so-me/trhtos, on,
of equal measure or
weight, ei)kw/n Pl.Phdr.235d, Plu.Sol.25; tini D.C.59.11, cf. Max.Tyr.31.2.

i)so-metri/a, h(,
equality of measure, Arist.Fr. 47.

i)so-me/twpos, on,
with equal forehead or
front, X.HG4.5.16.

i)so-mh/khs, es,
equal in length, Arist.HA506b14; th=| *)attikh=| Str.9.2.1; of numbers,
having a common factor, Pl.R. 546c.

i)so-mi_lh/sios, a, on,
of Milesian fashion, i(ma/tion D.S.12.21.

i)somoir-e/w,
have an equal share, Th.6.39, X.Cyr.2.3.17; tinos of a thing, D.48.19; tino\s pro/s tina Th.6.16; pro\s a)llh/lous Isoc.5.39; tino/s tini Is.1.2, D.H.6.66. Astrol.,
occupy the same degree, Cat.Cod.Astr.5(1).219.

i)somoir-i/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
equal share, kakoi=sin e)sqlou\s i)somoiri/an [i_s-] e)/xein Sol. ap. Arist.Ath.12.3; tinos in a thing, Th.7.75. = i)sonomi/a, Nymphod.21, D.C.52.4.
equability, of climate, Hp.
Aër.12; tw=n kra/sewn Gal.1.534. Astrol.,
equivalence of degree, Vett.Val.139.16.

i)somoir-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of
equivalent positions, kanonografi/a Id.336.11.

i)so/moir-os, on, Cret. visvo/- Leg.Gort.10.53, GDI4974 (Gort.): (moi=ra)
sharing equally or
alike, c. gen. rei, pa/ntwn X.Cyr.4.6.12, etc.; tw=n a)/llwn i). e)/stw SIG1044.40 (Halic., iv B.C.); gh=s i)so/moir' a)h/r air that
sharest earth
equally [with light], S.El.87 (anap.): c. dat., timai=s i)so/moiron e)/qhken ta\n o(mo/lektron h(/rwsin IG12(3).1190.3 (Melos); i)so/moiron, to/,
equal portion, Nic.Th.592: abs., i)so/moira . . e)n tw=| ko/smw| fw=s kai\ sko/tos D.L.8.26. Adv. -rws Eust.161.20.
equivalent, corresponding, c. dat., ki/bisin, ba/ktrw| a(/rphn i)so/moiron AJA9.320 (Sinope). Astrol.,
occupying the same degree, ai( kat' i)so/moiron sta/seis Vett.Val.70.31, cf. Man.4.194; th\n *)afrodi/thn i)so/moiron ou)=san h(li/w| Procl.Hyp.1.21. Adv. -rws Cat.Cod.Astr.5(1).219.

i)so/moros, on,= i)so/moiros, used by Poseidon of himself in relation to Zeus, Il.15.209: generally,
like, tini AP6.206 (Antip.Sid.); i)so/moron, to/,
equal portion, Nic.Th.105, Androm. ap. Gal.14.41. [i_s- ll. cc.]

i)so/neiros, on,
dream-like, empty, A.Pr.549 (lyr.) [perh. i_].

i)so/-nekus, uos, o(, h(,
dying equally or
alike, E.Or.200 (lyr.), ubi v. Sch.

i)so-ne/meos, on,
ranking with the Nemean games, a)gw/n SIG402.10, al. (Delph., iii B.C.), IG22.680.17 (prob.):—also i)so-ne/meios Klio 14.275 (Delph., iii B.C.).

i)sonom-e/omai, Pass.,
have equal rights, meta/ tinos Th.6.38.

i)sonom-i/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
equal distribution, equilibrium, balance, duna/mewn Alcmaeon 4, cf. Ti.Locr.99b, Epicur.Fr.352.
equality of political rights, Hdt.3.80, 142; i). poiei=n Id.5.37; opp. dunastei/a, Th.4.78; i). politikh/ Id.3.82; i). e)n gunaici\ pro\s a)/ndras kai\ a)ndra/si pro\s gunai=kas Pl.R.563b.

i)sonom-iko/s, h/, o/n,
devoted to equality, a)nh/r ib.561e.

i)so/nom-os, on,
where all have equal rights, i)sono/mous t' *)aqh/nas e)poihsa/thn Scol. 12; o)ligarxi/a i). Th.3.62; di/kaios kai\ i). politei/a Pl.Ep.326d; e)n i)sono/mw| politeu/ein App.BC1.15; zw=|on i). qew=| M.Ant.8.2; *galati/a i).
enjoying full citizen rights, of Gallia Cisalpina, Nic.Dam.130.28J. xalko\s i). copper
at par (24 obols = 1 stater), opp. xalko\s ou(= diallagh/ (copper at a discount), UPZ112v19 (ii B.C.), PTeb.99.4 (ii B.C.), PPetr.3p.193, al. (ii B.C.).

i)sonu/ktion, to/,
equinox, Gloss.:—Adj. i)sonom-nu/ktios, on,
equinoctial, Gal.16.407.

i)/soc, o(, a fish, Hsch. (Celtic word, cf. Welsh
ehawc, eog 'salmon', Lat.
esox.）

i)so/-cu^los, on,
like wood, Hsch. s.v. o)/culon.

i)so/-ogkos, on,
of equal bulk or
volume, Simp.in Cael.691.35, in Ph.1016.23.

i)so/-pais, o(, h(,
like a child, as of a child, i)sxu/s A.Ag.75 (lyr.).

i)so-pa/laistos [a^], on,
a span long, AP6.287 (Antip.). [i_ . . a^]

i)so-pa^lh/s, e/s,
equal in the struggle, well-matched, maxome/nwn . . kai\ genome/nwn i)sopale/wn Hdt. 1.82, cf. 5.49;
evenly balanced, ma/xh Ctes.Fr.29.31. generally,
equivalent, equal, i). pa/nth| Parm.8.44; i). ki/ndunoi Th.2.39; plh/qei i). tisi/ Id.4.94; ou)/ti w(/rifos i). toi Theoc.5.30; i). h)/mati nu/c AP9.384.18, cf. Orph.A.1014. Adv. -lw=s Sch.Arat.364.
i)so/-pa^los, on,= foreg., Luc.Nav.36, D.C.40.42, Poll.3.149,5.157, Hsch.; prob. in Ibyc.14, X.Ages.2.9.

i)so-pa^xh/s, e/s,
of equal or
even thickness or
density, Arist.HA527a7, Thphr.HP3.5.6, Dsc.5.90, Gal.10.431, Nicom.Harm.6:—late nom. sg. i)so/-pa^xus Herod.Med. ap. Orib.8.4.3 codd. i)so-pedh/s, e/s,= i)so/pedos, Gloss.

i)so/-pedon, to/,
level ground, a flat, Il.13.142, X.Cyr.3.1.5; fula/ttein e)pi\ tou= i)sope/dou e(auth/n Luc.Im.21.

i)so/-pedos, on,
of even surface, level, e)c i). xwri/ou Hp.VC11, cf. Luc.Hipp.4; i). tw=| de/rmati Gal.10.1011; i). xrw/mata
flat in appearance, opp. koi=la, Alex.Aphr.Pr.1.49. c. dat.,
level or
even with, xou=n poie/wn th= a)/llh| gh=| i)so/pedon Hdt.4.201, cf. D.S. 19.94, Plu.Num.10.

i)so-pe/leqros, on,
of the same number of ple/qra, Hsch.

i)so-penqh/s, e/s,
in equal distress, Sch.A.Eu.783.

i)so-pe/rastos or i)so-pe/ratos, on,
equally bounded, Sch.Od.1.98.

i)so-peri/metros, on,
of equal perimeter, Damian.Opt.3, Hero
*Deff.82, Procl.in Ti.2.71 D., al.
i)so/-petros, on, gloss on a)nti/petros, Sch.S.OC192.

i)so/-phxus, u,
of the length of a cubit, Philostr.Gym.12, Opp.H.1.213.
i)so/-plastos, on, gloss on a)nti/plastos, Hsch.

i)so-pla^th/s, e/s,
equal in breadth, Arist.Oec.1345a33, Archimel. ap. Ath.5.209c; a)/rtos i). Hippoloch. ap. Ath.4.128d (-platus codd.): c. dat., i). tw=| tei/xei Th.3.21.

i)so-pla/twn, wnos, o(,
a second Plato, AP11.354. [i_ . . a^]

i)so/-pleuros, on,
with equal sides, plai/sion X.An.3.4.19, etc.: freq. in Geom.,
equilateral, tri/gwnon Pl.Ti.54a, 54e; e)pi/pedon ib.55e; tetra/gwnon Plb.6.31.10. of numbers,
square, opp. e(teromh/khs, Pl.Tht.148a, Arist.APo.73a40. Adv. -pleu/rws Nicom.Ar.2.13. Rhet., of periods, Hermog. Inv.4.3.

i)so-plhgh/s, e/s,
struck in the same way, xordh/ Porph. in Harm.p.296W.

i)so-plhqh/s, e/s,
equal in number or
quantity, h)h/r Hp.Morb.2.4; i(ppei=s X.Ages.2.9: Math.,
equal in number, Euc.12.4, al.; sxh/mata ta\s pleura\s i). e)/xonta Papp.332.14: c. dat., tini to a person or thing, Th.6.37, D.C.50.33; i). qala/ssh| potamoi/ Poll.3.103. Adv. -qw=s Euc.12.5.

i)so-plhqo/pleuros, on,
having an equal number of sides, eu)qu/gramma, sxh/mata, Anon.Geom.in Papp.1142.21.

i)sopoli_t-ei/a, h(,
equality of civic rights, Arist.Fr.575; granted to individuals, IG7.4264 (Oropus, iii B.C.), 5(2).11 (Tegea, iii B.C.), etc.; or to communities, SIG472.11 (Phigalea, iii B.C.), Plb.16.26.9, D.S.15.46, etc. esp.
reciprocity of such rights (guaranteed by treaty between two states), GDI5040 (Crete), OGI265 (Pergam., iii B.C.), etc.; *lebadeu=si/n e)stin i). pro\s *)arka/das Plu.2.300b.

i)sopoli_/t-hs, ou, o(,
enjoying equal political rights, tina\s toi=s *makedo/sin poih/sas i). J. AJ12.1.1, cf. LXX 3 Ma.2.30, GDI5183.25 (Crete), Inscr.Magn.34.28, al., IPE12.357.
enjoying reciprocity of rights, of the citizens of Roman
municipia, D.H.8.76:—fem. i)sopoli_t-poli=tis, i/tidos, of cities
enjoying such rights, ai( i). po/leis,=
municipia, App.BC1.10.
equitable citizen, POxy.41.28 (iii/iv A.D.).

i)so-praci/a, h(,
a faring equally, like condition, Eust.662.35.

i)so/-presbus, u,
like an old man, A.Ag.78 (anap.).

i)so/-proikon, to/,
wedding-gift of bridegroom to bride, CPR30ii10 (vi A.D.), etc.
as good as given away, Hsch. s.v. a)nti/proika.

i)so-pro/cenos, on, (viso- lapis)
enjoying the privileges of a pro/cenos, Schwyzer 415.3 (Olymp.).
i)so/-pteros, on, gloss on a)/pteros, Sch.A.Ag.276:—also i)so/pteroi: i)so/timoi, Hsch.

i)so-ptu^xh/s, e/s,
with similar folds, xitw/nion IG22.1518.82,84.

i)so/-ptwtos, on, (ptw=sis)
with like cases, A.D.Pron.90.6.

i)so-pu/qios [u_], on,
ranking with the Pythian games, a)gw/n SIG402.24(Delph., iii B.C.), prob. in IG22.680.16; ste/fanos SIG557.29 (Magn. Mae.); i(era\ *au)goustei=a i). IGRom.4.1265 (Thyatira).

i)so/-puknos, on,
equally condensed (by tension), xordh/ Porph. in Harm.p.296W. (comment on puknote/ras in Ptol.Harm.1.8).
i)so/-purgos, on, gloss on a)nti/purgos, Hsch.

i)so/-pu^ron, to/,
fumitory, Fumaria capreolata, Dsc. 4.120, Plin.HN27.94, Gal.11.891.

i)so/-pu_ros, on,
reckoned as of equal value with wheat, lwto/s, kro/twn,
PLond.ined.2360.
i)so-rreph/s, e/s,= i)so/rropos, Nic.Th.646, Poet.de Herb.98.

i)sorrop-e/w,
to be equally balanced, in equipoise, Pl.Ti.52e,Lg.733c, 794e; tini
with . . , Plb.1.11.1.

i)sorro/p-hsis, ews, h(,
equipoise, equilibrium, Hero Spir.1.1.

i)sorrop-i/a, h(,
equipoise, equilibrium, Pl.Phd. 109a: metaph., i). tou= xro/nou Agath.4.25.

i)sorrop-ika/, ta/, title of
work on equilibrium by Archimedes.

i)so/rrop-os, on, (r(oph/)
in equipoise, of the balance, Pl.Phd.109a, Plt.270a（Sup.), etc.; ta/lanta bri/sas ou)k i)sorro/pw| tu/xh| A.Pers.346; i)sorro/pou tou= ph/xews (sc. tou= zugou=） ginome/nou IG22.1013.34. generally,
well-balanced, well-matched, i). au)to\s e(autw=| of a man
with his legs of the same length, Hp.Fract.19; of a nose,
flattened, but not awry, Id.Art.37; of a bone,
cylindrical, ib. 34; de/rma i)., opp. perirreph/s, ib.50; i). a)gw/n
evenly balanced, E.Supp. 706; ma/xh Th.1.105; duna/meis Pl.Ti.52e; bi/os Id.Lg.733c; timh/ Arist.EN1164b4: c. dat., to\ ge/nos to\ *)attiko\n i). tw=| e(wutw=n a)\n gi/noito would become
a match for their own, Hdt.5.91; i). *(rwmai/ois Hdn.6.7.8; i). katasth=nai/ tini IPE12.40.18(Olbia, ii A.D.); i). o( lo/gos tw=n e)/rgwn
in precise equipoise with . . , Th.2.42; i). pro/s ti Hdn.6.3.2.
of equal weight, xrusi/on Inscr.Délos313a.45 (iii B.C., -oro-). Adv. -o/pws, a)fie/nai Hp.Art.43; poreu/esqai Pl.Phdr.247b; a)gwni/sasqai D.C.41.61: neut. pl. i)so/rropa as Adv., Tim.Pers.47.

i)so/ruqmos, on, perh.
of like form, Pi.Pae.Fr.90.

i)/sos, h, on, Ep. i)=sos and e)/i+sos (v. infr.); Cret., Arc. vi/svos GDI 4998ii2, 4982.2, Schwyzer665, cf. gisgo/n: i)/son, Hsch.; later i(/sos Schwyzer 708a（1) (Ephesus, iv B.C.), Tab.Heracl.1.175, etc.:—
equal in size, strength, or number, c. dat., ku/mata i)=sa o)/ressin Od.3.290, etc.; freq. of appearance,
like, i)=sos a)nau/dw| 10.378; i)=sos *)/areui Sapph.91 (dub.); i)/sos qeoi=sin Ead.2.1: freq.abs., i)/shn . . bi/hn kai\ ku=dos Il.7.205; i)=son qumo\n e)/xein to be of
like mind, 13.704, 17.720: neut. as Adv., i)=son e)moi\ frone/ousa 15.50; qeoi=sin i)=s' e)/qele frone/ein 5.441, cf. 21.315, etc.; i)/sos tini\ to\ me/gaqos, u(/yos, Hdt.2.32, 124; to\ mh=kos, to\ pla/tos, X.An. 5.4.32; a)riqmo/n E.Supp.662; i)/sa to\n a). Pl.R.441c; poth\n i)/son
equal in flight of song, Alex.Aet.5.5; i)/son, to/,
copy of a document, PLond. 3.1222.5 (ii A.D.), etc.: with dat. pers. in place of an object of comparison, ou) me\n soi/ pote i)=son e)/xw ge/ras (i.e. tw=| sw=| ge/rai+) Il.1.163; toi=sd' i)/sas nau=s (i.e. tai=s tw=nde) E.IA262(lyr.); i)/sa toi=s nu=n strathgoi=s a)ga/q' ei)rgasme/nous D.13.21: folld. by a relative word, e)moi\ i)/son . . , o(/sonper u(mi=n
the same to me as to you, Ar.Ec.173; ta\ e)kei= i)/sa, w(/sper ta\ e)nqa/de Lys.19.36 codd. (fort. sa=）; ta\ i)/sa o(/saper . . Lex ap.D.23.44; i)/son . . o(/per Pl.Erx.405b. repeated to denote equal relations, i)/sa pro\s i)/sa
tit for
tat, Hdt.1.2; taxqe/ntes i)/soi pro\s i)/sous S. Ant.142 (anap.); i)/sous i)/soisi . . a)ntiqei/s E.Ph.750; i)/sa a)nti\ i)/swn lamba/nein, e)kdou=nai Pl.Lg.774c; i)/sos i)/sw| (sc. oi)=nos u(/dati) Cratin.184, Com.Adesp.107, etc.; ku/likos i)/son i)/sw| kekrame/nhs (where i)/son is adverbial) Ar.Pl.1132; dido/nai ga/la kai\ oi)=non pi/nein i)/son i)/sw| Hp. Epid.2.5.1: metaph., 'fairly blended', mhde\n i)/son i)/sw| fe/rwn Ar.Ach. 354. of persons,
equal in rights, bou/letai h( po/lis e)c i)/swn ei)=nai kai\ o(moi/wn Arist.Pol.1295b25; h( politikh\ e)leuqe/rwn kai\ i)/swn a)rxh/ ib. 1255b20; to\ kat' a)ci/an i)/. ib.1307a26, al.
equally divided or
distributed, i)/sh moi=ra Il.9.318; i)/sh alone,
one's equal share, mh/ ti/s moi a)tembo/menos ki/oi i)/shs Od.9.42 (i)/sshs cj. Fick, cf. i)/ssasqai）; th\n i)/. e)/xwn Cratin.250; ou) mh\n i)/. e)/teisen (sc. ti/sin) S.OT810; a)/xri th=s i)/. up to
the point of equality, D.5.17: neut., mh\ i)/son nei=mai e(kate/rw| Pl.Prt.337a; ou) mo/non i)/son, a)lla\ kai\ ple/on e)/xein Isoc.17.57; ou)k a)ne/ch| dwma/twn e)/xwn i)/son kai\ tw=|de nei=mai; E.Ph.547; ta\ i)/sa
fair measure, ta\ i)/. ne/mein Hdt. 6.11; mh\ i)/swn e(/kaston tugxa/nein a)lla\ pleonektei=n, X.Cyr.2.2.20; prostuxei=n tw=n i)/. to obtain
fair terms, S.Ph.552; ka)\n i)/sai (sc. yh=foi） ge/nwntai
equally divided, Ar.Ra.685.
based on equality of rights, i)/. kai\ e)/nnomos polit ei/a Aeschin.1.5; th\n politei/an i)saite/ran kaqista/nai Th.8.89; ta\ i)/.
equal rights, equality, freq. joined with ta\ o(/moia or ta\ di/kaia, w(s th=s politei/as e)some/nhs e)n toi=s i)/. kai\ o(moi/ois X.HG7.1.45; tw=n i)/. kai\ tw=n dikai/wn e(/kastos h(gei=tai e(autw=| metei=nai e)n th=| dhmokrati/a| D.21.67; ou) me/testi tw=n i)/. ou)de\ tw=n o(moi/wn pro\s tou\s plousi/ous toi=s loipoi=s ib.112; tw=n i)/. metei=xe toi=s a)/llois ib.96; also h( i)/. kai\ o(moi/a (sc. di/kh）, th=s i)/. kai\ o(moi/as mete/xein Th.4.105; e)p' i)/. te kai\ o(moi/h| on
fair and equal terms, Hdt.9.7, a/, cf. Th.1.145; e)pi\ th=| i)/. kai\ o(moi/a| ib.27, cf. SIG312.27 (Samos, iv B.C.), OGI229.44 (Smyrna, iii B.C.), etc.: generally,
just, fair, e)k poi/as i)/. kai\ dikai/as profa/s ews; D.18.284. of persons,
fair, impartial, S.Ph.684(lyr.), OT677; i)/. dikasth/s Pl.Lg. 957c; i)/. kai\ koinoi\ a)kroatai/ D.29.1, cf. 18.7; i)/. kai\ koino\n dikasth/rion Id.7.36; koinou\s me\n . . , i)/. de\ mh/ Pl.Prt.337a; i)/. i)/sqi krinwn Men.Mon. 266, cf. 257; kritai\ i)/. kai\ di/kaioi Plb.24.15.3, etc.
adequate, h( i)/. froura/ Th.7.27 (expld. by Sch. as
regular, tetagme/nh）; i)/sos toi=s parou=si Id.1.132. of ground,
even, flat, ei)s to\ i)/. katabai/nein, of an army, X.An.4.6.18 (but e)n i)/sw| prosie/nai to advance
with even step, ib.1.8.11); le/ousin ei)s to\ i)/. kaqista/menoi ma/xesqai, opp. meta\ pleoneci/as a)gwni/zesqai,
on even terms, Id.Cyr.1.6.28; i)/. toi=xos, opp. keklikw/s,
perpendicular, Phlp.in APo.2.27. Adv. i)/sws (v. sub voc.): but also, neut. sg. and pl. from Hom. downwds. (v. sub init.), i)=son . . a)ph/xqeto khri\ melai/nh|
even as Death, Il.3.454; i)=son e)moi\ basi/ue be king
like me, 9.616; i)=son ga/r se qew=| ti/sousin *)axaioi/ ib. 603; i)=son e)mh=| kefalh=| 18.82; to\n . . i)=sa qew=| . . ei)soro/wsin Od.15.520; i)=sa fi/loisi te/kessi Il.5.71, cf. 13.176, Od.1.432, 11.304, etc.: later abs.,
alike, dei/laie tou= nou= th=s te sumfora=s i)/son S.OT1347; th\n *sa/mon kai\ *(hrakle/as sth/las i)/son a)pe/xein Hdt.8.132: c. dat., i)/son naoi=s qew=n E.Hel.801; i)/son a)/pesmen tw=| pri/n
equally as before, Id.Hipp.302 (v.l. tw=n pri/n）; i)/sa toi=s pa/nu D.C.Fr.70.6; i)/sa kai/ . .
like as, as if, S.OT 1187(lyr.), E.El.994 (anap.), Th.3.14; i)/son w(s . . E.Ion1363; w(/sper . . S.El.532; w(/ste . . E.Or.882; a(/te . . Id.HF667(lyr.); o(/sonper . . D.15.1. with Preps.: a)po\ th=s i)/shs
equally, Th.1.15; o( a)po\ th=s i)/. e)xqro/s Id.3.40; a)p' i)/shs ei)=nai D.14.6; a)f' i(/sou SIG426.14 (Teos, iii B.C.); di' i)/sou D.C.43.37; at
equal distance, Pl.R.617b: also in Math.,
ex aequali, of proportions, Euc.5 Def.17, al.; di' i)/. e)n tetaragme/nh| a)nalogi/a|
ex aequali in disturbed proportion, Archim. Sph.Cyl.2.4,al., Papp.932.11; e)n i)/sw|
equally, Th.2.53, 4.65; e)n i)/sw| e)sti/ it matters not, E.IA1199; e)n i)/sw| [e)sti\] kai\ ei) . . Th.2.60; e)n tw=| i)/sw| ei)=nai Id.4.10; e)c i)/shs Pl.Lg.861a: more freq. e)c i)/sou Hdt.7.135, S.OT563, etc.; e)c i)/. tini/ Id.Ant.516, 644, Antipho 5.1, Pl.Grg.517a;
evenly, eu)qei=a grammh/ e)stin h(/tis e)c i)/. toi=s e)f' e(auth=s shmei/ois kei=tai Euc. 1 Def.4; e)c i)/. kai\ . . S.OC254; w(s . . Id.OT61; oi( e)c i)/. persons
of equal station, Pl.Lg.777d, cf. 919d; o( e)c i)/. ki/ndunos Plb.9.4.4; e)k tou= i)/. gi/gnesqai/ tini Th.2.3; toi=s e)k tou= i)/sou h(mi=n ou)=si X.Hier.8.5; e)c i)/sou tisi\ th=s politei/as metadido/nai Lys.25.3; e)k tou= i)/. ma/xesqai
to be evenly matched, X.HG2.4.16; e)c i)/. polemei=n D.8.47; kata\ mh=na to\ ai(rou=n e)c i)/. the sum due in
equal monthly instalments, PAmh.2.92.14, etc.; e)pi\ or e)p' i)/shs, e)pi\ i)/. diafe/rein to\n po/lemon Hdt.1.74; tou=to e)p' i)/shs e)/xei Id.7.50, cf. S.El.1062(lyr.), etc.; e)p' i)/sou Plb.1.18.10; e)p' i)/son Id.6.38.4, cf. Docum. ap. D.18.106, Phld.Ir.p.21 W.; e)pi\ i)=sa ma/xh te/tato Il.12.436; cf. kata\ i)=sa ma/xhn e)ta/nusse 11.336; kat' i)/son Dsc.1.68.6, Gal.UP1.19; met' i)/sou
equally, Demetr.Lac.Herc.124.12. Comp. i)sai/teros E.Supp.441, Th.8.89, X.HG7.1.14: Sup. i)so/tatos Timo 68; i)sai/tatos Ph.1.462. Adv. w(s i)sai/tata Pl.Lg.744c, but w(s i)so/tata SIG531.30 (Dyme). [i_ in early Ep. (exc. Hes.Op.752), cf. Sol.24.1: i^ first in Thgn.678, Sapph.2.1 (but i)=sos Ead.91 s.v.l.), B. 5.46 (but i)=son 1.62, Fr.2.2), and always in Pi. (exc. in compd. i_sodai/mwn) and Trag. (A.Fr.216 is dub. l.) exc. in compd. i_so/-qeos (q.v.); dub. in i)s-o/neiros. Both quantities are found in later poetry, sts. in same line, e)/xoisan i)/son ka/tw, i)=son a)/nwqen Theoc.8.19; pre/sbun i)/son kou/rois, i)=son a(do/nta ko/rais APl.4.309.]

i)sosqe/n-eia, h(,
equipollence, [tw=n ai)sqh/sewn] Epicur.Fr.36, cf. Chrysipp.Stoic.2.37, S.E.P.1.8, D.L.9.74.

i)sosqen-h/s, e/s,
equal in force or
power, peni/an i). plou/tw| poiei=n Democr.284; a)da/mantos i). a)=or Opp.H.2.466; mu/es th\n r(w/mhn i). Gal.UP7.14;
evenly balanced, ma/xai Id.1.364; diafwni/a S.E.P.1.26; to\ i). D.L.9.107. Adv. -nw=s Gal.9.81.

i)soske/l-eia, h(,
having two sides equal; kat' -eian
in trine aspect, Ptol.Tetr.125.

i)soskel-h/s, e/s,
with equal legs, esp. in Geom.,
having two sides equal, isosceles, tri/gwnon Pl.Ti.54a, etc.; to\ i). Arist.APo.41b14. of numbers,
that can be divided into two equal parts, even (as 6 = 3 + 3), opp. skalhno/s, odd (as 7 = 4 + 3), Pl.Euthphr.12d. Rhet., of periods,
containing equal members, Hermog.Inv.4.3. Medic.,
having equal tails, of a bandage, Heliod. ap. Orib.48.62 tit.

i)so/sprios, on,
bean-like; o)/nos i). an insect
that rolls itself up like a bean, the
wood-louse, S.Fr.363.
i)so-sta/dhn [a^], Adv., (i(/sthmi) = i)sostasi/ws, with marginal gloss h)\ susta/dhn, Suid. s.v. a)ntagwnisth/s.

i)so-staqme/w,
to be equal in weight, Id. s.v. a)/gousan.

i)so-sta/sios [a^], on,
equal in weight, xruso/s, xrusi/on, Str.4.4.5, Plu.CG17;
equivalent or
adequate, tini Hp.Ep.16, Luc.DMort.10.5, D.C.44.40, Max.Tyr.6.6; ti/s soi i). nekro/s; Polem.Call.46, cf. 31; a)=ra ou)=n i). tw=| *kro/nw| o( *zeu/s; Dam.Pr.91: i)sosta/sion, to/, prob. name of a e(tai/ra, title of a play by Alexis.
equally poised, in equilibrium, metaph., Dam.Pr.122. Adv. -i/ws Poll.8.11: neut. pl. as Adv., bai/nein Ph.1.462.
i)so-sta^te/w, = i)sostaqme/w, Lib.Decl.43.2.

i)so-stoixe/w, = a)ntistoixe/w, Sch.D.T. p.44H.;
to be co-ordinate, Simp.in Ph.408.13.

i)so/-stoixos, on,
occupying a corresponding place, of terms in parallel series, Id.in Cael. 156.18; gloss on a)nti/stoixos, Sch.E.Andr.745.

i)so-strofh/, h(,
correspondence, Ammon. in APr.35.23, Phlp.in APr.40.3.

i)so/-strofos, on,
equally twisted, even, xordai/ Nicom.Harm.6. = a)nti/strofos, S.E.M.7.6, Ammon.in APr.35.26: coupled with a)nti/str., Herm. in Phdr.p.189A.; a)na/gkh pa=n pro\s pa=n h)\ i). ei)=nai h)\ e(/teron Dam. Pr.312.
i)so-su/gkri^tos, on, gloss on a)mfh/ristos, Sch.Opp.H.1.90.

i)sosulla^b-e/w,
have the same number of syllables, A.D.Pron.11.20, al., PLit.Lond.183.

i)sosulla^b-i/a, h(,
equality of syllables, A.D.Adv.174.16.

i)sosu/lla^b-os, on,
having the same number of syllables, Plu.2.739a, Hermog.Id.1.12, A.D.Pron.11.8, etc. Adv. -bws St.Byz. s.v. *)/abai, EM552.34.

i)so-sw/ma^tos or i)so/-swmos, on, glosses on a)nti/stoixos, Sch.E.Andr.
745.

i)so-ta^gh/s, e/s,
corresponding in order, Philol.6 (v.l.); xw=rai Theol.Ar.51.
i)so-ta/lantos [ta^], on, gloss on a)ta/lantos, Hsch.

i)so/-tauros, on,
like a bull, cj. in S.OT478 (lyr.).

i)sota/x-eia [ta^], h(,
equal velocity, Simp.in Ph.1019.23.

i)sotax-e/w,
travel with equal velocity, Thphr.Fr.89.11; tini Ph.1.463, Hld.8.17.

i)sotax-h/s, e/s,
possessing equal velocity, Arist.Ph.216a20, al., Plb. 10.44.9, Cleom.2.1, Ph.1.588; a)/tomoi Epicur.Ep.1p.18U., Nat.2.2; ploi=a Ph.Bel.73.21; tini Arist.Ph.240a8: generally,
equally swift, ni/khs kri/sis Epigr.Gr.939.2 (Synnada). Adv. -xw=s Arist.Mech.848a16, Sch.Epicur.Ep.1p.8U.
uniform in rate, of the pulse, Gal. 8.459, Plb.10.44.13, Str.1.2.17. Adv. -xw=s Gal.9.454.

i)sote/l-eia, h(,
condition of an i)sotelh/s,
equality in tax and tribute, X.HG2.4.25, Vect.4.12, IG22.109b20, 276.13, al., GDI3077 (Mesembria), Ph.1.160, etc.: freq. in Boeot. Inscrr., visote/lia IG7.505, al. (Tanagra).

i)sote/l-estos, on, (tele/w)
made exactly like, exact, i). mi/mhma Nonn.D.18.247.
coming at the last to all alike, e)pi/kouros, of Death, S.OC1220 (lyr.).

i)sote/l-euton, to/,
leading to the same result, Sch.Hermog.in Rh.4.169 W.

i)sotelh/s, e/s (gen. sg. i)sotelou= (sic), Epigr.Gr.48), (te/los)
bearing equal burdens; at Athens and elsewh., of a favoured class of me/toikoi, subject to the same taxation as the citizens, Lys.Fr.225 S., Is.Fr.45, D.20.29, Arist.Ath.58.2, IG22.276.15,al., cf. SIG742.44 (Ephesus, i B.C.); of freedmen, IG9(1).412 (Aetolia), Hsch. metaph., of Hera, [tw=| *dii/+] i). his
consort, Orph.Fr.163.

i)so-tenh/s, e/s,
level, [i(/ppoi] ta\ nw=ta i)sotenei=s Tim.Gaz. ap. Ar.Byz. Epit.147.4.

i)so-tetra/gwnos [a^], on,
of four equal rectangles, sunagwgh/ Ps.-Hero Poliorc.p.238 W.

i)so/-texnos, on,
equal in art or
skill, tini Epigr.Gr.532 (Perinthus); toi=n i). au)lhtai=n Plu.Nob.9.

i)so/ths, htos, h(, (i)/sos)
equality, Arist.Metaph.1054b3, etc.: in pl., Pl.Lg.733b; i). xro/nou Id.Prm.140e: Math., i). gewmetrikh/
equality of ratios, proportion, Id.Grg.508a; a)nalogi/a i). lo/gwn Arist.EN1131a31. esp.
political equality or
justice, personified in E.Ph.536, cf. Pl.Lg.757a; i). politikh/ Plb.6.8.4, etc.: in dual, Pl.Lg.757b, cf. Arist.Pol.1302a7, Isoc.7.21.
fair dealing, impartiality, Men. Mon.259, Plb.2.38.8, Ep.Col.4.1.
equiformity, of the earth, Epicur.Nat.11.10. (On the accent v. Hdn.Gr.1.83, 2.945; i)soth/s is said to be Hellenistic by Moer.202.)
i)soti/m-hma [ti_], gloss on i)swni/a (-oni/a cod.), Hsch.

i)sotim-i/a, h(,
equality of privilege, opp. pleoneci/a, X.Hier.8.10, cf. Str.8.5.4, Ph.1.160; e)c i)sotimi/as diale/gesqai/ tini to converse with him
as his equal, Luc.Pisc.34.

i)so/tim-os, on,
equal in honour or
privilege, )*apo/llwn (i.e. sharing the honours paid to Zeus) OGI234.25 (Delph., iii B.C.),
CR Acad.Inscr.1906.419 (Alabanda); o( qeo\s . . -on pare/xi tra/pezan toi=s o(poqenou=n a)fiknoume/nois BCH51.73 (Panamara); pi/stis 2 Ep.Pet.1.1; oi( prw=toi kai\ i). Plu.Lys.19, cf. Wilcken Chr.13.10 (i A.D.), Luc.
D Mort.24.3, etc.; po/leis tisi/ D.Chr.41.2: Comp. -o/teroi, toi=s kratou=sin Id.39.4; to\ i).,= i)sotimi/a, Ph.2.246; of a person,
maintaining equality of privilege, Hdn.2.4.9. Adv. -mws, tina/s tisin a)/gein Ath.5.177c; zw=nta dikai/ws kai\ i). OGI544.34 (Ancyra, ii A.D.), cf. CIG4032.5 (ibid.), IGRom.3.195 (ibid.); i). e)/xousi pro\s a)llh/lous oi( o(/roi Phlp.in APr.167.14, cf. Alex.Aphr.in Metaph.241.11. generally,
equal in value: hence,
equal, a(ma/rthma a)kou/sion i). e(kousi/w| Ph.2.248; to\ i). duse/fikton e)n tai=s a)moibai=s Hdn.2.3.6; i). ma/xh
evenly balanced, Ael.NA10.1. as title of rank at the Ptolemaic court, tw=n i)soti/mwn toi=s prw/tois fi/lois PRyl.66 intr., 253 (ii B.C.), Arch.Pap. 6.372.

i)so/-toixos, on,
with equal walls or
sides, of ships, gloss on e)i/+sas, Hsch.

i)so-toni/a, h(, in Music,
uniformity of pitch, level pitch, Ptol. Harm.1.4 (pl.), Porph.in Harm.p.287 W.

i)so/-tonos, on,
pulling evenly, bro/xos Gal.18(1).351, Paul.Aeg.6.102.
bearing the same accent, Hermog.Id.1.12. in Music,
of level (unvarying) pitch, Ptol.Harm.1.4; but,
in unison, ib.7, 2.1. generally,
equal, even, i). th=| sugkri/sei tou= xrw/matos Dsc.5.123. Adv. -nws
equally, qumia=sqai Id.68.6.

i)so-tra/pezos [a^], on,
equal to the table, i.e.
large enough to fill it, ka/kkabos Antiph.182.2, cf. Philox.2.15.

i)so-tri^bh/s, e/s, in A.Ag.1443, selma/twn i)sotribh/s (cj. Pauw. pro i(stotr-)
pressing the benches
like others.

i)so/-tu^pos, on,
shaped alike, Nonn.D.1.448.
executed in duplicate, o(mologi/a PLond.1.113i65 (vi A.D.), cf.PMasp.32.79 (vi A.D.); misspelt soitupos POxy.2134.29 (ii A.D.): Subst., i)so/tupon, to/,
copy, counterpart of a legal instrument, Just. Nov.7.1
2 Ep..

i)so-tu/rannos [u^], on,
despotic, absolute, a)rxh/ Arist. Pol.1270b14, D.H.5.70.

i)s-oura/nios [a^], a, on,
high as heaven, do/ca Arch.Pap.1.220 (Ptol.).

i)s-ourgo/s, o/n, (e)/rgon)
doing like things, Phot.

i)so-u+yh/s, e/s,
of equal height, Euc.11.34,al.; tei/xei, new=|, Plb.8.4.4, Str.17.1.28:—also i)so/-u+yos, on, Gal.18(1).757.

i)so-fa^nh/s, e/s,
appearing like, Nonn.D.9.233.

i)sofa^ri/zw [i_],= a)ntiferi/zw,
match oneself with, vie with, ou)de/ ti/s oi( du/natai me/nos i)sofari/zein Il.6.101; e)/rga d' *)aqhnai/h| . . i)sofari/zoi 9.390; mnh/mhn ou)/tina/ fhmi *simwni/dh| -fari/zein Simon.146, cf. Theoc.7.30: generally,
to be equal to, tini Il.21.194, Hes.Op.490. trans.,
make equal, Nic.Th.572.

i)so/-fqoggos, on,
sounding equally, Nonn.D.6.202.
i)so/-fonos, on, gloss on a)nti/fonos, Sch.A.Th.895.

i)so-fori/a, h(,
equal or
regular movement, o)rxhstou= Poll.4.97.
i)so-fo/rios, on, dub. sens. in POxy. 1684.4 (iv A.D.).

i)so-fo/ros, on,
bearing or
drawing equal weights, equal in strength, bo/es . . h(/likes, i)sofo/roi Od.18.373; ta\ ske/lh toi=s w)/mois -fo/ra e)/xein X.Smp.2.20. proparox.,
moving regularly, Poll.4.97.

i)/sofrus, o(, name of a
plant, Herm.Trism.in Rev.Phil.32.252.

i)so/-frwn, onos, o(, h(,
fair-minded, eu)qunth/r IG9(1).877 (Corc., i B.C.).

i)so-fu^h/s, e/s,
of equal growth, i.e.
symmetrical, coined as etym. of o)sfu/s, Arist.HA493a23.
like in character, Thphr.HP 3.7.4.

i)so/-fwton, to/, name of an
eyesalve, Aët.7.112 (109 Lat. vers.).

i)so-xeilh/s, e/s,
level with the brim, kriqai\ i)soxeilei=s grains of malt
floating level with the brims of the vessels, i.e. on the surface of the liquor, X.An.4.5.26; zwro\n kera/sas i)soxeile/a AP6.105 (Apollonid.); i). th\n ka/tw siago/na poih/sas [o( ba/traxos]
level with the surface of the water, Arist.HA536a16: c. dat., *eu)fra/ths i). th=| gh=| Arr.An.7.7.5;
equally full, Max.Tyr.31.2.
i)so/-xeilos, on,= foreg., th=| gh=| Gp. 12.19.4, cf. 13.15.8.

i)so/-xeir, xeiros, o(, h(,
ambidextrous, Philostr. Gym.41.

i)so/-xnoos, on,
equally woolly with, tini AP6.252 (Antiphil.).
i)so/-xoiron, Achaean for bou/qouton (i.e. bou/quton), Hsch. s.h.v.

i)so/-xoos, on,
of the same number of xo/es, o)/cos i). u(/dati Hp. Morb.2.26.

i)so/-xordos, on,
with like strings, Hsch. s.v. a)nti/xorda.

i)soxron-e/w,
to be as old as, tini Luc.Syr.D.3;
to have the same period of maturity, to\ mh\ -xronei=n ta\ spe/rmata kaqa/per kai\ ta\ zw=|a Thphr.CP4.11.9. Gramm.,
have the same number of timeunits, of syllables, A.D.Synt.257.16; of feet, -xronou=ntes po/des Aristid.Quint.1.23.

i)soxro/n-ios, on,= sq., Thphr.CP4.11.2, Euc.Phaen. p.4 M., al., HeroDioptr.38; strofh/ Cleom.2.4; diasth/mata Ptol. Tetr.36: c. dat., to\ -xro/nion ei)=nai to\ para\ fu/sin tw=| kata\ fu/sin Simp. in Cael.430.6. Adv. -i/ws Ptol.Alm.13.2, Heph.Astr.1.10; tw=| h(li/w| Theo Sm.p.171 H.

i)so/xron-os, on,
equal in period of revolution, oi( a)planei=s a)ste/res i)so/xronoi/ ei)sin a)llh/lwn Eudox.Ars16.15;
equal in period of maturity, cj. in Thphr.CP1.18.3 (perisso/xronos codd., pariso/- Schneid., alternatively).
contemporary, Gloss.; tinos Vit. Theoc.
even, regular, sfugmo/s Gal.8.830. Adv. -nws Eudox.Ars5.8, Gem.6.27, S.E.M.5.83, Ruf.Syn.Puls.3. Gramm.,
consisting of the same number of time-units, A.D.Synt.272.23, Hermog.Id.1.12, Aristid.Quint.1.23.

i)so/-xroos, on,
of uniform colour, Dsc.2.146.

i)so/-xru_sos, on,
like gold, worth its weight in gold, Archipp.49, Archestr.Fr.15.3. i)so/xruson, to/, name of an
eyesalve, CIL13.10021.85, Gal.12.785.

i)so-yhfi/a, h(,
equality of votes, D.H.7.64.
equal right to vote, Plu.CG9.

i)so-yhfisth/s, ou=, o(,
valuer, cj. for -yi/sths in Gloss.

i)so/-yhfos, on,
with or
by an equal number of votes, h)\n i). kriqh=| A.Eu.741; i). di/kh ib.795.
having an equal vote with others, cu/mmaxoi Th.1.141, cf. 3.11; of a commander, ib.79; poiei=n [du/namin] i)so/yhfo/n tini Pl.Lg.692a; of communities,
possessing an equal franchise, e)leuqerw/sas th/nd' i). po/lin E.Supp.353.
voting alike, D.H.4.20.
equal in numerical value, of words
in which the values of letters added together make up the same sum, "*damago/ran" kai\ "loimo\n" i)so/yhfo/n tis a)kou/sas (both words make up 270), AP11.334; i)so/yhfos dusi\ tou/tois "*ga/i+os" w(s "a(/gios", w(s "a)gaqo\s" prole/gw IGRom.4.743 (Eumenia), cf. Gell.14.6.4, Artem.3.34, 4.24; for examples cf. the epigrams of Leonidas, AP6.321 sqq. i). e(sti/a, name of a plaster, containing a number of drachms
equal to the numerical value of its name, Nech. ap. Aët.15.13.

i)so/-yistos and i)so-yi/sths,=
aestimator, Gloss. (dub.).

i)so/-yu_xos, on,
of equal spirit, kra/tos i). A.Ag.1470 (lyr.). Adv. -xws, ma/xesqai Eust.831.52.
of like soul or
mind, Ep.Phil.2.20.

i)so/w [i^, exc. in Od. l.c.],
make equal, tini/ ti S.El.686, Ar.V.565 (dub.l.), Hp.Morb.4.39:—Med., o)/nuxas xei=ra/s te i)sw/santo
they made their nails and hands
alike, i.e. used them in like manner, Hes.Sc. 263:—Pass. (with aor. 1 Med.),
to be made like or
equal to, toi=si/n ken e)n a)/lgesin i)swsai/mhn Od.7.212; qeoi=si me/n nun ou)k i)sou/meno/n s' . . kri/nontes S.OT31, cf. 581, Hp.l.c.: abs., i)sou/menos, opp. krei/ttwn, Pl. Phdr.239a;
to be made level, of a bank, POxy.1674.7(iii A.D.).

*(ispa_ni/a, h(,
Spain, Mon.Anc.Gr.16.1, Str.3.4.19, Agathem.7; a)po\ th=s *)ibhri/as h)\ *(ispani/as h)\ o(/pws a)/n tis o)noma/zein e)qe/lh| Gal.12.388; th\n *)ibhri/an te kai\
*spani/an (v.l. *(ispani/an） o)nomazome/nhn Id.6.613, cf. 12.428, D.S.5.37.
*(ispa_no/s, h/, o/n, Spanish, ma/xairai Ph.Bel.71.14, etc.: *(ispano/n, to/, a kind of oil, in form *spa=non or *spano/n, Gal.10.551,790,822, 12.513, POxy.2052 (vi A.D.), Gp.9.26; h(
*spa/nh [liqa/rguros] Dsc.5.87.
i)/ssa, exclam. of malicious triumph over another's distress, Pl. Com.66, Men.36; i)ssa=| Herod.3.94. (Onomatop.; cf. si/tta.)
i)/ssasqai: klhrou=sqai, *le/sbioi, Hsch.
i)sse/la, i)tqe/la, v. i)calh=.
i)sso/qeos, v. i)so/qeos fin.
i(/ssupos,= u(/sswpos, PGoodsp.Cair.30.42 (ii A.D.).

i(sta/nw, later collat. form of i(/sthmi, first in inf. i(sta/nein, （a)nq-) PPetr.2p.120 (iii B.C.), (kaq-) Michel 1006.22 (Teos, ii B.C.), (sun-) Plb.3.108.4, (a)pokaq-) Ascl.Tact.10.9, cf. Dsc.4.43, etc.; cf. i(sta/nai *)attikoi/, i(sta/nein *(/ellhnes Moer.200; part. (e)f）ista/nontes Plb.11.2.5; to\ i(sta/non Simp.in Ph.1257.34: ind. i(sta/nei Philistio ap.Ath.3.115e, i(sta/nomen Ep.Rom.3.31, (par）ista/nousi Phld.Rh.1.266S., etc.: impf. (sun）i/stanon Plb.4.5.6, (di-) App.Hisp.36, etc.:—Pass., i(stano/menos IG22.1343.26 (i B.C.):—introduced by the copyists into Lys. 25.3, Is.2.29, etc.
i(sta/rion, to/, Dim. of i(sto/s, Men.142, PLond.5.1728.13 (vi A.D.), Choerob.in Theod.1.332.
i(sta/rxhs, ou, o(,= i(stwna/rxhs, Ostr.1155.

i(sta/w, collat. form of i(/sthmi, 3sg. pres. i(sta=| Hdt.2.143, 4.103: impf. i(/sta Id.2.106 (v.l. i(/sth): freq. in later Gr., (kaq-) UPZ18.11 (ii B.C.), Aristeas 228, (sun-) Str.9.5.16, cf. Dsc.1.129 (v.l. in 4.43), Aesop.340, Them.Or.23.292c, etc.

i(stei=on, to/,= i(stew/n, PCair.Zen.176.323 (iii B.C.): gen. pl. written i(ste/wn BGU1359, al.,
PTeb.ined.703.90.

i)ste/on, (*ei)/dw, oi)=da)
one must see, i)ste/on dh/ Pl.Tht.202e; i). h)/dh ti/ e)sti\ to\ pra=gma Id.Smp.217c.
one must know, Gal.5.480, Sch. Nic.Th.11.

i(stew/n, w=nos, o(,
weaving-shed, Men.Sam.19: censured by Phryn. 144.

i(/sthmi (cf. i(sta/w, i(sta/nw), causal,
make to stand, imper. i(/sth Il.21.313, E.Supp.1230, kaq-i/sta Il.9.202: impf. i(/sthn, Ep. i(/staske Od.19.574; 3pl. i(/stan B.10.112: fut. sth/sw, Dor. sta_sw= Theoc.5.54: aor. 1 e)/sthsa, Ep. 3pl. e)/sta^san for e)/sthsan dub. in Od.18.307, 3.182, 8.435, al. (v. e)/sta^san): hence, in late Poets, e)/sta^sas, e)/sta^se, AP9.714,708 (Phil.): aor. 1 Med. e)sthsa/mhn (never intr.), v. infr.A.111.2, 3: pf. e(/sta^ka Cerc.3, (kaq-) Hyp.Eux.28, UPZ 112.5 (ii B.C.), (peri-) Pl.Ax.370d, (a)f-) LXXJe.16.5, (par-) Phld.Rh. 1.9S., al., (sun-) S.E.M.7.109; also e(/sthka (v. infr.) in trans. sense, (di-) Arist.Vent.973a18, (a)f-) v.l. in LXX l.c.; e(stakei=a trans. in Test.Epict.1.25. intr.,
stand, Act., aor. 2 e)/sthn, Ep. sta/skon Il.3.217; 3pl. e)/sthsan, more freq. in Hom. e)/stan, sta/n [a^]; imper. sth=qi, Dor. sta=qi Sapph.29, Theoc.23.38; subj. stw=, Ep. 2 and 3sg. sth/h|s, sth/h| (for sth=|s, sth=|), Il.17.30, 5.598; 1pl. ste/wmen (as disyll.) 22.231, stei/omen 15.297; opt. stai=en, Ep. 3pl. stai/hsan 17.733; inf. sth=nai, Ep. sth/menai 17.167, Od.5.414, Dor. sta=men Pi.P.4.2; part. sta/s: pf. e(/sthka: plpf. e(sth/kein, sts. with strengthd. augm. ei(sth/kein, as E.HF925, Ar.Av.513, Th.1.89, etc.; Ion. 3sg. e(sth/kee Hdt. 7.152:—from Hom. downwds. the shorter dual and pl. forms of the pf. are preferred, e(/sta^ton, e(/sta^men, e(/sta^te, e(sta=si (IG12(8).356 (Thasos, vi B.C.), etc.), in Hdt. e(ste/a_si; imper. e(/sta^qi Aristomen. 5; subj. e(stw=; opt. e(stai/hn; inf. e(sta/nai, Ep. e(sta/men, e(sta/menai （e(sthke/nai only late, as Ael.VH3.18); part. e(stw/s （e(sthkw/s rare in early Gr., Hdt.2.126, Pl.Men.93d, Lg.802c, Arist. (infr. B.11.2), Alex.126.16, ei(sthko/ta IG12.374.179), fem. e(stw=sa (not e(stui=a; but sunesthkuiw=n prob. in Hp.
Aër.10), neut. e(sto/s Pl.Ti.40b, Tht. 183e, SIG1234（Lycia), etc., (kaq-) POxy.68.32 (ii A.D.), (e)n-) PRyl. 98（
a).10 (ii A.D.), (par-) Ar.Eq.564 (-w/s freq. v.l. as in Pl. and Ar. ll.cc., preferred by Choerob.in Theod.2.313); gen. e(stw=tos; Ion. e(stew/s, e(steo/s, w=tos; Ep. e(sthw/s Hes.Th.747; dat. pl. e(sthw=si cj. in Antim.16.5, cf. Call.Dian.134; Hom. does not use the nom., but has gen. e(sta^o/tos, acc. e(sta^o/ta, nom. pl. e(sta^o/tes, as if from e(staw/s: so also plpf. e(sta/thn, e(/sta^men, e(/sta^te, e(/sta^san: late pres. e(sth/kw, formed from pf., Posidipp. ap. Ath.10.412e: hence, fut. e(sth/cw Hom. Epigr.15.14, X.Cyr.6.2.17, Hegesipp.1.25, e(sth/comai X.Cyn.10.9 codd. Pass., i(/stamai: imper. i(/staso Hes.Sc.449, i(/stw S.Ph. 893, Ar.Ec.737: impf. i(sta/mhn: fut. sta^qh/somai And.3.34, Aeschin. 3.103: more freq. sth/somai Il.20.90, etc.: aor. e)sta/qhn Od.17.463, etc.; rarely e)/sthn, Dor. 3sg. e)/ssta SIG56.43 (Argos, v B.C.): pf. e(/stamai （di-) v.l. in Pl.Ti.81d, kateste/atai v.l. in Hdt.1.196. (From I.-E.
sthā-, cf. Skt.
sthā- (aor.
á-sthā-t), Lat.
stare, etc.; Gr. redupl. pres. and pf. fr.
si-sthā-, se-sthā-.) Causal,
make to stand, set up, pele/keas e(cei/hs Od.19.574; e)/gxos me/n r(' e)/sthse fe/rwn pro\s ki/ona
he set it against the pillar, 1.127, cf. Il. 15.126; i(. i(sto/n
set up the loom, or
raise the mast (v. i(sto/s 1 and 11); krhth=ras sth/sasqai
to have bowls
set up, Od.2.431; qeoi=s . . krhth=ra sth/sasqai in honour of the gods, Il.6.528; sth=sai/ tina o)rqo/n, st. o)rqa\n kardi/an, Pi.P.3.53,96; o)rqw=| st. e)pi\ sfurw=| Id.I.7(6).13; e)s o)rqo\n i(. tina/ E.Supp.1230; o( *canqi/as to\n fallo\n o)rqo\n sthsa/tw Ar.Ach.243; o)rqo\n ou)=s i(/sthsin S.El.27; sth=sai lo/gxas, for battle, Id.Ant.145(lyr.); esp.
raise buildings, statues, trophies, etc., i(. a)ndria/nta Hdt.2.110; tropai=a S.Tr.1102; tropai=on i(. tw=n polemi/wn Isoc.4.150, cf.IG22.1457.26; tropai=on sthsa/menoi X.HG2.4.7; tropai=on a)\n sth/saito tw=n tau/ths tro/pwn Ar.Pl.453; ta\ makra\ sth=sai tei/xh Th.1.69; i(. tina\ xalkou=n
set him
up in brass,
raise a brazen statue to him, D.13.21, 19.261 (so in pf.,
stand, ou(=tos e(/sthke li/qinos Hdt.2.141:—Pass., sfurh/latos e)n *)olumpi/a sta/qhti Pl.Phdr.236b; staqh=nai xalkou=s Arist.Rh.1410a33).
set, place, of things or persons, tri/pod' e)/stasan e)n puri/ Od.8.435, etc.; w(/s s' a)/gxi gh=s sth/swsi *kadmei/as S.OC399, etc.;
fix, tou\s o)fqalmou\s ei)s th\n gh=n Philostr.VA1.10; esp.
set men
in order or
array, pezou\s d' e)co/piqe sth=sen Il.4.298, cf. 2.525, etc.; sth=sai/ tinas teleutai/ous X. Cyr.6.3.25, etc.
bring to a standstill, stay, check, lao\n de\ sth=son Il.6.433; ne/as, i(/ppous, h(mio/nous sth=sai, Od.3.182, Il.5.755, 24.350; mu/lhn sth=sai
to stop the mill, Od.20.111; sth=sen a)/r' (sc. h(mio/nous) 7.4; sth=se d' e)n *)amnisw=| (sc. nh=a) 19.188; ba=rin Iamb.Myst.6.5; sth=sai th\n fa/lagga
halt it, X.Cyr.7.1.5; i(/sthsi r(ou=n Pl.Cra.437b, etc.; i(/. th\n yuxh\n e)pi\ toi=s pra/gmasin ib.437a; st. ta\ o)/mmata
fix them, of a dying man, Id.Phd.118; st. to\ pro/swpon
compose the countenance, X.Cyr.1.3.9; sth/santes e)pi\ tou/twn th\n dih/ghsin Plb. 3.2.6: esp. in Medic., i(/. koili/an Dsc.1.20; ta\s koili/as Philotim. ap. Orib.4.10.1; ai(morragi/as Dsc.1.129: abs., Arist.HA605a29:—Med., i(sta/menos tw=| nosh/mati Hp.Ep.19 (Hermes 53.65).
set on foot, stir up, koni/hs . . i(sta=sin o)mi/xlhn Il.13.336; i(/sth de\ me/ga ku=ma 21.313; nefe/lhn e)/sthse *kroni/wn Od.12.405, cf. Il.5.523; of battle, etc., fulo/pida sth/sein
stir up strife, Od.11.314; e)/rin sth/santes 16.292 (so intr. fu/lopis e(/sthke the fray
is on foot, Il.18.172):—also in Med., sthsa/menoi d' e)ma/xonto ib.533, Od.9.54; pole/mous i(/stasqai Hdt.7.9.b', 175, 236; so i(sta/nai boh/n A.Ch.885; kraugh/n E.Or.1529 (Pass., qo/rubos i(/statai boh=s
arises, S.Ph.1263); also of passions and states of mind, mh=nin, e)lpi/da sth=sai, Id.OT699, E.IA788(lyr.).
set up, appoint, tina\ basile/a Hdt.1.97; tu/rannon S.OT940, cf. OC1041, Ant.666:—Med., e)sta/santo tu/rannon Alc.37A; fu/lakas sthso/meqa Pl.R.484d:—Pass., o( u(po\ *darei/ou staqei\s u(/parxos Hdt.7.105, cf. IG 9(1).32.23 (Stiris, ii B.C.).
establish, institute, xorou/s, pannuxi/da, Hdt.3.48, 4.76 (so sth/sasqai h)/qea/ te kai\ no/mous Id.2.35; a)gw=na h.Ap.150); sth=sai xoro/n, *)olumpia/da, e(orta/n, Pi.P.9.114, O.2.3, 10(11).58; kteri/smata S.El.433; xorou/s B.10.112, D.21.51; ou)x u(giw=s i(sta/menos lo/gon
setting up a bad argument, Anon.Lond.26.34:—Pass., a)gorh\ i(/statai/ tini Hdt.6.58. = Lat.
statuere, determine, gnw=nai kai\ sth=sai D.H.8.68; diageinw/skein kai\ i(sta/nai Not. Arch.4.21 (Aug.):—Pass., ta\ u(po/ tinos staqe/nta OGI665.27 (Egypt, i A.D.); ta\ e(stame/na Wilcken Chr.167.27 (ii B.C.).
fix by agreement, o( staqei\s to/kos PGrenf.1.31.1 (i B.C.), cf. PFlor.14.11 (iv A.D.); to\ e(stame/non e)noi/kion BGU253.15 (iii A.D.).
bring about, cause, a)mpnoa/n Pi.P.4.199; sth=sai du/skhlon xqo/na
make its case desperate, A.Eu.825.
place in the balance, weigh, Il.19.247, 22.350, 24.232, Ar.V.40; [e)kpw/mata] Thphr.Char.18.7; a)riqmou=ntes kai\ metrou=ntes kai\ i(sta/ntes X.Cyr.8.2.21, etc.; i(sta/nai ti pro\s a)rgu/rion
weigh a thing against silver, Hdt.2.65; a)gaqo\s i(sta/nai good
at weighing, Pl.Prt.356b; to\ e)ggu\s kai\ to\ po/rrw sth/sas e)n tw=| zugw=| ibid., cf. Lys.10.18; e)pi\ to\ i(sta/nai e)lqei=n have recourse to
the scales, Pl.Euthphr.7c:—Pass., i(/stasqai e)pi\ zugou= Arr.Epict.1.29.15; staqei/s
weighed, IG11(2).161B113 (Delos, iii B.C.).
weigh out, pay, LXX 3 Ki.21.39, cf. Za.11.12, Ev.Matt.26.15. Pass. and intr. tenses of Act.,
to be set or
placed, stand, Hom. etc., a)gxou=, a)=sson, Il.2.172, 23.97; a)/nta tino/s 17.30; e)s me/sson Od.17.447; staqei\s e)s me/son Hdt.3.130; a)nti/oi e)/stan, e)nanti/oi e)/sthsan, Il.1.535, Od.10.391: prov. of critical circumstances, e)pi\ curou= i(/statai a)kmh=s Il.10.173: freq. merely a stronger form of ei)=nai,
to be in a certain place or state, a)rgu/reoi staqmoi\ e)n xalke/w| e(/stasan ou)dw=| Od.7.89, etc.; e(sta/tw for e)/stw, S.Aj.1084; ta\ nu=n e(stw=ta,= ta\ nu=n, Id.Tr.1271 (anap.); e)moi\ d' a)/xos e(/sta_ken Id.Aj.200(lyr.): with Adv., cumfora=s i(/n' e(/stamen, i(/n' e(/st. xrei/as, in what case or need
we are, Id.Tr.1145, OT1442; pou= tu/xhs e(/sthken; Id.Aj.102; later also a)di/kws, o)rqw=s, eu)labw=s i(/stasqai,
behave wrongly, etc., Plb.18.3.2, 33.6.3, 18.33.4.
take up an intellectual
attitude, w(s i(/stasqai dei= peri\ xrhma/twn kth/sews Phld.Oec.p.38J.; ou)k o)rqw=s i(/. Id.Rh.1.53S. in pregnant sense, sth=nai e)s . . Hdt.9.21; st. e)s di/khn E.IT962; st. para/ tina Il.24.169 (but oi( mh\ sta/ntes para\ ta\ deina/ those who did not
face the danger, D.H.9.28): c. acc. loci, ti/ tou=t' ai)qeri/an e(/sthke pe/tran; E.Supp.987 (lyr.); sth=te to/nde tri/bon Id.Or.1251:c. acc. cogn., poi/an m' a)na/stasin dokei=s . . sth=nai; S.Ph.277.
stand still, halt, a)ll' a)/ge dh\ ste/wmen Il.11.348, cf. Od.6.211, 10.97; opp. feu/gw, 6.199, etc.;
stand idle, Il.4.243, al.; e(sta/nai
to be stationary, opp. kinei=sqai, Pl.R.436c, etc.; kata\ xw/rhn e(sta/nai Hdt.4.97; ou) mh\n e)ntau=q' e(/sthke to\ pra=gma
does not
rest here, D.21.102, cf. 10.36; e)a\n h( koili/a sth=| if the bowels
are constipated, Arist.HA588a8: c. part., ou) sth/setai a)dikw=n D.10.10;
come to a stop, rest satisfied, a)/n tis o)rqw=s e)piba/lh|, e)/peita staqh=| Epicur. Fr.423; ou)x i(sta/menoi Plot.3.1.2: impers., i(/statai
there is a stop, one comes to a stop, Arist.APr.43a37, al.; ou)k e)/sth e)ntau=qa kakoi=s genome/nois a)poqanei=n Plot.3.2.8; also i(/stasqai me/xri tou= ge/nous Them.in APo. 55.8,al. metaph.,
stand firm, X.HG5.2.23; th=| dianoi/a| Plb.21.11.3; of arguments or propositions,
hold good, Phld.Rh.1.83, 2.192 S.: part., e(sthkw/s
fixed, stable, Arist.GA776a35, EN1104a4, Metaph. 1047a15; dei= to\ kri/ma e(sthko\s kai\ ku/rion ei)=nai SIG826ii29 (Delph., ii B.C.); logismo\s e(stw\s kai\ nounexh/s Plb.3.105.9; te/xnai ou)k e)/xousai to\ e(sthko/s, a)lla\ to\ stoxastiko/n Phld.Rh.1.71S.(so Adv. e(sthko/tws, opp. stoxastikw=s, ib.70S.), cf. Iamb.Protr.21.k'; xrei/a e(sthkui=a kai\ tetagme/nh Plb.6.25.10; e(sthko/ta qewrh/mata, e(sthko/tes skopoi/, Phld.Rh.1.2S., Po.5.22; of age, e(sthkui=a h(liki/a Pl.Lg.802c; timai\ e(sthkui=ai
fixed prices,
PTeb.ined.703.177.
to be set up or
upright, stand up, rise up, krhmnoi\ e(/stasan Il.12.55; o)rqai\ tri/xes e)/stan 24.359, cf. A.Th.564(lyr.), Pl.Ion535c, etc.; koni/h i(/stato Il.2.151; i(/stato ku=ma 21.240; of a horse, i(/stasqai o)rqo/s to
rear, Hdt.5.111; i(/stasqai ba/qrwn
from the steps, S.OT143.
to be set up, erected, or
built, sth/lh, h(/ t' e)pi\ tu/mbw| e(sth/kh| Il.17.435; e(/stake tropai=on A. Th.954(lyr.); mnhmei=on Ar.Eq.268, etc.; v. supr. A.11. generally,
arise, begin, i(/stato nei=kos Il.13.333; cf. A. 111.2. in marking Time, e)/aros ne/on i(stame/noio when spring
is not long
begun, Od.19.519; e(/bdomos e(sth/kei mei/s the seventh month
was begun, Il. 19.117; tou= me\n fqi/nontos mhno/s, tou= d' i(stame/noio as one month ends and the next
begins, Od.14.162, cf. Hes.Op.780; later mh\n i(sta/menos, mesw=n, fqi/nwn, first in Hdt.6.57, 106, cf. And.1.121, Aeschin.3.67; sxedo\n h)/dh meshmbri/a i(/statai Pl.Phdr.242a.
to be appointed, sth=nai e)s a)rxh/n Hdt.3.80; v. supr. A.111.3.

i(sti/a, i)sti/a, i(sti/h, *(isti/h, *(istiai/a, v. e(sti/a. *(istiai+ko/s, h/, o/n, Histiaean, of currency, BCH2.579, 6.51, 35.260（Delos). i(sti/asis, ews, h(,= e(sti/asis, POxy.471.53 (ii A.D.). i(stiatori/a, h(,= e(st.,
feast, PTeb.584 (ii A.D.). i(stia/twr, v. e(stia/twr. i(stihto/rion, and i)so-a_to/rion, v. e(stiato/rion.

i(stio-drome/w,
run under full sail, Hp.Ep.17, Plb.1.60.9, D.S.3.28.

i(stio/-kwpos (sc. nau=s), h(,
with oars and sails, a type of boat, Gell. 10.25.5.

i(sti/on, to/ (Dim. of i(sto/s in form only),
web, cloth, sheet: hence in pl.,
hangings, LXXEx.27.9,15; as a measure,
piece, PRyl.70.25 (ii B.C.); but, from Hom. downwds.,
sail, mostly in pl. i(sti/a, e(/lkon d' i(sti/a leuka\ . . boeu=sin they hauled
them up with ox-hide ropes, Od.2.426; te/taq' i(sti/a
the sails were spread, 11.11, cf. Pi. N.5.51; i(sti/a ste/llesqai, mhru/esqai, kaqelei=n, to lower or furl
sail (v. sub vocc.): lu/ein Od.15.496; i(sti/oisi xra=sqai Hdt.4.110; a)/kroisi xrw/menos toi=s i(sti/ois Ar.Ra.1000: prov., plh/resin i(. under full
sail,
with all one's might, Philostr.VS1.25.5, cf. Suid.: rarely in sg., e)n d' a)/nemos prh=sen me/son i(sti/on Il.1.481; e)ci/ei i(. a)nemo/en Pi.P.1.92; i(sti/w| katapeta/sai tina/ Pl.Prm.131b, cf. PMagd.11.7 (iii B.C.).

i(stio-peth/s,
velivolus, Gloss.

i(stio-poie/omai, Pass.,
to be furnished with sails, of ships, Str.15.1.15.

i(stio-rra/fos [a^], o(, （r(a/ptw)
sailpatcher, CIG9175, Poll.7.160. metaph.,
tricky, cheating fellow, Ar.Th.935:—also i(stiarra/fos, Gramm.in Reitzenstein Ind.Lect. Rost.1892/3p.4.

i(sto-boeu/s, e/ws, Ion. h=os, o(,
plough-tree or
pole, Hes.Op.435, cf. A.R.3.1318: prov., i(stoboh=i ge/ronti ne/hn poti/balle korw/nhn put a new tip on the old
plough, of an old man marrying a young wife, Orac. ap. Paus.9.37.4.—Acc. i(stobo/hn, prob. f.l. for i(stoboh=, AP6.104（Phil.).

i(sto-do/kh, h(,
mast-holder, a piece of wood standing up from the stern, on which the mast rested when let down, Il.1.434; glossed by i(sto-qh/kh, Sch.D adloc., EM478.30.

i(sto-kerai/a, h(,
sail-yard, Orph.A.696, Artem.1.35.

i(sto-pe/dh, Dor. i(sto-pe/da, h(,
a piece of wood set in the keel
to which the mast was bound, or,
a hole in the keel
for stepping the mast, Od.12.51,162, Alc.18.6.

i(sto/-podes, oi(,= kele/ontes,
the long beams of the loom, between which the web was stretched, AP7.424 (Antip.Sid.): sg., Eub.145,POxy.264.5 (i A.D.).

i(sto-poii/a, h(,
loom-making, Sch.Nic.Th.11.

i(sto-po/nos, on,
working at the loom, AP6.48, Man.4.423; *palla/s AP6.247 (Phil.); kerki/des ib.9.778 (Id.); v.l. for i(sto/tonos, Ar.Ra.1315.

i(stor-e/w, (i(/stwr)
inquire into or
about a thing, ti Hdt.2.113, A. Pr.632, etc.; peri/ tinos Plb.3.48.12; also,
inquire about a person, tina S.OT1150, 1156; o(/d' ei)/m' *)ore/sths . . o(\n i(storei=s E.Or.380, cf. Tr.261: folld. by relat. clause, *ai)/gisqon e)/nq' w)/|khken i(storw= S.El. 1101.
examine, observe, xw/ran, po/lin, Plu.Thes.30, Pomp.40, cf. J.AJ1.11.4; th\n tou= *me/mnonos [su/rigga] OGI694.7; th\n su/nesi/n tinos Plu.Cic.2, etc.; tina\s a)poloume/nous Gal.11.109: hence,
to be informed about, know, kakw=s to\ me/llon i(storw=n A.Pers.454; pate/ra i(storei=s kalw=s Id.Eu.455, cf. Hp.Praec.12: metaph., ei)/ tis a)kti\s h(li/ou nin i(storei= ble/ponta
has news of him, A.Ag.676: folld. by relat., th\n porei/an i(storw=n, w(s dusdi/odos u(pa/rxei Plb.3.61.3;
read in history, Id.1.63.7. c. acc. pers.,
inquire of, ask, i(store/wn au)tou\s h(/ntina du/namin e)/xei o( *nei=los Hdt.2.19, cf. 3.77;
inquire of an oracle, E.Ion 1547;
visit a person for the purpose of inquiry, *khfa=n Ep.Gal.1.18:— Pass.,
to be questioned, klhqe/ntas i(store/esqai ei) . . Hdt.1.24; i(storou/menos S.Tr.415, E.Hel.1371. c. dupl.acc.,
inquire of one
about a thing, ti/ m' i(storei=s to/de Id.Ph.621, cf. Lyc.1. abs.,
inquire, a)koh= i(. Hdt.2.29, etc.; esp. in part., i(store/wn eu(/riske Id.1.56, etc.; ou)/q' o(rw=n ou)/q' i(storw=n S.OT1484; folld. by a relat. word, i(sto/reo/n te o(/tew| tro/pw| perige/noito Hdt.1.122.
give an account of what one has learnt, record, tou\s bi/ous tw=n xersai/wn Thphr.HP4.13.1, cf. Luc. Hist.Conscr.7, etc.; i(storou=si/ tines . .
it is stated that . . , Dsc.4.75, etc.:—freq. in Pass., o( karpo\s . . e)pilhmptikou\s i(storei=tai w)felei=n Id.1.83; peri/ tinos i(storei=tai dio/ti Phld.Mus.p.18K.; i(storei=tai peri\ *gorgou=s toiou=ton Plu.2.227e, cf. Id.Cic.1, Ael.Tact.34.3, etc.; *)apollo/dwros ei)/rhken a)pelqo/ntas *(/uantas i(storei=sqai
are represented as having gone, Str.10.3.4; tw=n i(storoume/nwn ou)deno\s h(=tton polupra/gmwn the most in dustrious person
on record, Phld.Mus.p.108K.

i(sto/r-hma, atos, to/,
narrative, tale, feukto\n i(. Anacreont.4.9; muqika\ i(. D.H.2.61, cf. Plu.Per.1: pl., maqh/mata kai\ i(. Aristid.Or.46(3).28.

i(stor-hte/on,
one must relate, lo/gon Plu.2.882b.

i(stor-i/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
inquiry, i(stori/h|si ei)de/nai ti para/ tinos Hdt.2.118, cf. 119; h( peri\ fu/sews i(. Pl.Phd.96a; ai( peri\ tw=n zw/|wn i(. Arist.Resp.477a7,al.; h( i(. h( peri\ ta\ zw=|a Id.PA674b16; h( zwikh\ i(. ib.668b30; peri\ futw=n i(., title of work by Theophrastus;
systematic or
scientific observation, Epicur.Ep.1p.29U.: abs., of
science generally, o)/lbios o(/stis th=s i(. e)/sxe ma/qhsin E.Fr.910 (anap.); of
geometry, Pythag. ap. lamb.VP18.89: in empirical medicine,
body of recorded cases, Gal.1.144;
mythology, *(hsi/odon pa/shs h)/ranon i(stori/hs Hermesian.7.22.
knowledge so obtained, information, Hdt.1 Praef., Hp.VM20; o)/yis e)mh\ kai\ gnw/mh kai\ i(. Hdt.2.99; pro\s i(stori/an tw=n koinw=n for
the knowledge of . . , D.18.144; h( th=s yuxh=s i(. Arist.de An.402a4.
written account of one's inquiries, narrative, history, prob. in this sense in Hdt.7.96; ai( tw=n peri\ ta\s pra/ceis grafo/ntwn i(. Arist.Rh.1360a37, Po.1451b3, Plb.1.57.5, al.; e)k tw=n i(storiw=n kai\ e)k tw=n a)/llwn marturiw=n OGI13.12 (iii B.C.); ai( *maiandri/ou i(. Inscr.Prien.37.105; koinh\ i(. general
history, D.H.1.2; i(. *(ellhnikh/, *(rwmai+kh/, Plu.2.119d; restricted by some to contemporary history, Lat.
rerum cognitio praesentium, Verr.Flacc. ap. Gell.5.18: generally,
story, account, Call.Aet.3.1.7.
i(storiagra/fos, v. i(storiogra/fos.

i(storiko/s, h/, o/n,
exact, precise, scientific, mi/mhsis Pl.Sph.267e; tw=n para\ toi=s a)/llois eu(rhme/nwn i(.
well-informed respecting . . or
able to recount . . , Arist.Rh.1359b32; a)podei/ceis i(storikw=n Phld.D.1.23. Adv. -kw=s
scientifically, accurately, Arist.GA757b35;
by personal observation, kat amaqei=n ti Gal.14.275.
belonging to history, historical, pragmatei=ai D.H.1.1; tu/pos (opp. logiko/s) Id.Dem.24; a)nagrafh/ Id.1.4; gra/mmata Plu.Them.13: Subst.,
historian, Arist. Po.1451b1, Aristeas 31, Phld.Rh.1.200S., D.H.4.6, D.S.1.6, etc.; -w/tatos basile/wn Plu.Sert.9. Adv. -kw=s, i(. kai\ didaskalikw=s Str. 1.1.10; i(. kai\ e)chghtikw=s, opp. a)podeiktikw=s, Phld.Mus.p.12 K.; but e)chghtikw/teron h)\ -w/teron, of Aristotle's method in HA, Antig.Mir.60.

i(storiogra^f-e/w,
write history, D.H.Th.42.

i(storiogra^f-i/a, h(,
history-writing, interpol. in J.Ap.1.19.
i(storiogra^f-iko/s, h/, o/n,= i(storiko/s 11, Sch. D.T.p.167 H.

i(storio/gra^f-os, o(,
writer of history, historian, Inscr.Prien.37.107 (ii B.C.), Plb.2.62.2, Phld.Rh.1.359 S., D.S.1.9, Ath.Mech.7.2, etc.:
chronicler, as distd. from suggrafeu/s (writer of contemporary history), Sch.D.T.p.168H.; *)/eforos o( i(., opp. *(hro/dotos o( suggr., Placit.4.1.6:—Dor. i(storiagra/fos, oi( i(. oi( suggegrafo/tes ta\s *magnh/twn pra/ceis SIG560.13, cf. 702.3 (Delph., ii B.C.), 685.93 (Crete).

i(sto/r-ion, to/, (i(/stwr)
fact or
illustration in proof, Hp.Nat.Puer. 31, Morb.4.54, Ep.19 (Hermes53.66).

i(sto/r-isma, atos, to/,
clinical history, Gal.17(1).648 (pl.).

i(stor-iw/dhs, es,
like history, Tz.H.8 No. 231 tit.

i(sto/s, o(, (i(/sthmi)
anything set upright:
mast, i(sto\n . . sth=san a)ei/rantes they stepped
the mast, Od.15.289, cf. Il.23.852, etc.; i(stou\s sthsa/menoi Od.9.77. cf. Il.1.480; i(sto\n ai)/resqai X.HG6.2.29; opp. kaqairei=n, ka\d d' e(/lon i(sto/n took
it down, unstepped
it, Od.15.496; kerai/a kai\ i(. IG22.657.14: generally,
rod, pole, i(sto\s xa/lkeos Hdt.8.122;
beam, IG22.1672.306 (pl.).
beam of a loom, which stood upright, instead of lying horizontal as in our looms; po/ssw kate/ba toi a)f' i(stw=; (sc. to\ e)mpero/nama) Theoc.15.35; later i(. o)/rqios (opp. the horizontal loom), Artem.3.36: generally,
loom, i(sto/n t' h)laka/thn te Il.6.491, Schwyzer180 (Crete), etc.; i(. sth/sasqai to set up
the beam and so begin a web, Hes.Op.779; i(. e)poi/xesqai to traverse
the loom, because the weaver was obliged to walk to and fro, Il.1.31, Od.5.62.
warp fixed to the beam: hence,
the web itself, i(sto\n u(/faine Il.3.125, etc.; h)mati/h me\n u(fai/nesken me/gan i(., nu/ktas d' a)llu/esken Od. 2.104; i(. metaxeiri/zesqai Pl.Phd.84a; o( e)ktetmhme/nos i(.
the web cut from the loom and finished, opp. o( pro\s e)ktomh/n, Artem.l.c.;
web of a certain size, piece, PHib.1.67.12 (iii B.C.), etc.; o)qoni/wn i(. tprisxi/lioi Plb.5.89.2; trei=s i(. kaqelei=n Str.8.6.20. i(. a)raxna=n spiders'
webs, B.3.7.
comb of bees, Arist.HA624a5.
shinbone, leg, Opp.C.1.408. a constellation, Aët.3.164.

i(sto/-tonos, on,
stretched on the loom, phni/smata v.l. in the codd. other than Rav. for i(sto/pona, Ar.Ra.1315; kerki/s E.Hyps.Fr.1 ii 10 (lyr.).
i(sto-tri^bh/s, v. i)sotribh/s.
i(stoury-ei=on, to/,= i(stw/n, Gloss.

i(stoury-e/w,
work at the loom, S. OC340, Trypho ap.Ath.14.618d (Epit.), Orph.Fr.192.

i(stoury-i/a, h(,
weaving, Pl.Smp.197b, Alciphr.3.41.

i(stoury-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for weaving, Poll.7.35, 10.126; h( i(. (sc. te/xnh),= foreg., Phld.Mus.p.24 K. Adv. -kw=s Poll.7.35.

i(stoury-o/s, o( or h(,
worker at the loom, weaver, PSI4.371.8 (iii B.C.), J.BJ1.24.3.

i(stofo/ros, on,
bearing a mast, Hsch.

i(/strac, a kind of
bird, Hsch. (fort. te/trac).

*)/istros, o(,
Ister, Danube, Hes.Th.339, etc.; *)/istros, h(,
Milesian colony at its mouth, St.Byz.; also called *)istri/a, h(, Arr. ap. eund., Ion. -ih, Hdt.2.33:—Adj. *)istria_no/s, Ion. i(stoury-hno/s, h/, o/n,
of or
from Istria, Hdt.4.78, St.Byz., etc.; *)istriana\ pro/swpa
tattooed masks, like the faces of Scythian slaves, Ar.Fr.88; *)istrianai\ zeirai/ Scythian tunics, prob. for i)spnia=tai seirai/ (glossed i)strhni/des), Theognost. Can.14; i)striana/, ta/, covers for the baskets carried by kanhfo/roi, Poll.10.191:—fem. *)istria_ni/des, of these garments and covers, Hsch.; but also *)istriani/dwn u(/fh S.Fr.210.67.

i)stri/des, ai(, a kind of
garment (perh.f.l. for foreg.(or for vestr-)), Hsch. i)stua/zei: o)rgi/zetai, Id.; cf. oi)=stros. i)stulo/n: to\ stuxhdo/n (leg. stoixhdo/n), Id. i)/stw, 3sg. imper. of oi)=da; cf. i)/ttw.

i(stw/n, w=nos, o(,= i(stew/n (q.v.),
weaving-shed, Varro RR1.2.21.

i(stwn-a/rxhs, ou, o(,
controller of weaving, PGiss.12, Ostr.1154, al.

i(stwn-arxi/a, h(,
his office, PRyl.98.5 (ii A.D.), BGU753iv 4 (iii A.D.).

i)/stwr or i(/stwr, Boeot. vi/stwr Schwyzer 491, etc., oros, o(, h(:—
one who knows law and right, judge, e)pi\ i)/stori pei=rar e(le/sqai Il.18.501; i)/stora d' *)atrei/dhn *)agame/mnona qei/omen a)/mfw 23.486; vi/stores
witnesses, IG7.1779 (Thespiae); tw= teqmi/w vi/stwr Schwyzer 523.64 (Orchom. Boeot.); qeou\s pa/ntas i(/storas poieu/menos Hp.Jusj.init., cf. Poll.8.106. Adj.
knowing, learned, Hes.Op.792; i(/. tino/s
knowing a thing,
skilled in it, w)|dh=s h.Hom.32.2; e)gxe/wn B.8.44; ka)gw\ tou=d' i)/. u(peri/stwr S.El.850 (lyr), cf. E.IT1431, Pl.Cra.406b. (From vid-twr, cf. *ei)/dw, oi)=da: i(/stwr acc. to Hdn.Gr.2.108, etc.)
i)sfai/nein: merimna=n, Hsch.

i)/sfnion, to/, prob. f.l. for i)/sqmion,
neck of a jar, E.Fr.656: prov., xalepo\s bi/os i)/sfni' a)/gontos, expld. of a potter's life, cod.Par. ap. Nauck l.c., nisi leg. *)/isqmi' (cf. i)sqmia/zw).
i)/sfwres: lh|stai/, kle/ptai (Lacon.), Hsch.
i)sxa/dion [a^], to/, Dim. of i)sxa/s, Ar.Pl.798.

i)sxa^do-ka/ru^on [ka^], to/,
mixture of figs and almonds, Arr.Epict. 4.7.23: pl., ib.3.9.22,4.7.22.

i)sxa^do-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
dealer in figs, Pherecr.4, Nicoph.19:—fem. i)sxa^do/-pwlis, idos, Ar.Lys.564.

i)sxa^do-fa/gos [fa^], on,
eating figs, Hsch.s.v. kradofa/gos.

i)sxa^dw/nhs, ou, o(,
buyer of figs, Pherecr.4.

i)/sxaimos, on, (i)/sxw, ai(=ma)
staunching blood, Thphr.HP9.13.1, Dsc. 4.43;
styptic, Luc.Tim.46, Aret.CA2.6 (dat. pl. -ai/masi codd.), POxy.1088.19. i)/sxaimos, h(,
plant used as a styptic, Andropogon ischaemum, Thphr.HP9.15.3, Sch.Il.11.846.
i)sxai/nw, f.l. for i)sxa/nw or i)sxnai/nw (qq.v.).
i)sxaleu=sai: qhla/sai, Hsch. (Cf. a)ni/sxalos.) i)sxalwme/nai: dedermatwme/nai, Id. (cf. i)/calos).

i)sxa^na/w, Ep. lengthd. form of i)sxa/nw (cf. sq.): Ion. impf. i)sxana/askon Il.15.723:—
hold back, stay, 5.89; nu=n d' e)pei\ i)sxana/a|s (sc. me) Od.15.346:—Pass.,
hold back, wait, nhusi\n e)/pi . . e)elme/noi i)sxano/wnto Il.12.38; so\n mu=qon potide/gmenoi i)sxano/wntai Od.7.161, cf. Il. 19.234;
to be stayed, A.R.2.864. intr., c. gen.,
cling to, and so,
long after, desire eagerly, me/ga dro/mou i)sxano/wsan Il.23.300; i)sxano/wn
filo/thtos Od.8.288: c. inf., [mui=a] . . i)sxana/a| dake/ein Il.17.572; i)sxano/wsin i)dei=n Procl.h.Ven.2.6. (i)xan- is v. l. in Il.23.300, Od.8.288, and shd. prob. be preferred; cf. i)xana/w.)

i)sxa/nw [a^], Ep. lengthd. form of i)/sxw (v. foreg.),
hold in check, hinder, de/os i)sxa/nei a)/ndras Il.14.387; *ai)/ant' i)sxane/thn w(/s te prw\n i)sxa/nei u(/dwr 17.747; to\n d' ou)k i)/sxane desma/ h.Bacch.13: c. gen.,
keep back from, kru/os a)ne/ra e)/rgwn i)sxa/nei Hes.Op.495; so in Prose, o( h(/lios . . i)sxa/nei [to\n si=ton]
checks its growth, Thphr.CP4.13.6 (v.l. i)sxai/nei, fort. i)sxnai/nei).
get, obtain, have, a)pemnhmo/neuen h)/ a)na/logon th=| a)pomnhmoneu/sei pa/qos i)/sxa[ne]
had an experience . . , Epicur.Nat.27 G., cf. 51 G.; peri\ . . da/ktulon （daktu/lwn codd.) pa/qos i)sxa/nousin Vett.Val.65.13; ma=llon e)k tw=n pragma/twn h)\ e)k tw=n lo/gwn ta\s laba\s i)sxa/nousi Phld.Herc.873.6; e)me/qen pe/ri qumo\n a)rei/w i)/sxane A.R.1.902.

i)sxa/rion, to/, Dim. of i)sxi/on,
hip, Hero Aut.29.

i)sxa/s, a/dos, h(, (i)sxno/s)
dried fig, Ar.Eq.755, Hermipp.63.16, Alex. 162.15, Arist.HA577a10, IG22.1013.24, PCair.Zen.110 (iii B.C.), Theoc.1.147, etc.; i)sxa/dos e)gkw/mion POxy.2084; also, of
over-ripe olives, Eust.1963.55.
spurge, Euphorbia Apios, Thphr.HP9.9.6, Dsc.4.175, Plin.HN26.72. (i)/sxw)
that which holds, anchor, S.Fr.761, Luc.Lex.15.
i)/sxaudai: i)sx[n]o/fwnoi, Hsch.

i)sxe/-ga_on, to/, (i)/sxw, gh=)
retaining wall, SIG241A7, 247I214 (Delph., iv B.C.).

i)sxe/-qu^ron, to/, perh.
frame of a window, IG11(2).165.10, al. (Delos, iii B.C.).

i)sxe/-plinqa, ta/,
uprights (perh.
doorjambs), SIG247I215 (Delph., iv B.C.).
i)sxerw/: e(ch=s, Hsch. (Cf. sxero/s.)

i)sxhth/rios, a, on, (i)/sxw)
astringent, Hp.Loc.Hom.20, cf. Erot.

i)sxi^-a^diko/s, h/, o/n, (i)sxi/on)
of the hips, fqi/sis Hp.Coac.140. of persons,
subject to sciatica, Dsc.1.30.6, Gal.13.986.
good for sciatica, e)pi/plasma Dsc.2.174 (as v.l.), cf. Gal.l.c.

i)sxi^-a/zw,
move the hips, of a rider, Procop.Goth.4.31; of a woman, Id.Arc.9; in walking, Suid., Phot. Pass., kai\ i)sxiasqe/nta, of a bandage, prob. f.l. for kai\ sxisqe/nta, Gal.18(1).786.
i)sxi^-a^ko/s, h/, o/n,= i)sxiadiko/s, Thphr.Fr.87, Cat.Cod.Astr.7.241.

i)sxi^-a/s (sc. no/sos), a/dos, h(,
hip-disease, Hp.Aph.6.59,60.
sciatica, ib.3.22 (pl.), Id.
Aër. 22 (pl.), Thphr.HP9.13.6 (pl.); i). xroni/a Dsc.1.10. = leuka/kanqa, Id.3.19, cf. Gal.12.58.

i)sxi^/-a^sis, ews, h(,
hip-disease, Pall.in Hp.2.13D.
i)sxi^-oi/dhs (oi)de/w）: o( mega/la i)sxi/a e)/xwn, Com.Adesp. 1022.

i)/sxi^-on (parox.), to/,
hip-joint, in which the thigh turns, kat' i)sxi/on, e)/nqa te mhro\s i)sxi/w| e)nstre/fetai, kotu/lhn de/ te/ min kale/ousin Il. 5.305, cf. 11.339, Od.17.234, etc.; later to\ kat' i)sxi/on a)/rqron Gal. UP15.8; also, the intra-capsular ligament of the hip-joint, Poll.2.186; = kefalh\ tou= mhrou=, Hp.Art.53,58, Cael.Aur.TP4.38. in pl. (dual, Autocr.1.6),
fleshy parts round the hip-joint, haunches, of a boar, i)sxi/a te gloutou/s te Il.8.340; of a lion, pleura/s te kai\ i)sxi/a 20.170; of a horse, Pl.Phdr.254c, cf. e; freq. of men, e)k tw=n mhrw=n e)/s te ta\ i). kai\ ta\s lapa/ras Hdt.6.75, cf. X.Eq.7.7; i)sxi/wn fu/sin . . pro\s ta\s a)napau/seis xrh/simon Arist.PA689b15; ta\ i). sarkw/dh e)poi/hsen [h( fu/sis] ib.b14: hence, other animals are said to have no i)., ib. b6,33. later,
the projecting part of the os innominatum, upon which man rests when sitting, Gal.2.772.

i)sxiorrwgiko/s, h/, o/n, (r(w/c)
with broken hips, limping, me/tron i). an iambic trimeter ending in five long syilables ascribed to Ananius, Gramm. Harl. in Studemund
Ind. Lect. Vratisl. 1887/8p.16:—also i)sxiorrw/c (sc. sti/xos), w=gos, o(, Tz.in An.Ox.3.310.

i)sxn-ai/nw, fut. -a^nw= （sun-) E.IA694 codd.: aor. i)/sxna_na A.Eu. 267, Ar.Ra.941; Ion. -hna Hdt.3.24, Hp.Off.13:—Med. (v. katisxnai/nw) :—Pass., aor. i)sxna/nqhn Id.Coac.369, 407: (i)sxno/s):—
make dry, wither, e)pea
 to
 nekro
 i)sxnh/nwsi, of a mummy, Hdt.3.24, cf. Hp.Aph.5.22, A.Eu.267, Pl.Grg.522a, etc.; i). to\ sw=ma Hp.Art. 33, cf. Pl.Plt.293b, Arist.Metaph.1048b27; e)/pine bru=ton i)sxnai/nwn xro/a A.Fr.124.
reduce a swelling, Hp.Liqu.6, Aph.5.25: metaph., sfudw=nta qumo
 i).
to bring down a proud stomach, A.Pr. 382; to\ deino
 kai\ diafqare
 frenw=n i)/sxnaine E.Or.298; th
 te/xnhn oi)dou=san i)/sxnana I
reduced the swollen art (Tragedy), Ar.Ra.941.— In the metaph. sense, i)sxai/nw is a constant v.l. (as in the compds. katisxnai/nw, sunisxnai/nw); cf. i)sxa/nw fin.
i)sxn-a^le/os, v. i)sxale/os.

i)/sxn-ansis, ews, h(,
emaciation, Paul.Aeg.3.69, Aët.16.80(75), Mich.in PN46.6.

i)sxn-antiko/s, h/, o/n,
fit for reducing, Arist.Pr.885a28, Dsc.1.24.

i)sxn-a^si/a, Ion. -ih, h(,

i)sxn-asmo/s,, o(,
reducing treatment, tou= sw/matos Hp.Fract.14.
i)sxneu=sai: u(fei=nai, qhla/sai, Hsch. (Cf. i)sx<*>aleu=sai.) i)sxni/des: a)/gkurai, i)sxa/des: kai\ filh/matos ei)=dos, Id.

i)sxno-ka^la^mw/dhs, es,
with slender reed, Eust.1165.12.

i)sxno/-kwlos, on,
with thin limbs, Antyll. ap. Orib.7.16.15.

i)sxno-mu_qe/w, = leptologe/w, and i)sxno-mu_qi/a,, h(,
subtle dispute, Hsch.
i)sxno/-pous, podos, o(, h(, gloss on tanau/poda, Sch.Od.9.464.

i)sxno/s, h/, o/n,
dry, withered, fullei=a Ar.Ach.469; i). turo/s, opp. xlwro/s, Poll.6.48, POxy.1338 (v A.D.). of persons,
thin, lean, Hp.Aph.2.44, Theoc.10.27, etc.; i)sxnoi\ kai\ sfhkw/deis Ar.Pl.561; i)sxnoi\ kai\ a)/sitoi Pl.Lg.665e; i). e(/ceis a
spare habit of body, Plu.Lyc. 17; of roots, -o/terai Dsc.1.9,10; of the voice, i)sxno\n fqe/ggesqai to speak
thin or
small, Luc.Nigr.11.
weak, feeble, sfugmo/s Gal. 8.506.
reduced, of a swelling, ou(/tw a)\n ta/xista i)sxno\n to\ oi)/dhma ge/noito Hp.Fract.21, cf. Epid.4.26. Adv. -nw=s, e(sthkw/s
without external swelling, Id.Coac.481.
light, thin, of clothing materials, POxy.1535 B9 (ii/iii A.D.), etc.:metaph., of style,
spare, plain,
unadorned, i). xarakth/r D.H.Pomp.2, cf. Demetr.Eloc.190, Quint. 12.10.58, Plu.2.42d. Adv. -nw=s, ei)pei=n to speak
plainly, Plb.1.2.6; -nw=s i)dei=n th\n a)reth/n dub.l. in Lycurg.80. (Perh. cogn. with Lat.
vescus: a connexion with i)/sxw was imagined by the Greeks; cf. i)sxno/fwnos 11.)

i)sxnoskelh/s, e/s,
lean-shanked, D.L.5.1, Gal.6.322.

i)sxno/ths, htos, h(,
thinness, leanness, sarko/s Hp.
Aër.21; sw/matos Arist.HA581b26; fu/sios Aret.SA1.7. of style,
spareness, i.e.
plainness, i). fra/sews, of Lysias, D.H.Vett.Cens.5.1; cf. Phld.Rh.1.165S., Demetr.Eloc.14.
thinness, weakness of pronunciation, opp. plateiasmo/s, Quint.1.5.32.

i)sxnourgh/s, e/s,
finely wrought, gloss on eu)u+fh/s, Sch.S.Tr.602.

i)sxno-fwni/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
hesitancy of speech, Hp.Epid.2.5.1, Arist. Pr.895a16, 902b25.

i)sxno/-fwnos, on,
thin-voiced, weak-voiced, Phld. Po.2.25, Gal.17(1).186; of Isocrates, Plu.2.837a; of partridges, Antig.Mir.6; but,
having an impediment in one's speech (connected by the Greeks with i)/sxw）, oi( i). . . i)/sxontai tou= fwnei=n Arist.Pr.903a38, cf. 895a15, 905a21, AB100; i). kai\ traulo/s Hdt.4.155, cf. Hp.Epid.1.19; i). kai\ bradu/glwssos LXXEx.4.10, cf. Ezek. Exag.114; also of metals, etc., xruso\s kai\ li/qos u(po\ plhro/thtos i). kai\ dushxh= Plu.2.721c: metaph., h( fili/a i). ge/gonen e)n tw=| parrhsia/zesqai ib.89b. Adv. -fw/nws Zos.Alch.p.108B.

i)/sxn-wsis, ews, h(,
drying up, mastw=n Sor.1.59; of the body, Id.2.36.

i)sxn-wtiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for drying up or
reducing, du/namis Dsc.5.109 (interpol.).

i)sxome/nws, Adv., (i^sxw)
with checks or
hindrances, Pl.Cra.415c.

i)sxour-e/w,
suffer from retention of urine, Aret.SD2.4, Herod.Med. ap.Orib.10.37.2.

i)sxour-i/a, h(,
retention of urine, Sor.2.6, Gal.8.403, Herod.Med. ap. Orib.10.37.16.

i)sxu_r-iei/w, Desiderat. from sq.,
venture to affirm, Hp.Art.1, cf. Gal.18(1).309.

i)sxu_r-i/zomai, fut. -i^ou=mai Lys.6.35, Isoc.17.24: aor. i)sxu_ri^sa/mhn Th.5.26, Pl.Grg.489c:—
make oneself strong, be strong, i)sxurizo/menos u(f' i(/ppwn si/dhros
gaining force from the impetus of the horses, X.Cyr.6.4.18.
use one's strength, tw=| sw/mati Pl.l.c.; esp. in overcoming resistance, pro\s to\ polu\ h(=tton Arist.Pr.951a13; ei)s tou\s a)sqenei=s Id.EN1124b23;
contend stoutly, u(pe\r a)/qlwn Ael.NA 15.15;
persist or
continue obstinately in doing . . , c. part., Th.7.49: abs., ibid.; esp. by word of mouth,
maintain stiffly, obstinately, c. acc. et inf., Id.3.44, Is.11.1; tau=ta Pl.Grg.495b; o(/ti . . , w(s . . Th. 4.23,6.55, Pl.Tht.172b; peri/ tinos Id.Sph.249c.
put firm trust in a thing,
rely on it, tw=| cunw=| pa/ntwn Heraclit.114; lo/gw| Lys.6.35; diaqh/kais Is.1.3; tw=| no/mw| Hyp.Eux.4, D.33.27; paraskeuh=| Id.44.3, cf. Isoc.17.24;
feel confidence, Antipho 5.76.

i)sxu_r-iko/s, h/, o/n,
stubborn, Pl.Tht.169b (Comp.), prob.l.in Alex.194,cf.Phot.

i)sxu_r-iste/on,
one must maintain stoutly, Pl.R.533a.

i)sxu_r-istikw=s e)/xw,
to be inclined to
affirm, gloss on i)sxuriei/w, Gal.18(1).309.

i)sxu_ro-gnwmosu/nh, h(,
obstinacy, Ph.1.653, J.Ap.1.22.

i)sxu_ro-gnw/mwn, on, gen. onos,
stiff in opinion, Arist.EN1151b5, D.L.2.24: Sup., Ph.Fr.23H.: metaph., logismo/s Id.2.413.

i)sxu_ro/-detos, on,
fastbound, Sch.A.Pr.148.
i)sxu_ro-qw/rac, a_kos, o(, h(, gloss on xalkoxitw/nwn, Hsch.
i)sxu_ro-ka/rdios, on, gloss on tlh/qumos, Id.
i)sxu_ro-pa^qe/w, = deinopaqe/w, Sch.Arat.71.

i)sxu_ro-pai/kths, ou, o(,
one who plays valiantly, IG14.1535, Delph.3(1).216, Vett.Val.4.17.

i)sxu_ro-plh/kths, ou, o(,
wounding severely, gloss on dioplh/ktan, Hsch.

i)sxu_ro-poi/hsis, ews, h(,
strengthening, tw=n a)sqenou/ntwn mori/wn Aët.12.21.
confirmation, corroboration, Gloss.

i)sxu_ro-poio/s, o/n,
strengthening, EM 480.12, Sch.A.Ch.415, etc.
i)sxu_ro-po/ths, ou, o(, gloss on zapo/ths, Hsch.

i)sxu_ro/-pous, podos, o(, h(,

doing mighty deeds, Paul.Al.O.1; gloss on o)brimoergo/s, Sch.D Il.5.403.

i)sxu_ro/-rrizos, on, (r(i/za)
with strong root, Thphr.CP2.12.3, etc.

i)sxu_ro/s, a/, o/n, (i)sxu/s)
strong, esp. of personal strength, S.Ph.945, E.Fr.290, etc.; of things, i). be/los Alc.15.4; r(eu/mata Hdt.8.12; i). xqw/n
hard, A.Pers.310; of food,
indigestible, Hp.Art.50; of taste,
strong, Thphr.HP7.6.1; of armies, i)sxurote/ra fa/lagc X.Cyr.7.1.30; of places, Th.4.9, X.An.4.6.11, etc.; th=s xw/rhs to\ -o/taton Hdt.1.76; to\ e(autou= i)., opp. ta\ toi=s polemi/ois i)., X.Eq.Mag.8.24; ta\ i)sxuro/tata your
strongest points, Th.5.111; ta\ th=s po/lews i).
that in which the strength of the state
lies, Aeschin.3.66; o(rw=ntes ou)de\n i). a)po\ tw=n *lesbi/wn no
show of strength, Th.3.6; i). ti pro\s to\ pra=gm' e)/xein a
strong point, Men.Epit.130; -o/taton tekmh/rion SIG685.84 (Crete, ii B.C.).
powerful, a)/loxos *dio/s A.Supp.302; po/lis E.Supp.447; qeo/s Ar.Pl.946; i). to\ pollo/n Hdt.1.136; oi( i). e)n tai=s po/lesin X.Ath. 1.14: Comp. -o/teros, e)s peiqw/ Democr.51; o( o)pi/sw mou e)rxo/menos -o/tero/s mou e)sti/n Ev.Matt.3.11.
forcible, violent, severe, sitodei/h, yu/xh, Hdt.1.94,4.29; limo/s Ev.Luc.15.14; a)nagkai/h Hdt.1.74; ai( li/an i). timwri/ai
violent, excessive, Id.4.205; o(/rkos -o/tatos, a)na/gkai -o/tatai, Antipho 5.11, 6.25; no/shma Hp.
Acut.(Sp.）4; bh/c Th.2.49; ge/lws, e)piqumi/ai, etc., Pl.R.388e, 560b, etc.; no/mos i).
severe, Hdt.7.102, Lys.15.9; e)/xqra Pl.Phdr.233c; gnw/mh -ote/rh
more positive, Hdt.9.41; tro/pw| w(=| a)\n du/nwntai -ota/tw| Foed. ap. Th.5.23; kata\ to\ i)sxuro/n
by main force, opp. do/lw|, Hdt.4.201, cf.9.2. of literary
style,
vigorous, D.H.Comp.22; also of syllables,
strong, ib.16; sta/seis lamba/nein i). ib.22. Adv. -rw=s
strongly, with all force, e)gkei=sqai Th.1.69, etc.; fula/ttein tina/s X.An.6.3.11.
very much, exceedingly, with Adjs., Hdt.4.108; e)/qnos me/ga i). ib.183; diw/ruges i). baqei=ai X.An.[1.7.15], etc.; i). xlwro/n Hp.Prog.11; ki/nhsis nwqh\s i). Arist.HA503b9; i). filopla/twn Phld.
Ind Sto.61: with Verbs, i). h(/desqai, a)nia=sqai, X.Cyr.8.3.44; a)ph/ggeilen o(/ti pa/nta dokoi/h i). tw=| eu)nou/xw| ib.5.3.15: Comp. -ote/rws Heraclit.114, Hdt.3.129; -o/teron X.Cyr.4.5.12, etc.: Sup., in answers, i)sxuro/tata/ ge
most certainly, Id.Oec.1.15.
i)sxu_rosw/matos, on, gloss on o)brimoergo/s, Sch.Opp.H.1.360.

i)sxu_ro/ths, htos, h(,
strength, Ph.1.128; v.l. for e)x-, D.H.3.65, for o)x-, Ph.1.644.

i)sxu_ro/-frwn, onos, o(, h(,

i)sxu_ro/-xrws, wtos, o(, h(, gloss on talau/rinos, Sch.Il.5.289.

i)sxu_ro/w,
