i)sx-u/s [v. sub fin.], u/os, h(,
strength of body, Hes.Th.146, 823, etc.; a)kmai\ i)sxu/os Pi.O.1.96; deino\n i)sxu/os qra/sos S.Ph.104; th\n i). deina\ kai\ th\n r(w/mhn Pl.Smp.190b; pro\s i)sxu\n o)fqalmoi\ a)/rista pefuko/tes X.Smp.5.5: pl., i)sxu/es kai\ a)sqe/neiai Pl.R.618d; kata\ swma/twn i)sxu=s kai\ eu)morfi/as Id.Lg.744c; of places, i)sxu\s gh=s S.OC610; of a fortified place, Th.4.35.
might, power, qeou=, qew=n, A.Th.226 (lyr.), S.Aj. 118; i). basilei/a A.Pers.590 (lyr.), cf. 12(anap.); o(/pou ga\r i). suzugou=si kai\ di/kh
might and right, Id.Fr.381; fu/sews i)., of Themistocles, Th. 1.138; e)pi\ me/ga e)lqei=n i)sxu/os to a great height
of power, Id.2.97, cf. 1.85, etc.; para\ i)sxu\n th=s duna/mews Id.7.66; i). ma/xhs fighting
power, Id.2.97; i). th=s e)lpi/dos Id.4.65, cf. 2.62; h( tw=n no/mwn i). POxy.67.14 (iv A.D.);
validity, PGrenf.2.71ii11 (iii A.D.), etc.
brute force, kat' i)sxu/n
perforce, opp. do/lw|, A.Pr.214; pro\s i)sxu/os kra/tos S.Ph. 594; pro\s i)sxu/os xa/rin E.Med.538; u(po\ th=s i)sxu/os Epicr.3.10; kate/xontes i)sxu/i+ to\ plh=qos Th.3.62; ei)/ ti i)sxu/i+ pra/ttetai, i)sxurw=s pra/ttetai Pl.Prt.332b.
motive force, Arist.Ph.250a6; h( kinou=sa i). Id.Cael.275b20, al. in Lit. Crit.,
vigour of style, D.H.Pomp.3, Comp. 2,al. in Tactics, the
main body of troops, ou)/pw h( i). pa/restin X.Cyr.1.4.19. [u^ in gen., etc.: in nom. and acc. sg. u^ in Pi.N.11.31 (acc.): u_ in Trag. and Com., A.Th.1080 (anap.), Ch.721 (anap.), S. Aj.118, Men.449.] (Perh. visxu/s, cf. bi/sxun, gisxu/n.)
i)/sx-u_sis, ews, h(, mistranslation of Hebr., LXXCa.2.7, 3.5 prob. for diff. root; prob. f.l. for xu/sis (cj. Wendl.) in Ph.1.354.

i)sx-u/w (i)sxu/s), Batr.279: impf. i)/sxuon Ar.V.357, X.HG6.4.18: fut. i)sxu/sw Ar.Av.1607, etc.: aor. i)/sxu_sa S.Aj.502, etc.: pf. i)/sxu_ka Aeschin.1.165, Cerc.17.34:—Pass., aor. kat-isxu/qhn D.S.15.87: (i)sxu/s):—
to be strong in body, S.Tr.234; o(/pws u(giai/noien kai\ i)sxu/oien X.Cyr.6.1.24; o(\s me/giston i)/sxuse stratou= S.Aj.502; i). toi=s sw/masin X.Mem.2.7.7; tou= sw/matos i)sxu/ontos Antipho 5.93; i)/sxuo/n t' au)to\s e)mautou=, i.e. I
had all my
strength, Ar.V.357; i). e)k no/sou
to be recovering, X.HG6.4.18.
to be powerful, prevail, mhde\n mei=on i). *dio/s A.Pr.510, etc.; ple/on, mei=zon i)., E.Hec.1188, Ar.Av.1607; later i). pro/s tina
prevail against, LXXPs.12(13).4; e)pi/ tinas ib.1 Ma.10.49; i). tini/
to be strong in a thing, sofi/a a)nh\r u(pe\r a)ndro\s i)sxu/ei Pi.Fr.61; qra/sei E.Or.903; e)n th=| poihtikh=| Phld.Po.5.9; i). tini\ pro\s tou\s polemi/ous Th.3.46; i). e)k ponhri/as D.2.9; o(/qen i)sxu/omen, h(=|per i)sxu/ousi, Th.1.143, 2.13; i). para/ tini
have power or
influence with one, Id.8.47, Aeschin.2.2, D.38.20, etc. of things,
prevail, o(/rkos ou)/ti *zhno\s i). ple/on A.Eu. 621; ta)lhqe\s ga\r i)sxu=on tre/fw S.OT356; to\ di/kaion e)n pa=sin i). D. 37.59;
have force, a(\ w(ri/sw su\ di/kaia, tau)ta\ . . kai\ kata\ sou= prosh/kei toi=s a)/llois i)sxu/ein D.19.241, cf. 25.71; o( lo/gos do/ceien a)\n i)sxu/ein Arist. Pol.1280a28; nomh\ a)/dikos ou)de\n i).
is of no
force, PTeb.286.7 (ii A.D.); i)sxu=o/n ti something
permanent, prob. in Epicur.Ep.1p.7U.: c.inf., o( kairo\s i)sxu/ei . . pra/ttein D.17.9, cf. LXX 2 Ch.2.6(5), al., Plu.Pomp. 58; ou)k i). a)rtistomei=n Str.14.2.28, cf. Ev.Marc.5.4, D.Chr.33.22, etc.
to be worth or
equivalent to, h( mna= i)sxu/ei li/tras du/o kai\ h(/misu J.AJ14.7.1, cf. PGnom.106, Ptol.Tetr.134; ai( yh=foi ta/lanton i)sxu/ousin (prob. for i)/sxousin) Plb.5.26.13. Act.,
condense, nefe/las LXXSi.43.15. a)/rton pa=san h(donh\n i)sxu/onta
making strong . . , ib.Wi.16.20 (
in se habentem, Vulg.). -u/ontes a)ste/res those
in dominating positions, Serapion in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).226. [u_ in Batr. l.c., Trag. and Com., S.Aj.1409, OT356, Ar.V.357, Av. 488, 1606; later, u^ sts. in pres. and impf., AP5.166 (Asclep.), 211 (Mel.).]

i)/sxw, redupl. form of e)/xw (only found in pres., and impf. Act. and Pass., Ep. inf. i)sxe/menai, i)sxe/men, Od.20.330, Il.17.501), but in Hom. and Hes. almost always with a limited sense,
keep back, restrain (v. infr. 11), de/os i)/sxei tina/ Il.5.812,817, etc.; i)/. tina\ a)na/gkh| Od.4.558; qumo\n i)/. e)n sth/qessi Il.9.256; *zeu\s i)/sxen e(o\n me/nos Hes.Th.687; ou)d' e)/ti shkoi\ i)/sxousi (the calves) Od.10.413; [prw\n] i)/sxei r(e/eqra Il.17.750; i(/ppous i)/. 15.456, etc.; i)=sxon boulome/nous tou\s e(pta\ e)s to\ pro/sw parie/nai Hdt.3.77; mhde\n h(ma=s i)sxe/tw Ar.V.1264; ou)de/pote/ g' i)/sxei qu/ra, prov. of those who keep open house, Eup.265; i)/sxe sto/ma E.HF1244; i)/sxe dakw\n sto/ma so/n S.Tr.976 (anap.); to\ i)/sxon th\n porei/an X.An.6.5.13; xei/marron . . e(/rkea i)/sxei a)lwa/wn
keep it
back, Il.5.90: c. gen., ci/fos i)/. tino/s
to keep it
from him, E.Hel.1656; i)/. th=s r(oh=s, tou= i)e/nai, Pl.Cra.416b, 420e: folld. by inf., i)/. tina\ mh\ pra/ssein E.IA661:—Pass.,
to be checked, Gal.UP15.3: also impers., e)n tou/tw| <*>xeto here
the matter stopped, X.An.6.3.9. abs., i)/sxe
hold, <*>n,
stop! A.Ch.1052, S.Ichn.95; of ships,
put in, v.l. in Th.2.91; Pol<*> tai=s po/lesi Id.7.35, cf. A.R.2.390; of rivers,
stop, Arr.An.5. 9.4:—in this sense Hom. uses Med. or Pass., i)/sxesq' *)argei=oi, mh\ feu/gete Od.24.54, cf. Il.3.82; i)/sxeo
check thyself, be calm, 1.214, 2.247, Od.22.356, etc.;
keep quiet, 11.251: c. gen., i)/sxesqai/ tinos
desist from a thing, 18.347, 24.323.
hold fast, hold, once in Hom., [kano/na] a)gxo/qi sth/qeos Il.23.762, cf. S.Aj.575, Ph.1111 (lyr.): metaph.,
keep, maintain, eu)fhmi/an Id.Tr.178; e)lpi/sin i)/. ti ib.138; gnw/man Id.Ph.853 (lyr.); e)pisth/mhn labo/nta i)/sxein Pl.Tht.198a; of outward matters, o)du/nh i)/. th\n gaste/ra
affects it, Hp.Nat.Mul.14; to\n ai)=s' a)/platos i)/sxei S.Aj.256 (lyr.); ai( a)/tomoi to\n palmo\n i)/sxousi
keep up, Epicur.Ep.1p.8U.:—Pass., fqo/h| i)/sxesqai Isoc.19.11 (s.v.l., sxo/menon Blass); also to\ i)sxo/menon kata\ diafora/n that which
is permanent in distinction, Chrysipp.Stoic.2.128. after Hom.,
hold or
have in possession, v.l. in Hdt.3.39, Th.3.58;
have a wife, Hdt.5.92.b'; of women, i)/. e)n gastri/ or simply i)/.
to be pregnant, Hp. Epid.2.2.18, etc.; meta\ tou=ton i)/. *kleo/mbroton
conceives Cl., Hdt.5.41: generally, like e)/xw, i)/sxe ka)mou= mnh=stin S.Aj.520; lh=stin i)/. to be forgetful, Id.OC584; a)/lgos i)/. Id.OT1031; gnw/man i)/., = gnw=nai, Id.El. 214 (lyr.); i)/. dou=lon bi/on Id.Tr.302; nou=n Pl.Smp.181d; e)pwnumi/an Id.Prm.130e; xrw/mata Hp.Prog.12; kakw/sias Id.Art.61;
receive, [pempa/da] SIG57.35 (Milet., v B.C.); i)sxe/tw di/khn kai\ u(pexe/tw ib. 286.15 (iv B.C.), cf. IG5(2).357.23 (Stymphalus, iii B.C.): c. dupl. acc., i)/. tina\ cu/neunon S.Aj.1301; qeo\n ou) lh/cw prosta/tan i)/sxwn Id.OT882 (lyr.).
have in it, involve, o)/lbos i)/. fqo/non Pi.P.11.29; meta/stasin i)/.
to be susceptible, capable of cure, Hp.Aph.5.7; a)na/lhyin met' eu)petei/as Pl.Ti.83e;
to be worth, dub. l. in Plb.5.26.13; v. i)sxu/w 3. intr.,
to be, like e)/xw, a)pole/mws i)/sxontes Pl.Plt.307e; eu)= i)/. to\ sw=ma Id.R.411c; w(=de Id.Phlb.38c; toi=s pa=si xalepw/teron Th.7.50.

i)swni/a, h(, （w)nh/）
the same price, cost price, th=s i). Ar.Pax1227; ta=s i). a)polusa/tw he shall release him at
the original price, Milet.3 No.140.55 (Crete).

i)swnu^m-i/a, h(, rejected as a name for a
pronoun by A.D.Pron.9.7.

i)sw/nu^m-os, on, （o)/noma）
bearing the same name as, c. gen., kalei=n tina i)sw/numon e)/mmen ma/trwos Pi.O.9.64; h)eli/oio tropai=s i)sw/numon [i_] e)/rnos, i.e. h(liotro/pion, Nic.Th.678.

i)/sws, Lacon. vi/w(r (v. bi/wr), Adv. of i)/sos,
equally, in like manner, Sapph.Supp.25.11, S.Ph.758, Pl.Lg.805a, etc.; w(s i)sai/tata ib.744c;
evenly, Hp.Off.3.
equally, with reference to equality, to\ o)rqo\n lhpte/on i)/sws Arist.Pol.1283b40;
fairly, equitably, i)/. kai\ koinw=s Aen. Tact.22.24; ou)k i)/. ou)de\ politikw=s D.10.74; mhde\n i)/. kai\ dikai/ws fronou=ntas D.H.10.40; ou)k i)/sws xrh/sasqai/ tini Plb.23.2.7.
probably, perhaps, Alc.Supp.33, Hdt.6.124, A.Pr.319, S.Ph.144, Pl. Grg.473b, etc.; i)/. pou E.El.518; ou)/te sumfo/rws ou)/t' i)/. kalw=s D.5.10; ou)k i)/sws, a)ll' o)/ntws Pl.Lg.965c: ironical, smikra/ ge i)/. prosqh/kh Id.R.339b: freq. joined with a)/n or ta/x' a)/n, e.g. S.Aj.691, 1009, Pl.Ap. 31a; a)mfisbhtou=ntes prostiqe/asin a)ei\ to\ i)/sws kai\ ta/xa Arist.Rh. 1389b18: i)/sws without a)/n c. opt. is f.l. in A.Supp.727, E.IT1055; i)/. me/n . . , i)/. de/ . .
perhaps so or so, X.Cyr.4.3.2: repeated i)/., i)/. Ar.Nu. 1320, D.3.33: used to soften or qualify a positive assertion, S.OC661, Ar.Ra.224, Pl.Phd.61c, Phdr.233e, Arist.Metaph.987a26, etc. with numerals,
about, Ar.Pl.1058, Damox.3.2.

i)/swsis, ews, h(, （i)so/w）
making equal, comparison, Gloss.
i)/tala: i(sti/a ei)s a(\ tou\s i(stou\s diatei/nousin, Hsch. (Cf. i)tlai/.）

*)ita^l-i/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
Italy, Hdt.1.24, etc. [*i_t-, S.Ant.1119 (lyr.), Call.Dian.58.]

*)ita^l-ia/zw, Dor. fut -a/cw,
live in Italy, Hsch., Phot.
*)ita^l-i/dhs, ou, o(, poet. for *)italiw/ths, AP9.344（Leon.), Call. Fr.448.

*)ita^l-iko/s, h/, o/n,
Italian, Pl.Lg.659b, etc.; ai(/resis Placit. 1.3.9; spei=ra, =
Cohors Italica, Act.Ap.10.1; *)italikoi/, oi(, Italians resident at Delos, SIG726.4 (i B.C.), etc.:—pecul. fem. *)ita^l-i/s, i/dos [i_], AP7.373 (Thall.); h( *)itali/s (sc. gh=), = *)itali/a, D.C.54.22 codd. *)ita^l-iw/ths, ou, o(,
Greek inhabitant of Italy, Hdt.4.15, Th.6.44, etc.; cf. *sikeliw/ths:—fem. *)ita^l-iw=tis, idos, Adj.
Italian, nh=es, po/leis, Th.8.91, Str.5.4.4: Adj. *)ita^l-iwtiko/s, h/, o/n, Pl.Ep.326b, Luc.Hist. Conscr.15.

*)ita^l-o/s, o(,
Italian, Parth.7.1, Str.5.1.1: as Adj., *)i. ai)xmhth/s [i_] AP7.741 (Crin.), etc.

i)ta^lo/s, o(, = tau=ros, D.C.Fr.4.2, Hsch.; whence Italy is said to be called, Timae.12, cf. Fest. s.v. *)itali/a. (vitalo/s, cf. Lat.
vitulus, Osc.
Viteliû (Italia).)

i)ta^m-eu/omai [i^],
to be i)tamo/s, interpol. in Jul.Or.7.210c.
i)ta^m-i/a, h(, = i)tamo/ths, LXXJe.29.17（49.16).

i)te/a [i_], Ep. and Ion. i)te/h, also i)tei/h (A.R.4.1428): h(:—
willow, Il. 21.350, Hecat.292（
a) J., Hdt.1.194,
PTeb.ined.703.195, etc.; i). leukh/, =
Salix alba, i). me/laina, =
Salix amplexicaulis, Thphr.HP3.13.7.
wicker shield, target, E.Heracl.376 (lyr.), Supp.695, Tr.1193, Cyc.7, Ar.Fr.65. i). de/ndros, = i(/ppouris, Ps.-Dsc.4.46. (*ei)te/a, the Attic deme-name, is a different word; cf i)te/i+nos, i)teo/fullos; prob. cogn. with Lat.
viēre, vīmen, Lith.
výti 'twist', 'wind',
vytìs 'willow-twig', OE.
wipig 'willow'.)

i)te/i+nos [i_t], h, on,
of willow, i). r(a/bdos Hdt.4.67, cf. Thphr.HP5.3.4, PCair.Zen.353.5 (iii B.C.); ta\ i). Sammelb.5807.3.
made of withy rods, wicker, i). sa/kea Theoc.16.79.

i)te/on [i^], （ei)=mi
ibo) one must go, Hp.Acut.38, Pl.R.394d, Lg.803e, etc.

i)teo/fullos [i_], on,
decorated with a pattern of willow-leaves, fia/lh Annuario 4/5.463 (Halic., iii B.C.).

i)tew/n [i_], w=nos, o(,
willow-ground, Gp.3.6.6.
i)/thlos, h, on, expld. by Hsch. as e)/mmonos, ou)k e)ci/thlos, A.Fr. 42.
i)t-h/rios [i^], coined as etym. of e)cith/rios, EM348.45.
i)/t-hs, ou, o(, = i)tamo/s, Ar.Nu.445, Pl.Smp.203d; i)/tas ge e)f' a(\ oi( polloi\ fobou=ntai i)e/nai Id.Prt.349e, cf. 359c; i)/. kai\ polupra/gmwn D.C.55.18.
i)t-hte/on, = i)te/on, Ar.Nu.131, Diph.31.

i)t-htiko/s, h/, o/n,= i)tamo/s, Max.Tyr. 41.5: Comp., ib.21.2: Sup. -w/taton o( qumo\s pro\s tou\s kindu/nous
most ready to encounter dangers, Arist.EN1116b26.
i(=tqai: h(=sqai, Hsch. i)tqe/lan: difqe/ran, Id. (cf. i)calh=). i)tlai/: oi(=s <e)n>tei/nousi ta\s w)/as tou= u(fainome/nou mugelei=s (fort. *pugelei=s）: oi( de\ tou\s mi/tous, Id.

i)/ton, to/, Thracian name for a kind of
mushroom, Thphr.Fr.167, Plin.HN19.36; prob. fr. vi/ton, cf. oi)to/n, ou)ito/n.

i)to/s, h/, o/n, (ei)=mi
ibo)
passable, o(do/s AP7.480 (Leon.).

i)/trion (on the accent v. Hdn.Gr.1.357, al.), to/, a kind of
cake (pemma/tion lepto\n dia\ shsa/mou kai\ me/litos gino/menon Ath.14.646d, but cf. plakou=ntes, shsamou=ntes, i)/tria Ar.Ach.1092, melitw/masi kai\ i)tri/ois Dsc.4.63), Anacr.17, Hp.Acut.（Sp.）72, Anon.Lond.Fr.2.3, POxy. 736.50: freq. in pl., Sol.38, S.Fr.199, Archipp.9, prob. in Herod.3.44; i)/tria, tragh/maq' h(=ke, puramou=s, a)/mhs Ephipp.8.3; later, of any cake, i)/tria karpou= pepoihme/na puri/nou D.H.1.55; of the Roman
libum, plakou=s e)k ga/laktos i)tri/wn kai\ me/litos Ath.3.125f.

i)tri/neos [i^n], a, on,
like i)/tria, AP6.232 (Crin.).

i)triopw/lhs, ou, o(,
dealer in i)/tria, prob. in Poll.7.30.
i)/tta, dialect word for druoko/lay, Hsch. i)tte/la, v. i)calh=. i)/ttion: ou)si/a (Elean), Id. i)/tton: e(/n (Cret.), Id. i)/ttuga: e)kplhktika/ A.Fr.427 (ap. Hsch.).

i)/ttw, Boeot. for i)/stw, 3sg. imper. of oi)=da, esp. in phrase i)/ttw *zeu/s Zeus
be witness! says Cebes the Theban in Pl.Phd.62a; *qh/baqen i)/ttw *deu/s, and i)/ttw *(hraklh=s, says the Boeotian in Ar.Ach.911,860, cf. Pl.Ep.345a.
*)/itu^los [i^], o(, Itylus, son of Zethus and Aëdon, Od.19.522, Pherecyd.124J.: expld. as,= mo/nos, o)rfano/s, ne/os, a(palo/s by Hsch.
i)/tuc, a bird, Phot., Suid.; cf. i)=duc.
*)/itus, uos, o(, Itys, son of Tereus and Procne, A.Ag.1144 (lyr.), Ar.Av.212, etc. [i^tu^-, but a(\ *)/itu^n ai)e\n *)/itu_n o)lofu/retai S.El.148 (lyr.), cf. Ar. l.c.]

i)/tw [i^], 3sg. imper. from ei)=mi (
ibo); in Trag. almost an exclam.,
go to! S.Ph.120;
well, well! E.Med.798.

*)/itwn [i^], o( St.Byz., and *)/itwnos, o(, Str.9.5.8, a town in Thessaly: —hence *)itwni/a, h(, title of Athena who was worshipped there, Hecat. 2J., Paus.1.13.3,10.1.10; xrusaigi/dos *)itwni/as nao/s B.Fr.11.2; also at Coronea, Plb.4.25.2,25.3.2, Str.9.2.29, Paus.9.33.1; at Athens, IG 12.310.217; at Amorgos, ib.12(7).33 (ii B.C.):—also *)itwnia/s, h(, Call. Cer.75, AP9.743 (Theodorid.): *)itwni/s, h(, A.R.1.551, AP6.130 (<Leon.>).
*)itw/nios, o( (sc. mh/n), name of month in Thessaly, IG9(2).259.5, al.: *)itw/nia, ta/, festival of Athena Itonia, ib.12(7).22,al. (Amorgos), cf. Polyaen.2.54.
i)u/+, exclam. of surprise, Hdn.Gr.1.506.
*)iuggi/hs, o(, epith. of Dionysus, Hsch.

i)uggiko/s, h/, o/n, (i)/ugc)
of the i)/ugges (cf. i)/ugc 3), fu/sis Dam.Pr.112, 119.
*)iu/ggios, o( (sc. mh/n), name of month in Thessaly, IG9(2).258.5 (cf. p.xii); cf. *)iuggi/hs.
i)uggodrome/w,= bohdrome/w, bohqe/w, (Boeot.) Hsch. (leg. i)ugo-).

i)ugh/, h(,= i)ugmo/s,
howling, shrieking, as of men in pain, Orac. ap. Hdt.9.43, S.Ph.752;= gunaikw=n oi)mwgai/ AB267; but also of the
shout of heralds, Tim.Pers.233; the
hissing of snakes, Nic.Th.400, Opp.H. 1.565. [i_u_- Orac. ap. Hdt. l.c., Nic.; i^u_- in S.l.c.]

i)ugmo/s, o(, (i)u/zw)
shout of joy, Il.18.572; also,
a cry of pain, shriek, A.Ch.26 (lyr.), E.Heracl.126. [i_ in Il.; i^ in Trag.]

i)/ugc, i)/uggos, h(, （i)u/zw, cf. Dam.Pr.213),
wryneck, Iynx torquilla, Arist.HA504a12, PA695a23, Ael.NA6.19; used as a charm to recover unfaithful lovers, being bound to a revolving wheel, i)/. tetra/knamos Pi.P.4.214, cf. AP5.204; e(/lkein i)/ugga e)pi/ tini X.Mem.3.11.18; i)/. e(/lke tu\ th=non e)mo\n poti\ dw=ma Theoc.2.17: metaph., e(/lkomai i)/uggi h)=tor
as by the magic wheel, Pi.N.4.35; w(/sper a)po\ i)/uggos tw=| ka/llei e(lko/menos Luc.Dom.13. metaph.,
spell, charm, th=| sh=| lhfqe/ntes i)/uggi Ar.Lys.1110, cf. S.Fr.474 (prob. cj.), Lyc.310, D.L. 6.76, Plu.2.1093d (prob. cj. in 568a), Philostr.VA8.7 (pl.), Hld.8.5;
passionate yearning for, a)gaqw=n e(ta/rwn A.Pers.989. in pl., name of certain 'Chaldaic' divinities, Procl.
in R.2.213K., in Cra.p.33 P., Dam.Pr.111, al.: in sg., h( prw/th i)/. ib.217, cf. 213. = su=rigc monoka/lamos, EM480.1. [i_ Ep. and Pi.; i^ Att.]

i)u/zw, aor. i)/uca Pi.P.4.237:—
shout, yell, in order to scare beasts, polla\ ma/l' i)u/zousin Il.17.66; oi( d' i)u/zontes e(/ponto Od.15.162; later,
yell from grief or pain,
cry out, i)/ucen a)fwnh/tw| a)/xei Pi. l.c.; used by A. in lyr., only in imper., i)/uz' a)/potmon boa/n Pers.281, cf. 1042, Supp. 808, 872; part., i)u/zwn S.Tr.787; i)u/zwn a)n' o)/ros Call.Fr.512 (perh. here =
piping, cf. sq.); of bees,
buzz, Q.S.1.440. (From the Interjection i)u/+, q.v. (from i)ou/ acc. to EM480.6): vi-, cf. a)bi/uktos, e)kbiou/zei.) [i_ Ep. and Pi.; i^ in S.Tr.787, and prob. in A.]

i)ukth/s [i_], ou=, o(, （i)u/zw)
one who shouts or
yells: singer, piper, Theoc.8.30, in poet. form i)ukta/ [a^].

i)/urkes: ai)=ges a)gri/ai, u(strixi/des, Hsch. i)uxmo/s, o(,= i)ugmo/s, Id. ifeiomaxw,=
ario, Gloss. (dub., fort. kriomaxw=,=
arieto).
*)ifqi=mis, o(, Egyptian deity (prob. Nefertem) identified with Prometheus, PHib.1.27.86 (iii B.C.).

i)/fqi_mos, h, on, also os, on (v. infr.),
stout, strong, of bodily strength, w)/mois i). Il.18.204; krati\ e)p' i). 3.336; i). potamw=n 17.749; bow=n i)/. ka/rhna 23.260; of heroes, i)/. yuxai/, kefalai/, 1.3, 11.55; of Hades, Od. 10.534; also, of women,
comely, stately, i). basi/leia 16.332; a)/loxos Il.5.415, Theoc.17.128; para/koitis Od.23.92, etc.; quga/thr 15.364; *phrw/ 11.287: later, generally,
strong, powerful, i)fqi/mhs filo/thtos D.P.655:—Hom. uses i)fqi/mh of women; but i)/fqimoi yuxai/, kefalai/, speaking of men. (No v-; prob. not cogn. with i)/s, i)=fi.)

i)=fi (A) (instrum. of i)/s, q.v.), Ep. Adv.
by force or
might, freq. in Hom., but only with four Verbs, i)=. a)na/ssein Il.1.38, etc.; i)=. ma/xesqai 1.151; i)=. damh=nai 19.417, Od.18.156; boo\s i)=. ktame/noio Il.3.375; later i)=. bihsa/menos Euph.90, etc.—Freq. in prop. names, e.g. *)ifia/nassa, *)ifige/neia, *)ifigo/nh, *)ifida/mas, *)/ifiklos, vifia/das, etc.
i)=fi (B), an Egyptian measure, prob. = 1/4 and 1/5 artaba, PMasp.138, 139, al. (vi A.D.), PLond.5.1687.11 (vi A.D.):—hence i)/fion me/tron PMasp.308.3 (vi A.D.): written oi)/fin Hsch.

i)fi^-ge/neia^ [i_f], h(,
strong-born, mighty, epith. of Artemis, Paus. 2.35.1, Hsch. pr. n., Iphigeneia, Agamemnon's daughter, the Homeric *)ifia/nassa (but distd. by S.El.158), Stesich.27, etc.; also called *)ifigo/nh, E.El.1023; *)=ifis Lyc.324. [-ei/a_ A.Ag.1526 (lyr.).]

i)fi^-ge/nhtos, on,
produced by might, pu=r Orph.Fr.247.28.
i)/fiklos: dusxerh/s, Hsch.: as pr. n., Il.2.705, al.:—hence Adj., *)ifi/kleios, a, on, sfuro/n Call.Aet.3.1.46.

*)ifikra^ti/des, ai(, a kind of
shoes, called from the Athen. general Iphicrates, D.S.15.44, Alciphr.3.57, Dam.Isid.89.
i)fi/n: kalh/n, Hsch. i)finta/n: kru/fa lalou=san, ai)nigmatwdw=s, Id.

i)/fios [i_f], a, on, Ep.Adj., freq. in Hom., but only in phrase i)/. mh=la
fat, goodly sheep, Il.5.556,al., cf. D.P.753, etc.
i)=fis: taxu/s, Hsch. i)fi/thn: a(gni/thn, Id. i)/flhma: trau=ma, Id. (i.e. i(/fl-, cf. si/flwma).

i)/fuon [i_], to/,
spike-lavender, Lavandula Spica, Ar.Th.910 (pl.), Fr. 560 (pl.), Epich.161, Thphr.HP6.6.11, 6.8.3.
i)xai/nw [i_],= sq., o(/ssa d' e)mei=o se/qen para\ qumo\s a)kou=sai i)xai/nei Call. Aet.1.1.22, cf. EM568.7.

i)xa^na/w [i_],
crave, yearn, v.l. for i)sx- in Il.23.300, Od 8.288; turou= a)lw/phc i)xanw=sa Babr.77.2:—Med., i)xana=sq' e)paure/sqai Herod. 7.26, cf. Hsch., EM478.44. (Cf. sq.; *)/ixana, name of a town in Sicily, is derived from the root by St.Byz.: prob. cogn. with a)xh/n, h)xh/n; Avest. a_zi- 'craving', Skt.
īhate 'crave'.)

i)=xar ( i)/xar codd.), to/,
vehement desire, dub. l. in A.Supp.850 (lyr.), cf. Sch.
i)/xqon: a)/stron, e)gxeira/dion, culofa/nion, Hsch.

i)xqu/-a [u^], Ion. i)xqu-u/h, h(, (i)xqu=s)
dried skin of the fish r(i/nh, like our
shagreen, Hp.Foet.Exsect.1, Archig. ap. Gal.12.406; of
fish-skin in general, Ruf. ap. Orib.4.2.16.
pot, perh. for pickled fish, CIG 8345c (Nola, vase).
fishing, fishery, BGU1123.9 (i A.D.), PSI3.160.8 (ii A.D.). tarixhra\ i). pickled
fish, PLond.3.856.20 (i A.D.).
i)xqu-a^gwgo/s, v. i)xquo/ner.
i)xqu-a/zomai,= i)xqua/w, AP 7.693 (Apollonid.).

i)xqu-a^ko/s, h/, o/n,= i)xqui+ko/s, zw/|dia,
Cat.Cod. Astr.1.160. i)xqu-a^kh\ pu/lh, h(,
fish-gate, Aq., Sm., Thd.Ze.1.10: cf. i)xqui+ko/s

i)xqu-a/w,
fish, angle, mostly in Ep. pres. and impf., i)xqua/askon gnamptoi=s a)gki/stroisin Od.4.368: c. acc.,
fish for, au)tou= d' i)xqua/a . . delfi=nas 12.95, cf. Opp.H.1.426:—Med., Lyc.46.
sport (like fish), delfi=nes . . e)qu/neon i)xqua/ontes Hes.Sc.210. Pass.,
to be made of fish, i)xquw/menos a)/rtos (vulg. a)/rgos) Horap.1.14.
i)xqu^bol-eu/s, e/ws, o(,= i)xqubo/los 2, Nic.Th.793, Call.Del.15, AP7.504（Leon.), 10.9, cf. Ps.-Hes. ap. Ath.3.116a.

i)xqu^bol-e/w,
strike, harpoon fish, AP7.381 (Etrusc.), 635 (Antiphil.).

i)xqu^/bol-os, on, (parox.)
striking fish, catching fish, i). mhxanh/ of the trident, A.Th.132 (lyr.); ai)/quiai AP6.23. Subst.,
fisher, angler, ib.7.295 (Leon.), 9.227 (Bianor). Pass., (proparox.) i). qh/ra a spoil
of speared fish, ib.6.24; i). dei=pna Opp.H.3.18.

i)xqu^-bo/ros, on,
fish-eating, lari/des AP7.652 (Leon.).

i)xqu^/-botos, on,
fed on by fish, Opp.H.2.1, Epic.Oxy.213v.15.

i)xqu^-go/nos, on,
producing fish, Nonn.D.26.275.

i)xqu/dion, to/, Dim. of i)xqu/s,
little fish, freq. in Com. (v. infr.), Chrysipp.Stoic.2.208, PFlor.119.7 (iii A.D.), Jul.Mis.350b, etc. [u_, Ar.Fr.387.8, Theopomp.Com.62.3, Anaxil.19, Cratin.Jun.13, POxy. 784 (i B.C.), etc.; but u^ in dact., AP11.405 (Lucill.), Archestr.Fr. 45.18.]

i)xqu^-do/kos, on, (de/xomai)
holding fish, spuri/des AP6.4 (Leon.).

i)xqu^-ei=on, to/,
fish-market, dub. in IG12(2).646a.49 (Nesos).

i)xqu^/-h, h(,
Ion. for i)xqu/a.

i)xqu^-h/mata, ta/, (i)xqu/a)
fish-scales: hence,
scrapings, shavings, lwtou= Hp.Ulc.13,al.:sg.only, ib.21.

i)xqu^-hro/s, a/, o/n, (i)xqu=s)
fishy, scaly, i.e.
foul, dirty, pinaki/skoi Ar.Pl.814,Fr.532; e)/laion Ph. Bel.90.19; zwmo/s Luc.Lex.5; ou)k e)/stin i)xquhro/n nothing
of the fish kind, Diph.32.21; h( pu/lh h( i). the
fish-gate, LXXNe.3.3:—Subst., i)xqu^hra/, h(,
tax on fish, UPZ110.98 (ii B.C.), PFay.42（
a） v 2 (ii A.D.).

i)xqu^-i/+a, h(,
fishing, Procl.Vit.Hom.p.25 W.

i)xqu^-i+ko/s, h/, o/n,= i)xquhro/s, pu/lh LXX 2 Ch.33.14; zw/|dia Ptol.Tetr.152:—Subst., i)xqu^-i+kh/, h(,
fishery toll, Inscr.Magn.116.42, OGI496.9 (Ephesus):
i)xqu^-i+ka/, ta/, Ostr.343 (iii B.C.):—also i)xqu^/-i+nos, h, on, Ael.NA17.32.

i)xqu^/-kentron, to/,
trident, Poll.10.133, Paus.Gr.Fr.216: i)xqu^o/kentron, Hsch., Suid.

i)xqu^-me/dwn, ontos, o(,
king of fish, Marc.Sid.54.

i)xqu^-no/mos, on,
ruling-fish, Opp.H.1.643.
i)xqu^o-boleu/s, i)xqu^o-bo/los,= i)xqub-, Phot., Eust.191.33.

i)xqu^o/-brwtos, on,
eaten by fish, Plu.2.668a, SIG997.7 (Smyrna).

i)xqu^o-eidh/s, e/s,
fish-like, lepi/s Hdt.7.61.

i)xqu^o/-eis, essa, en,
full of fish, fishy, po/ntos, *(ellh/spontos, Il.9.4,360; i). ke/leuqa, i.e. the sea, Od.3.177; muxo\s i)., of the Bosporus, Ar.Th.324;
fish-like, de/mas Opp.H.3.548.
consisting of fish, qh/rh ib.1.666; bo/los AP6.223 (Antip.).
i)xqu^o-qh/ra,= kukla/minos, Ps.-Dsc.2.164.

i)xqu^o-qh/ras, ou, o(,
fisherman, Sch.Lyc.1200: also i)xqu^o-qhreuth/s, ou=, o(, Man.4.243:
i)xqu^o-qhrhth/r, h=ros, o(, AP7.702 (Apollonid.).

i)xqu^o-qhri/a, h(,
fishing, Eust.1165.3: h( i)xquoqhrikh/ (sc. te/xnh) Poll.1.97.

i)xqu^o-ke/ntauros, o(, h(,
half-man and half-fish, of Triton, Tz.ad Lyc.34.

i)xqu^o/-kolla, h(,
fish-glue, i.e.
isinglass, Dsc.3.88, Gal.13.662, cf. Plin.HN32.84:—also i)xqu^o/-kollon, to/, Gloss.

i)xqu^o-loge/w,
discourse of fish, Ath.7.308d, 8.360d.

i)xqu^o-lu/mhs [lu_], ou, o(,
plague of fish, Com. epith. of a fish-eater, Ar.Pax 814.

i)xqu^o/-mantis, ews, o(,
one who prophesies by means of fish, Ath.8.333d.

i)xqu^o-meta/bolos, o(,
fishmonger, PRyl.196.7 (ii A.D.).
i)xquo/ner: i)xquagwgoi/, Hsch.
i)xqu^opra/ths [a_], ou=, o(,= -pw/lhs, PLond.1.113.5b4 (vi A.D.), etc.

i)xqu^optri/s (v.l. i)xqu^o-opti/s), i/dos, fem. Adj.
for broiling fish, e)sxa/ra Poll.6.88,10.95.
i)xqu^o-pw/laina, irreg. fem. of -pw/lhs, Pherecr.64.

i)xqu^o-pwle/w,
sell fish, Poll.7.26.

i)xqu^o-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
fishmonger, freq. in Com., Ar. Fr.387.10, Antiph.68.7, Alex.56.1; also in Pap., BGU330.10, etc.: —fem. i)xqu^o/-pwlis a)gora/
fish-market, Plu.2.849e, Maiuri
Nuova Silloge 440 (Cos).

i)xqu^o-pwli/a, h(,
fishmongering, Ath.7.276f, Plu.2.668a (nisi leg. ta\ i)xquopw/lia).

i)xqu^o-pw/lion, to/,
fish-market, IPE12.32B4 (Olbia), PFlor.119.9 (iii A.D.), Sch.Ar.Ra.1068:
i)xqu^o-pwlei=on, Hsch.

i)xqu^o/-rroos, on, contr. i)xqu^o/-rous, oun, (r(e/w)
swarming with fish, potamo/s Timocl.15.1.

i)xqu^o-trofei=on, to/,
fish-pond, Moschio ap.Ath. 5.208a, D.S.11.25:
i)xqu^o-tro/fion, to/, SIG997.13 (Smyrna).

i)xqu^o-trofiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for keeping fish, Gp.20.1 tit.

i)xqu^o-tro/fos, on,
feeding fish: full of fish, diadromai/ Plu.Luc.39.

i)xqu^oulko/s, o(, (e(/lkw)
angler, Phot., Suid.:—written i)xqu^o-olko/s in Hsch.

i)xqu^ofa^g-e/w,
feed on fish, Arist.HA616a32, Str.11.8.7.

i)xqu^ofa^g-i/a, h(,
fish diet, PMag.Berol.1.290, Eust.135.19.

i)xqu^o/fa^g-os, on,
eating fish, Clearch.74; e)/qnh Porph.Abst.1.13; oi) *)i. a)/ndres the
Fish-eaters, a tribe on the Arabian Gulf, Hdt.3.19, cf. Str.16.4.4, Paus.1.33.4; another on the Persian Gulf, Str.15.2.1.

i)xqu^ofor-e/w,
convey fish, ei)s *)arkadi/an, *)arx. *)ef. 1918.168 (Epid.).
produce fish, EM117.26.

i)xqu^o/for-os, on,
producing fish, krhni=des Ctes.Fr.57.10.
carrying fish, ploi=a Sm.Jb.40.26(31): Subst. -fo/ros, o(, *)arx. *)ef.1918.168 (Epid.).

i)xqu^-pa^gh/s, e/s,
piercing fish, a)gki/strwn sto/mata AP6.27 (Theaet.).

i)xqu^-po/ros, o(, (pei/rw)
harpoon, Inscr.Délos 354.60 (iii B.C.).

i)xqu=s (so Hdn.Gr.2.936, -u=s and -u/s freq. in codd.), u/os, o(, acc. i)xqu/n Pi.Fr.306, cf. Hdn.Gr.1.416, Choerob.in Theod.1.383, in late Poets also i)xqu/a AP9.227 (Bianor), Theoc.21.45: voc. i)xqu/ Erinn. 1, Crates Com.14: pl. i)xqu/es Pl.Phd.109e, etc., i)xqu=s Alex.261.9, acc. i)xqu/as, contr. i)xqu=s Od.5.53, both forms being used in Com., -u=s Ar.Ra.1068, Archipp.29, -u/as Antiph.68.12, Ephipp.21; codd. vary in Arist.HA564b19, PA644a21, D.S.5.3, Str.8.3.19, etc.; -u=s SIG997.1 (Smyrna, perh. i B.C.); -u/as BGU1123.9 (Aug.), etc.: dual i)xqu= Antiph.194.15:—
fish, w)mhsth/s Il.24.82, cf. 21.122, al., cf. Hes.Op.277, Hdt.2.93,S.Aj.1297,etc.: prov., a)fwno/teros tw=n i)xqu/wn Luc.Gall.1, cf. S.E.M.2.18: metaph., of
a stupid fellow, Plu.2.975b. in pl., oi( i)xqu/es
the fish-market at Athens, para\ tou\s i)xqu=s Ar.Ra.1068; e)n toi=s i)xqu/si Id.V.789, Antiph.125.1. pl., the constellation Pisces, Eudox. ap. Hipparch.1.2.3; i). *dio/s Porph. Antr.22. (i(xqu/s Att. acc. to Gell.2.3.2.) [u_ in disyll. cases, nom. -u_s Il.21.127, Damox.2.20, Archestr.Fr.52 (i)xqu=s ou)=sa shd. be read for i)xqu\s e)ou=sa in Matro Conv.35), acc. -u_n Pherecr.120, Antiph.166.7, Archestr.Fr.28, but -u^n Theoc.21.49, and apptly. Pi. l.c.: u^ in trisyll. cases and in all compds.] (Cf. Lith.
žuvìs, Arm.
jukn, 'fish'.)

i)xqu^silhi+sth/r, h=ros, o(,
a stealer of fish, AP7.295 (Leon.).

i)xqu-stefh/s, e/s,
fish-crowned, ko/lpoi *)amfitri/tas Tim.Pers.38.
i)xqu-fa/gos [u^, a^], on,= i)xquofa/gos, AP9.83 (Phil.).

i)xqu-fo/nos, on,
killing fish, Opp.C.2.444.

i)xqu-w/dhs, es,= i)xquoeidh/s, Arist.PA697b5, al. Adv. -dw=s Id.HA536a9.
full of fish, li/mnh Hdt.7.109, Arr. Ind.41.1. (o)/d-wda)
fishy, smelling or
tasting of fish, e)rugh/ Aret.SD1.5, Gal.7.76; pro/bata Philostr.VA3.55, cf. Arr.Ind.26.7.
i)/xla: ki/xla, Hsch. i)/xmata: i)/xnia, Id. (Perh. for i)/qmata.)

*)ixn-ai=os, a, on,
of Ichnae in Thessaly, of Themis, h.AP.94; of Nemesis, AP9.405 (Diod.), Lyc.129: *)/ixnai (in Thessaly), o(/pou h( *qe/mis *)i. tima=tai Str.9.5.14.
*)ixn-a/omai,= i)xneu/w, Hsch., Suid.

*)ixn-ei/a, h(,
casting about for the scent, of hounds, X.Cyn.3.7 (pl.).
*)ixn-ela/ths, v. i)xnhla/ths.

*)/ixn-euma, atos, to/,
track, Poll. 5.11.

*)ixn-eu/mwn, onos, o(,
tracker: hence, an Egyptian animal of the weasel-kind,
which hunts out crocodile's eggs (asp's eggs,Ael.NA6.38),
Herpestes ichneumon, Arist.HA612a16, Eub.107.12, Nic.Th.190, Plu.2.966d, PLond.3.904 (ii A.D.); cf. i)xneuth/s 11. a small kind of wasp,
that hunts spiders,
Pelopaeus spirifex, Arist.HA552b26,609a5, cf. Plin.HN10.204. a bird, Ant.Lib. 14.

*)/ixn-eusis, ews, h(,
tracking, X.Cyn.3.4, 10.5, Poll.5.11.
method of investigation, cj. in Epicur.Ep.2p.42U.
*)ixn-eu/teira, h(, fem. of i)xneuth/r, te/xna IG9(1).880.9 (Corc.).

*)ixn-eute/os, a, on,
to be searched out, dikaiosu/nh Philostr.VA6.21.
*)ixn-euth/r, h=ros, o(,= sq., Opp.C.1.76,450,468; as Adj., i). tarso/s Nonn.D.46.115.

*)ixn-euth/s, ou=, o(,
tracker, hunter, Poll.5.10; of dogs which hunt by scent, ib.17: metaph., *ku/pridos i)xneuta\s a)rgure/ous sku/lakas, of money given to a e(tai/ra, AP5.15 (Marc. Arg.): *)ixneutai/, oi(, title of a satyric play by Sophocles (cf. v. 298).
detective who
traces missing persons, PRyl.188.22 (ii A.D.). = i)xneu/mwn 1, Hdt.2.67, Nic.Th. 195.

*)ixn-eutiko/s, h/, o/n,
good at tracking, ku/wn Ael.NA6.59, Arr. Epict.1.2.34, Ph.2.38.

*)ixn-eu/w,
track out, hunt after, S.Aj.20, OT 221, 476 (lyr.); i). qh=ras kusi/n E.Cyc.130; ku/nes i)xneu/ousai
hunting by scent, Pl.Lg.654e: metaph., kata\ sou= th\n yh=fon i).
seeking for a vote of condemnation, Ar.Eq.808; i). ta\ lexqe/nta Pl.Prm.128c; th\n tou= kalou= fu/sin Id.R.401c; [sofi/an] LXX Si.51.15; i)xneu/eis . . ti/s ei)/m' e)gw/ . . ; Epigr.Gr.227 (Teos);
follow on the track of, emulate, matradelfeou/s Pi.P.8.35. i). o)/rh
to hunt the mountains, X.Cyn.4.9.

i)xnhl-a^si/a, h(, (e)lau/nw)
tracking out, search, Them.Or.13.165d.

i)xnhl-a^te/w,
track out, ta)lhqe\s lo/gw| Ph.1.12, cf. 2.475,al.

i)xnhl-a/ths [a^], ou, o(,
tracker, [a)lhqei/as] Plu.2.762b:—poet. i)xnela/ths AP6.183 (Zos.), APl.4.289.
i)xnhl-a^ti/a or i)xnhl-ei/a, h(,= ff. ll. for -hlasi/a in Poll. 5.11.
i)xnhl-a^tiko/s, h/, o/n,= i)xneutiko/s, Sch.S.Aj.8.

i)/xnion, to/ (Dim. of i)/xnos only in form, cf. Hdn.Gr.2.903, but written i)xni/on by Eust.233.44),
track, footprint, i)/xni' e)reunw=ntes ku/nes h)/i+san Od.19.436; met' i)/xnia bai=ne qeoi=o followed on her
track, 5.193; met' a)ne/ros i)/xni' e)reunw=n Il.18.321; kat' i)/xnia/ tinos e)fe/pesqai A.R.1.575; i)/xnia i(/ppwn X.An.1.6.1 (v.l. i)/xnh): less freq. in sg., to\ i)/. mou=non le/leiptai tw=n podw=n Democr.228; i)/. o)ce/os i(/ppou Call.Aet.3.1.86; e(/pesqai/ tini kat' i)/xnion Q.S.8.361; i)/. e(dra/sasqai to plant one's
step, AP6.70 (Maced.). metaph.,
trace, remnant, prote/rhs a)glai/+hs ib.58 (Isid.).
i)/xnippos: o(/pou oi( li/qoi tri/bontai, a)ko/nh, Hsch.

i)xno-ba/ths [a^], ou, o(,
going on the track, name of a hound, Ov.Met. 3.207.

i)xno-bla^bh/s, e/s,
hurt in the foot, Man.4.500.

i)xno-gra^fi/a, h(,
tracing out: ground-plan, Vitr.1.2.2.

i)xno-pe/dh, h(, a kind of
fetter or
trap, AP6.109 (Antip.), 7.626.

i)xno-poie/w,
track out, tai=s r(isi\n i). ta\ qhri/a EM395.39.

i)/xnos, eos, to/,
track, footstep, Od.17.317, Hes.Op.680, Hdt.4.82; of the
spoor of game, X.Cyn.6.15, etc.: metaph.,
track, trace, kat' i)/xnos plata=n a)/fanton A.Ag.695 (lyr.); e)s tau)to\n e)lqw\n . . lo/gwn i)/. Id.Pr.845; i)/. kakw=n r(inhlatou/sh| Id.Ag.1184; i)/. palaia=s duste/kmarton ai)ti/as S. OT109; i)/. teixe/wn E.Hel.108; i)/xnh tw=n plhgw=n Pl.Grg.524c; ta\ tw=n kondu/lwn i)/. Aeschin.3.212: with neg., not
a trace, mazw=n ou)de\ i)/xnh Aret.SD1.8; i)/. podo\s qei=nai, Lat.
vestigia ponere, E.IT752, cf. Or.234; qe/sqai AP7.464 (Antip.); lepto\n i)/. a)rbu/lhs ti/qete step softly, E.Or.140 (lyr.); i)/. e)pante/llein podo/s Id.Ph.105 (lyr.); i)/. e)rei/dein AP5.300 (Paul. Sil.); e)n i)/xnesi/ tinos po/da ne/mein (metaph.) Pi.N.6.15; i)xnw=n tinos e)/xesqai Lib.Or.64.4; toi=s stoixou=si toi=s i)/xnesi th=s pi/stews Ep.Rom.4.12; kat' i)/xnos a)/|ssein, kat' i)/xnh diw/kein, S.Aj.32, Pl.R.410b, cf. E.Hec.1059 (lyr.); ei)s i)/xnos tino\s i)e/nai Pl.Ep.330e; i)/. metie/nai, metelqei=n, Id.Phdr.276d, Tht.187e; i)/xnous prosa/ptesqai hit upon a
trail, Id.Plt.290d; toi=s a)rxai/ois i)/. e)s ta\ qeme/lia xrwme/nous Jul.Or.2.66b; i)/xnh u(poyi/as ei)/s tina fe/rei Antipho 2.3.10; mh/t' i)/. mh/t' ai)/qugma . . paradido/ntwn Phld.Sign.29, cf. Rh.1.91 S. poet.,
foot, E.Ba.1134, Herod.7.20.
hard sole of the foot, LXX De.11.24,al., Gal.10.876, Orib.47.9.7;
sole of a shoe, Hp.Art.62,Arr.Ind.16.5;
sandal, POxy.1449.51 (pl., iii A.D.). ta\ i)/. tw=n xeirw=n the
palms of the hands, LXX 1 Ki.5.4. i)/. a)nqrw/pinon, as a measure of length, Ruf.Anat.31.
track, route in the desert, PRyl.197.8 (ii A.D.). pl.,
representations of footprints as votive offerings indicating the presence of a God, a)ne/qhkan . . kata\ th\n tou= qeou= e)ne/rgian i)/xnh au)tou= xru/sea te/ssera BCH51.106 (Panamara), etc.

i)xnoskop-e/w,
look at the track or
traces, e)n sti/boisi toi=s e)moi=s A.Ch. 227, cf. S.Ichn.7; i). kai\ stibeu/ein to\ me/llon Plu.2.399a.

i)xnoskop-i/a, h(,
looking at the tracks, Plu.2.917f.

i)xw/r [i_], w=ros, o(,
ichor, the juice, not blood, that flows in the veins of gods, Il.5.340,etc.: Ep.acc. i)xw= ib.416: in pl., of the Giants, Str. 6.3.5; later simply,
blood, A.Ag.1480 (anap.).
the watery part of animal juices,
serum (cf. Gal.15.345), of the blood, Hp.Cord. 11, Pl.Ti.83c, Arist.HA521b2 (also in pl., v.l. in 521a18), PA651a18; of gall, xolw/deas i)xw=ras Hp.Acut.（Sp.）1; of milk,
whey, Arist. HA521b27;
gravy of underdone meat, Archestr.Fr.57.6;
juice of burning logs, Dsc.1.119, Eup.1.120.
serous or
sero-purulent discharge, Hp.VC19, Arist.HA630a6 (pl.), Gal.10.184, etc.; i)xw=res u(darei=s u(/pwxroi, from women in childbirth, Arist.HA586b32; of the
putrefied blood of a viper, Id.Mir.845a8; of
naphtha (prob.), regarded in legend as due to the putrefaction of Giants' corpses, ib.838a29.

i)xwro-eidh/s [i_], e/s,
serous, ai(=ma Hp.Nat.Hom.12, Arist.HA521a13, Alex.Trall.12.

i)xwro-rroe/w, (r(e/w)
run with serous matter, Hp.
Coac.501, Erot. s.v. dakruw=des e(/lkos:—later i)xwrroe/w, w)=ta i)xwrroou=nta Dsc.3.23, cf. Archig. ap. Orib.46.26.2.
i)xwrw/dhs [i_], es,= i)xwroeidh/s, Hp.Morb.3.16, v.l. in Arist.HA586a29.

i)/y (on the accent v. Hdn.Gr.1.404), o(, gen. i)po/s [i_], nom. pl. i)=pes: (i)/ptomai):—
wood-worm, Od.21.395, Thphr.HP8.10.5; found in vines, Id.CP3.22.5, Lap.49, Str.13.1.64. (Cf. i)/c.)
i)/yao, v. i)/ptomai.
i)/y-hlos, a, on, Aeol. for u(yhlo/s, Lyr.Adesp.60.
i)/y-oqen, Aeol. for u(yo/qen, Jo.Gramm.Comp.3.15.
i)/y-oi, Aeol. for u(you=, Sapph.91.
i)/yon (i)/ptomai）: to\ desmwth/rion, Hsch.

i)/yos (A) or i)yo/s, o(,
cork-oak, Quercus Suber (?), Thphr.HP3.4.2. at Thurii,= kisso/s, Hsch.
i)/yos (B), to/, Aeol. for u(/yos, Hdn.Gr.2.928; cf. i)/yoi.

i)/w, subj. of ei)=mi (
ibo). i)w=, contr. for i)a/ou, imper. of i)a/omai.

i)w/, an exclam., chiefly in dramatic poetry (lyr.); freq. repeated twice, rarely three times, as A.Supp.125; esp. in invoking aid, i). ma/kares, i). qeoi/, Id.Th.96, S.Ph.736; i). i). *paia/n Id.Tr.222; i). *ba/kxai E.Ba.578. freq. also of grief or suffering,
oh! i). du/stanos S. Ant.850; i). moi/ moi Id.OC199, etc.; i). kakopa/rqene *moi=ra AP7.468 (Mel.); i). *spa/rta ib.434 (Diosc.): c. gen., i)., pa/ter, sou= tw=n te . . te/knwn A.Ag.1305; i). moi po/nwn E.Ph.1290; i). i). trauma/twn Ar.Ach. 1205. rarely in Prose, i)., fasi/ tines, of an objector, Gal.Thras. 32. with other Interj., i). w)\ w)/ S.OC224; e)\ e)\ i). Id.El.840. [i^: yet sts. i_, in anap., A.Ag.1455, S.El.149, E.Alc.741.]

*)iw/ [i_], *)iou=s, h(, acc. *)iou=n Hdt.1.1; voc. *)ioi= A.Pr.635, etc.:—Io, daughter of Inachus. name of
the moon at Argos, Eust.ad D.P.92.

i)wa/ (A),= i)w/, A.Pers.1070 (lyr.). i)wa/ (B), h(,
smoke, prob. in Call.Fr.1.40 P.
i)w/ga, v. e)gw/.

i)wgh/, h(, Ep. word,
shelter, *bore/w u(p' i)wgh=| under
shelter from the north wind, Od.14.533.

i)w/dhs [i_], es, （i)o/s)
like verdigris, green, Hp.Prog.11, Dsc.5.79, Gal. 10.871; of bile, Id.18(1).107; kako/noia . . touti\ to\ i)w=des . . a)fi/hsin Plu.2.565c.
rust-coloured, ferruginous, Thphr.Lap.37, Call. Hist.4, Dsc.5.152.
poisonous, u(/dwr Ath.2.42a, cf. Gal.11.327; o)do/ntes, of serpents, Philostr.Jun.Im.5: metaph., of persons,
virulent, Ptol.Tetr.158. (o)/d-wda)
acrid, o)cu/thtes Hp.VM19; a)/sqma Philum.Ven.36.3, etc.
i)wei=: be/lei, Hsch.

i)wkh/, h( (for diwkh/ acc. to A.D.Conj.256.27, v. sq.),
rout, pursuit, ou)/te bi/as . . u(pedei/disan ou)/te i)wka/s Il.5.521: personified, with *)/eris and *)alkh/, 5.740:—metaplast. acc., po/non ai)pu\n i)w=ka/ te dakruo/essan 11.601.
viw/kw, = diw/kw, GDI3153 (Corinthian vase).
i)wli/a, h(, （i)a/） = fh/mh, deilh/, Hsch. i)w=lka, = au)/laka, Id., Cyr.; cf. w)=lka. i)/wlon: me/lan, Hsch. i(w/n, i(w/nga, i(w/nei, Boeot. for e)gw/, e)/gwge, e)gw/nh, v. e)gw/.

*)/iwn, wnos, o(, Ion, Hdt.7.94, 8.44, E.Ion 74, etc.: *)/iwnes, oi(,
the Ionians, v. *)ia/ones; of those who spoke the Ionic dialect, A.D.Pron. 4.22, al.: *)iwni/a, h(,
their country, A.Pers.771.
i)wna=s: peristera/, Hsch.

i)wnia/, a=s, h(, (i)/on)
violet-bed, Ar.Pax577; i). leukh/
giliflower, Matthiola incana, Thphr.HP6.8.5; i). me/laina
violet, Viola odorata, ib. 6.6.2.
ground-pine, Ajuga Chamaepitys, Apollod. ap. Ath.15.681d, Dsc.3.158; i). a)gri/a Sch.Nic.Al.55. e)s i)wnia/n: e)s koprw=na, Hsch.

*)iwni/zw,
speak Ionic, A.D.Adv.162.7.

*)iwnikolo/gos, o(,
reciter of *)iwnika/, Ath.14.620e.

*)iwniko/s, h/, o/n,
Ionic, Ionian: -koi/, oi(,= *)/iwnes, Philostr.VS1.21.5:

i)y-ko/n (sc. u(po/dhma), to/, a kind of
shoe, Herod.7.59; esp. with the connotation,
effeminate, Ar.Pax46, Pl.Com.69.14, etc. Adv. -kw=s
in the Ionic fashion, i.e.
softly, effeminately, Ar.Th.163. *)i. me/tron, suzugi/a, Ionic, defined in Heph.11, cf. D.H.Comp.4, etc.; pou/s Heph.1.9, cf. Aristid.Quint.1.15: -ka/, ta/, poem in this style, Ath.14.620e. Adv. -kw=s,, prob. in D.H.Dem.43. *)i. e)/qos, of the
Ionic dialect, A.D.Pron.74.9. Adv. -kw=s Sch.Porph.Abst.2.36: Comp. -w/teron A.D.Adv.135.1.

*)iw/nios, a, on,=foreg., tro/pos, of the Ionic dialect, Philostr.VA7.35:—fem. *)iwni/s, i/dos, Ionian, Paus.6.22.7, etc.: as Subst., Call.Epigr. 27, Plu.Luc.18: *)iwnia/s, a/dos, Nic.Fr.74.4, Str.8.3.32.

i)wni/s, i/dos, h(,
a water bird, Ar.Byz.Epit.5.5.
i)wni/skos, o(, Ephes. name for the fish xru/sofrus, Archestr.Fr. 12.
